story:
My name is Akasha-Regine Rodgers, native Washingtonian and owner/operator of Oh My Boba LLC. My passion for cooking began when I was nine years old. By 13 I was already working at farmer’s markets, joyously serving up smiles. I couldn’t help but to fall in love. Since then, I’ve submerged myself within the culinary arts. After graduating high school in 2011, I began to dedicate my life to professionally perfecting my craft. I attended the Art Institute of Washington, joining their Bachelors’ degree program in Culinary Arts and Management. Simultaneously, I developed my skills. I tirelessly worked in every position the food service industry could provide me, striving to become a more well-rounded chef. Through determination and perseverance, my childhood passion has become my professional journey.

With the creation of Oh My Boba, I wish to learn more about the people around me. I desire to share that knowledge with my community. Oh My Boba serves as a centerpiece for my ultimate goal: connecting cultures, people, through food.

 

Oh My Boba is a new food truck in Southern Maryland that serves a unique fusion of Latin American and Asian cuisine. We prepare Asian inspired empanadas and side dishes and Latin inspired boba teas. We want to use this truck to show that there is more to Latin and Asian cuisine than Mexican and Chinese food. Exploring different cuisines is an easily accessible way for people to open their minds to cultural differences and enhance a sense of community.

Oh My Boba’s mission is to bring the community of Southern Maryland closer together by introducing a new cuisine and cultural unity. Short term plans include forming partnerships with other small businesses to optimize community outreach which will benefit Charles County, Southern Maryland and the greater DC area in multiple ways including: creation of full & part time employment, accredited internships, cooking classes, catering and much more.

 

Your support to this campaign will ensure the continued success of Oh My Boba throughout 2020 and beyond. Here are a few things we need help with:

Vendor fee for festivals & events

There are numerous festivals in the Southern Maryland area that can provide Oh My Boba ample opportunities to connect with and provide for the community. However, many of these festivals require upfront fees. Despite our desire to participate, we currently cannot afford to attend. With your help we can change that. 

Remodeling/Upgrading

Although we had a successful first year, we stumbled upon many obstacles. In order to continue to achieve the level of excellence customers come to expect from Oh My Boba, upgrades are needed. From new ovens to fit more of our tasty empanadas, to more cabinet space to make room for more yummy ingredients, Oh My Boba is in need of a make-over. Your proceeds will also go towards an efficient warmer and repairs to our water pump/heater. Together we can continue to reach our goals. 

Truck maintenance   

Oh My Boba is a mobile experience! In order to keep you full and happy we have to get to you. While our 2002 P42 Workhorse looks beautiful on the outside, we all know that it’s the inside that counts. Our baby needs regular oil changes and checkups. We want to expand our outreach and keep in contact with our community, no matter the distance. With your help we can safely drive further without fear of breaking down.

Menu development

Remember, Oh My Boba strives to connect cultures and people. We want Southern Maryland to experience food and flavors they’ll never find anywhere else. To do this, constant research and experimentation is necessary. With your contributions we can develop new menu items, and gift our customers with a unique cuisine that will guarantee your return and satisfaction. 

I want to be able to provide the Charles county and Southern Maryland area with fun, new menu items from time to time to keep you coming back.

Expanding our team/community

Recently, I have been diagnosed with fibromyalgia, which although can be treated, cannot be cured. It prevents me from physically being able to do all the work myself. Being able to hire help would assist me greatly with providing deliciousness for all of you.

What you get:

Not only will you get our undying appreciation and gratitude, there will also be merchandise! If our goal is reached, Oh My Boba will hold a free event where you will be able to reap the benefits of your support!! 

Not only will you get my undying appreciation, gratitude and shout outs on the upcoming website, but there will be many merchandise options in the perks section of the campaign and I will post pics of the merchandise as they come in. As an extra incentive, if we fufill our goal an event will be planned where you will be able to reap the benefits of your support through free food and fun!

 

As mentioned previously, Oh My Boba’s mission is to bring the community of Southern Maryland closer by forming cultural unity. We want to create close-knit bonds with not just our customers, but everyone around us. In order to achieve this goal, we plan to form partnerships with other small businesses and local food trucks. We also plan to create various employment opportunities including of full or part time employment and accredited internships. There are also plans for cooking classes and event catering. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot financially contribute, that is okay. There is still support you can give!

Please share this campaign through your social media platforms and do not hesitate to email ohmybobbba@gmail.com for questions about this project.

story:
Short Summary

It all started with Two friends and Union brothers with a dream and passion for creating the finest and freshest craft beer possible. Founded by Zach Waltz whose in the IBEW and Jeremiah Cain who belongs to the Boilermakers. As most of you know we have officially signed our lease at 365 Mercer Road Harmony Pa 16037. It is a former Ice cream shop/ Diner that we will transform into our craft brewery and eatery. We will operate on a 3.5BBL SS Brewtech brewhouse with five 3.5BBL unitanks. We will offer 12 handcrafted in house beers on tap. We will have 52 seats on the inside and an amazing patio outside. Warmer months you will be able to enjoy the patio accompanied by live music and many outdoor games. We hope to open in early spring and can’t wait to invite everyone inside to enjoy all that we have to offer. #BeHoppyDrinkLocal

 


*Picture is not of our draft tower. But this is the exact same tower we have on order*

 

 

WHO WE ARE

-Zach Waltz

Zach Is a Husband and Father of two girls. He was born and raised in Harmony Pa and has always wanted to give back to the community by opening a small business that can provide jobs and a place of comfort for many people to enjoy. In his spare time he enjoys spending time with his wife and two daughters. He also enjoys watching sports.

-Jeremiah Cain

Jeremiah was born and raised in North Hills. After high school he joined the United Stated Marine Corps where he served 5 years. He is currently a husband and soon to be father. When he is not working he enjoys spending time with his wife and 2 boxers. 


With Zach being born and raised in Harmony Pa, it is important for us to contribute to our own community.. We believe that Harmony is bursting at the seams with culture new and old alike and we want to do our part to keep it going. With many other small businesses located in historic Harmony we feel that this was a perfect fit for us. Harmony is a unique place in many ways and we intend to keep it going .Born and raised in Harmony  we felt it was important to give our community a little more life and a place to unwind and enjoy fresh handcrafted food and brews.

We will post constant pictures and videos of updates being made to the building as there is already a dramatic change in what it use to be. Once all the exclusive swag is designed we will also post pictures of it as well.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  1. We are looking to gain additional funding that will allow us to transform this former Ice cream shop/ Diner into our beautiful taproom.
  2. We will need to raise around $20,000 to finish all renovations
  3. We will offer many different perks that range across many different tiers as a thank you to each and everyone that believes in us and is willing to help.
  4. Each and every dollar raised on this campaign will go directly into our building for yourself and everyone to enjoy.
  5. All the money donated will go directly to installing state of the art channel drains in the brewery for all waste, completion of our bar featuring a beautiful stained concrete bar top, installing a new kitchen hood with a start of the art fire suppression system.

The Impact

  1. We feel that we will provide a space for friends and families alike to enjoy for years to come
  2. We have won many awards on the Homebrew level so we plan to bring the same quality craft to the table for everyone to enjoy
  3. We will push ourselves each and everyday to get better and provide you the consumer the best possible beverages, foods and experience that will make you want to come back often

Risks & Challenges

With already having all of our brewing equipment purchased we now face the challenges of making sure we have the proper funds to provide a state of the art location for everyones enjoyment. We understand that as a small business there will be many small hurdles and we feel that we have all the right people in place to overcome these challenges. With the help of you we will be able to complete construction on the taproom and push closer to opening our doors.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially. So we ask you that you please spread the word and help us get this brand and taproom off the ground.

We understand that as a small business there will be many small hurdles and we feel that we have all the right people in place to overcome these challenges. With the help of you we will be able to complete construction on the taproom and push closer to opening our doors.

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially. So we ask you that you please spread the word and help us get this brand and taproom off the ground.

story:
I am the inventor Luis Burgos, I was born in France and since I was a child I already stood out for having extraordinary skills, with only 4 years of age I was capable of doing simple manual work at school and at 12 years old I was already building model airplanes that flew. facet helped me to develop many other things and thus achieved over the years 19 international awards, 7 world records, participated in 25 fairs around the world, developed 16 professions and several languages, obtaining 82 international patents of which 6 of them were successes in various countries.

In recent years I have worked in the development of the best packaging system for all solid food products: The XBRIK is a container without a plastic bag inside with a high technology. Currently it is 55% compostable and 45% recyclable, it has a few Lids to open, perfectly pour the products and close the containers.

I start this campaign because I believe that the union of people is strength and if many people put a small grain of sand with their help I will get to eliminate most of the plastic bags used in the food industry; This will be achieved by standardizing the XBRIK as the most practical, ecological and economical container. Success is very important to me because I would like to help improve our planet and change the lives of millions of people.

All the people who help my cause will really make a difference in their life and in the world. My question to all of you: Who would you bet on? For someone who fights every day? For someone who has brilliant ideas? By someone who is able to solve any problem? Imagine for a moment what a simple container can achieve, ask yourself how many years you have been breaking cardboard containers and to close them you normally put a clothespin or twist the plastic bag and when you finish the package that plastic bag that you use and that goes to the garbage dump flies through the air and ends up anywhere in the world.

With the XBRIK, the majority of loose plastic bags are gone, the recycling industry, the packaging industry and also the way in which you opened food packaging throughout your life is changed. This will be a before and after.

I need to raise the necessary funds to start the first of the five stages of the project, with this being able to obtain materials and machinery to start the commercial career, this will help me to put on the market the first idea of ​​the entire XBRIK system and thus obtain the reward of work, dedication, perseverance and research of so many years.

I need to raise 170,000 Euros, these funds will go to the following:

A. Realization of 2 injection molds 60,000 Euros.

B. Purchase of 3 medium injection machines 55,000 Euros.

C. Realization of a new web page 1600 Euros.

F. Marketing campaign 18,000 Euros.

G. Rent warehouse and condition it to create the factory 35,000 Euros

With these funds I will start the commercialization of the first part of the XBRIK project.

But the project has 5 stages for its gradual integration into the market, these are:

Stage Nº1. Manufacture of the TUPPERWARE with the multipurpose Lid TOPBRIK, a reusable container for many years, specially designed to contain solid food.

Stage Nº2. Adaptation of TOBRIK lids to cardboard bags of cat and dog food; it will allow to perfectly open, pour and close food sacks.

Stage Nº3. Special laminated cylindrical container for nuts with the incorporation of TOPBRIK- lids.

Nº4 Market launch for the first time of the XBRIK container with TOPBRIK lids with cat food; At first it was packaged manually and launched with its own brand.

Nº5 Launch and mass production of XBRIK, at this point we will have the first packaging machine and we will launch our own brand of cereals, creating 2 factories in the US to export to all countries of the world.

To do the first stages for the commercialization of the project I will not have too many problems; However, the further I advance, some challenges will arise that I will have to face to give some examples:

The first will be to create the best packaging machine in the world, it has to be high speed, low consumption, very efficient and with mechanical and electronic reliability.

The second will be international distribution, although I already have two large distributors.

The third will be to make the XBRIK container 100% compostable in the future.

The fourth to create characters, a very good brand for cereal XBRIKs and to carry out an extraordinary marketing campaign.

To all the people who have read this far, thanks for reading a little about my story, if some people cannot contribute, but can spread it, this helps me a lot, look at the video of the child in it, you can see the scope of this transcendental idea ; Imagine if a child as young as 3 years old could open it and pour out his cereal, imagine what it would help millions of people around the world. If you all have acquaintances in the packaging industry, many contacts in the networks or friends who can do something all people will be welcome.

And to all the people who can help by financing, I thank you millions in advance.

story:
Maine's First Dedicated Gluten-Free Craft Brewery

We are opening a dedicated gluten-free craft brewery in Biddeford's mill district, and we need your help! Lucky Pigeon Brewing will offer interesting craft-brewed beer and a welcoming tasting room (once COVID restrictions allow us to invite you in) for all to enjoy. 

When co-founder Kathleen Pigeon became gluten-free, she found there were few beers available to her. With 10% of the US population following a gluten-free diet, the opportunity to produce delicious craft-brewed gluten-free beer and offer a vibrant tasting room experience became clear.

Why We Need Your Help

While we are getting our beautiful open space in the Pepperell Mill ready and setting up our brew house, we need your help.  The biggest challenge we face upon opening is ensuring that we can package the beer to be able to share it.  Outside of the equipment to make the beer, the canner is the most expensive piece of equipment.  A high-quality canner is critical to preserving the flavor and aroma of the beer.  Your contribution here will support us getting the beer into cans, so we can get our cans into your hands.

We hope you'll support Lucky Pigeon Brewing and pick up some great branded items. We also ask that you please share this campaign, connect with us on social media, and spread the word (especially to the gluten-free folks in your life).

Thanks for your support and come visit us when we open!

story:
“The Essential Knives” to “The Energetic Knives”

You don’t need these knives if you have the essentials, you will be able to get by. However you may want these knives!

These knives bring the flair, fire and fun to the kitchen.

We are crafting "energetic" knives that are fundamentally different than most western knives. Knives that few have in their kitchen, yet when you do you will wonder why you haven't always had them.

You don't need a Porsche, but driving one will put a smile on your face.

Our Handles

We have been out fossicking through the country side again in the beautiful wine region of South Australia, McLaren Vale with our arborist mate to find more interesting woods and burls to make beautiful handles with. We have had more help from our little worker buddies too. Along with some Platypus gum burl the termites helped carve for us, we also have olive wood root with circles and holes where wood worms have worked their way through. These woods we have stabilized and cast in coloured resin to be a solid block, then to be styled into the wa- styled "D" handles.

Woods we are using are Olive Root, Platypus Gum, Brown Mallee Root, Maple Burl, Dwarf Banksia Pod and Poplar Burl.

Our Three Knives

This collection is a collection of three knives - the Nakiri, the Deba and Sujihiki knives. We wanted to create a collection a little more traditional to Japanese cuisine yet cross over to cover tasks in western kitchens. All three are made with the very best Japanese knife steel- 67 layer Damascus VG-10 Stainless steel. They are Japanese half tang style. The handles (along with the beautiful Damascus cloud effect) are what gives these knives their beauty and sets them apart from any other knife in the world. We use an eclectic range of woods, some from our local region and some from others. We then cast and stabilise these woods with different colours to bring them together to make the most beautiful, colourful and "energetic" handles to complete these knifes into true works of art. In fact, we aren't sure if these should be in an art gallery or the kitchen at times!

These three knives all complement each other in many ways-

For example- Use your Deba to cut down your protein. The thick heavy blade is great for cutting through the fish's rib cage or the chicken bones. Then you use your Nakiri to prep the veg to go with the meal. Then when your protein is cooked (or uncooked if you dining on sashimi) you can carve/ slice it into perfect portion size with the Sujihiki. Job done! This collection can work so well together for endless delights, only your imagination can hold you back!

3 Knife Collection

The Nakiri

The Nakiri is the most used knife in Japan and it may be the same if we had them in the West. “Na” means “Vegetable” and “Kiri” means “to cut”. The first thing you notice with this knife is its rectangular shape. It is a light nimble knife that has only a slight radius on the cutting edge for "roll" chopping, but its big strength is "cross" chopping. This is where the whole knife meets the board in a single strike, chopping all in its path down the length of the cutting edge. The height of the blade, which remains slim and sharp, makes it easy to chop while the short length make it very easy to control. The Nakiri will out class a chefs knife if you are cutting fruit or veg as it’s lightweight and easy to control. The blade moves quickly and turns fruit into salad in moments.

If you like to work with fruit and veg - this is your knife!

The Nakiri Knife - The blade made for vegetables

The Deba Knife

The Deba is one of the older blades you find in Japan (but still quite rare in the west). With a heavy, strong blade heel to get through a fish head or chop through anything solid. It also has a razor sharp edge to the point to do more delicate cuts and get through the rib cage. The single bevelled edge blade is also used to run the con-curve back of the blade over the rib cage of fish to cut fillets away with the greatest of ease. This knife will accelerate the dissection of any poultry or fish, teamed with a longer blade for the final slash is also what helps us create sashimi.

If you like cutting fish - from lip to tail - this is the blade for you (whilst this is the known focus it also does most other things and can be used as a utility knife).

The Deba Knife - The fish, meat and poultry chopper

The Sujihiki

Last but maybe the best is the Sujihiki knife. Working with the Sujihiki is like playing the violin. Drawing the full length bow across the strings rather than slashing back and forth leads to a much cleaner cut. The kitchen becomes a construction of an orchestra and the finished look and feel of your cuts go to the next level. The Sujihiki knife is a long knife designed for long drawing cuts. You should never saw your meat, you lose all the juice and goodness in doing so. This razor sharp long edge will do it in one fowl stroke. We give our Sujihiki a Tanto Tip mainly because it looks awesome, who doesn't want to carve a roast with what looks like a Katana sword! However, the Tanto point is especially helpful when cutting sinew away from the bone.

If you like anything from sushi to texas BBQ - this is the blade for you.

The Sujihiki - The slicer that finishes the dish with a single stroke

Long, Slim & Sharp - The 270mm Sujihiki blade is the kitchen equivalent of a violin bow

In summing up

So that is the knife set we are looking to craft - The Nakiri, the Deba and the Sujihiki.

If you want to progress the tool kit in your kitchen so your kitchen becomes more, so your kitchen evolves and has more energy, then these are the knives for you.

Also, they make the perfect gift as we can personalise the knives with any engraving you choose for a friend or loved one. We are planning on having them delivered this side of Christmas if your looking for the perfect Christmas gift.

We appreciate your support in advance.

Last Point

Last kickstarter campaign was much more popular than we predicted. This meant it took a little longer to deliver than planned. We have improved, however, if you want it soon, order soon. We will make the knives in the order they are ordered so first in, best dressed.

Thanks in advance for your support!

Risks and challenges

The main risk is time. It may take a few months if lots of people order. We will make the knives in order of the orders placed so first in best dressed. Thanks again for your support.
story_txt:
“The Essential Knives” to “The Energetic Knives”
You don’t need these knives if you have the essentials, you will be able to get by. However you may want these knives!
These knives bring the flair, fire and fun to the kitchen.
We are crafting "energetic" knives that are fundamentally different than most western knives. Knives that few have in their kitchen, yet when you do you will wonder why you haven't always had them.
You don't need a Porsche, but driving one will put a smile on your face.
Our Handles
We have been out fossicking through the country side again in the beautiful wine region of South Australia, McLaren Vale with our arborist mate to find more interesting woods and burls to make beautiful handles with. We have had more help from our little worker buddies too. Along with some Platypus gum burl the termites helped carve for us, we also have olive wood root with circles and holes where wood worms have worked their way through. These woods we have stabilized and cast in coloured resin to be a solid block, then to be styled into the wa- styled "D" handles.
Woods we are using are Olive Root, Platypus Gum, Brown Mallee Root, Maple Burl, Dwarf Banksia Pod and Poplar Burl.

Our Three Knives
This collection is a collection of three knives - the Nakiri, the Deba and Sujihiki knives. We wanted to create a collection a little more traditional to Japanese cuisine yet cross over to cover tasks in western kitchens. All three are made with the very best Japanese knife steel- 67 layer Damascus VG-10 Stainless steel. They are Japanese half tang style. The handles (along with the beautiful Damascus cloud effect) are what gives these knives their beauty and sets them apart from any other knife in the world. We use an eclectic range of woods, some from our local region and some from others. We then cast and stabilise these woods with different colours to bring them together to make the most beautiful, colourful and "energetic" handles to complete these knifes into true works of art. In fact, we aren't sure if these should be in an art gallery or the kitchen at times!
These three knives all complement each other in many ways-
For example- Use your Deba to cut down your protein. The thick heavy blade is great for cutting through the fish's rib cage or the chicken bones. Then you use your Nakiri to prep the veg to go with the meal. Then when your protein is cooked (or uncooked if you dining on sashimi) you can carve/ slice it into perfect portion size with the Sujihiki. Job done! This collection can work so well together for endless delights, only your imagination can hold you back!

This knife will accelerate the dissection of any poultry or fish, teamed with a longer blade for the final slash is also what helps us create sashimi.

The Deba Knife - The fish, meat and poultry chopper

The Sujihiki
Last but maybe the best is the Sujihiki knife. Working with the Sujihiki is like playing the violin. Drawing the full length bow across the strings rather than slashing back and forth leads to a much cleaner cut. However, the Tanto point is especially helpful when cutting sinew away from the bone.
If you like anything from sushi to texas BBQ - this is the blade for you.
The Sujihiki - The slicer that finishes the dish with a single stroke

Long, Slim & Sharp - The 270mm Sujihiki blade is the kitchen equivalent of a violin bow

story:
“Experience the cool, naturally refreshing taste of Honey Juice”

Donate to fund the first production line of a new alternative to sugary drinks and sodas

My Story:

Thank you for taking the time to read about my campaign! I am a stay at home mom from Dallas, Texas. I have always been health-conscious and willing to seek out the best all-natural and organic foods to feed my family. Over the past few years, I have perfected my own healthy, all-natural, fully organic beverage. It has become very popular within my circle of family and friends, I can hardly keep up with the demand!

Honey Juice is my own secret recipe that is sweetened by the all-natural flavor of honey. It is naturally organic and beneficial to adults and children! Honey Juice is a cool and refreshing alternative to unhealthy sugary drinks and diet sodas.

My family & friends have enjoyed the experience of Honey Juice.  Now, I want to take this beverage to the next level in offering it to the public so you too can enjoy the healthy experience of Honey Juice.  In order to turn my beverage into a business and start mass-producing it for distribution to several stores, I need your help!

Impact:

Today’s children and teens are often not getting the nutrition they need to let their bodies grow and thrive. Often the beverages they consume are full of sugar, extra calories, and unnecessary harmful ingredients and colors. Many of these artificial colors have been linked to ADHD diagnoses and behavior issues.

Drinking sugary beverages can also contribute to tooth decay, obesity, and a serious risk of developing diabetes. But at the same time, children are drawn to sweet beverages, and it can be difficult to provide a healthier alternative that doesn’t cause similar problems, or have unwanted ingredients.

A beverage like Honey Juice provides the sweetness that young and old crave, with the healthy ingredients and antioxidant properties parents want for their children. Delicious both warm and cold, this is the ideal beverage for children and teens alike! We recommend that children under the age of one avoid the drink until later on, as it does contain honey and that can be a health risk for little tots.

What I Need:

To fully realize my dream of selling Honey Juice to the masses, I need to raise $50,000 to hire a beverage company to help me mass-produce the product and help get it on high-end, organic stores such as Whole Foods, Trader Joe’s and Sprouts, as well as super stores like Walmart, Target, and local grocery stores as well.

Once we have contracted with a beverage company, we will use any additional funding to help with marketing, advertising, and covering any incidental costs that come along the way! We already have our “prototype” recipe ready for the beverage company to use, and we have beta tested the beverage among our large group of friends and family. The next step is to start mass-production!

Your generous donations can go a long way! As you can imagine, being a stay at home mom means we’re living on a strict budget. We live comfortably and are able to make ends meet, but we really do not have the savings to put towards this kind of project. At the same time, my husband is incredibly supportive of my dream, and wants me to do whatever it takes to get started. By donating to my campaign, you are helping to quickly bring this great product to the market and you are saving me the risk of incurring high-interest business loans. 

Your help will greatly be appreciated.  Please make a donation today!

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can’t make a donation at this time, there are still ways you can help support my campaign! Please take a few moments to share my information with your friends and family via social media, email, and through word of mouth! With your help we can get Honey Juice ready for production and mass-distribution into stores early next year!

Thank you in advance for your support and generous donations!

story:
About Us

Cocoaphilia is defined as the appreciation of chocolate. We create handcrafted artisan chocolates in small batches. 

Baking and candy making has long been a passion of mine. In my younger years, I dreamed of owning a bakery/coffee shop. A few years ago, I discovered working with chocolates, truffles, etc., and became hooked. I dream in chocolate, my mind is always going on ideas for new flavor profiles. In December of 2014, with the blessing of my husband and our two children, ages 8 and almost 10, I found the courage and followed my heart to open Cocoaphilia. 

Our dream is to purchase and run a food trailer specializing in all things chocolate. Truffles, Brownies, Desserts...you name it. We aspire to sell our treats in the OKC Metro on a daily basis, along with events that are held around the area, even the state. 

By donating to our campaign, you are helping us to purchase the Everything Chocolate Desserts Food Trailer, and to create a future for our children that will last for years to come!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $25,000. With that we hope to purchase a food trailer that has been in operation and is fully functional for what we are needing. We have found several in our area that are already in working order, and this amount is needed to purchase the truck, any licensing, and other expenses that might pop up.

  • We have some exciting perks for our generous contributors...including two for helping to promote other small businesses that choose to donate!
  • Every cent we receive in donations will go towards the purchase of the food trailer. 

What We Will Do

We are ready, willing and able to work hard, to get the food trailer set up and ready to roll before the Fall season starts. We are ready to put our time, energy and expertise in to making the best chocolate treats in our area, and to be a successful part of the food truck industry in Oklahoma.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Tell your friends and family, share our campaign with everyone you know. You might even know of someone who has a small business we could promote if they choose one of those options in our perks.
  • There are some great IndieGoGo tools for helping to share also!
We humbly thank you for your generous donations, and for helping to spread the word about our campaign!

story:
Short Summary

The remote island of Erromango in the southern province of Tafea in Vanuatu is suffering shattering losses as a result of a direct hit of Cyclone Pam on Saturday 14th March 2015. With the entire population of 2000 living in thatched housing, subsistence farming and relying on transport by boat to neighbouring villages they have lost it all - homes, food gardens,  food security and boats.

Our small business Pacific Provender Ltd is based at the isolated village of Port Narvin on Erromango. In 2014 we established the first ever sandalwood distillery on the island named  Banyan Distillery and we distilled the inaugural batch of the highly valued sandalwood oil - history in the making. We work in close consultation with the Erromangan Sandalwood and Essential Oil Association representing 42 farmers and the Department of Forests of the Republic of Vanuatu to train and employ Ni-Vanatuan sandalwood growers to process, produce and value add sandalwood oil products.

Now we play an integral role in the recovery and rebuilding of long term and resilient livelihoods of sandalwood growers in the face of the devastating destruction caused by the extreme Category 5 cyclone.

We need your help and support.

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise $160 000 AUD to aid the recovery and reconstruction of the of the sandalwood farmers' agricultural livelihoods by creating employment and high quality sustainable essential oil value added products for the local and international market.

Building Materials = $40,000 AUD
Cement, tech screws, roofing iron, cement reo etc

To help rebuild local houses on Erromango.

To make cement bricks to build two concrete buildings for the Association.
1. The Farmers Co-op for farm supplies such as chainsaws, fencing equipment, seeds and nursery equipment. This building will have a cellar cold room for food, seeds, water, medical supplies and can be used a cyclone shelter.
2. The Kiln Dryer for timber and can double as a cyclone shelter. Pacific Provender Ltd has a boiler that can be used to run a timber kiln dryer.

House Hold Items =  $12,000 AUD
Kitchen cooking  and eating utensils, clothing and bedding for families of Port Narvin.

Boat = $30,000 AUD
The main mode of transport around the islands. It is needed for the immediate transport of food, medical equipment and in the long term to transport  produce to and from Banyan Distillery for value adding.

Lucas Mill with slabbing attachment= $15,000 AUD
To salvage forestry timber that has been blown over.

Farming Equipment = $40,000 AUD
Chainsaws, gardening tools, wheel barrows, axes, winches, seeds, poly pipe, water tanks etc for the Farmers' Association.

Freight = $20,000 AUD

Barge from Port Vila to Erromango = 12,000 AUD
Melbourne to Port Vila = 8,000 AUD

Mosquito Stick Making Machine = $7,000 AUD
Pacific Provender Ltd will train farmers to operate the mosquito stick making machine and use the salvaged, smaller sandalwood timber as the base for the mosquito sticks.The sandalwood powder will be blended with essential oils with high citronella content to make the mosquito sticks. Pacific Provender will purchase the sandalwood from the farmers providing immediate and much needed money into the community. The mosquito sticks can then be distributed across the 82 islands of Vanuatu and sold for mosquito control and associated illnesses .
These can be sold country wide on all 82 islands of Vanuatu.

All funds raised will be gifted to the Sandalwood and Essential Oil Association of Erromango Number 012507 registered by the Vanuatu Financial Services Commission Republic of Vanuatu. The Association members will prioritise the allocation of funds.

The Impact

During fourteen years of planning and consultation with the Erromangan Council of Chiefs and their communities we have built a strong relationship with the people of Erromango and have the support of:

  • Port Narvin Council of Chiefs
  • Tafea Provincial Government
  • Republic of Vanuatu Department of Forests
  • Vocational Rural Training Centres on Erromango
  • Secure land leases

We are on the ground living and working on the island. We have a responsibility and a commitment to improving the livelihoods of sandalwood growers, their families and communities through sustainable production, diversification into other essential oils and value adding of products.

Our source of sandalwood is sustainable and production of oil for the local and international market is ethical - employment and value adding on the island.

Your contribution will go directly to the Erromango Sandalwood and Essential Oil Farmers' Association and their families. This means a family can:

rebuild after Cyclone PAM

pay school fees

send a child to highschool

buy gardening tools and seeds

access some medical assistance


Risks & Challenges

We are a small 'husband and wife 'business. We have overcome significant challenges to move a business from Australia to not only Vanuatu but a remote outer island. Three years of meticulous planning and three shipping containers of machinery and distillation equipment shipped to Port Narvin and we have achieved the seeming impossible - distilling the highly valued sandalwood oil on Erromango. 

Erromango is the forgotten island. It has very little tourism and relies on the sale of sandalwood and lobsters for income. Our greatest challenge is ensuring "their voices are heard" and sandalwood growers are empowered to value add to their natural resource to break the cycle of selling immature wood.

We have established markets for the value added oil.

Other Ways You Can Help
Donations of goods

story:
A Little Bit of Background

Hi, my name is Paula and I'm opening a bakery in beautiful Joseph, Oregon. Vanilla Stag will be located at the new grocery store, re-opening in just a few weeks from now.

I've been cooking for as long as I can remember. As a young girl, I was the designated family baker and pretty soon began to see cooking as more than simply preparing food. I trained in Classical French Cuisine at the Chef Studio under the tutelage of the late Robert Reynolds. Later I co-founded The Irreverent Spoon, a pop-up dinner club in Portland, Ore. with one of my dear culinary training peers. My professional cooking career includes some very interesting and fun jobs. From Pastry Chef/Baker at a gluten-free garden-to-table restaurant in the state of Washington's Olympic Peninsula; caterer for a wedding on a grassy labyrinth on the Columbia River Gorge; Friday night Cook at a crêperie in Portland, Ore.; to Chef for the Eire Retour, a 10-day tour in the west of Ireland.

My mentor Robert used to say “food tastes better when it tastes like what it is,” and his words have deeply influenced my approach to cooking and baking. I would describe my cooking style as straightforward and aimed at creating community around the table. Through this bakery, I'll get to share my passion for cooking and bring joy to the world around me.

 

A Brand is Born

Deer are part of the landscape in Wallowa County and it's very common to see them wondering all around. This past Winter, there was one young buck that would come by and rub his antlers on a tree right outside our back door. It was wonderful to watch and he made an impression on me.

One day in early January, I was walking on Wallowa Lake's east moraine brainstorming about cooking possibilities and a flash of inspiration hit all at once: the ubiquitous stag, present in our everyday lives here in Joseph, and the promise that young buck represented. And vanilla, the most foundational and approachable flavor in sweets.

And just like that, the Vanilla Stag brand was born. 

 

What We Offer

At Vanilla Stag we will produce high-quality and downright delicious sweet and savory pastries, cakes, desserts and cookies -including gluten-free and dairy-free options- year round in the heart of Joseph, Oregon.

We’re not looking at reinventing the world of pastries but to simply bring something special to Wallowa County. Using local and fresh ingredients whenever possible, it is our goal to introduce new flavors and to offer a contemporary approach on some familiar items. Once we get established, we also plan to start making artisanal breads in-house.

Our wish is to make Vanilla Stag treats memorable and contribute to making Wallowa County a culinary destination. And with your help, we can make it happen.

 

 

Our Goal

We have a very aggressive schedule that is dictated by the grocery store re-opening date. Our goal is to raise $15,000 in startup capital in the next 15 days. The money we raise is going to help us get the bakery going and will be covering costs like:

  • Lawyer's Fees 
  • Bakery equipment, from big commercial mixers to zesters
  • Operational costs, like packaging boxes/bags, display trays, etc
  • Marketing costs from product labels to a website
  • Starting inventory, because we need a lot of flour and sugar and butter and ... sprinkles!
  • Crowdfunding Fees

Your contribution means everything to us. And as a thank you, we want to offer some perks:

  • Goodie boxes of tasty treats just for you, so whether you're near or far, you can get a taste of who we are.
  • The Cookie Love Jar: we'll have a cookie jar at the bakery with the names of everybody that contributed to the campaign to remind us daily of those who helped make Vanilla Stag possible.
  • Fun and stylish gifts, who doesn't love them?

We will honor any and all support you can give to our project with our promise of hard work and commitment to quality. So head over to the perks area on the right and choose your level of spice!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that perhaps you may not be able to contribute financially to this project but you can contribute by helping us spread the word. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to post on your social media and tell every cookie lover in your life about this campaign. 

We sincerely appreciate your support and will be forever grateful.
Thank you!  ... And please come visit us anytime!

story:
The Story:

Wine Guy & Wine Gal has been a dream in the making for years. My love and passion for the wine world has taken me on a journey that is absolutely priceless. It’s not just the amazing food and wines, it’s been all of the amazing people I have met that have taught, shared and helped me arrive at this once in a lifetime opportunity. I have been in the wine industry for over 30 years building wine brands, selling and sharing my journey with everyone I meet. Now it’s time to share with all of you. 

The Wine:

Making wine is not easy. Making great wine is very rare. Being able to make amazing wines from some of the top vineyards in Sonoma is a once in a lifetime opportunity. We need some more funds to help make this dream come to life. We are so grateful and appreciative for everyones help and that’s why we wanted to create some fun ways to not only say thank you but to let you know that you’re part of our journey.

The Journey:

I am so excited to announce that we have our Inaugural Vintage of Wine Guy & Wine Gal wines from Sonoma being released in November. We are starting where most wine brands only dream of. We have a partnership with not one but two famous and historic wine families in Sonoma. The Mauritson Family and Dutton Family. Having the opportunity to be in a great relationship with these families is above and beyond exciting. We can’t wait to share these wines with everyone. 

It’s more than food and wine, it’s about sharing our story with all of you. So join our journey and “Let’s Pair Together”

story:
Hello Supporters!

 

Our passion for Italian cooking and travel has brought us through many  kitchens, ranging from the restaurants of Michelin Star chefs to the homes of shepherds, grandmothers, and farmers of Italy's varied regions.  We would like to share these culinary experiences with you through the opening of our first solo restaurant, Cicala.  Our menu will stem from Italy's Southern regions with a focus on handmade pastas and charcuterie, offering rustic Italian cuisine in a elegant and refined setting.

The opening of Cicala Restaurant will lead the North Broad Street Renaissance by bringing luxury dining back to the historic Divine Lorriane Hotel, while coinciding with the opening of the newly renovated Metropolitan Opera House, just one block north of us.              

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are seeking $50,000 in funds which will provide pre-construction operating costs such as deposits for interior and kitchen designers, legal fees etc.
  • Invitations to soft openings and exclusive events are just a few of our perks which we are excited to offer.  Scroll down to see how you can take a pasta class with us or even join us on one of our tours to Italy with a generous donation.
  • $1.3 million has already been raised in capital through investors, SBA loans and landlord contributions.  The money raised through this campaign will go toward immediate use while we close the already commited funding.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributions toward this campaign are not limited to monetary donations. 

GET THE WORD OUT!  Share this campaign with your friends and family through various social media or email our cause to colleagues who may have the means to help.  

ATTEND OUR LAUNCH PARTY!

Join us May 10th inside of our restaurant space for an evening of chef tastings, music, wine, beer, and silent auction.  All proceeds will fund our pre opening operating costs such as legal fees, designs fees, permits etc...  Tickets available for purchase through Eventbrite.com starting April 10!

story:
Hey Friends! My name is Judy Steenekamp and i have been married for 6 years to an amazing guy, Chris Steenekamp and together we have a big dream that we are so passionate about that we just need to share it with YOU.

THIS IS US!

Now that you know who we are and where we live, lets get down to this awesome idea that we would love for you to be a part of.

Having passion and a business idea is easy, but the question i had to roll around in my head is what will make Seven Tree Cafe stand out from the rest. We have restaurants that offer vegan dishes, coffee shops and health shops down the road, but what would get the public super excited  if it were to launch in SA?

The drive through was my light bulb moment. Absolutely Brilliant. So i got to work.

HOW DO YOU FIND OUT WHAT THE PUBLIC WANTS? - YOU ASK!

​ I recently did a survey on what products and services vegans, vegetarians and health nuts would like to see more of in South Africa which helped me to see what is lacking in SA and how Seven Tree can fill that gap to supply the public with the goods they need and want.

I noticed that another common complaint was not having a One Stop Shop which is exactly what our aim is. 

The idea behind Seven Tree Cafe is to:

  • Be the first vegan drive through cafe in South Africa where you can buy  cruelty free products  or sit down, relax and choose some great food from the menu.
  • Open drive through cafes throughout South Africa. Once again we do not have anything like this at all in South Africa.
  • Promote health and wellness.
  • Empower and educate people.
  • Create job opportunities.
  • Support small local suppliers and  walk along side outreach organizations.
  • To be a leader in the market

 

​FIRST DRIVE THROUGH VEGAN WELLNESS CAFE  IN SOUTH AFRICA

We only have 3 major drive through brands in South Africa with a population of approximately 55 million people (I wont even go into why these brands are not good for your health and the environment) Our aim is to change that.

People turning to vegan, raw and healthy lifestyles is on the rise in South Africa and that is why a drive through wellness cafe is brilliant and THE TIME IS NOW because not only will it offer healthy meals for the entire family  but it will also offer a convenient shopping experience for our clients.

​

THE MOBILE APP

The App will allow clients to:

  • Place their take away & grocery order from any device
  • Pay
  • Receive a reference number and collect. Easy Peezy

Most people i chat to always answer with "BUSY"  when you ask them how they are doing.     Life is fast paced, every second counts and convenience is key, i am sure most of you can relate so that is why the app combined with the drive through is going to make life a whole lot easier.

 

 GIVING BACK

  • We just recently launched a website called GOT 2 LOVE (www.got2love.co.za) where people can list their cruelty free business. Seven Tree will stock their products so that we support the small guy and not just the big suppliers. Sometimes it is the granny down the street that makes the most delicious relish that you just wont find in any shop.
  • Fruit & Vegetables will be bought from a range of community gardens in the area. We will support these organizations by helping to  grow their gardens, feed more people, create more jobs and keep people off the street which in turn gives them back their dignity and helps fight poverty.

(photo - www.harvestofhope.org.za)

(photo - just love these kids from Morkels cottage )

JOBS & TRAINING

 

EMPOWERING EVENTS

  • Changing your lifestyle and eating habits seminars will hosted by top health experts in the industry. 
  • Cooking seminars for those that want to take their healthy cooking to the next level.
  • Food & drink tasting events which will include items from the menu and goods from our suppliers  because people will buy more when they know what they are buying.

LOYALTY CARDS

  • Eveyone loves a freebie. We are all about giving back to our clients so we will be implementing a loyalty card programme. We have a few ideas up our sleeve which will be revealed once our shop is open for business.

 

" NO Act of Kindness, no matter how small, has ever been wasted" 

Your contribution  to us is and act of selfless kindness, believing in something that will change the lives of many and revolutionize the vegan industry in South Africa. 

We don't have anything like this in South Africa, there is a growing demand so we  believe with YOUR contribution, our passion, drive and faith the business will grow from strength to strength nationally.

"It only takes one person and one act of kindness to inspire others and create change"

Your contribution goes way beyond what you could ever imagine.

  • You are helping to make our dream become a reality - there are not enough words to express our gratitude.
  • Be part of the first ever cruelty free wellness drive though café in South Africa 
  • Support organizations and give people the opportunity to better themselves through our training programme.
  • Small local suppliers are given another place to sell their products and share their passion with a wider audience.

 Take a sneek peek at some of the items Seven Tree will offer the public 

Wellness Shop : Vegan cheese, vegan "meat", milk, health drinks, cruelty free baby & child products, bath and beauty products, nuts, seeds, apparel, essential oils, bread and pastries, household products, general grocery products, sweets and alot more.

Our Menu :

  • Freshly squeezed juices, smoothies, coffee, exotic teas ect 
  • Breakfast vibes 
  • Vegan sushi
  • Smoothie bowls
  • Wraps
  • Burgers
  • Hot dogs
  • Fries
  • Salads
  • Vegetable dishes
  • Natchos 
  • Sweet things 

These are just a few examples, unfortunately we cant let all our secrets out of the bag.

 

With Big Dreams come Big Money. We will need $50 000 to start our very first Seven Tree drive through.

Shop rental and deposit: $ 5800 (3 months rent + Deposit) 

Electrical: $ 700

Shop interior and furniture: $ 9500

Catering equipment: $ 4250

Cutlery and crockery: $ 500

Stock for cafe and wellness shop: $ 11500

Menu ingredients : $ 3800

Staff uniforms: $ 450

Fridges: $ 850

Cash register: $ 300

Menus: $ 250

Signage: $ 450

Marketing: $ 650

Website & App: $ 2500

Telephone line and internet: $ 400

POS System: $ 4600

Security system: $ 1500

Opening day & promotions: $ 2000

GRAND TOTAL : $ 50 000   

 

With out you this wont be possible, please have a look at what we are offering to say a BIG BIG  thank you for your contribution.

Some of the perks will be digital and some will be in the form of a gift voucher including free shipping. You will be able to choose any of the products from the wellness shop.

Stay tuned as we will be adding additional perks during the campaign period.

There is nothing like a good ol' surprise when you least expect it.

 

 

 

We believe that any start-up business or even established businesses that have been around for sometime will face certain challenges at some point.

I have done my market research so i have no doubt in my mind that this is a concept that will be successful, I know that together Chris and i have enough drive and passion to embrace the times of success and to fight through the times of challenge.

  • Be fierce when it comes to marketing your brand.
  • Excellent food and customer service is vital.
  • Stay up to date with market trends
  • Make wise decisions, when in doubt don't do it.
  • Stay ahead of your competitors (Being the first and only wellness drive through cafe will definitely put us ahead of the race)

We  need the $50 000 to be able to do everything we want to but should we not meet the required amount then we will start up on a smaller scale with the same vision and passion building the business up to where we want it to be. 

What will happen to the funds that are received over and above $50 000?

  • 1/3 will go towards the business (stock, interior, building, rent)
  • 1/3 will go to the community organizations
  • 1/3 will go back to YOU by means of additional Perks

 

We know that you might be reading this campaign and  you would love to contribute but unfortunately you are not able to,  we absolutely understand, but you can still help!

Spread the word, SHARE this campaign with family, friends and  anyone that you feel might be interested in helping us achieve our goal via email, social media, word of mouth ect 

Any and all help is sincerely appreciated.

We have a big vision for Seven Tree and we would love to have YOU on this journey with us

Stay ahead of your competitors (Being the first and only wellness drive through cafe will definitely put us ahead of the race)

We  need the $50 000 to be able to do everything we want to but should we not meet the required amount then we will start up on a smaller scale with the same vision and passion building the business up to where we want it to be. 
What will happen to the funds that are received over and above $50 000?


1/3 will go towards the business (stock, interior, building, rent)

1/3 will go to the community organizations

1/3 will go back to YOU by means of additional Perks

 


We know that you might be reading this campaign and  you would love to contribute but unfortunately you are not able to,  we absolutely understand, but you can still help!
Spread the word, SHARE this campaign with family, friends and  anyone that you feel might be interested in helping us achieve our goal via email, social media, word of mouth ect 
Any and all help is sincerely appreciated.
We have a big vision for Seven Tree and we would love to have YOU on this journey with us

story:
(La versión en español la encuentras en nuestra web: https://www.francotiendacafe.com/)

 

What is FRANCO®?

A colombian coffeehouse that offers specialty coffee beverages to colombians in a simple, affordable, kind and special way. 

We foster rural development by increasing domestic consumption of the best paid coffee beans. 

 

 

WHAT MOVES US?

We believe it's time for colombians to connect with the specialty origin coffee that coffee growers in their own country produce with so much love and passion.

We believe it's time to remember what makes us so special and how we can walk together, trusting each other again.

We believe we can do these in each cup of coffee at a time :).

 

Simple and magic experience.

 

 

We will offer at least 4 types of different origins specialty coffee beans so each costumer can choose one of them and feel our wonderful diversity in each cup.

We offer also 5 types of beverages and 3 sizes to enjoy your chosen coffee beans...

It's easier, kinder and more special.

      

"Dar papaya" is a bad choice.

 

Dar papaya is an expression we use in Colombia to say we are giving other the chance to harm or take advantage of us because we were not sufficiently cautious. 

Suppose you leave your wallet in the dinner table and you don't take care of it. Now suppose you are about to leave and you notice someone has taken it. A colombian will probably say: you "dar papaya". 

               

Transforming social disadvantage.

    

All our coffee beverages are made of specialty origin beans, so we will pay the coffee growers 5 times more than a regular one receives! 

And when you buy this special coffee beverage we promise to pay them even 3 times more for their coffee beans, something nobody does in any coffeehouse in our country.

 

Imagine we can reach our goal to have 50 coffeehouses over the next five years. It means 50 times more the opportunity for our coffee growers to earn until 15 times they earn today. Its a real gamechanger!

 

"Trust is Worthy" Campaign.

 

This special beverage you will find in the sizes menu is the entry to a magic experience.

When you buy it, we give the freedom to pay it voluntarily -no vigilance or observance- in a special box we will dispose in our locations. We don't know you but we believe in you.

Thanks to this act of faith, we promise to pay three times more the value of the coffee each beverage contains to our coffee growers. 

But.. how?

At the end of the month we will publish how many of this beverages were sold of each type of bean. We will contact the coffee growers, notify them the results and pay them immediately the extra money they owned. 

 

Direct Commerce, Fair Trade.

 

We will tell you the big secret: we buy our coffee beans directly from the coffee growers, no intermediaries in between. That's why this process is more fair and profitable for them. 

The traditional way involves many agents from the coffee growers to the final costumer, so the profit of each coffee bean is distributed in many parts.

Buying it directly from them makes it possible to have affordable specialty beans with fair payment to those who really deserve it. 

 

Franco (Long Term) Plan.

 

We dream with giving a chance to our coffee growers to receive real opportunities to grow. We dream with giving them a direct benefit.

Imagine one coffee shop buys 110 pounds of coffee each month. If we reach our goal we would be able, in five years, to buy 2.755 pounds of specialty coffee beans that are paid 15 times more a regular coffee growers earns in our country.

More demand we make possible, more supply (well paid) will come!

 

Together We Can.

 

Some tribus in Africa used to call it UBUNTU: "I am what I am because of who we all are".

We believe is possible that everyone wins when everyone trusts in each other. That's the experience we want to deliver.

We trust in our costumers when we let them pay with no vigilance and observance, costumers trust in our promise of paying more to our coffee growers, whom in turn trust in us to get it. 

When you support us you make this circle of trust possible :)             

We believe specialty coffee is made for all of us, we believe it's time to feel it closer.

We designed a simple and magic experience. We discovered our colombian costumers don't really care about coffee data or boring technical features like degrees of roast and temperatures.

We discovered they connect with flavors, places, colors and emotional identities. 

The easier it is, the more special it becomes.

 

But..

what specialty origin coffee means?

Imagine each type of this bean it's like a unique piece done by the hands of an special coffee artisan in a single and particular origin. It comes from a defined and unique provenance, like a farm.

It's specialty is qualified by an expert and it scores more than 85 in the Q Coffee international measurements.

It has unique flavors and tastes as a result of a long, loved and dedicated work.

 

Digital Believer Certification

A lifetime memory of your contribution for this dream. Imagine the emotional value it will have in 20 years. Your name, the date and all the heart you gave us with your fund all-in-one in a unique digital piece!

 

Special 6 Oz FRANCO® Gold Cup

 

Imagine you order one beverage and you drink it in one of 100  limited edition FRANCO® Gold Cups we have designed to our  beloved believers. You can take them to our coffeehouses and feel the magic power it gives to your experience. It remembers to  you something really wonderful happened because of your generosity.

 

FRANCO® Wall of Fame

 

Now imagine you see your name in every coffeehouse in a wall like these. It will be there FOREVER to remember us that in millions of millions of people around the world, you, that big hearted and visionary human being, contributed in such a way to make this real.

 

PD: "Franco" is a spanish term that means trustworthy, honest, something like "it is what it is and you get what we said". It doesn't need ornament to be special :).

story:
Who is Blackwater Distilling?

Blackwater Distilling (www.blackwaterdistilling.com) is the first distillery to open in MD since the closure of the last rye whiskey distillery in the early 1970s. Blackwater Distilling was formed by the Cook brothers, Chris and Jon, in 2005 but did not begin production until 2011. Being the first distillery in MD in over 30 years did not make this an easy business to start (are any of them easy?) and the economic downturn certainly didn’t help, either. We had to bootstrap every step of the way; building this company has been an effort of love (and stubbornness). Since opening on April 1, 2011, we have released ten regular spirits and several other limited run specialty spirits.

We are located in Stevensville, MD, the gateway to Maryland’s Eastern Shore. We believe the Shore is a very special place, and we do everything we can to give back to our community and run our business in a fashion that is healthy for the environment, the community, and our customers. We believe strongly in traditional production methods and using all natural ingredients. As a result, our products have won numerous awards including our most recent (and fourth) Gold Medal for Sloop Betty Vodka at the New York International Wine and Spirits Competition and Best in Category (Craft Aged Rum) for our Picaroon Dark Rum at the 2017 and 2018 ADI spirits competition.

Since opening our doors over seven years ago, we have had almost twenty other distilleries join us in helping to rebuild the craft spirits industry in Maryland. We work together to spread our message to consumers in the mid-Atlantic.

Maryland recently changed their distilling licenses in a way that allows us to open a tavern and fundamentally change how we accomplish this goal. Starting the Tavern will allow customers to order cocktails rather than solely sample straight spirits.  We will be able to host mixology classes, special spirits workshops, and even social events for families and businesses. We’ll be open seven days a week and will also have food available on-site.

What do we need your help to accomplish?

In short, we’re asking for your help to change the way customers get to experience our brand, and our products as we continue our efforts to be part of a growing craft spirits industry in Maryland. With your help, we are expanding and moving our business from our current location to a new spot right on route 50 in Stevensville. This will give us both the operational space we need, and the indoor and outdoor space required to make Blackwater a successful Distillery and Tavern.

In addition to Blackwater Distilling, Kent Island is also home to Cascia Winery and has a brewery on the way, Cult Classic Brewing. Demographics on Kent Island are also skewing towards households with disposable income, with increasing building trends favoring apartment complexes and 55 and over communities. This places Blackwater in a high visibility and easily accessible location front and center on the main tourist artery to the beach in the summer.  Blackwater Distilling is part of a local community that favors growth in the industry and homegrown businesses. It is both the right time and the right place for this expansion in every conventional sense. Add to this the increasing popularity of craft spirits, and the increasing opportunities for our existing customer base, and we feel strongly that this move will be a success.

So, where do you fit in?  Well… as with any move like this, we have a budget and a plan to make the move within it, but we need help funding it.  We want to have a great bar and a great outdoor entertainment space, areas where your support will be required. We’re raising money to cover the building of the bar and all mechanicals supporting it, as well as outdoor furniture, games, and, with our stretch goal, hardscaping and (hopefully, pending fire marshal approval) a firepit.  These are all areas that will help us make a great first impression as a destination, and as representatives of the craft distilling movement.

Actual bar layout may differ somewhat, although concept of use is accurate.

So, what’s the tab?  We’re looking for $40,000.  We want to build a bar that is worthy of Maryland’s rich distilling history and future. We need bar equipment including two kegerators.  As a tavern, we won’t just focus on local spirits, we’ll focus on local alcohol. We want one kegerator reserved for kegged Blackwater Distilling cocktails, and another for local beer. Our intention is to only carry local products when there is a quality local product available. We also need the basics; it’s easy to overlook them, but our customers will assume cleanliness and service will be top notch. And they will! Sinks, ice maker, and dishwasher will allow our staff the time and resources to meet those goals. While we’re still working on designs (getting close!), the bar itself should be remarkable visually, and evocative of both craft spirits and Maryland. Current visions take inspiration from oak staves, textured copper, and other natural materials.

Outdoors will be a key part of our operation for at least three seasons of the year. We need comfortable seating, space heaters, and games. The space is permanently covered with an 18 foot ceiling, entirely open on two sides, partially open on a third, and accessible to the tavern on the fourth. The outdoor space where drinking is permitted must be fenced off, this will include the covered space minimally, with access allowed both indoors and to the food truck.  What kind of games? Group games. We want this space to be a very comfortable and social one.

What’s in the stretch goal? Well, this property is blessed with space. We’d really like to increase that space by adding some hardscaping outdoors beyond the current covered space. This will allow us to increase seating and also focus on adding natural beauty to the exterior. Our goal is to add an outdoor fireplace or stone firepit with ample seating around it, and possibly a small area for music. Lastly, we would like the stretch goal to help us with planting trees. While much of this property is wooded, we’d like to plant more between our outdoor area and the highway. Part of this property was cleared when it was originally developed, and we’d like to restore native trees.

Lastly, what happens if we don’t reach our goal? Well, we have to prioritize the work, and it will be prioritized as presented. We’ll start our focus on the bar, move from there to the outdoor space, and from there into our stretch goal work with hardscaping and landscaping. If we don’t reach our full target, we’ll do what we have experience doing, we’ll dig deep, lean on emotional support from friends and family, and get the project done to the best of our ability. Hard work and believing got us to where we are today and paved the way for other Maryland distillers.  We don’t give up.

What's in it for you?

The Quid Pro Whiskey... Aside from the glorious feeling of being a part of something special, as well as something that can make you feel special (the whiskey!), we have a lot of great perks available for purchase.

We have some great offers and opportunities to save on items and packages that will be available at retail after the Distillery and Tavern are open for business. Buying in now gives you the opportunity to be an early adopter, come out right away and see what we have to offer, and save some money along the way.

We have some other perks that are similar to things we'll be offering at the Tavern, but won't be what we consider 'regular items'. We plan on offering mixology classes, we'll give you the chance for a private class for eight. We're offering private tables for the grand re-opening of the distillery and grand opening of the tavern. These are largely one time only items.

Last, we have some options that we may never offer again, chiefly, whole barrels of aged spirits. In the name of the move, we're offering up a couple barrels of Picaroon rum, and also the option to create your own barrel. We have some regulations governing how these transactions have to take place, but they're a great opportunity to have something completely unique that may never be offered again.

At Blackwater Distilling, we have experience with change as a business. As Maryland's first distillery, by definition, we have experienced every change in this market since it's renaissance.  We haven't done this process exactly, but we have done most of the component changes individually at some point in our recent past.  This is a big project for us, it is our primary focus with the business today, and we are looking forward to bringing you a craft spirits destination for years to come.

Risks & Challenges

Since we already have our distilling equipment, liquor licenses at the state and federal level, and an approved location, the primary risk is construction. So far we are on budget and on time but as with all projects there is the risk that timelines may be longer than anticipated with construction costs impacted. The Indiegogo campaign addresses that risk as well as helps our team build out the tavern the way we envisioned. 

The move: Moving our distillery to the tavern location involves many logistics, not the least of which is moving specialized distilling equipment. Blackwater’s assumption is that by hiring professional movers and mitigating risk wherever possible, there will be no impact to our schedule and the move will be as near to seamless as we dare to hope. In the event that it is not, delivery timelines may be impacted.

Construction: The move to the new tavern location requires a construction build-out that must meet the standards of state, local, and federal regulations. Blackwater Distilling will do everything in its power to use project management best practices to estimate its delivery date for backers. Construction, planning and zoning, and weather delays are always a possibility and may impact opening day and delivery dates to backers.

But rest assured! We’ve already addressed a lot! We have a signed lease and will be partnering with an established (and local!) restaurant. This will provide the double benefit of putting food in people's bellies while, at the same time, we won’t be involving ourselves in any unfamiliar business models. We have county approval for zoning use, should be able to pull permits for interior work any day, and have submitted plans for approval on exterior work. Local supporters have literally put pen to paper to sign their names supporting our project as required by the county for the tavern license. We have established marketing and social media support teams in place and ready to roll. And we’re an established business with multiple award winning products that is ready to spread its wings and grow!  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren’t in a position to contribute financially, you can still be part of the project! You can support our growing distillery and the campaign by sharing our campaign video on Facebook and our campaign link with friends and family. You can also follow and share our posts on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and join our mailing list to stay updated on our campaign progress. Plus you’ll hear about new events at the tavern and distillery!

However you choose, we give you our thanks and deeply appreciate your support.

Every share, like or tweet counts!
