But rest assured! We’ve already addressed a lot! We have a signed lease and will be partnering with an established (and local!) restaurant. This will provide the double benefit of putting food in people's bellies while, at the same time, we won’t be involving ourselves in any unfamiliar business models. We have county approval for zoning use, should be able to pull permits for interior work any day, and have submitted plans for approval on exterior work. Local supporters have literally put pen to paper to sign their names supporting our project as required by the county for the tavern license. We have established marketing and social media support teams in place and ready to roll. And we’re an established business with multiple award winning products that is ready to spread its wings and grow!  
Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren’t in a position to contribute financially, you can still be part of the project! You can support our growing distillery and the campaign by sharing our campaign video on Facebook and our campaign link with friends and family. You can also follow and share our posts on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and join our mailing list to stay updated on our campaign progress. Plus you’ll hear about new events at the tavern and distillery!
However you choose, we give you our thanks and deeply appreciate your support.
Every share, like or tweet counts!

story:
Our Story

Got a dollar to share? There are 1.2 million vegans in the US alone...if just a tiny fraction of those gave $1 we could have the most awesome nut milk maker ever!! 

The world of food is changing! More and more people are cooking (and eating) without dairy milk and animal products. Whether it be for health, social justice, or the environment, veganism is picking up steam. Every day I feel such joy to be alive in the age of compassion and consciousness. We are so awesome!! 

My name is Susana Romatz. My partner and I started our Avellana journey five years ago, commercially producing vegan cheese made from hazelnut milk. While this was very rewarding, we found that the price we had to charge was prohibitive for many.That weighed on us a lot. When a distributor who was interested in getting our cheeses into a larger market approached us, we realized that the price was going to go up even higher. We were at a turning point. We would either need to go big and expensive, or reconsider our goals and methods. Did we want to produce a cheese that only a small percentage of people could afford? Or was it time to take a different tack and re-examine our mission?

We decided to change direction. While we so appreciate (and often purchase) awesome pre-made vegan cheeses, for us, showing people how to make their own crazy delicious vegan cheese and providing the very best tools to do so, made more sense to us. Teaching people allows everyone the opportunity to grow and learn like we did as we developed our cheese, as well as keeping the cost of the final products lower, reducing packaging, and increasing self-sufficiency.

The machines that are available on the market to date are mostly lacking in power. We tried to use our juicer to make nut milk to poor results, because a lot of the nut material wasn't fully broken down, wasting the good fats and proteins locked inside the cellulose. We quickly realized that the only way to really extract as much goodness as is possible from the fibrous nuts, is to use a machine to grind them up completely, then use centrifugal force to sling out those delicious fats and proteins. So we ended up buying a commercial grade soy milk maker to do the job. Unfortunately, when it arrived we realized it wasn't engineered or constructed the way we needed it to be for this job of extracting. We took out parts, drew up plans, and had some new parts tooled from food grade plastics. In essence, we made our own custom nut milk separator that we used to extract hundreds of gallons of the best hazelnut milk ever made.

Once we stopped producing our cheeses, I realized that what the world needs is a way to make really delicious nut milks without a damp, squishy nut milk bag or wasting expensive nut materials on machines that aren't powerful enough to properly break down their fibers. A machine that would transform the fibers extracted into a usable flour, rather than compost or further waste materials. 

I started drawing up plans and the Avellana Separator was born. 

What We Need to Make the Machine a Reality:

I hired an engineer to draw up preliminary plans for a prototype and to produce a rough design model of my idea (pictured in the video). Next, I partnered up with an company that does "end to end" product development. End to end means that they examine my CAD files, help me come up with a working prototype, and together we will produce a line of separators for retail.

We need $2,000 to move forward to the next phase of prototype review. After that we will need another big chunk of money to move forward into building a functional prototype. My hope is that once we meet the first $2,000 goal and can refine the idea, more people will sign on to to help with the final costs.

Though we have a patent pending beta prototype that shows the basics on how this separator works, we need further product evaluation, engineering, research, and testing to finalize a working prototype. Once we reach this goal, we will move into phase two of our fundraising plan, which will allow us to reach out to the larger manufacturing facilities necessary to produce a small initial run of manufactured separators. 

Where will your money go?

In more detail, the money we are raising will be spent in this way:

Stage 1. Research, mechanical engineering, concept refinement, and CAD review at a cost of $2,000. 

Stage 2. Alpha prototyping, materials, developing proof of concept, parts fabrication and assembly, and testing at a cost of $9,000-$20,000. 

Stage 3. Product refinement, CAD refinement, designing and manufacturing modifications, and fully field testable beta prototyping at a cost of $8,000-$12,000. 

Once we get to this point in the process, we will have a fully functioning nut milk separator and we can use that beta prototype to secure the funding necessary to manufacture a run of 1,000-10,000 separators. 

Risks & Challenges

There is a LOT of work that needs to go into this process before the finished results come to our doors. You might ask yourself, why would I trust this process with my hard earned money? How do I know that this product will come to fruition? Well, though there are no guarantees in life...anyone who knows me will attest that I am not a quitter. I believe that this product will help change the way we make food. Not to mention the fact that I desperately need this product to make my life easier, healthier, and tastier. I've personally invested thousands of dollars into this project to get it to this point. 

That, coupled with the fact that I am working with world class engineers and product manufacturing experts, with your help we will see this product through to completion. Give a dollar, give five dollars, whatever you feel comfortable doing. Also, share this campaign to all your friends!! Maybe, just maybe, we can get something cool made. 

 

The Impact

Making it easier and more fun to make dairy alternatives at home is imperative to the vegan and plant based movement. We can help save animals from suffering, make a positive impact on the environment, and make awesome dairy alternative products at home if this project succeeds.

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Rashe Malcolm, owner of Rashe's Cuisine, wife, and mother of 4. I started Rashe's Cuisine as a teenager focusing on providing meals to the elderly and families that could not otherwise afford catering services of quality, healthy, and cultured foods. I also taught young girls and latch key kids how to prepare quick meals for themselves and their family. Today, Rashe's Cuisine continues to cater, deliver and provide food to the communities I serve. Until recently, I also ran a Jamaican To Go brick and mortar restaurant on Tallassee Road.

I recently lost my brick and mortar restaurant to a ceiling collapse that flooded the restaurant and then subsequent sale to another restaurant, all within less than a week span. Instead of giving up, I have used this situation as an opportunity to finally achieve a dream. I'm finally going to realize my dream of operating Rashe's Cuisine,  Jamaican-To-Go as a mobile food trailer. so I can continue the work I love. 

I'm reaching out to you, my community, to raise the money for the necessary deposit on the food trailer. The food trailer will allow me to realize my long-time vision to be more visible in my community and also own my kitchen, two things that are very important to me.  

What We Need & What You Get

As I'm working through the Small Business Administration (SBA) for a loan to purchase the food trailer, the SBA requires me to have a deposit of $9,000 as my down payment for the loan. Where you can help is by pre-purchasing food plates. My goal is to pre-sale 900 plates of food at $10 per plate whether individual or by groups. This will allow me to EARN the necessary funds I need to put the down payment on my food trailer. Do you have a family reunion, office party, training, employee appreciation, lunch n' learn or just your next family meal that you need someone to provide food for? Pre-purchase those plates through this crowd-funding campaign.  Want to support, but financially you can't? Share my campaign with individuals & businesses who may need my catering or family meal services. Help me get the word out!

What Does A $10 Plate Look Like?

A $10 plate will come with 2 meats and 2 sides (for example: Jerk Pork, Jerk Chicken, Rice and Peas, and Veggies). Don't eat meat, not a problem I can provide for you a 4 veggie option that's sure to please (Veggie Pattie, Curry Veggies, Rice and Peas, and Plantains). Want to support, but not sure if you and your guests want a full Jamaican meal. No problem, I custom make meals for your occasion. Having a breakfast meeting? Let me provide you with a breakfast bar that will WOW your co-workers or clients. Want a Southern menu with a Jamaican vibe? Try my Jamaican Jerk BBQ Ribs and Whole Jerk Chicken Wings with Mac and Cheese and Collard Greens.

story:
Short Summary

With your contribution, I will be able to rent out my kitchen, order the necessary supplies, and finish my website. I will start making business cards and printing stickers with the logo that was a picture that my brother drew as a child. It is a funny face that perfectly emulates my company.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • If you donate, you will get a free order of any cookies of your choice (6)

  • Will be for renting the space every month which includes 20-40 hours in the kitchen $640.00/mo for kitchen time + $125.00/mo for storage 

  • $2,000 will go towards utensils, bakeware, and ingredients.
  • $500 will go towards paper goods (stickers + business cards) 
  • $500 will go towards packaging (boxes, bags, etc.)

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • You can see in real time the website coming together.
  • Eventually, more options will be available for ordering.

Risks & Challenges

My main obstacle is starting this business by myself. 

  • With the money, this will solve all of my problems because I have the support of my friends at Eataly, and am constantly trying new recipes. I have the determination to make this business a success to bring sweets to Brooklyn/ New York. 
  • Eventually, I can send goods to other states for those who aren't in New York.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to spread the word about my business that would be amazing. You can follow the Instagram at @mindfussbakery

I can send you stickers to put anywhere around the city which will help spread the word of my bakery.

You can send utensils from this Amazon list- http://a.co/8TVe8NP

Thank you so much for your support and helping me make my dreams come true and helping my brothers story be spread.

story:
YOUR BAR WANTS MORE

Odds are your bar looks something like mine: bottles, mostly clear, some with beige labels, some in dark bottles (what are they hiding?), some look okay, but mostly they're downright boring. 

Things are about to change.....

ALL IT TAKES IS JUST ONE SIP

John Porter has been mixing up tasty cocktails for a long time - some proven and established mixes (he earned the nickname ‘Uncle Margarita” early on), and some that he just made up using gins and liqueurs that he crafted at home using a variety of botanicals, fruit, herbs and spices.

When Jason Stormo met John some seven years ago, John shared with him one of his homemade cocktails that blew his mind, both figuratively and, after several more, quite literally.  Jason coined John’s mix “dangerously delish”.

About three years ago, John began developing a liqueur that would be the predecessor to what is now Porters No 17, sharing each new batch with his friends.  Though they often drank just a little too much, they can attest that this liqueur is tasty and delicious - sweet enough but not syrupy; a little tart but not bitter or sour.  

Two years ago, John started experimenting with various mixes of botanicals - juniper, cardamom, lemon peel, orange peel, anise and others - to craft his own gins, as someone who enjoys making delicious cocktails is wont to do.  Time and lots of tasty testing brought a heady and aromatic gin made with 19 organic botanicals - what is now Royal Rebel Gin.

When Jason and John decided to work together to bring to the world Beautiful Spirits, they labored tirelessly - many a evening, tasting, sipping and tasting again - to create the perfect vodka.  The fruit of their labors is the smooth and velvety, twice-distilled and triple filtered Liquide Vodka.

For John and Jason, their backgrounds are as dissimilar as their love of delicious spirits are similar.

TEAM SOCIETY 1017

John Porter, working with his wife, renowned artist Tracy Porter, has been in design and brand building for more than 25 years.  Developing everything from dinnerware to greeting cards, the products they’ve designed have been met with tremendous success.  In addition to his professional career, John has served in a wide range of community-oriented organizations: president of the chamber of commerce, board of trustees at Ripon College (WI), founder and treasurer of a preschool, board member of a charter school, and founder of an education foundation.  To stay fit and have fun, John plays basketball, runs trails and enjoys cooking. He has been married for 26 years and has four boys. (Semi-ironically, growing up in Evanston, IL, John attended the Willard Grade School, named after Frances Willard, the president of the Woman's Christian Temperance Union.)

Jason Stormo is a graduate of UCSB with Bachelor of Science in Environmental Studies, emphasis in chemistry and geography. Experience gained through 18 years working in the environmental remediation industry includes managing multi-million-dollar at-risk projects, managing and training teams of staff, and client and regulatory negotiations. On the side he has worked to build a sales territory as a representative for a beer and spirits distribution start-up, is a home brewer, and a musician. His expertise in overseeing extremely detailed operations in vast bureaucracies dovetails perfectly with the requirements demanded by the spirit licensing organizations.

Given their respective backgrounds, talents and experiences, Jason will manage Artisan Beverage Collective, LLC operations; John will manage creative development, and as Brand Ambassador, John will also introduce the spirits to retailers, the industry and influencers. And together, John and Jason will grow sales for the spirits.

BEAUTIFUL SPIRITS

Look across the landscape of spirits and there is a noticeable void in the market of bottles that you would want to flaunt on your bar or gift to friends.  Color, beauty and art are missing. Our beautiful bottles will fill that void, dancing on the shelf in resplendent color and award-winning enchanting designs. And, they will make great gifts...who wouldn't love a beautiful bottle on their bar.

We will continue to work closely with our Master Distiller to hand-craft each Beautiful Spirit one batch at a time.  We will work to establish relationships with key retailers, bars and restaurants starting first in the Central Coast, throughout California and expand across the U.S.  In addition, we're already exploring opportunities with our contacts in China and Mexico. With an exploding export market (U.S. spirit exports rose 14.3% in 2017), we’ll explore other international opportunities as well.

Further, we will make our beautiful spirits available nationally via a partnership with a California-based online retailer of fine spirits.

With our line of Beautiful Spirits, we will ever-so-subtly disrupt the $26.2B liquor market and establish a beachhead with beautifully bottled, super premium spirits that will fill a niche.  And, as we grow, we will expand the assortment of spirits we introduce.  

The Society 1017 brand was developed and is owned by our company, Artisan Beverage Collective, LLC.  We will make and market three spirits to start – a velvety vodka, a heady aromatic gin and a delectable liqueur characterized by a hint of sweet and tart.  In time, we will introduce additional beautiful spirits: whiskeys, bourbons, flavored vodkas, tequilas, more liqueurs and other creative spirits provide additional opportunities to expand the line.

Our penchant for demanding delicious hand-crafted boutique spirits will continually hold our standard high: ultra premium spirits made from the finest ingredients, organic botanicals and pure spring water. 

Our ability to organize, develop and build brands will allow us to expand the line as appropriate. An archive of thousands of gorgeous designs from which to choose will also ensure that whatever we bring to market will be unique and colorful – beautiful spirits.  

Your support will ensure that beautiful spirits – inside and out – are available to all!

The funds raised will allow us to continue to work closely with our Master Distiller to produce the spirits that we’ve developed.  Through our company, Artisan Beverage Collective, LLC, we will distribute our products throughout the Central Coast of California. We will expand our distribution as demand for our beautiful spirits grows.  

YOU GIVE; WE GIVE.

Our fundraising goal is $40,000.  With that amount we can bring to market all three of our debut boutique spirits.  Although you will probably feel amazing just knowing that you are contributing to something truly special, with each contribution there are super special perks to reward your generosity.  Check them out on the right-hand side. 

If we raise…       then we will…

$ 15,000            - bring to market Porter’s No. 17™
$ 28,000           - bring to market Porter’s No. 17™ and Liquide Vodka™
$ 40,000           - bring to market Porters No. 17™, Liquide Vodka™ and Royal Rebel Gin™

Any additional funds raised will go towards, in order of priority,
 - increasing inventories to leverage economies of scale to reduce overall costs
 - developing and bringing to market two additional spirits - a Bourbon and a Tequila
 - developing custom-molded glass bottles for each of the spirits
 - securing a space for a Society 1017 Tasting Room in Santa Barbara County
 - developing and bringing to market additional spirits and spirit-related drinks - a Whiskey, flavored vodkas, additional liqueurs, ready-to-drink pre-made cocktails, custom-branded beers and wines (they need beautiful bottles, and cans. too!).

IT'S NOT ABOUT MORE SPIRITS.

It’s about elevating the art of premium spirits.  While women comprise approximately 1% of all distillers, women influence 70%+ of all spirit purchases.  And she appreciates more choices - in life and in her spirit choices.  Thus we present Beautiful Spirits - Inside + Out: Bar Décor - the gift of spirits; eye-catching, delicious and enchanting, inside and out.  

Oh, and guys (like us) like them, too!

Building brands is a part of our DNA.  With the Tracy Porter Poetic Wanderlust® lines, products have placement in most of the major department stores across the US.  We know how to get products into the right retailers.  John and Jason have strong backgrounds in managing people, organizations, operations and outcomes, and Jason has practical experience in alcohol sales and distribution.  Together, John and Jason bring a powerful suite of talents to develop, introduce, build and expand niche products in a huge and growing market.

THE SPIRIT INDUSTRY IS COMPETITIVE




As John and Jason know from experience, there are a lot of risks involved in creating and successfully operating a business, especially a wholesale liquor business.  At each stage – from distilling the batches to delivering product to retailers - there are myriad hurdles. Working with their master distiller, they will hand-craft each small batch of their spirits.  Through their company, Artisan Beverage Collective, LLC, they will market and distribute their beautiful spirits first to retailers, bars and restaurants in the Central Coast of California, then expanding throughout the state, and beyond.  Growing as time, resources and demand allows.

John and Jason each possess their own unique talents and experiences which dovetail perfectly to meet the demands of their business.  John has experience in sales, importing, exporting, wholesale, retail, mail order, logistics, and negotiating licensing agreements. Jason has experience in managing multiple teams, overseeing multi-territorial operations, logistics, navigating vast bureaucracies, and working in the alcohol distribution industry.  

Together, Jason and John possess vast experience in project management, managing teams, organizing details and supporting growth…they have the necessary chops to address the myriad hurdles every successful company must surmount.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP.

We understand that contributing may not work for you.  There are though other ways that you can help.  First and foremost, spread the word:

- via social media: at the top you can click on the logos to share this campaign on your Facebook or Twitter feed.  Please share this with everyone!

 - via email - email your friends and family.  Surely someone you know wants..NEEDS beautiful bottles on their bar.

Your referrals help drive awareness and interest in our campaign - we can't do it without you. Literally.

JUST THE FACTS.

Just a heads up.  Indiegogo's rules and regulations prevent us from shipping alcohol directly to you.  We know it sucks but we understand why and we'll work with you to get you what you want as soon as possible.  Thus, you will receive a voucher for any alcohol in your contribution perk which can be redeemed at our distribution center in Los Olivos, CA, or at participating retailers.  If you don’t live near here then you must book a trip out here soon.

Los Olivos is one of the most charming small towns in California with a horse/ranch/winery vibe and dozens of tasting rooms - that’s why we want to open a tasting room here and share our spirits.  Check our charming town (www.losolivosca.com).

On a side note, the perks with a box or other accessory were developed based on what was available at the time the campaign launched and may need to be replaced with very similar accessories.  It will still look amazing.

Society 1017: Beautiful Spirits - Inside and Out 

We are indebted to you in more ways than we can express.

Thank you!
story_txt: YOUR BAR WANTS MOREOdds are your bar looks something like mine: bottles, mostly clear, some with beige labels, some in dark bottles (what are they hiding?), some look okay, but mostly they're downright boring. Things are about to change.....ALL IT TAKES IS JUST ONE SIPJohn Porter has been mixing up tasty cocktails for a long time - some proven and established mixes (he earned the nickname ‘Uncle Margarita” early on), and some that he just made up using gins and liqueurs that he crafted at home using a variety of botanicals, fruit, herbs and spices.When Jason Stormo met John some seven years ago, John shared with him one of his homemade cocktails that blew his mind, both figuratively and, after several more, quite literally.  Jason coined John’s mix “dangerously delish”.About three years ago, John began developing a liqueur that would be the predecessor to what is now Porters No 17, sharing each new batch with his friends.  Though they often drank just a little too much, they can attest that this liqueur is tasty and delicious - sweet enough but not syrupy; a little tart but not bitter or sour.  Two years ago, John started experimenting with various mixes of botanicals - juniper, cardamom, lemon peel, orange peel, anise and others - to craft his own gins, as someone who enjoys making delicious cocktails is wont to do.  Time and lots of tasty testing brought a heady and aromatic gin made with 19 organic botanicals - what is now Royal Rebel Gin.When Jason and John decided to work together to bring to the world Beautiful Spirits, they labored tirelessly - many a evening, tasting, sipping and tasting again - to create the perfect vodka.  The fruit of their labors is the smooth and velvety, twice-distilled and triple filtered Liquide Vodka.For John and Jason, their backgrounds are as dissimilar as their love of delicious spirits are similar.TEAM SOCIETY 1017John Porter, working with his wife, renowned artist Tracy Porter, has been in design and brand building for more than 25 years.  Developing everything from dinnerware to greeting cards, the products they’ve designed have been met with tremendous success.  In addition to his professional career, John has served in a wide range of community-oriented organizations: president of the chamber of commerce, board of trustees at Ripon College (WI), founder and treasurer of a preschool, board member of a charter school, and founder of an education foundation.  To stay fit and have fun, John plays basketball, runs trails and enjoys cooking. He has been married for 26 years and has four boys. (Semi-ironically, growing up in Evanston, IL, John attended the Willard Grade School, named after Frances Willard, the president of the Woman's Christian Temperance Union.)Jason Stormo is a graduate of UCSB with Bachelor of Science in Environmental Studies, emphasis in chemistry and geography. Experience gained through 18 years working in the environmental remediation industry includes managing multi-million-dollar at-risk projects, managing and training teams of staff, and client and regulatory negotiations. On the side he has worked to build a sales territory as a representative for a beer and spirits distribution start-up, is a home brewer, and a musician. His expertise in overseeing extremely detailed operations in vast bureaucracies dovetails perfectly with the requirements demanded by the spirit licensing organizations.Given their respective backgrounds, talents and experiences, Jason will manage Artisan Beverage Collective, LLC operations; John will manage creative development, and as Brand Ambassador, John will also introduce the spirits to retailers, the industry and influencers. And together, John and Jason will grow sales for the spirits.BEAUTIFUL SPIRITSLook across the landscape of spirits and there is a noticeable void in the market of bottles that you would want to flaunt on your bar or gift to friends.  Color, beauty and art are missing. Our beautiful bottles will fill that void, dancing on the shelf in resplendent color and award-winning enchanting designs. And, they will make great gifts...who wouldn't love a beautiful bottle on their bar.We will continue to work closely with our Master Distiller to hand-craft each Beautiful Spirit one batch at a time.  We will work to establish relationships with key retailers, bars and restaurants starting first in the Central Coast, throughout California and expand across the U.S.  In addition, we're already exploring opportunities with our contacts in China and Mexico. With an exploding export market (U.S. spirit exports rose 14.3% in 2017), we’ll explore other international opportunities as well.Further, we will make our beautiful spirits available nationally via a partnership with a California-based online retailer of fine spirits.With our line of Beautiful Spirits, we will ever-so-subtly disrupt the $26.2B liquor market and establish a beachhead with beautifully bottled, super premium spirits that will fill a niche.  And, as we grow, we will expand the assortment of spirits we introduce.  The Society 1017 brand was developed and is owned by our company, Artisan Beverage Collective, LLC.  We will make and market three spirits to start – a velvety vodka, a heady aromatic gin and a delectable liqueur characterized by a hint of sweet and tart.  In time, we will introduce additional beautiful spirits: whiskeys, bourbons, flavored vodkas, tequilas, more liqueurs and other creative spirits provide additional opportunities to expand the line.Our penchant for demanding delicious hand-crafted boutique spirits will continually hold our standard high: ultra premium spirits made from the finest ingredients, organic botanicals and pure spring water. Our ability to organize, develop and build brands will allow us to expand the line as appropriate. An archive of thousands of gorgeous designs from which to choose will also ensure that whatever we bring to market will be unique and colorful – beautiful spirits.  Your support will ensure that beautiful spirits – inside and out – are available to all!The funds raised will allow us to continue to work closely with our Master Distiller to produce the spirits that we’ve developed.  Through our company, Artisan Beverage Collective, LLC, we will distribute our products throughout the Central Coast of California. We will expand our distribution as demand for our beautiful spirits grows.  YOU GIVE; WE GIVE.Our fundraising goal is $40,000.  With that amount we can bring to market all three of our debut boutique spirits.  Although you will probably feel amazing just knowing that you are contributing to something truly special, with each contribution there are super special perks to reward your generosity.  Check them out on the right-hand side. If we raise…       then we will…$ 15,000            - bring to market Porter’s No. 17™$ 28,000           - bring to market Porter’s No. 17™ and Liquide Vodka™$ 40,000           - bring to market Porters No. 17™, Liquide Vodka™ and Royal Rebel Gin™Any additional funds raised will go towards, in order of priority, - increasing inventories to leverage economies of scale to reduce overall costs - developing and bringing to market two additional spirits - a Bourbon and a Tequila - developing custom-molded glass bottles for each of the spirits - securing a space for a Society 1017 Tasting Room in Santa Barbara County - developing and bringing to market additional spirits and spirit-related drinks - a Whiskey, flavored vodkas, additional liqueurs, ready-to-drink pre-made cocktails, custom-branded beers and wines (they need beautiful bottles, and cans. too!).IT'S NOT ABOUT MORE SPIRITS.It’s about elevating the art of premium spirits.  While women comprise approximately 1% of all distillers, women influence 70%+ of all spirit purchases.  And she appreciates more choices - in life and in her spirit choices.  Thus we present Beautiful Spirits - Inside + Out: Bar Décor - the gift of spirits; eye-catching, delicious and enchanting, inside and out.  Oh, and guys (like us) like them, too!Building brands is a part of our DNA.  With the Tracy Porter Poetic Wanderlust® lines, products have placement in most of the major department stores across the US.  We know how to get products into the right retailers.  John and Jason have strong backgrounds in managing people, organizations, operations and outcomes, and Jason has practical experience in alcohol sales and distribution.  Together, John and Jason bring a powerful suite of talents to develop, introduce, build and expand niche products in a huge and growing market.THE SPIRIT INDUSTRY IS COMPETITIVEAs John and Jason know from experience, there are a lot of risks involved in creating and successfully operating a business, especially a wholesale liquor business.  At each stage – from distilling the batches to delivering product to retailers - there are myriad hurdles. Working with their master distiller, they will hand-craft each small batch of their spirits.  Through their company, Artisan Beverage Collective, LLC, they will market and distribute their beautiful spirits first to retailers, bars and restaurants in the Central Coast of California, then expanding throughout the state, and beyond.  Growing as time, resources and demand allows.John and Jason each possess their own unique talents and experiences which dovetail perfectly to meet the demands of their business.  John has experience in sales, importing, exporting, wholesale, retail, mail order, logistics, and negotiating licensing agreements. Jason has experience in managing multiple teams, overseeing multi-territorial operations, logistics, navigating vast bureaucracies, and working in the alcohol distribution industry.  Together, Jason and John possess vast experience in project management, managing teams, organizing details and supporting growth…they have the necessary chops to address the myriad hurdles every successful company must surmount.OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP.We understand that contributing may not work for you.  There are though other ways that you can help.  First and foremost, spread the word:- via social media: at the top you can click on the logos to share this campaign on your Facebook or Twitter feed.  Please share this with everyone! - via email - email your friends and family.  Surely someone you know wants..NEEDS beautiful bottles on their bar.Your referrals help drive awareness and interest in our campaign - we can't do it without you. Literally.JUST THE FACTS.Just a heads up.  Indiegogo's rules and regulations prevent us from shipping alcohol directly to you.  We know it sucks but we understand why and we'll work with you to get you what you want as soon as possible.  Thus, you will receive a voucher for any alcohol in your contribution perk which can be redeemed at our distribution center in Los Olivos, CA, or at participating retailers.  If you don’t live near here then you must book a trip out here soon.Los Olivos is one of the most charming small towns in California with a horse/ranch/winery vibe and dozens of tasting rooms - that’s why we want to open a tasting room here and share our spirits.  Check our charming town (www.losolivosca.com).On a side note, the perks with a box or other accessory were developed based on what was available at the time the campaign launched and may need to be replaced with very similar accessories.  It will still look amazing.Society 1017: Beautiful Spirits - Inside and Out We are indebted to you in more ways than we can express.Thank you!

story:
Overview

Hello, my name is Ronn from Connellsville Pennsylvania.  I have a great work ethic and have a lot of experience in the hospitality and tourism sector.    I am passionate about great food and good nutrition. During this time of covid 19, I would love to bring great food into my community and I’d like your help to be able to do that. My business idea is to use a travelling food truck to bring great food to you for breakfast, lunch and dinner.   I want to focus on awesome home cooked food, superb service, and being able to help people in need and struggling with the conditions covid 19 has created.  I’d love to do that by creating food for carers and key workers, and I hope to be able to serve a free hot meal to someone in need. I’m very excited about the opportunity to help people who are less fortunate.

I have just a few short weeks to make it all happen.  I have a great opportunity to purchase a food truck that is an established business.  The aim of this campaign is to raise the funds to do just that.   I would like to be very mobile and deliver food to local businesses, work sites, festivals, colleges and do awesome catering and provide great food.

I’m really counting on my family and friends for support because the traditional banking methods just didn’t work. COVID-19 hit many people hard and I am no different.  This campaign is about doing something for the community, so I’m asking the community to support me, to help make this happen. 

Delicious home-cooked food for everyone is the goal and hopefully a few ethnic days also. I’ll have a lunch menu that is sandwiches like veggie wraps, ham barbecue, hotdogs, sloppy Joe’s, potato salad,  macaroni salad and fresh salads. I will also have sodas, water, fresh fruit, potato chips, and candy bars.  On the ethnic days the truck will be serving food such as Polish pierogi, haluski, sauerkraut and pork.  Italian gnocchi and meatballs, lasagna, stromboli, fettuccine Alfredo.   Mexican tacos, burritos and pinto beans. The early morning crowd can also get coffee, fruit salads, smoothies, juices, pastries and donuts. I have a plan and as I develop the catering business, down the road I will add breakfast sandwiches.

Goals

  1. My goal for the project is $30,000 which would cover the cost of the truck and box ($17,000) , Ice machine ($3000), freezer ($3000), waterline to garage for ice machine ($4000),  and the remainder for start up food and products. If the entire goal is not met, the first purchase would be the truck and box.
  2. Create a food truck to bring great food to the community and help make things better during covid 19
  3. Help me work with colleagues to bring our community breakfast, lunch and dinner.  By doing that, I hope to be able to work with colleagues who have been impacted by covid 19 and want to get back to work. 
  4. Say thanks to our care workers and key workers by giving them a community food truck that offers a discount for their hard work during this time. 
  5. Its hard just now, and help offer a free meal to those who’ve been hard hit by the effects of covid 19 and the lock down. 
  6. At the end of the weeks, food that hasn’t been sold, will go to the homeless shelter / community center.

Specifications

I’m asking for a contributions of $50 dollars, but any contribution will help. And definitely read about the contributing perks such as food vouchers, mugs and tee shirts.  Don't forget to share share share.  You can help share this by:

  • Tweeting the link to my campaign
  • Share me on facebook and linked in
  • Share on instagram, Tumblr  and snapchat

 

Milestones

  1. 30 days to raise the funds

I have 30 days to raise the funds, that’s $1,000 dollars a day.  I need your help to find 20             backers to help fund the project for $50 each for my project each day. What that gets you is a community food truck bringing great food and maybe helping give a hot meal to someone in need during some really hard times. 

   2.   Colleagues

This is a big project with a great potential, if you want to get involved and help make this happen, then get in contact with me and let’s help get some great food into our community!

   3.    Network 

If you can think of parts of the community that this project can help, get in touch with me and let me know!  Working together, we can beat the impacts covid 19 has had on our community and working environment and help keep our community strong.

story:
WE ARE BRIDGETOWN MONROE

 

We have Business plans, profit and loss and cash flow figures to share for all large investments. Please just drop us a message for further details. 

Bridgetown Monroe is something iconic, unique and something we all need, especially during these troubling times. Bridgetown Monroe started out as a mobile bar. It doesn't look like your cliché mobile bar. There is no converted horse boxes or Citroen vans. We serve from the iconic Chevy C-10 pickup truck. Registered in 1970, we carefully and tastefully transformed the truck into a bar. 

The design of the bar is secret, all hidden within the bed of the truck. Once the truck is at the venue, given 5 minutes, the truck converts into a simply but very tasteful bar. The best thing about our bar, we actually drive it to parties, events and festivals. With ease, it roars up, instantly turns heads, and then creates the most iconic cocktails and Prosecco. 

Following three incredibly successful years with the mobile bar, we have decided to move our bar into a bricks and mortar bar. Why you ask? Because everyone needs an epic, go to, heart pumping bar on their high street that creates memories, experiences and thrills. 

Bridgetown Monroe will be the staple on Hitchin's high street. It will be the go to venue that not only creates a place to absorb, but it will also work with local business's to help re build the high street. The high street has been diminished for many years and as a result of Covid has only declined even more. We want to link with like minded business to offer joint services to keep the high street thriving and for Bridgetown Monroe to be a partner more than competition. 

We are based 100% on customer service and experience so our customers are the world to us. If we don't offer the unique service we promise and deliver the most delicious cocktails they expect then we completely fall flat and don't deserve to operate. 

For us to succeed with need our customers to be by our side, we offer what we do because of our customers. This is the first time Bridgetown Monroe has done fund raising and it is a very important part of our journey. Customers who can donate will become part of the Bridgetown family and grow with us as we become a firm member of the high street. 

The funding will help launch the bar on the high street. In essence we will be a Tiki bar created stunning cocktails and offer a place to dance and catch up with friends and loved ones. The funding will help kit the bar out to a very high standard. For it to be an experience you have to feel like you are being transported to someone different. An escape from the norm. We all have individual battles, some big some small, and our bar needs to be that refuge at times. 

Without this funding we can't create the place we have always dreamed of. We don't want to do it half hearted. It will take money, a decent amount, a lot of dedication and hard work and a loyal fan base to make Bridgetown Monroe the place to be.

_________________

What We Need & What You Get

 

We have hired one of the best consultants in the business to see our plan through. He has carefully managed expectations, designs, budgets and profit and loss calculations to make every air tight. Especially when it comes to seeking funds from our customers, we want everything perfect before we get to that stage. It would be rude of us to ask for money when we weren't 100% guaranteed of its success. 

In total we are seeking £100,000 to get the bar kitted out, to make it tick every box we have envisaged and to allow the two months of trading easier. We plan to launch the bar in July 2021. Any earlier then it would be silly going off current Covid climates. We are handed the premises on the 1st of March and we want to take 4 months to really build the place up. Kit the bar out to such a high spec it will feel like no other. We have designers and art directors on board to professionally build the bar. We want customers to walk in, and jaws drop. 

Hitchin where the bar will be, is a beautiful market town steeped in history. The buildings are beautifully designed with character and stories and our bar will sit in probably the most iconic building in Hitchin. Hawkins department store which has been a staple of Hitchin's high street for over 100 years has now closed and is under renovation to split it into 5 units, Bridgetown Monroe being one of them. 

The funding will be spent wisely. It will be going towards furniture, flooring, design of the actual bar, wall designs, props, bar materials, music systems and tills. The furniture is going to be sourced globally, looking for unique one off pieces that will not only look the part but feel like a cloud to sit on. Tables will be in all shapes and sizes, finishes and designs. Everything will be a mix but all carefully in keeping. 

Flooring will be mix of vintage tiling and polished concrete with gold leaf lava rivers leading the customer to the bar. 

The walls will be a mixture of beautifully deep Farrow and Ball paint that will have a matt warm effect to it and tropical life sized palm tree wallpaper. The bar will be heavily adorned with tropical plants. All real. They will be shaped and potted to fit around the room. 

In the corner of the room will be a Instagram corner. A corner that demands a selfie in front of. Lashings of palm trees, Tiki statues and comfy arm chairs. 

Glassware and Tiki will be premium. We do believe its about the glass you drink it out of too. You wouldn't want a glass of ice cold beer in a champagne glass. We stand by this. 

The money raised will be meticulously documented and relayed back to our investors if you required and we really want you to come on this beautiful journey with us. Without your kind investments we couldn't do it, and without your custom with wouldn't want to do it. 

Onto the perks. You need to be rewarded for your kind investment and this is something that will be done handsomely. 

We have several different levels of investment and rewards and its down to you which one you go with. 

1) Invest £50 and receive our exclusive members card. Here you will get 20% discount for 1 year off all food and drink.

2) Invest £100 and receive our gold members card with £200 of free drinks loaded on to it plus 10% one year discount, or you can chose something from our merchandise.

3) Invest £300 and receive our gold members card with £400 of free drinks loaded on it plus 20% one year discount, or you can chose something from our merchandise. 

4) Invest £1000 and receive our Platinum members card with £500 free drinks loaded on it plus 20% discount for one year, plus a cocktail on our menu named after you, or you can chose from our merchandise. 

5) Invest £5000 and receive 3% stake in the bar from all profits for five years, our Platinum members card with £500 free drinks loaded, plus a cocktail on our menu named after you. 

We do hope to raise the entire £100,000 for the bar, but for any reason we don't manage to hit the cap, your investment will stand by the reward you will receive and the bar will open through other avenues of funding. We don't want to do down this route as we really want our customers to be part of our journey and for everyone that does invest, the world around Bridgetown Monroe will know about it. 

We have  the very best consultant working on the financials of the bar and have a very extensive business plan and Profit and Loss/Cashflow ready to share for anyone that wants to invest large amounts. Please at anytime message chris@bridgetownmonroe.com for further details. 

_________________

The Impact

 

Now you will be thinking, if I don't live local why would I invest in the bar. I would question the same thing, but here at Bridgetown Monroe we wholeheartedly believe the high street is crumbling beneath us and this is one of the core reasons we want to open a bricks and mortar bar. Working closely with the other local venues to set up partnerships, we want to build healthy profitable workable futures that keeps people returning to the high streets. 

You will always be part of the BTM family if you invest, regardless of your investment amount and will always be welcomed into the bar with open arms. Probably with a free drink or two. We are very loyal and dedicated to our customers and fans. If you don't live local you are more than welcome to chose from our merchandise store which is launching soon so you can always have a bit of Bridgetown Monroe close by. 

You will also know you personally have contributed to keeping a high street open and thriving. 

_________________

Risks & Challenges

 

With any business comes risks. We would be silly to think otherwise, but we have countermeasures in place to deal with this if it ever did arise. Our contracts with the landlords are super tight and pandemic protected and have many avenues to bring in profit if our bar is forced to close due to another lockdown. We have picked July as well hoping we will be a lot more free than currently. 

We have a very loyal accountant and booker who has been with us for 8 years through thick and thin and knows our accounts exceptionally well and always been by our side. 

The owner of the bar Chris will be the manager. Nothing speaks passion and pride then the owner running the bar day to day. He knows hospitality, he knows customer service and knows how to succeed. Having launched the Bridgetown Monroe brand only 3 years ago, it is already known worldwide. He doesn't fail at anything because he has that drive and succession ingrained in him. 

_________________

Other Ways You Can Help

 

So that's it. We are creating the worlds finest tiki bar that it going to be ground breaking. This is the first bar of many. We adore our customers and this is why we opening a bricks and mortar bar. A place to party and experience. We need your help, your love and your dancing shoes. 

Please do share our funding campaign where you can. The more people that see it the more our dream will become a reality. 

Everyone at Bridgetown Monroe thank you for your time and we hope one day to welcome you with open arms into your bar. We say your bar because we can't do it without you and you will have a place at Bridgetown Monroe anytime. 

Thank you so much for your time and look forward to hearing from you.

The funding will help launch the bar on the high street. In essence we will be a Tiki bar created stunning cocktails and offer a place to dance and catch up with friends and loved ones. The funding will help kit the bar out to a very high standard. For it to be an experience you have to feel like you are being transported to someone different. An escape from the norm. We all have individual battles, some big some small, and our bar needs to be that refuge at times. 
Without this funding we can't create the place we have always dreamed of. We don't want to do it half hearted. It will take money, a decent amount, a lot of dedication and hard work and a loyal fan base to make Bridgetown Monroe the place to be.
_________________

What We Need & What You Get
 
We have hired one of the best consultants in the business to see our plan through. He has carefully managed expectations, designs, budgets and profit and loss calculations to make every air tight. Especially when it comes to seeking funds from our customers, we want everything perfect before we get to that stage. It would be rude of us to ask for money when we weren't 100% guaranteed of its success. 
In total we are seeking £100,000 to get the bar kitted out, to make it tick every box we have envisaged and to allow the two months of trading easier. We plan to launch the bar in July 2021. Any earlier then it would be silly going off current Covid climates. We are handed the premises on the 1st of March and we want to take 4 months to really build the place up. Kit the bar out to such a high spec it will feel like no other. We have designers and art directors on board to professionally build the bar. We want customers to walk in, and jaws drop. 
Hitchin where the bar will be, is a beautiful market town steeped in history. The buildings are beautifully designed with character and stories and our bar will sit in probably the most iconic building in Hitchin. Hawkins department store which has been a staple of Hitchin's high street for over 100 years has now closed and is under renovation to split it into 5 units, Bridgetown Monroe being one of them. 

The funding will be spent wisely. It will be going towards furniture, flooring, design of the actual bar, wall designs, props, bar materials, music systems and tills. The furniture is going to be sourced globally, looking for unique one off pieces that will not only look the part but feel like a cloud to sit on. Tables will be in all shapes and sizes, finishes and designs. Everything will be a mix but all carefully in keeping. 
Flooring will be mix of vintage tiling and polished concrete with gold leaf lava rivers leading the customer to the bar. 
The walls will be a mixture of beautifully deep Farrow and Ball paint that will have a matt warm effect to it and tropical life sized palm tree wallpaper. The bar will be heavily adorned with tropical plants. All real. They will be shaped and potted to fit around the room. 
In the corner of the room will be a Instagram corner. A corner that demands a selfie in front of. Lashings of palm trees, Tiki statues and comfy arm chairs. 
Glassware and Tiki will be premium. We do believe its about the glass you drink it out of too. You wouldn't want a glass of ice cold beer in a champagne glass. We stand by this. 
The money raised will be meticulously documented and relayed back to our investors if you required and we really want you to come on this beautiful journey with us. Without your kind investments we couldn't do it, and without your custom with wouldn't want to do it. 
Onto the perks. You need to be rewarded for your kind investment and this is something that will be done handsomely. 

We have several different levels of investment and rewards and its down to you which one you go with. 
1) Invest £50 and receive our exclusive members card. Here you will get 20% discount for 1 year off all food and drink.
2) Invest £100 and receive our gold members card with £200 of free drinks loaded on to it plus 10% one year discount, or you can chose something from our merchandise.
3) Invest £300 and receive our gold members card with £400 of free drinks loaded on it plus 20% one year discount, or you can chose something from our merchandise. 
4) Invest £1000 and receive our Platinum members card with £500 free drinks loaded on it plus 20% discount for one year, plus a cocktail on our menu named after you, or you can chose from our merchandise. 
5) Invest £5000 and receive 3% stake in the bar from all profits for five years, our Platinum members card with £500 free drinks loaded, plus a cocktail on our menu named after you. 
We do hope to raise the entire £100,000 for the bar, but for any reason we don't manage to hit the cap, your investment will stand by the reward you will receive and the bar will open through other avenues of funding. We don't want to do down this route as we really want our customers to be part of our journey and for everyone that does invest, the world around Bridgetown Monroe will know about it. 
We have  the very best consultant working on the financials of the bar and have a very extensive business plan and Profit and Loss/Cashflow ready to share for anyone that wants to invest large amounts. Please at anytime message chris@bridgetownmonroe.com for further details. 
_________________

The Impact
 
Now you will be thinking, if I don't live local why would I invest in the bar. I would question the same thing, but here at Bridgetown Monroe we wholeheartedly believe the high street is crumbling beneath us and this is one of the core reasons we want to open a bricks and mortar bar. Working closely with the other local venues to set up partnerships, we want to build healthy profitable workable futures that keeps people returning to the high streets. 

You will always be part of the BTM family if you invest, regardless of your investment amount and will always be welcomed into the bar with open arms. Probably with a free drink or two. We are very loyal and dedicated to our customers and fans. If you don't live local you are more than welcome to chose from our merchandise store which is launching soon so you can always have a bit of Bridgetown Monroe close by. 
You will also know you personally have contributed to keeping a high street open and thriving. 
_________________

Risks & Challenges
 
With any business comes risks. We would be silly to think otherwise, but we have countermeasures in place to deal with this if it ever did arise. Our contracts with the landlords are super tight and pandemic protected and have many avenues to bring in profit if our bar is forced to close due to another lockdown. We have picked July as well hoping we will be a lot more free than currently. 
We have a very loyal accountant and booker who has been with us for 8 years through thick and thin and knows our accounts exceptionally well and always been by our side. 
The owner of the bar Chris will be the manager. Nothing speaks passion and pride then the owner running the bar day to day. He knows hospitality, he knows customer service and knows how to succeed. Having launched the Bridgetown Monroe brand only 3 years ago, it is already known worldwide. He doesn't fail at anything because he has that drive and succession ingrained in him. 
_________________

Other Ways You Can Help
 
So that's it. We are creating the worlds finest tiki bar that it going to be ground breaking. This is the first bar of many. We adore our customers and this is why we opening a bricks and mortar bar. A place to party and experience. We need your help, your love and your dancing shoes. 
Please do share our funding campaign where you can. The more people that see it the more our dream will become a reality. 
Everyone at Bridgetown Monroe thank you for your time and we hope one day to welcome you with open arms into your bar. We say your bar because we can't do it without you and you will have a place at Bridgetown Monroe anytime. 
Thank you so much for your time and look forward to hearing from you.

story:
Short Summary

We are committed to opening the first woman black-owned mobile coffee truck in Charles County, Maryland December 2020.  

The Grind House is a mobile coffee truck with plans to base its initial location in Charles County, Maryland. The Grind House derives its name from its owners love for hard work and coffee. With that said, the name has a twofold meaning: grind as in hard work and in coffee grind. Our mission is to serve the community with great coffee and excellent customer service to include a bit of hospitality, all the while encouraging people to pursue their dreams. 

The Grind House will feature a full menu of moderately priced coffee, espresso drinks, hot and cold teas, bagels, sandwiches, salads and seasonal soups.  Each cup of coffee will be served with a motivational note of encouragement.  

Our vision is to build an empire that starts in Charles County, Maryland and grows throughout the United States and eventually, internationally. Supporting our campaign will not only help us become the first woman black-owned coffee truck in Charles County, MD, but it will also afford other small businesses in the area with opportunities for advancement. As we always say, we want to get the community involved so that we can all evolve.  

A percentage of proceeds will go towards small business grants to help entrepreneurs pursue their dreams and all excess food and drinks will be provided to the homeless. 

What We Currently Have

  • Salaries for our Consultants and Employees
  • Dry supplies for one year (hot and cold cups, drink holders, cup sleeves, stirrers, etc.)
  • Commissary Kitchen

What We Need & What You Get

To continue turning this dream into a reality, we need at least $45,000 to get started. Some of you may be shocked by the asking; we are confident that with your help, we will meet this goal!  We have received several quotes and have participated in many walkthroughs of food trucks with various companies. After long hours of researching, quotes, and walkthroughs we’ve decided on a coffee distributor, builder, and the equipment. 

  • The coffee truck and build out: $34,000 (mock-up and invoice below) 
  • The coffee equipment : $9,000 
  • Supplies for 1 year: $2,000  

To keep you at ease we wanted to share a few things to ensure you that The Grind House is here to stay. We have an established business plan, financial manager, communications manager, coffee consultant, investor, a pandemic proof plan, and plans for yearly expansion. 

By donating to The Grind House you will receive awesome perks such as pre-paid coffee and tea, t-shirts, sweatshirts, and more!

Pandemic Proof

You may be thinking, “WOW” this is a great idea but how will it sustain in a pandemic?” Well, we’ve also asked ourselves that question, and therefore have created a pandemic proof plan which includes: contactless delivery, a drive thru option and a monthly coffee membership. 

The Impact

As a serial entrepreneur, the owner of The Grind House (Brittany Yates) has a heart for small and local business owners. She understands the peeks and the pits of starting and building a sustainable community business. She is an advocate for entrepreneurship and is committed to helping those businesses by providing grants, yearly; by way of The Grind House.  These unique features of the Grind House coffee truck will benefit, impact, and support local businesses to include advertisement opportunities, partnerships, alliances, and small business grants. In addition to assisting small businesses we will donate all excess food and beverages to the homeless in Charles County, weekly. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Great question! Share, Share, and Share! The more people know about what we would like to accomplish, the better! Share on your social media pages, via text and email. You can also sign up for our mailing list to stay updated by going to thegrindhouseusa.com and opting in on the popup.  

Be sure to follow us on Facebook and Instagram: @TheGrindHouseUSA 

For comments, questions on donations and investing, please contact us at info@thegrindhouseusa.com 

Thank you for taking the time to read our story!

story:
The World's Most Innovative Vending Bike

Ferla Bikes is a manufacturer and designer of the World’s Most Innovative Vending Bikes and Carts. Our bikes and carts offer the highest-grade materials and quality, not to mention looks. Ferla Bikes was founded on the idea that an amazing vending platform is in anyone’s grasp and now we are bringing that goal another step further.

 

OUR MISSION

At Ferla Bikes, we strive to think creatively in designing innovative solutions for the budding entrepreneur in building the business of their dreams!

 

WHY CHOOSE US?

A fully electric cafe on wheels, our coffee carts are specialized to meet your requirements as a mobile cafe. Our offerings include a sink equipped vending bike, the option to upgrade to pedal assist among other wonderful add-ons, and plenty of storage in every vending bike we make.

 

WHAT IS IT?

Ferla X: World’s First Fully Capable Vending Bike – “All-in-One”

With an all new configuration, Ferla X has been optimized for the efficiency of its operator. With a sink, extensive storage space, and the option to configure with multiple features, the Ferla X is truly the vending bike that offers it all.

Finally, the world’s first fully-optimized mobile cafe on wheels is here. Whether you plan to start a coffee bike, espresso bike, ice cream bike, hot dog bike, taco cart, juice cart, smoothie cart, fruit cart… well, you get the idea! It’s all possible with Ferla X.

 

PRODUCTION

The Ferla X is a quality product made to the highest possible standards. Each bike is assembled and tested thoroughly in the USA by highly trained bike mechanic professionals.

 

COST BREAKDOWN

With a special Indigogo base price of $3,999.00 you get just about everything you need to customize your bike to fit your business. The base price includes the advanced innovative bike with a heavy duty frame and wheels, a premium wood box and rear storage and serving box, a retractable canopy, sneeze guard, and a battery powered sink system with a high-powered pump and NSF grade clean and gray water tanks. 

 

INCLUDED FEATURES

 

Heavy Duty Tires

 

The Ferla X is equipped with new wheels: All-Terrain Fat Tires and a Larger Rim help to support the large frame. You can easily ride on gravel roads and skip pot-holes with ease!

 

Upgraded Rear Box

The Ferla X comes with All-New & Improved rear storage unit: a cubic shape increases your options for storage capability, and the flat top is perfect for displaying condiments when you are stationary.

 

Extendable Table

We didn’t forget to add your favorite extendable flip-up table – perfect for adding extras such as napkins, forks, and spoons for your customers. Plus, our new and improved durable wood frame adds strength to the mix.

 

Heavy Duty Frame

Updated and improved, our frame is built to support the weight of your entire mobile restaurant set-up.

 

NSF Grade Sink System

A foldable faucet, removable basin, and the option to add hot water heating makes our Ferla X the most competitive vending bikes on the market.

 

Lockable Storage Space

With more storage space than ever, you will have no problem with setting up a fully mobile cafe.

 

Side Display Bars

Our famous side display bars now come on both side of the Ferla X’s vending unit.

 

Acrylic Sneeze Guard 

Keep your service area neat and tidy with the included quarter-inch thick acrylic sneeze guard. This high-quality guard keeps your product safe and provides an amazing display window to show off your goods! 

 

Weather-Proof Canopy

Easy-Removable canopy to keep all of your goods dry, including yourself and your customers.

 

ADDITIONAL ADD-ONS

Pedal Assist

Our pedal assist includes All-New 750W Heavy Duty rear-hub motor, with LCD display to let you know how fast you’re riding, distance, power selection, and more. As always, available with a throttle mode to let you relax while steering the bike. No need to pedal? Yes, that’s right! Pedal Assist package will do Everything for you!

 

Solar Panel System

Our flexible panels are lightweight and durable, so you can take them on your next outdoor event. Plus, our solar panels feature the highest-efficiency solar cells available which means more power or faster charging times for solar compatible batteries. Freezer Running Time – up to 15 hours.

 

Nitro/Cold Brew System

With up to two taps to serve either Nitro or flat Cold Brew, you can expand your business and serve what the people want! Nitro Infused Coffee is the newest, biggest thing to happen to coffee and now you can serve it to your customers right from the bike!

 

Temperature Controlled Battery Operated Freezer

Upgrade your Coffee Bike with a built-in temp-controlled battery operated cooling system. Finally, a vending bike made for both ice cream and coffee – or whatever else you plan to serve! Milk? Fruits? Drinks? You Name It!

 

VARIATIONS

Ferla X - Grill Bike

Outfit your Ferla X with our grill package and serve anything from Tacos to Burgers, it’s up to you!

 

Ferla X - Ice Cream Bike

With 2 different sized freezers to choose from, you can serve the perfect relief for those hot summer days. The smaller temperature controlled freezer/refrigerator is perfect to help support a coffee business by holding milk and cream while the larger freezer is perfect for serving gallons on gallons of Ice Cream.

 

SPECIFICATIONS

 

BUY NOW, PAY LATER WITH CLICKLEASE

During our campaign here on Indiegogo, you can select any perk to make a $999 deposit. This deposit will grant you a huge discount depending on the perk selected, all the way up to $1000 off the $4999 retail price. By making a deposit today you will save huge as you make your final payment with a Ferla Bikes representative. After you make the deposit, we will send you an email to confirm payment options and add-ons at the end of the campaign.  

Clicklease is our financing partner and when you receive an email from Ferla Bikes for the rest of the payment you will receive a link to our Clicklease/Ferla Bikes page. From there you can apply for easy financing on the rest of the payment and Ferla Bikes will be there every step of the way to help you with the process. 

 

OUR HAPPY CLIENTS

CUSTOMER REVIEW

“Ferla Bikes is the perfect fit for what we wanted to happen in our business. Not only do they produce top of the line bikes, but the service that Ferla team provides is second to none.”
