story:
Myoshi knives is created by Eyal Azerad, a world renown sword-maker and founder of Darksword Armory inc. For the past 23 years, Eyal Azerad has been manufacturing high end European swords and armors for private collectors and important movie and gaming productions. Most notably, Eyal Azerad has worked closely with Ubisoft during the making of Assassin's Creed II and the weapons for the Lord of the Rings theater adaptation. Both of which have been brought to fruition in Darksword Armory’s forge in Montreal, Canada. By travelling to museums and private collections in Europe and  Japan, Eyal was able to carefully examine blades from all over the world from a standpoint of design, functionality and metallurgical composition. This affords him with a unique perspective on what makes a blade effective and elegant in both form and function.

After years of development, the Myoshi lines stem from a deep desire to create unique, high end professional chef knives combined with clean designs. To this end, we sourced the highest quality materials to produce a beautiful work of art. It would not only be a stunning piece in any kitchen, but prove to be an exceptional knife for both cooking enthusiasts and professionals alike. We extensively examined various types of wood to compare the different grains, weights and hardness. We  crafted an ergonomic grip that has long lasting performance without compromising aesthetic beauty.This enabled us to mesh Japanese blade designs with modern European styling, resulting into a luxurious work of art, surpassing the mere classification of "kitchen knives". 

 

We decided to create two distinct premium knife sets, one fitted with VG10 Titanium coated Premium Japanese steel (The Hisashi Collection) and the other set with AUS10,  67 layer folded Japanese steel (The Shogun Collection). While natural elegance is at the core of our project, we made sure to produce both knife sets with unrivaled quality and edge sharpness and retention. We honored  the traditional Japanese 16 degree sharpened edge, making the blades extremely sharp for the most delicate cuts.  

 

 

Key Features

- clean, organic modern design with premium material to meet the most demanding standards in the industry

- individually handcrafted using AUS10, 67 layer Japanese folded Steel with Shushan finish to reduce the drag of the knife OR VG10 folded steel with long lasting titanium coating. All knives are skillfully tempered to a Rockwell hardness of 58-60. 

- a taper ground double beveled 16 degree razor sharp edge to produce an exceptionally sharp knife for all your cooking projects. 

- beautifully finished stabilized Canadian maple grip, designed for exceptional handling

- perfectly engineered blade design and blade thickness for perfect balance

- Unlimited lifetime sharpening service.

THE HISASHI SERIES :: PREMIUM TITANIUM KNIFE SET  

 - 8" Chef knife ::  The Hisashi Titanium coated 8” chef knife is the most robust knife available in our Indiegogo campaign. Hand crafted with a 3.5 mm thick VG10 Titanium coated Japanese steel for exceptional durability. The 8” chef knife is the extremely versatile essential player on the experienced chef’s stage. The blade is long, broad, and able to perform difficult cutting and chopping tasks, but is tapered and agile for mincing and other fine tasks. The blade is Titanium coating to promote long lasting edge maintenance and unparalleled longevity even in the busiest kitchen.

- 7” hybrid cleaver  :: The Hisashi 7” cleaver is EXCLUSIVELY available in our VG10 line. Shaped as an hybrid cleaver and chef knife, the 7” blade easily cuts through all major cooking projects. Designed for heavy chopping of hard vegetables, meat, or even bone, but able to perform finer tasks such as slicing, mincing, or dicing, this knife is an excellent companion in the kitchen. The 3.5mm thick VG10 Titanium coated Japanese steel blade requires little maintenance to continue performing at a high level.

- 5.5” utility paring knife :: The Hisashi 5.5” paring knife is especially suited to delicate tasks such as finely cutting fruits or vegetables, skinning meat, or preparing the finishing touches on a dish. 

-The Hisashi Series knives comes with our signature magnetic knife block. 

The SHOGUN SERIES FOLDED JAPANESE STEEL KNIFE SET 

 

 - 8" Chef knife :: The Shogun Series Folded Japanese steel 8” chef knife is the perfect tool for the bulk of your cooking tasks. Long enough to chop the most awkward shaped cuts, but sized for comfort and dexterity. This is the 'go to' in the chef's arsenal. The 8” chef knife has a broad blade tapering up to a point which allows the knife to rock back and forth in a skilled chef’s hands while dicing, mincing, or performing other essential tasks. Fashioned out of 67 layers of AUS10 steel and hammered with a “Tsuchime” finish to reduce the drag of the knife.

- 6.5” utility knife :: The 6.5” utility knife is exceptionally balanced for miscellaneous cutting tasks.A utility knife is an important sidearm for every chef, filling in the gap between larger and smaller kitchen cutting utensils. The shorter length gives greater balance and ease of use, allowing for agile handling for delicate tasks.  

- 5” paring knife :: The Shogun Series 5” paring knife is an extremely versatile tool that can be used in a wide variety of ways. The blade is extremely comfortable to handle and passes effortlessly through fruits, vegetables, and meats. The paring knife is mainly used for peeling and chopping, preparing garnishes and trimming fat. 

-THE SHOGUN Series set comes with our signature magnetic knife block. 

INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE  

In order to produce these knives at this amazing price, we need to place large initial orders with our manufacturing partners. Your pledge will be used to pay for the parts and tooling necessary to get this project off the ground. In return, you’ll be among the first to own the Myoshi knives at a great price. While the expected retail price for these professional Japanese chef knives will be 870$ CDN (about 660$ USD)for each set and magnetic knife stand, backers will enjoy the knives for 475$ CDN (about 350$ USD). 

On behalf of the entire team, I thank you for your help in making this dream a reality. 

BUDGET

$40,000 to initiate production. This covers supplies, tooling and manpower.

Risks and challenges

We feel strongly about Myoshi's likelihood of success, we already have several working prototypes but like everything else on Indiegogo, it’s a work in progress. Timing, unforeseen circumstances, delays from manufacturing and distribution are risks with launching any product. We have a competent award-winning team behind us working to minimize this and to bring our product to you as fast as possible. We will do our best to overcome any obstacles and keep you updated every step of the way.
story_txt: Myoshi knives is created by Eyal Azerad, a world renown sword-maker and founder of Darksword Armory inc. For the past 23 years, Eyal Azerad has been manufacturing high end European swords and armors for private collectors and important movie and gaming productions. Most notably, Eyal Azerad has worked closely with Ubisoft during the making of Assassin's Creed II and the weapons for the Lord of the Rings theater adaptation. Both of which have been brought to fruition in Darksword Armory’s forge in Montreal, Canada. By travelling to museums and private collections in Europe and  Japan, Eyal was able to carefully examine blades from all over the world from a standpoint of design, functionality and metallurgical composition. This affords him with a unique perspective on what makes a blade effective and elegant in both form and function.After years of development, the Myoshi lines stem from a deep desire to create unique, high end professional chef knives combined with clean designs. To this end, we sourced the highest quality materials to produce a beautiful work of art. It would not only be a stunning piece in any kitchen, but prove to be an exceptional knife for both cooking enthusiasts and professionals alike. We extensively examined various types of wood to compare the different grains, weights and hardness. We  crafted an ergonomic grip that has long lasting performance without compromising aesthetic beauty.This enabled us to mesh Japanese blade designs with modern European styling, resulting into a luxurious work of art, surpassing the mere classification of "kitchen knives".  We decided to create two distinct premium knife sets, one fitted with VG10 Titanium coated Premium Japanese steel (The Hisashi Collection) and the other set with AUS10,  67 layer folded Japanese steel (The Shogun Collection). While natural elegance is at the core of our project, we made sure to produce both knife sets with unrivaled quality and edge sharpness and retention. We honored  the traditional Japanese 16 degree sharpened edge, making the blades extremely sharp for the most delicate cuts.    Key Features- clean, organic modern design with premium material to meet the most demanding standards in the industry- individually handcrafted using AUS10, 67 layer Japanese folded Steel with Shushan finish to reduce the drag of the knife OR VG10 folded steel with long lasting titanium coating. All knives are skillfully tempered to a Rockwell hardness of 58-60. - a taper ground double beveled 16 degree razor sharp edge to produce an exceptionally sharp knife for all your cooking projects. - beautifully finished stabilized Canadian maple grip, designed for exceptional handling- perfectly engineered blade design and blade thickness for perfect balance- Unlimited lifetime sharpening service.THE HISASHI SERIES :: PREMIUM TITANIUM KNIFE SET   - 8" Chef knife ::  The Hisashi Titanium coated 8” chef knife is the most robust knife available in our Indiegogo campaign. Hand crafted with a 3.5 mm thick VG10 Titanium coated Japanese steel for exceptional durability. The 8” chef knife is the extremely versatile essential player on the experienced chef’s stage. The blade is long, broad, and able to perform difficult cutting and chopping tasks, but is tapered and agile for mincing and other fine tasks. The blade is Titanium coating to promote long lasting edge maintenance and unparalleled longevity even in the busiest kitchen.- 7” hybrid cleaver  :: The Hisashi 7” cleaver is EXCLUSIVELY available in our VG10 line. Shaped as an hybrid cleaver and chef knife, the 7” blade easily cuts through all major cooking projects. Designed for heavy chopping of hard vegetables, meat, or even bone, but able to perform finer tasks such as slicing, mincing, or dicing, this knife is an excellent companion in the kitchen. The 3.5mm thick VG10 Titanium coated Japanese steel blade requires little maintenance to continue performing at a high level.- 5.5” utility paring knife :: The Hisashi 5.5” paring knife is especially suited to delicate tasks such as finely cutting fruits or vegetables, skinning meat, or preparing the finishing touches on a dish. -The Hisashi Series knives comes with our signature magnetic knife block. The SHOGUN SERIES FOLDED JAPANESE STEEL KNIFE SET   - 8" Chef knife :: The Shogun Series Folded Japanese steel 8” chef knife is the perfect tool for the bulk of your cooking tasks. Long enough to chop the most awkward shaped cuts, but sized for comfort and dexterity. This is the 'go to' in the chef's arsenal. The 8” chef knife has a broad blade tapering up to a point which allows the knife to rock back and forth in a skilled chef’s hands while dicing, mincing, or performing other essential tasks. Fashioned out of 67 layers of AUS10 steel and hammered with a “Tsuchime” finish to reduce the drag of the knife.- 6.5” utility knife :: The 6.5” utility knife is exceptionally balanced for miscellaneous cutting tasks.A utility knife is an important sidearm for every chef, filling in the gap between larger and smaller kitchen cutting utensils. The shorter length gives greater balance and ease of use, allowing for agile handling for delicate tasks.  - 5” paring knife :: The Shogun Series 5” paring knife is an extremely versatile tool that can be used in a wide variety of ways. The blade is extremely comfortable to handle and passes effortlessly through fruits, vegetables, and meats. The paring knife is mainly used for peeling and chopping, preparing garnishes and trimming fat. -THE SHOGUN Series set comes with our signature magnetic knife block. INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE  In order to produce these knives at this amazing price, we need to place large initial orders with our manufacturing partners. Your pledge will be used to pay for the parts and tooling necessary to get this project off the ground. In return, you’ll be among the first to own the Myoshi knives at a great price. While the expected retail price for these professional Japanese chef knives will be 870$ CDN (about 660$ USD)for each set and magnetic knife stand, backers will enjoy the knives for 475$ CDN (about 350$ USD). On behalf of the entire team, I thank you for your help in making this dream a reality. BUDGET$40,000 to initiate production. This covers supplies, tooling and manpower.Risks and challengesWe feel strongly about Myoshi's likelihood of success, we already have several working prototypes but like everything else on Indiegogo, it’s a work in progress. Timing, unforeseen circumstances, delays from manufacturing and distribution are risks with launching any product. We have a competent award-winning team behind us working to minimize this and to bring our product to you as fast as possible. We will do our best to overcome any obstacles and keep you updated every step of the way.

story:
Like Nesquik, but nothing like it.

 

This is a new instant Belgian chocolate drink mix that is more chocolatey, contains less sugar, and is made with premium Belgian chocolate for satisfying chocolate enjoyment whenever you want.

  • Just 4 ingredients: Belgian cocoa, sugar, vanilla, and sunflower lecithin
  • Made from super premium cacao beans that have been carefully fermented, roasted and ground to release all the amazing flavor of well-crafted chocolate
  • Does NOT contain carrageenan which is an irritant for many people
  • Has a deeper chocolate flavor than the kid stuff so you'll have your chocolate craving satisfied in no time
  • Stirs easily into the cold milk of your choice with just your spoon

 

Pledge now and get your reward >>>

 

Praise for some of Cocoa Metro's Current Products:

  • BevNET review gives 5 out of 5 stars: “Cocoa metro has created what we can safely call the best chocolate milk ever created.”
  • San Francisco Chronicle - Cocoa Metro Races into Hall of Fame: “At the very top was Cocoa Metro Belgian chocolate milk, which soared into our Taster’s Choice Hall of Fame with one of our highest scores of the year.”
  • Fan Email: "I don’t know what brand of magical oompa loompas you have working over at Cocoa Metro, but holy heck that chocolate milk is amazing.”

 

 

Be the first to have this Belgian chocolate drink mix in your pantry. Pledge now —>

 

Who are we?

We are Cocoa Metro, makers of ready-to-drink Belgian chocolate milk to help chocolate addicts thrive in a kiddy chocolate milk world. We are sold at Whole Foods Markets and many other fine food markets across the country. We also make and sell an organic Belgian hot drinking chocolate mix, organic unsweetened Belgian cocoa powder, and an organic chocolate-infused vanilla extract. We believe there is so much more depth of flavor and enjoyment to be had in really good chocolate. Not enough time to waste on the kid stuff.

Perhaps you grew up on Nesquik too? I drank gallons of it with my cousins during late night sleepovers. We would scoop way more of it into our glasses than prescribed on the carton because we were looking for more chocolate taste. Now that I've tried a few nice chocolates (ok, like metric tons of nice chocolate) from around the world, I am not satisfied with an overly sweet, dumbed down chocolate flavor. We are here to provide you (and me really) a deeper chocolate drinking experience than you can find anywhere in stores right now.

Are we the underdog? Um, yes. By a long shot. But, with your help, we plan on pulling off a Hoosiers - David & Goliath - 1980's Olympic Hockey Team - Rudy - Rocky - Karate Kid win with this project. You have the power to make it happen.

Remember the Titans. Pledge now to receive your reward—>

 

What are the funds for?

  • Packaging and ingredients for the initial production run
  • Special blending of the ingredients called agglomeration that helps your powder stir into cold milk
  • Time in the lab with agglomeration experts to get it right the first time
  • Shipping your reward out to you, a contributing founder to this project

 

Time to get the project funded and receive your rewards. Pledge now—>

 

Rewards:

$25 Receive 2 bags of the Belgian chocolate drink mix the moment they roll off the production line

$50 Get 5 bags of the Belgian chocolate drink mix the moment they roll off the production line

 

Find the reward that fits you best & pledge—>

 

*Nesquick is a brand name owned by the Nestle Corporation and is not affiliated in any way with this project.

 

Risks and challenges

We feel confident in our ability to successfully bring this project to you based on our 10 years experience as a consumer packaged goods company. However, there are always risks and challenges. We've seen many on our journey so far. One area of focus is the solubility of the powder. Although we have consulted in depth with companies that provide agglomeration services, until our specific recipe is run through their process, we can't know for certain how well it will blend. There is no reason for it not to work—agglomeration is a tried and true method for creating soluble powders—but until it's done, there is the question. To overcome this risk once we are funded, we have allotted plenty of time in the agglomeration lab with experts to ensure we get it right.

story:
Why I Am Here:

Pursuing a long-time love of wine, I (Winemaker Bob) started small volume wine making in 2007.  The award-winning Zinpiphany© Zinfandel and Rhone-styled #2red followed.  Passion later changed to purpose following a diagnosis of incurable prostate cancer. Determined to make the best of the situation, I created the Robert and Susan Hollander Foundation, an IRS approved 501c3 non-profit supporting prostate cancer research.  Since then, all proceeds from my wine making efforts at 2redWinery are committed to supporting prostate cancer research through the Foundation.  Your tax-deductible support will allow me to continue to produce great wines for you while supporting prostate cancer research.

Blending the 2015 Zinpiphany -How It Happens in 75 seconds


The Campaign:

By supporting this campaign with your tax-deductible support, you are rewarded with award-winning wine library while I can continue wine making and supporting prostate cancer research.

The campaign has three parts:

  1. Your tax-deductible support.
  2. Red wine rewards for you.
  3. All proceeds pass to the Foundation and prostate cancer research.

About 3 million men are living in America right now with prostate cancer and about 28000 will die this year.   Prostate cancer will affect about 1 in 7 men over their lifetime.  This campaign will allow me to continue the pursuit of something I love while helping someone you may know.

What I Need, What You Get & What I Do

All proceeds above my anticipated barrel cost of $9500 are committed to the Foundation and prostate cancer research.  The Foundation currently operates with an expense rate of 0.0% (I pay the costs.)  You get the wine (see Perks).  I get the satisfaction of making wine and doing something useful.  In the four fiscal years the Foundation has been operational, we have made annual gifts with recipients including clinical investigators at MD Anderson, the Cleveland Clinic. and the University of Minnesota.  Both wines have been consistent award winners:

I am proud and pleased with all of my wines, including those not yet entered in competition. The 2012 and 2013 Zinpiphany and #2red are the current go-to wines on our dinner table.

story:
There is no happiness in the world like the happiness you get when you bite into the perfect cookie or a decadent cupcake! I grew up in the kitchen learning how to bake the most delicious cookies and cupcakes with my grandmother and mother. Our baked goods have always been family favorites, but now I'd love the opportunity to share my family's baking traditions with the public. I offer 10 cookie and 10 cupcake flavors as well as any special request. Each order of homemade cookies or cupcakes is baked from scratch, professionally packaged, and delivered to you. My fundraising goal will support my costs for the following items...

- a small business license
- a cottage food license
- upgrading some of my baking equipment
- purchasing baking and packaging supplies in bulk
- launching a website

I currently have a small but dedicated customer base and it would be a dream come true to expand my business. Thank you so much for helping to make Mandy's Homemade Baked Goods a reality!

story:
Who We Are:

we are two self-taught, driven bakers who love our community. we believe in compassion for all creatures. specializing in mouthwatering vegan treats such as cinnamon rolls, pop tarts, cupcakes, croissants and donuts- so good that vegans and omnivores alike devour our treats. we have both worked incredibly hard over the years to hone our craft and build a community of people who can't wait to have our treats available more widespread. we love syracuse and believe in continuing to grow and flourish the small businesses that exist here. you can find us frequenting local coffee shops and handmade businesses because we believe in the people who created them. we hope you'll believe in us too.

What We Have:

we have incredible drive and passion for what we do. both of us know what it is to work hard. over the years we have each worked multiple jobs and slept very little when necessary to keep our dream alive. we have both sacrificed because we love what we do. currently, we are operating with a home processing permit which allows us to sell wholesale to several small businesses. we would love to expand that to include farmers markets, pop ups, and some day our very own storefront. we have just found a dream location that will allow us to operate as a commercial kitchen which will greatly expand our abilities. this is where you come in.

What We Need:

running and owning a business is not a cheap thing. we are not naive to this, and we have already given everything we have out of pocket to make our business what it is. commercial bakery equipment is very pricey, but so worth it. we have a goal of $10,000 which would allow us to comfortably pay a few months rent at our new spot, afford a commercial sized mixer (if you guys had any idea how many small batches we have to make-we need this!!), upgrade the equipment we currently use, buy the insurance to get a spot at the farmers market, and invest in our first round of the vegan, organic, ethically sourced ingredients that make our treats so tasty. investing in us means the world to us. we are not people who love asking for help, but we think that investing in us means everyone wins. you, us and the animals. 

Your generous funds will support us as we dive headfirst into this beautiful dream. In exchange, we're offering fun perks such as bakery vouchers, logo stickers, cinnamon rolls, custom cakes, t-shirts and even mugs. If you want your dollar to go further, you can choose not to receive a perk.  Any amount helps, and we are truly grateful from the bottom of our hearts.

The Impact:

Vegans and Omnivores alike will come together and enjoy ethically made treats. our dream is to protect animals and empower women like us. growing our business means down the road we can staff more driven women who have likeminded values. growing our business means we get to spread a little more kindness through the community we love so much. thanks for coming on this journey with us.

story:
Who We Are

Almost four years ago, my wife Heather and I started Brush Naked. I was in a hotel room in Edmonton and was brushing my teeth after breakfast. Once I finished brushing my teeth, I threw the toothbrush out. The garbage can was empty and plastic, so once the toothbrush hit the bottom of the can it bounced, almost like it was slow motion. All I could think about was what a waste it was. Brush Naked was born.

At Brush Naked we offer bamboo handle toothbrushes with recyclable/compostable packaging. We've learned a lot in the last four years and the one thing we're sure of bamboo is a wonder plant!

Bamboo is naturally anti-microbial and anti-bacterial. It requires no irrigation or pesticides. Unlike a tree, you can cut down bamboo and it will completely regenerate in less than four years! This makes bamboo perfect for ... STRAWS!

Introducing Sip Naked

Our mission at Sip Naked is to eliminate single-use plastic straws. We're going to do that by offering bamboo straws. Stainless steel, silicone and compostable plastic straws just aren't as environmentally-friendly, especially when you consider the processes used to make them! And who wants cold steel in their mouth? Unfortunately, compostable plastic straws won't break down without proper disposal. There are too many that end up in our oceans where the conditions don't exist to break down compostable plastic.

Bamboo straws are where it's at! A bamboo straw can be used for at least a month. It's ideal for hot and cold drinks because bamboo is temperature resistant. No inks or dyes are used. Bamboo straws are ideal for warm, hot and icy cold drinks such as water, coffee, soda, shakes and smoothies. A bamboo straw can even go in the dishwasher!

What We Need

While we have secured funds to cover most of our start-up costs for Sip Naked, the money raised by this campaign will help us equip and stock Sip Naked while minimizing our reliance on loans. We are aiming to raise at least $15,000 with this crowdfunding campaign. While our hope is to exceed this goal, your contributions will be put towards initial inventory and package design even if we don't meet our campaign goal.

Examples of our Start-Up requirements:

  • initial inventory
  • package design
  • website design
  • computer equipment
  • workbenches/tables for shipping
  • shelving

What You Get

To get you excited to help eliminate single-use plastic straws, we've teamed up with some of our favorite companies to offer some pretty sweet rewards. You'll receive perks like Brush Naked toothbrushes, Sola Skincare Coconut Deodorant, Bathorium, Stone Field Shave shaving kits, Plenty + Spare Lip Balm, gift certificates from Belgard Kitchen, Craft Beer Market, Havana Vancouver and Verdura Salads, or a 7 night stay oceanfront in Maui.

 

For more information on what each rewards package includes, click on the package of interest. 

If you simply want to make a contribution without getting something in return, click the "BACK IT" button . This option will allow us to put more of the funds toward Sip Naked!

The Impact

By supporting Sip Naked, you'll be helping to eliminate single-use plastic straws. Every single day in North America, hundreds of millions of straws are thrown out. Yes, plastic straws can technically be recycled, but most straws are too light to even make it through the sorter. Most straws end up in the landfill, where they take thousands of years to break down. The rest eventually find their way into our oceans. Did you know that single-use plastic straws are among the top ten items found during shoreline clean ups (toothbrushes are in the top ten as well)?

Once in the oceans, plastics pollute the water and kill marine life. Over 70% of seabirds and 30% of turtles have plastics in their stomachs. Marine life that ingest plastic have a 50% mortality rate. Plastics that stay in the oceans for long periods of time eventually get broken down into smaller pieces called microplastics. These microplastics are consumed by fish and then make their way up the food chain.

We've already made an impact reducing plastic with Brush Naked. Let's make an impact with Sip Naked!

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge we face is trying to establish the brand while the single-use plastic straw alternative industry is young. We expect many competitors to launch in the next few years.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about Sip Naked and our crowdfunding campaign! Share our campaign link on social media, and tell everyone you know that we're coming soon to a drink near you!

THANK YOU!

Thank you so much! Whether you are helping to fund us or just cheering us on, we couldn't do it without your support. We can't wait to see you Sip Naked!
story_txt:
Who We Are
Almost four years ago, my wife Heather and I started Brush Naked. I was in a hotel room in Edmonton and was brushing my teeth after breakfast. Once I finished brushing my teeth, I threw the toothbrush out. The garbage can was empty and plastic, so once the toothbrush hit the bottom of the can it bounced, almost like it was slow motion. All I could think about was what a waste it was. Brush Naked was born.
At Brush Naked we offer bamboo handle toothbrushes with recyclable/compostable packaging. We've learned a lot in the last four years and the one thing we're sure of bamboo is a wonder plant!
Bamboo is naturally anti-microbial and anti-bacterial. It requires no irrigation or pesticides. Unlike a tree, you can cut down bamboo and it will completely regenerate in less than four years! This makes bamboo perfect for ... STRAWS!

Introducing Sip Naked
Our mission at Sip Naked is to eliminate single-use plastic straws. We're going to do that by offering bamboo straws. Stainless steel, silicone and compostable plastic straws just aren't as environmentally-friendly, especially when you consider the processes used to make them! And who wants cold steel in their mouth? Unfortunately, compostable plastic straws won't break down without proper disposal. There are too many that end up in our oceans where the conditions don't exist to break down compostable plastic.
Bamboo straws are where it's at! A bamboo straw can be used for at least a month. It's ideal for hot and cold drinks because bamboo is temperature resistant. No inks or dyes are used. Bamboo straws are ideal for warm, hot and icy cold drinks such as water, coffee, soda, shakes and smoothies. A bamboo straw can even go in the dishwasher!
What We Need
While we have secured funds to cover most of our start-up costs for Sip Naked, the money raised by this campaign will help us equip and stock Sip Naked while minimizing our reliance on loans. We are aiming to raise at least $15,000 with this crowdfunding campaign. While our hope is to exceed this goal, your contributions will be put towards initial inventory and package design even if we don't meet our campaign goal.
Examples of our Start-Up requirements:

initial inventory
package design
website design
computer equipment
workbenches/tables for shipping
shelving

What You Get
To get you excited to help eliminate single-use plastic straws, we've teamed up with some of our favorite companies to offer some pretty sweet rewards. You'll receive perks like Brush Naked toothbrushes, Sola Skincare Coconut Deodorant, Bathorium, Stone Field Shave shaving kits, Plenty + Spare Lip Balm, gift certificates from Belgard Kitchen, Craft Beer Market, Havana Vancouver and Verdura Salads, or a 7 night stay oceanfront in Maui.
 


For more information on what each rewards package includes, click on the package of interest. 
If you simply want to make a contribution without getting something in return, click the "BACK IT" button . This option will allow us to put more of the funds toward Sip Naked!

The Impact
By supporting Sip Naked, you'll be helping to eliminate single-use plastic straws. Every single day in North America, hundreds of millions of straws are thrown out. Yes, plastic straws can technically be recycled, but most straws are too light to even make it through the sorter. Most straws end up in the landfill, where they take thousands of years to break down. The rest eventually find their way into our oceans. Did you know that single-use plastic straws are among the top ten items found during shoreline clean ups (toothbrushes are in the top ten as well)?
Once in the oceans, plastics pollute the water and kill marine life. Over 70% of seabirds and 30% of turtles have plastics in their stomachs. Marine life that ingest plastic have a 50% mortality rate. Plastics that stay in the oceans for long periods of time eventually get broken down into smaller pieces called microplastics. These microplastics are consumed by fish and then make their way up the food chain.

We've already made an impact reducing plastic with Brush Naked. Let's make an impact with Sip Naked!
Risks & Challenges
The main challenge we face is trying to establish the brand while the single-use plastic straw alternative industry is young. We expect many competitors to launch in the next few years. 
Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word about Sip Naked and our crowdfunding campaign! Share our campaign link on social media, and tell everyone you know that we're coming soon to a drink near you!
THANK YOU!
Thank you so much! Whether you are helping to fund us or just cheering us on, we couldn't do it without your support. We can't wait to see you Sip Naked!

story:
Six years ago in a small town in Spain, an idea was born, to promote veganism in Logroño. Our little idea soon gained strength and became our goal.

In 2013 this adventure began with a bean burger, five years later we are a 100% vegan restaurant, with more than 9 types of vegan burgers, sandwiches, tapas and a variety of desserts, all handmade with organic and local produce.

Since then, the importance of green, sustainable, and a environmentally friendly way of living has gained mass appeal. This motivated us take our dream further. Everything had to be in harmony with what our heart dictated.

We hired renewable energy sources, we started using organic napkins, we changed our packaging in a way that respects the environment and we started using ecological cleaning products.

Currently our restaurant doesn’t quite reflect our spirit, or way of thinking.

We need to update our image and renovate and improve our premises in order to be wheelchair friendly and create an amazing experience for our customers and staff.

With this campaign we intend to raise sufficient funds to make the following improvements: change the restaurant and kitchen layout , update the plumbing and electricity installations, comply with current regulations on soundproofing, access for the disabled, and renovate the façade.  We also would like to upgrade the kitchen for the current demand, investing in machinery and utensils that facilitate our work.

Create a franchiseable and sustainable business model to expand not only our business but also our dream.

In this country there are 260,000 establishments, one bar for every 175 people, and the highest density in the world. More than in the entire United States. It is necessary to carry out this change, generate less waste, be respectful with the environment, support local trade and base our diet on a vegan or vegetarian diet.

It is clear that a few restaurants are not going to make a big difference, but they are going to show other entrepreneurs that there is another way of doing things and that it can be done better, that it is viable and of course the business is still profitable. That is the ultimate goal of all business.

Can't Give? Please share! 

If you’ve read this far but you don’t have any extra funds to contribute, please consider helping us out by spreading the word! Share this campaign on any (or all) of your social media accounts and tell people about our project.  Just a quick click can make a huge difference and help us achieve  our goals.

Thank you

************************************

Hace seis años en una pequeña ciudad de España, nace una idea. La idea de acercar y dar a conocer el veganismo en Logroño. Poco a poco esa idea fue cogiendo fuerza y llego a convertirse en nuestro sueño.(meta)

En el 2013 comienza esta aventura con una hamburguesa de alubias, cinco años más tarde somos un restaurante 100% vegano, con más de 9 tipos de hamburguesas diferentes, bocadillos, tapas, y una gran variedad de postres. Todo elaborado a mano con productos ecológicos y de cercanía. Todo estaba cambiando a nuestro alrededor, así que decidimos ir un poco más lejos. Necesitábamos que todo estuviese en armonía con lo que nos dictaba el corazón. Contratamos energías renovables, empezamos a usar servilletas ecológicas, cambiamos nuestro packaging de forma que fuese respetable con el medio ambiente y empezamos a usar productos de limpieza ecológicos.

Actualmente nuestro local está bastante desfasado, no refleja para nada nuestro espíritu, ni forma de pensar. Necesitamos actualizar nuestra imagen, renovar las instalaciones eléctricas y de fontanería, con el fin de optimizarlas y sanearlas. Adaptar el local para permitir la entrada de personas en silla de ruedas. Crear un ambiente acogedor para nuestros clientes y facilitar el trabajo del personal tanto de cocina como de sala.

Con esta campaña pretendemos recaudar fondos suficientes para acondicionar el local. Cambiar la distribución, renovar las instalaciones de electricidad y fontanería, cumplir la normativa vigente sobre insonorización, acceso a minusválidos, renovar la fachada. También adecuar la cocina para el volumen de trabajo actual, invirtiendo en maquinaria y utensilios que nos faciliten el trabajo.

Crear una imagen corporativa, una forma de negocio franquiciable. De manera que no solo se copie el negocio, si no su espíritu. Crear un modelo de negocio de hostelería respetable con el medio ambiente, sostenible. En este país hay 260.000 establecimientos, un bar por cada 175 personas, la mayor densidad del mundo. Más que en todo Estados Unidos. Es necesario llevar a cabo este cambio, generar menos residuos, ser respetuosos con el medio ambiente, apoyar el comercio local y basar nuestra alimentación en una dieta vegana o vegetariana.

Está claro que unos pocos restaurantes no van a marcar una gran diferencia, pero sí que van a demostrar a otros empresarios que hay otra forma de hacer las cosas y que se pueden hacer mejor, que es viable y por supuesto que el negocio sigue siendo rentable. Ese es el fin último de todo negocio.

¿No puedes contribuir? ¡Por favor comparte!

Si has leído hasta aquí pero no tienes fondos adicionales para contribuir, ¡por favor considera ayudarnos a correr la voz! Comparte esta campaña en cualquiera (o todas) de tus redes sociales y cuéntales a las personas sobre nuestro proyecto. Un solo clic rápido puede marcar una gran diferencia y ayudarnos a lograr nuestros objetivos.

Gracias

Gracias

story:
Royal Foundry Craft Spirits is a new distillery that will infuse the Minneapolis craft cocktail scene with British flavor. We will be producing fine spirits made in the classic British tradition using imported grains, botanicals and classic recipes.

Our Story

Royal Foundry Craft Spirits founders Nikki and Andy McLain are a husband and wife team who have partnered with friend and former coworker Kelly Everhart. American-born Andy lived in Europe for much of his childhood with his British parents, and still has close family and friends across the pond. His love of Scotch has led him to fulfill his dream of running a distillery. CEO Kelly has a wealth of experience in the military and corporate sector as a lawyer and  small business owner, and CMO Nikki has a background in both marketing and advertising.

 

​Why Invest in Spirits?

Because Craft is king! According to Fortune Magazine, the movement has just begun: “Forget Craft Beer, Craft Liquor is the Next Big Thing,” Fortune Magazine 10/2016.

Where craft beer was 10 years ago, the “premiumization” trend has been the main driver behind growth in the distilleries industry over the past five years. The emergence of a cocktail culture in the mid-2000's also pushed industry performance forward, as people became selective about the taste of their drinks.

Minnesota is still in the infancy stages of craft distilling. In fact, Royal Foundry is only the seventh Cocktail Room licensed in the City of Minneapolis, and one of less than 30 licensed in the state.  

Why invest in Royal Foundry?

To bring our dream to life, we need financial support. This is where you come in. We aren’t funded by a big liquor conglomerate. We are using our own savings, as well as money from family, friends, and people like you!

 Royal Foundry Craft Spirits is seeking $250,000 to help offset the cost of:

  • Our beautiful copper pot still, custom-built by Specific Mechanical, which reflects the tradition of spirit-making in the Old World. 
  • A climate control system that will allow for a flexible environment for our on-site barrel storage/aging facility. 
  • Custom wooden wash backs—the traditional fermentation vessel for Scotch whisky—built by local barrel maker, Atlas Barrel.
  • A new deck that will run the length of our facility. It will be a great place to relax with a cocktail and enjoy the views of downtown.

Our Products

Royal Foundry will create high quality, small-batch spirits. Our first products will be a Royal Navy-style rum, a London-style dry gin, and a single malt whisky.

The star of the show is our Royal Foundry single malt Scotch-style whisky. Following the traditions of Scotland, Andy will be distilling a small batch classic single malt whisky from malted barley. The process Royal Foundry uses is unique in the US and includes “off grain” fermentation in custom wooden fermentation vessels called “wash backs”. Because the Scots don’t use an “e” in their whisky, neither will we! When you taste our whisky, we want you to experience the authentic flavors of Scotland.

We will also distill vodka for our cocktails and experiment with Irish- and American-style whiskies, as well as traditional British liqueurs to compliment our dynamic cocktail program.

Our Home

Housed in a 15,000 square-foot warehouse facility located in the West Market District by International Market Square, Royal Foundry aims to be your new local—whether you are an expat, an Anglophile, or just love a good drink.


241 Fremont Ave N, Minneapolis, MN 55405

The Royal Foundry Cocktail Room will showcase our spirits and custom-designed, craft cocktails. The Royal Foundry Barrel Room has more than 2,500 square feet of space that can be rented and transformed for any event. The Crown Room will offer tours and tastings for a VIP club experience or private events for groups of 50 or less.

Our Equipment is impressive. We are using a 65-gallon Artisan still for R&D and custom small-batch creations. We have an infamous 200-gallon still known in the distilling community as “Miss Dana,” star of Nat Geo and the Discovery Channel. Our custom 300-gallon copper pot still—with whiskey “hat” and a twenty-plate copper column—can make a great whisky with character one day and a highly rectified vodka or gin the next.

Dining and Entertainment

Food.  Royal Foundry will partner with local food trucks who serve traditional British fare, like fish and chips and meat pasties. Future plans include opening our own food truck, which will serve British pub food during lunch and dinner hours, as well as High Tea on weekends and during special events.

Sport. Minnesota is one of the top cycling markets in the nation, and Royal Foundry plans to introduce a new cycling sport to the Twin Cities that has been a long-standing tradition in Britain: Short Track Cycle Racing! Our 70-meter outdoor race track will bring unrivaled energy to our facility.   Join a league, compete on a semi-pro level or just take ride around the track. You can watch the action from the deck or head inside and play a game of Skittles on our custom-made bowling lanes or catch your favorite Premier League match. 

Help Share Our Story!

Please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and through emails or text—however you communicate with your network. You can share the Indiegogo link and spread the word. For every referral who joins, you will earn a free beverage coupon. For referrals totaling over $1,000 you will earn a free Crown Club VIP Membership. For referrals totaling over $5,000, our mixologist will create a custom cocktail in your name.  To make sure you collect on your referrals, jot us an email with the names of contributors you refer and we will do the tracking for you!

Our social feeds are: 

https://royalfoundrycraftspirits.com

@RoyalFoundryCraftSpirits

Facebook page is Royal Foundry Craft Spirits.

If you are interested in speaking with any of the team, reach out to us at royalfoundrycraftspirits@gmail.com.

Cheers to Our Partners !

Venture Bank; Van White Holdings; General Contractors of Minnesota; The Ackerberg Group; Christian Dean Architecture; One Simple Plan; Specific Mechanical; Boston Capital Leasing; Atlas Barrel; Sailer Benefit Services Inc.; Paul Connors and Cincinnati Insurance; Spruce Valley Payroll, CHUX, Windmiller Design Group and many more!

This campaign is subject to the Indiegogo, Inc. Terms of Use.

story:
Our Location

We are becoming a cornerstone of the revitalization of the Ossining waterfront. Several projects are planned for the area including several housing complexes and the Sing Sing Prison Museum. These are nearby to the building where we are located. The Ossining train station and Waterway taxi from Haverstraw, NY are in a short walking distance from 6 Degrees. 

 

What We Are About

In addition to serving fine craft beer, our family-friendly establishment has been providing a venue for local artists to share their creations. To date, these include music and photography. We are looking to expand these connections. 6 Degrees has provided a much needed location for the local community to patronize and is becoming a destination location for patrons coming from the surrounding counties and New York City.

We have been supporting the community through many avenues for several years. As per our Farm Brewer’s License, we are now using grains and hops produced in New York, which supports the NY farmers.

 

The Bottom Line

Our team is growing and we want you to be a part of something amazing. Proudly wear the swag obtained with your support. 

It'll take a village to raise a brewery!! 

The Site

We are located at 35 Main Street in Ossining, NY.

 

Use Of The Funds That We Raise

We will be using the funds to buy a 1BBL pilot brewing system, with fermenters and necessary equipment from Spike Brewing Systems.

 

For Further Information

If you have any questions, check out our website: www.6DegreesBP.com, email us through the site or stop in.

 

Risks and challenges

As with any project, there are risks. We appreciate your help. Please forward this website/campaign to others who may be interested in helping us to obtain the upgraded brewing system and be able to give back to our community on a larger scale. Once the project time has elapsed, we will put in the order for the rewards and distribute them as soon as we are able.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't support the campaign financially, please pass this along to someone who you think who you think may appreciate it. You can use the Indiegogo Share tools to do it.

Please forward this website/campaign to others who may be interested in helping us to obtain the upgraded brewing system and be able to give back to our community on a larger scale. Once the project time has elapsed, we will put in the order for the rewards and distribute them as soon as we are able.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't support the campaign financially, please pass this along to someone who you think who you think may appreciate it. You can use the Indiegogo Share tools to do it.

story:
Who We Are 

Qué Tal will be the Twin Cities first authentic Salvadorian food truck. You can explore unique eats that offer fresh new flavors while supporting our community-driven focus. We plan to partner with local organizations in providing free meals as well as cultural and food education experiences.  Qué Tal is more than just a food truck, it is a commitment to share Salvadorian culture, traditions, and stories, and to be apart of building a strong community.

Great Food

Qué Tal will provide new dishes and a combination of flavors that will awaken the foodie in all of us. Our food is made in small batches and locally sourced when possible. Our unique authentic flavor comes from family recipes that have been passed down from generation to generation. El Salvador's national dish and what takes center stage in our menu are the pupusas. They are made fresh and to order by the hands of a pupusera, a craftswoman skilled at making the perfect pupusa. Most importantly our food is made with love and from people that love to make it.  

Our Menu  

Rich Culture

Our food at Qué Tal reflects Salvadorian culture: vibrant, rich in flavor, depth, warmth and perhaps most importantly, inviting. We will share our delicious food with customers, our extended family, and create a cultural experience that begins with our openness and invitation that we hope leaves you walking away with new found knowledge, respect, and admiration for what El Salvador offers. We are looking forward to sharing our food, history, music, art, and traditions to create a space in which both, our customer's, bellies and hearts are full.

Strong Community

As a collectivist culture, Salvadorian values are founded in community and so is Qué Tal. We believe that what sets us apart from other food trucks, and other food establishments in the Twin Cities, is our commitment to building strong communities. As progressive and thriving as our cities are, we face many racial and socioeconomic disparities. Many members of our communities are underrepresented and underserved. As an immigrant, Latina, and woman entrepreneur, our founder, Nancy Alayon, is determined to make Qué Tal a true community partner. Qué Tal will provide meals, along with food and cultural education classes to cultural centers, low-income schools, and organizations committed to the same work. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are almost there but we need your help! 

We have secured funding for the truck and build but we still need to cover the rest of our startup costs. Our goal of $20,000 will allow us to cover:

-All required permits and licensing 

-Insurance Costs 

-Initial product inventory 

-Small ware 

-Season event fees 

Most importantly it would cover the cost of providing free community meals throughout our summer season. As a new business, maintaining low operating costs is crucial. Our campaign contributions would allow us to do both, maintain low operating costs and allow us to provide free monthly community meals. Every contribution counts and each contribution comes with its own special "PERK!" 

We have some pretty cool perks in store for you, including stickers, sunnies, tote bags, T-shirts, and even a YEAR OF FREE PUPUSAS*!!!!!! In addition, we have a special contribution that allows you to pay it forward. Every contribution comes with a free pupusa and their name on our food truck! 

Risks & Challenges

We have a unique offering since there are no other Salvadorian food trucks on the market however with any new business, there are risks. There are a number of established food trucks in the Twin Cities as well as a booming restaurant scene but we know that we have something special.  

Qué Tal is owned and operated by Nancy Alayon. Nancy's experience spans four years of high-paced restaurant experience, ten plus years of sales experience, five years of leadership and management experience and three years of non-profit and community work. Her work experience is matched by her skills in the kitchen, yet nothing could match her love of food and the desire to share it with her community.

To ensure the success of Qué Tal, we have been able to leverage our communities to explore and foresee the challenges and complexities of owning a food truck. In reviewing our business plan with successful entrepreneurs, discussing the complexities of running a small business with small business owners, networking with other restaurateurs, aligning with the communities we aspire to partner with, and asking people to try the food – a lot – we know we have the right people, mentors and business plan in place to minimize the risks involved with opening a small business.

We feel good about the authenticity of our food, the groundwork, and our business model that we will overcome any challenges we may face.

Other Ways to Help

There are many ways you can help our campaign!

-Help us get the word out! Like and share our campaign page!

-Like our Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter Pages!

https://www.instagram.com/quetalstreeteats/

https://www.facebook.com/quetalstreeteats/

https://twitter.com/QueTalEats?lang=en   or @quetaleats

story:
www.nutty-life.com

about me and nutty life

I started nutty life 2 years ago after passionately making nut milk for myself for a few years.  I was sick and tired of buying store-bought nut milks filled with cancer-causing carrageenan & various gums known to cause bowel issues in lab rats.  So, I decided to make my own nut milk that was additive free and naturally sweetened with dates.

I have been making our cashew milks on a small scale for the past 2 years -- blending everything by hand in 2-quart blenders.  We currently run 4 blenders at a time & are in the kitchen for 16+ hours on production days.  We are in about 35 Boston-area stores and hoping to expand throughout New England in the coming months.  As we expand into new stores, we will not be able to keep up with demand with our current production process, so we need your help to purchase a 60-quart floor blender.  Every dollar helps us get closer to our goal!

what we need & what you get

We are purchasing a used 60-quart floor blender (originally ~$20k) for $5500.  We have already put $500 down & need your help with the remaining $5000.  Even if we don't reach our full goal, every single dollar will go towards purchasing this blender.

For Boston-area folks, you will receive your choice of cashew milk, cookie dough, or body products for your generous contributions! And for non-Boston supporters, you will get to choose from our body products or our cookie dough.  And you'll be receiving all of these goodies at a discount with free shipping!!

the impact

Your contribution will help us spread nutty life throughout New England.  This piece of equipment is what we need to keep up with the demand of expanding into more stores.  We are hoping to become a national, and even international, brand some day -- spreading health and wellness one sip at a time!

We have come so far, constantly re-investing our cash into the business to purchase more small blenders, ingredients, etc.  We need this boost in sales to take us to the next level!

risks & challenges

we have never used a piece of equipment like this one, so there will definitely be a learning curve involved.  luckily, we have a good support team behind us (fellow food entrepreneurs & mentors) who can help us overcome this challenge.  I am also a go-getter and am determined to solve any problem that is thrown my way

other ways you can help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, please help us by spreading the word about our project.  We are only launching the project for a few days, so we need all the help we can get!

Thank you so much for your continued support!!

Cheers to a nutty life :)

Caroline

story:
HOW IT WORKS:

Snaxchange aims to reduce food wastage by offering an online platform for users to sell food and beverages purchased from Retailers to others at a discounted rate and ahead of the ‘best before’ date. The seller will thus recover some of their expenses as an alternative to dumping food and beverages as waste. Moreover, the buyer will have access to food and beverages at discounted rates for immediate consumption. All food items and beverages which cannot be sold by the stipulated ‘best before’ date will be passed on to Food Banks of partnering NPOs at no or minimal costs just before the immediate expiry date. This will provide a three-tier consumption ecosystem that offers three opportunities for each food item to be consumed: first by the primary consumer who bought it from the Retailer, second by the Secondary Consumer who bought it from the Primary Consumer via Snaxchange and, third by the tertiary consumers who source food from Food Banks of Partnering Charitable Organisations that receive the donated food from primary consumers. 

OUR NOVELTY:

We did extensive research to find out if any company had ventured into these areas. We found that some NPOs have a similar intent to reduce food wastage but a completely different business model. No organization provides a platform for individuals to resell and donate food with the sole purpose of combating food wastage. Such platforms only exist for non-food items. When we approached government authorities (Licensing Bodies) for permissions; they admitted there was a shortage of such platforms associated with food wastage and had to have detailed internal discussions to provide approval for this innovative idea. A common theme from the licensing office was that this idea is so innovative, they may have to develop a new licensing category. However, there is nothing preventing a roll-out into the market. Given the novelty of this idea, Snaxchange has been sharing this idea with the aid of Non Disclosure Agreements with all direct and indirect stakeholders.

HOW YOU CAN HELP:

We at Snaxchange are very excited for the launch of our venture. However, as with any E-Business, we depend heavily on effective marketing. We seek your backing to help raise funds for our marketing initiatives and development of our IT initiatives. We aim to reach millions of users to help them contribute to this worthwhile cause and save our planet.

We believe your support will help Snaxchange reach new heights. Visit us on www.snaxchange.com or email us at info@snaxchange.com
Download our app from the Apple Store and Google Play.

You can also find us on Social Media:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SnaXchange

Twitter:     https://twitter.com/SnaXchange

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/snaxchange

Website : www.snaxchange.com

story:
OUR STORY

We are creating an in-house brewery called Whippetlabbet Brygginkubator (Translation: Whippet Lab's Brew Incubator) inside Whippet Lab Restaurant and Beer Lounge. We are located in a neighborhood called Skanstull on the island of Södermalm -- the hipster capital of Stockholm and also, coincidentally, the craft beer epicenter. The Brew Incubator will allow brewers traditionally underrepresented in the brewing community to brew using professional 200L equipment and develop their own brewing identity. The goal is to foster talented people who couldn't otherwise start their own brewery to develop their brewing skills, get creative, and build their own brand. What's great is that all Brew Incubator members and guest brewers will get to have their beer on tap at Whippet Lab's bar! This will give brewers access to a dedicated audience of beer connaiseurs eager and ready to drink it.

 

WHO ARE WE?

Stina Nygårds (Brewer), who for many years has brewed beer at home in her three great aunts' farmhouse kitchen in Dalarna, and VS Brodie (Whippet Lab owner and chef), who for 20 years has been a chef in Paris, and Jami Weinstein (Whippet Lab owner and tap curator), a professor with a background in Philosophy & History of Science and Technology dreamed up the idea to establish a small brewery in Stockholm that could diversify the newly exploding Swedish brewing community.

With your support, we can foster a whole crop of new brewers, spark interesting collaborations, and what's more: make the brewing process visible to the Swedish public - who can learn about the process behind the beers they are drinking. In Stockholm it is rare to have an in-house brewery!

Whippet Lab's Brew Incubator will give 1-2 brewers a year the opportunity to buy in and brew with us, and have their own tap at Whippet Lab.

 

THE NECESSARY TOOLS...

In order to get the Brew Incubator up and running we need some more equipment. Here’s where your contributions would be of invaluable help! If we raise enough money, we will invest in:

  • a 200 liter brew kettle
  • a cooling system for wort and fermenter, air compressor, pump, malt mill
  • construction costs of building the brewery space and tap system
  • 1-2 more fermenters
  • 1-2 bright beer/maturation tanks to store Whippet Lab's own house lager

 

PERKS PERKS PERKS!

Of course you get perks for donating! We are offering, for example:

  • Whippet Lab Brew Incubator swag such as t-shirts, key chains, stickers
  • Exclusive invitations to Whippet Lab's anniversary crowdfunding benefit party and/or the Brew Incubator launch party
  • Name your own keg, barstool, or fermenter
  • And, big donors can even get their own brew day or a trip to Stockholm!

What's exciting is that for each 10,000€ benchmark we reach, we will release a new must-have surprise perk! So keep checking back to discover more as the campaign rolls along.

 

SOCIAL JUSTICE AND BREWING

Whippet Lab, aside from being a restaurant and bar, is also what we call "a Social Club for the resistance." The Social Justice Club is our way of turning the tradition of elite, members-only, private social clubs on its head. While Whippet Lab is open to everyone, like those old boys’ clubs Whippet Lab also has a membership (which gives members a discount at the restaurant) and co-hosts events and benefits with local and international organizations dedicated to fighting for social justice. These can include, for example, organizations fighting against racism, homophobia, sexism, classism, climate change, or who support animal rescue, the arts, literature, economic equality, immigration, education, feminism, and refugees.

The concept of the Brew Incubator is an extension of our social justice work, and is based on an inclusive politics. We want use our brewery as way to open up and diversify the brewing world by providing a real, live brewery where those people who wouldn't ordinarily have access to the brewing world could get the opportunity to brew.

 

CHALLENGES

Originally we had hoped to be able to launch the brewery at the same time as Whippet Lab opened in late July 2017. But everything takes longer than you think it will and costs more than you expect. VS and Jami, two Americans, started the restaurant/bar Whippet Lab and they faced endless surprises and challenges in the process. However, through dedication and hard work, it is now up and running. And with its amazing food, unparalleled tap list of a dozen rotating Nordic and Baltic microbrews, and inclusive atmosphere, it has become a highly rated and much appreciated alternative among the Södermalm restaurants/bars. (Check out Untapped, Beer News, Google, Trip Advisor, Facebook, Girlie Girl Army, and Dagens Nyheter to see what our guests have been saying!)

And now, with your help, an in-house brewery is on its way! Our brewing background is in small-scale home brewing, so it will be a challenge to engineer a brewery at a significantly larger scale and to calibrate recipes so that they work at that scale as well. However, a functioning space for the brewery is already in place and we also have our first fermenter and the required permits in hand. So, we are ready to go as soon as the rest of the equipment is purchased and installed!

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

If you wish to help but cannot afford to make a donation, there are still ways! First, you can share this page with everyone and anyone you know who could be interested in contributing. There's also the possibility to donate used equipment, if you have some equipment you want to unload. And then, there are more practical hands-on possibilities. For example, we would appreciate help with setting up the brewery, carrying heavy stuff, teaching at Whippet Lab Brew Incubator's brew school, and all things technical and building related. If you're handy, we could very much use your help!

So, please, get in touch if you want to offer advice, lend us a hand, or contribute in any other way!

story:
Mélodie is made of cheese. It's why she's so good at finding the cheese for you and pairing it with delicious things. But this comes naturally to someone who's from the Cheese Capital of France. And she wants all her friends, neighbors, and fellow curd nerds to experience Cheese Around The World (but also, very specifically, Oregon).

How? Through:

  • Cheese to go!

  • Cheese flights!

  • Cheese education!

  • Cheese pairings (wine, beer, charcuterie, and more!)

  • Cheese waffles!

  • Partnerships with local restaurants and wineries!

Let's be honest, launching a specialty shop is pricey, not the priciest, but pricey. And the biggest price tag belongs to refrigeration. And, believe it or not, every $5, $10, $27, $50 (or more!) makes a huge difference. Not just to Melodie, but to cheese lovers everywhere!

Cheese incentives are guaranteed to any giver! ;)
story_txt:
Mélodie is made of cheese. It's why she's so good at finding the cheese for you and pairing it with delicious things. But this comes naturally to someone who's from the Cheese Capital of France. And she wants all her friends, neighbors, and fellow curd nerds to experience Cheese Around The World (but also, very specifically, Oregon).
How? Through:

Cheese to go!
Cheese flights!
Cheese education!
Cheese pairings (wine, beer, charcuterie, and more!)
Cheese waffles!
Partnerships with local restaurants and wineries!

Let's be honest, launching a specialty shop is pricey, not the priciest, but pricey. And the biggest price tag belongs to refrigeration. And, believe it or not, every $5, $10, $27, $50 (or more!) makes a huge difference. Not just to Melodie, but to cheese lovers everywhere!
Cheese incentives are guaranteed to any giver! ;)

story:
The Next Chapter In The Dining Experience

 

Let me keep this real simple...

SURPRISE ME KITCHEN is a "no-menu" concept where our chefs imagine, create, prepare and deliver wonderfully packaged gourmet meals safely to the comfort of your home.

 

Let me explain...

We don't have menus here! 

In fact, we don't want them because we believe it's time to reinstate freedom in the dining experience both for our guests and our chefs. I'm well-positioned to know this, having worked in this industry for 25 years in a variety of establishments ranging from casual, upper casual to prestigious five-star fine dining restaurants in Beverly Hills, CA. 

Genesis Of The Concept

One night in a restaurant where I used to work in Beverly Hills, two of my guests were struggling, trying to figure out what to order for dinner even though I had already answered all of their questions in great detail. The situation was getting hopeless. I had to do something. So, I took the menus away and asked them 3 simple questions:

Do you have any food allergies? 

Do you have any dietary restrictions? 

What are you in the mood for today?

And that was it. With their permission and the information they had provided from answering my 3 questions, the chef and I crafted a wonderful four-course surprise meal for them. I gave them a detailed description of every dish that landed in front of them. Their faces lit up with every course, not knowing what was coming next, just excited that something wonderful was coming. By surrendering their dining experience to us, something magical happened: excitement, anticipation, and happiness. I was just as satisfied with the experience as they were.

I repeated that same process with many more guests throughout the years, and every time, the result was the same: smiles all around as guests left impressed and happy with the unexpected turn their dinner had taken. Year after year, my "no-menu" concept was solidifying in my head as a potential powerful new business model. 

And just like that, Surprise Me Kitchen  was born.

How It Works

Though the main focus of our concept is on feeding our guests great food, our operation is heavily backed by the latest technologies.  

Guests would go to our website: www.surprisemekitchen.com, select a date, and whether they'd prefer "Delivery" or "Pickup". After that, they are prompted to select their food allergies, dietary restrictions and food preferences from a well designed pop-up screen. Once done, guests can click on "Order catering" for the review of their order, information and payment.

Et voila! With the information provided, our chefs will create, design and prepare a delicious four-course gourmet meal designed specifically for each individual guest. Meals are then delivered elegantly and safely by a well-dressed Butler in white gloves. 

 

Check this out: https://www.instagram.com/p/CEPzbTSpHtP/?igshid...

And this: https://www.instagram.com/stories/highlights/17...

Here are some of the dishes our guests have enjoyed recently:

 

The Bright Future of Surprise Me Kitchen

Yes, this is a very unique and ambitious concept that has never been tried before.

We get that. But here's the thing...

The dining experience as we know it will never be the same again. The coronavirus pandemic - to a degree - has exposed the vulnerabilities of our industry but in the same token has revealed a plethora of new opportunities we ought to try moving forward. Surprise Me Kitchen is one such opportunity we're trying to insert into the mainstream of the dining experience.

Our plan in the near future (when people are allowed to congregate again) is to organize pop-up Surprise Me Dinner events throughout the city in the most unexpected, most beautiful and attention-grabbing locations. Each event will have a unique theme, style and vibe in an elegant setting with exceptional service and unforgettable ambiance. To us, eating in is not just about sustenance, but rather should be a memorable dining experience whose momentary impact can linger for a while.

Where To From Here?

The city of Los Angeles is our lab, where we are designing and perfecting the blueprint of our operation. When the time comes, we will take our Surprise Me Kitchen concept to other cities around the country - an initiative that aims to bring unknown talented chefs as well as celebrity and well-known industry masters into the spotlight and give them a platform to let their imagination soar without limits as they showcase their culinary skills to the benefit of all our guests.

Our Ask

We need your help with feedback, suggestions and ideas on how to fine-tune this service so it aligns with your dining expectations. We also need your financial backing and word-of-mouth. We want you to become an important part of this journey of ours as we set out to bring anticipatory excitement, elegant service, creative freedom and pure joy to the dining experience with our innovative "no-menu" concept.

Risks and challenges

All businesses are currently facing a common enemy: Covid-19. We're aware of the challenges ahead of us. The truth is, the launch of this concept that had been tucked away for so many years was precipitated by the coronavirus pandemic. The moment called for a concept like this, and we responded by building it from the ground up within weeks after the lockdown.

Funding, customer acquisition, market penetration are some of the challenges we anticipate will arise as we move forward. As we pioneer the next chapter in the restaurant industry, our team will fail at some things and will excel at others, but we will continuously learn so that we can create a scalable business that withstands the test of time and transforms the dining experience for the better, for good. No matter the challenges we face along the way, though, we stand humble, open and ready to take them on. Like anything in life, it's about trial and error - well, mostly error in our case for now - but we will work hard, staff well, learn diligently, iterate quickly and execute intelligently all the way to success.

We believe our concept has what it takes to disrupt the dining experience and set the restaurant industry on a new reinvention course for years to come as it was the case in the 1920s with the advent of diners, and in the 1950s with the success of drive-thru fast food joints. It's time!
