story:
_____________________________________________________________________________

Who is Revival Chili?

_____________________________________________________________________________

Hi, my name is Jordan and I absolutely LOVE chili. From eating chili in burritos to creating classic combinations with rice or cornbread, I eat chili at least once a day! And this isn’t your grandma’s chili. My secret recipe satisfies everyone from my health conscious mom to my hungry fraternity brothers at the University of Virginia.

Starting a Chili food truck has been my dream for years, but Revival Chili isn’t just about amazing food. We are creating a life-changing solution for reentering citizens.

Of the 650,000 ex-offenders released from prison in the U.S. this year, two-thirds will find themselves back behind bars within three years. The rest will face unemployment rates 30% higher than the general public. At Revival Chili, we believe in second chances. By starting a food truck, we will provide our employees with job training, personal mentoring, and hands-on experience. By teaching them skills in entrepreneurship on the truck, we hope to give our employees the tools necessary to go on to start their own businesses.

It is with YOUR HELP that we hope to achieve our mission.

Our primary goal is to teach our employees to become leaders that can go on to create or lead sustainable businesses. We will provide first-hand experience managing a business, positively interacting with consumers, and the ins and outs of purchasing. We hope to change the negative connotations associated with ex-convicts and build a more inclusive entrepreneurial ecosystem, while staying environmentally conscientious with every business decision. Our goal is to positively impact the careers of over 100 previously incarcerated citizens by 2025.

We believe we can touch 100 lives because of the cascade effect within our business. We will do everything in our power to help our employees go on to start their own food trucks, while encouraging them to hire reentering citizens. This mission will in turn create more jobs, give back to the community, and allow our business to grow.

_____________________________________________________________________________

What have we done so far?

_____________________________________________________________________________

Revival Chili was incorporated in October 2016. We currently have three employees: Travis, Trevon, and Jacob who are all phenomenal. They are extremely hard workers, always show up on time (and even early), and are ready to make a change in their lives as well as our customer's.

Since incorporation, we have catered five events and participated in twenty-three pop-up events across the city. The largest event we participated in was Light Up Night in Downtown Pittsburgh on November, 18th, 2016. Our swagged out booth can be seen below and we sold over 200 bowls while there!

Other great events Revival Chili has been at include: lunches at NoVA Place, farmer's markets, Pittsburgh cultural trust events, outside Roundabout Brewery and many more. 

_____________________________________________________________________________

What is the impact we will have?

_____________________________________________________________________________

Revival Chili is committed to fair wages, professional development, and great food! According to the University of Michigan, when surveyed, employees were the least likely to hire ex-offenders in roles that handled money or interacted with customers. For individuals interested in a food service job, such as working or owning a food truck, this inability to get initial experience is debilitating to their career paths.

So, one of Revival Chili’s cornerstone values is to pay a livable wage to our employees. Currently, the minimum livable wage for an hourly employee is $15.50. Revival Chili will be using that as the base wage to discourage recidivism in our employees as best we can.

Essentially, reducing unemployment rates among ex-offenders is an extremely complicated social issue. Non-profits, for-profits, and government agencies alike tend to focus on job training, placement, or sustaining life for those unemployed. Most programs look only at behind the scenes jobs and severely lack in job satisfaction, as well as, long-term career building. That is why we are focused on professional development and putting our employees experience, skills, and development at the forefront of every business decision.

At Revival Chili, we believe passionate people should be allowed to pursue the career of their choice, regardless of past discretions. Inline with our mission, a startup in New York is achieving something similar with employment and training in the food truck industry. This truck is called Drive Change in NYC, founded by entrepreneur Jordyn Lexton. With Jordyn as a mentor, Revival Chili has been able to create a more thought out, robust business plan. We hope to stand out with our dedication to teaching entrepreneurial skills and providing valuable experience for our employees (and deliver some spicy chili).

Another company doing something similar is called Hot Chicken Takeover in Columbus. Part of their mission is:

HCT’s about more than just chicken. It’s about our people. Beyond an amazing community of customers, HCT provides supportive jobs to men and women who need a fair chance at work. Be it homelessness, previous incarceration, or another barrier to employment, HCT employees are wildly ambitious and have set their sights on what’s next.

They have seen great success in Columbus. After operating out of a shared space, HCT is already opening up a storefront. You can see their progress at the website below.

http://www.dispatch.com/content/stories/busines...

_____________________________________________________________________________

What do we need?

_____________________________________________________________________________

The Revival Chili entity is already set up along with the bank account, payroll, accountant, insurance, and lawyer. Plus, by setting up at pop-up events over the last 4 months, we have acquired the majority of small equipment needed for the truck (besides large kitchen items). Now, all we need is the actual truck, or in this case, that food trailer to be towed behind the CEO’s pick-up! Here’s what the breakdown looks like:

Any resources collected will be extremely useful to ensure Revival Chili can sustain full-time employment for our employees and continuing operation of the trailer.

_____________________________________________________________________________

What are some of the risks and challenges?

_____________________________________________________________________________

There are obvious risks in every startup business, especially the food industry. Revival Chili is minimizing these risks through the partnerships we have created in the city of Pittsburgh. Currently, we have a main partner, Zero Six Eight. Zero Six Eight is an incubator for previous incarcerated individuals that want to start their own business or people that would like to hire ex-offenders. They help us by finding employees, providing administrative support, and community development training for Revival Chili. We plan to use this partnership to create a supportive and continuously growing community of chili lovers!

Revival has also received recognition and support from other organizations in the city that try to break down barriers to employment.

"I'm thrilled to see Revival Chili pushing forward! Jordan Robarge is providing an incredible opportunity for ex-offenders to get in on the ground floor of a small business. At Community Kitchen Pittsburgh, we know how tough it can be to get a good job when you have a record. We are proud and grateful to have CKP graduates on the Revival Chili team!" - Tom Samilson, Director of Programs, Community Kitchen Pittsburgh

Another challenge is ensuring we can grab a share of the food truck market here in Pittsburgh. Luckily, the food truck is just starting to blossom so we are entering at the right time. Also, there are no chili-inspired food trucks in the city which is slightly baffling because who doesn’t love chili?! It also makes it easier when you serve the best chili anyone has ever seen.

_____________________________________________________________________________

What are the perks?

_____________________________________________________________________________

Take a look at our amazing menu and let us know what you'd like to order! Don't worry, the prizes aren't as spicy as the chili (unless it is chili, of course :D).

_____________________________________________________________________________

Who is Revival Chili team?

_____________________________________________________________________________

Jordan graduated from the University of Virginia in 2015 with a Systems Engineering degree and was thrilled to enter the fourth class of Venture for America (VFA) Fellows immediately after college. The summer after graduation, while on his way to Pittsburgh, Jordan started catering family members and friend's events with his world-renowned chili. In Pittsburgh, he worked for an early-stage incubator, Thrill Mill, that also ran an Innovation & Music Festival, Thrival. Jordan helped grow Thrival by creating an Ambassador program with 20 Ambassadors at 8 different colleges. He also developed an Andriod and iOS application for the Festival in 2016. Through the connections he made while at Thrill Mill, Jordan was able to turn his chili-cooking hobby into a social enterprise supporting local farms, renewable energy and re-entering citizens. Jordan hopes to be able to provide healthy, delicious chili to everyone in Pittsburgh, especially incoming VFA Fellows.

 

Thanks to everyone who has read our story. We truly appreciate any and all support you can give for the build out of the trailer. We understand everyone is at different places in their life. If you can’t support us financially, please share our campaign with your network and spread the good #revivalchili word! You can use to share buttons at the top of the page to share this campaign across your social media accounts. :)

story:
Who we are?

Andersen Winery is a Danish winery, founded in December 2015 but dating back to 2009 when the team started experimenting with production of sparkling wine, using the traditional method combined with the finest fruits and berries that Denmark has to offer. Andersen Winery is owned by winemaker Mads Groom Andersen, food specialist Frantz Maurice Scott Lundby and entrepreneur Morten Rinder Stengaard.

Andersen Winery has a vision of producing world-class sparkling wines based on the best fruits and berries Denmark can offer. Our sparkling wines are served at some of the best restaurants in Denmark, such as Michelin-star restaurants Kong Hans Kælder and Restaurant Geranium.

We have particpated in three competitions, and each time the wines have been awarded with medals. In June 2016, Sparkling Apple 2014 was awarded with a bronze medal at Dansk Frugtvinskue in Denmark, and in November 2016 Sparkling Blackcurrant 2015 received a gold medal at the International Food Contest (IFC) in Denmark. In March 2017 Sparkling Blackcurrant 2015 and Sparkling Apple 2016 Low alc. have been awarded with gold and silver medals, respectively, at the Apfelcider International in Germany.

How we do it?

We cooperate with local fruit and berry producers, from whom we buy all of our raw materials. We focus on building long-term relationships with our partners to be able to impact how the fruits and berries are grown and when they are harvested. For example, our close collaboration with an apple farmer ensures that we can decide exactly when the apples should be harvested, in order for the acidity and sugar levels to be optimal, which is important for us to produce the best possible wines. Similarly, when harvesting blackcurrant we go out and help the farmer and hand-sort the berries during the harvest. For this we pay a premium price, which helps our partners generate a sustainable business, while at the same time we are able to develop and produce wines for our customers that are outstanding and second-to-none. 

When the fruits and berries have been picked, they are immideately brought to our winery, where we start the processing when these are still 100% fresh. We use the traditional method (sometimes refered to as the Champagne method) in the production, which means that the juice is first fermented in a tank, after which it is bottled and fermented a seocnd time to produce the bubbles. The wine then rests for a number of months in the cellar, after which they are hand-riddled and the dosage, that determines the sweetness of the particular wine, is added.

What is next?

We are currently working on expanding our production facilities to be able to scale up production to meet demand. The funding will be used for buying a number of 3,000 litre steel tanks as well as various other wine-making equipment necessary for producing sparkling wines at bigger scale, while ensuring the same high quality that we want to be known for.
story_txt: Who we are?Andersen Winery is a Danish winery, founded in December 2015 but dating back to 2009 when the team started experimenting with production of sparkling wine, using the traditional method combined with the finest fruits and berries that Denmark has to offer. Andersen Winery is owned by winemaker Mads Groom Andersen, food specialist Frantz Maurice Scott Lundby and entrepreneur Morten Rinder Stengaard.Andersen Winery has a vision of producing world-class sparkling wines based on the best fruits and berries Denmark can offer. Our sparkling wines are served at some of the best restaurants in Denmark, such as Michelin-star restaurants Kong Hans Kælder and Restaurant Geranium.We have particpated in three competitions, and each time the wines have been awarded with medals. In June 2016, Sparkling Apple 2014 was awarded with a bronze medal at Dansk Frugtvinskue in Denmark, and in November 2016 Sparkling Blackcurrant 2015 received a gold medal at the International Food Contest (IFC) in Denmark. In March 2017 Sparkling Blackcurrant 2015 and Sparkling Apple 2016 Low alc. have been awarded with gold and silver medals, respectively, at the Apfelcider International in Germany.How we do it?We cooperate with local fruit and berry producers, from whom we buy all of our raw materials. We focus on building long-term relationships with our partners to be able to impact how the fruits and berries are grown and when they are harvested. For example, our close collaboration with an apple farmer ensures that we can decide exactly when the apples should be harvested, in order for the acidity and sugar levels to be optimal, which is important for us to produce the best possible wines. Similarly, when harvesting blackcurrant we go out and help the farmer and hand-sort the berries during the harvest. For this we pay a premium price, which helps our partners generate a sustainable business, while at the same time we are able to develop and produce wines for our customers that are outstanding and second-to-none. When the fruits and berries have been picked, they are immideately brought to our winery, where we start the processing when these are still 100% fresh. We use the traditional method (sometimes refered to as the Champagne method) in the production, which means that the juice is first fermented in a tank, after which it is bottled and fermented a seocnd time to produce the bubbles. The wine then rests for a number of months in the cellar, after which they are hand-riddled and the dosage, that determines the sweetness of the particular wine, is added.What is next?We are currently working on expanding our production facilities to be able to scale up production to meet demand. The funding will be used for buying a number of 3,000 litre steel tanks as well as various other wine-making equipment necessary for producing sparkling wines at bigger scale, while ensuring the same high quality that we want to be known for.

story:
OUR STORY

In Fall of 2016, Sophia Karbowski and Austin Patry, two Entrepreneurial Management students at Texas Christian University (TCU), realized that Fort Worth was lacking healthy food options. After visits to California, and many açaí bowls later, the two health-conscious foodies seized the opportunity to introduce Fort Worth to its first açaí bowl-focused establishment.

With each craving of açaí came more motivation, and within months, what started as an idea soon became a proof-of-concept food truck. Our final goal? Roll n Bowl our way to a brick and mortar (with a healthy drive-thru), and spread the love of fresh and nourishing açaí, pitaya, and more all over the South!

We have bootstrapped the whole company thus far, and now we need your help! We've finalized a business plan, done catering events, pitched in TCU Venture Capital competitions, and purchased a food trailer, but now we need some funding for just a few more things.

 

WHAT WE NEED

$3,500 - Generator

Our trailer will run solely off of generator power. Since we have no heated appliances, we won't be using any propane. Our blenders are powerful and produce some high voltage bursts. A 20,000 watt generator will allow us to make our bowls with fresh ingredients, and not worry about losing power!

$3,500 - Custom Trailer Wrap

Currently, our trailer is pretty bare bones with no design. We're looking for $3,500 to get an awesome customized wrap around our whole trailer! We want to make the design sleek, but groovy with pops of bright color. Here's a picture of our trailer as of now:

Commercial Vitamix Blender - $400

Who knew a blender could be so expensive? We have one, and now we just need one more! A must have in order to make our bowls.

Deep Freezer - $300

Keep our ingredients cold and fresh. Summer is coming. 

Permits - $300

Once our trailer is wrapped, and we have all of the proper equipment, it's time to get it inspected and permitted. 

 

REWARDS

For those of you wanting to pledge to our Indiegogo campaign, we have some awesome rewards! From stickers, to t-shirts, to pre-paid superfood parties, to FREE BOWLS FOR LIFE, we've got so many ways to bring you healthy happiness! Check out the images below for some examples of the great stuff you can get!

T-shirts - Pick your favorite shirt and rep your passion for healthy foods!

Option 1

Option 2

Option 3

Catering events - Bring the party to you when you give $500 or more!

 

OUR BOWLS

Rollin' n Bowlin's mission is to make Fort Worth, and the DFW metroplex, healthier without sacrificing taste. Many Texans don't know about these Cali-bred treats, and we are so excited to share them with you! 

We've tried the best açaí bowls in America, conducted thorough research, and gone through many taste tests. A lot of thought has gone into our menu, and if you haven't noticed, we love puns and play on words. Check it out: 

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

GIVE - The very best thing you can do is give to this Indiegogo campaign to help us get rollin'. Every pledge matters no matter how big or how small! 

SOCIAL MEDIA - Follow us, like us, comment, and share! The more active you are on social media with us, the more people will find us and be able to get involved! Click the links below! 

Instagram

Facebook

Snapchat: rollinnbowlin (snap the picture below to follow)

SPREAD IT - Send this to everyone you know! You can click the Indiegogo social media and other share tools for your convenience! Let's get everyone in the DFW area on board!

 

Risks & Challenges

We are relying on this crowdfunding money. Should we not hit our goal, then we will have to seek out catering events until we have enough money to fully operate. Many food trucks struggle with the first few months of their business because of the word of mouth nature of our business, but we are confident in Rollin' n Bowlin' (RNB) because word of mouth has already spread! We've already done a few catering events and we have a very supportive and rapidly growing social media following.

Our product is delicious, appealing, healthy, and fun. Our team is passionate, diligent, knowledgeable, and positive. We will be working towards operational excellence and sound business practices to ensure that Rollin' n Bowlin' will become an option to everyone in the DFW area!

If you have any questions regarding our business or how the Indiegogo funds will be used, please email info@rollinnbowlin.com and we will get back to you right away!

story:
About Us

My name is Alexandra Barroso and I'm the owner of restaurant Tuga. 
For already two years I've been living in Sofia, Bulgaria. 
Cooking has always been my passion and I was also missing a lot Portuguese cuisine so a year ago I left my corporate job to try to bring a little bit of Portugal to the city!

I started organizing transportation of Portuguese products to Bulgaria (there are almost no
Portuguese products here) and I rented a small bar&diner. Unfortunately, the kitchen
there was too small and it didn't allow much for cooking.

So four months ago I rented a restaurant with a bigger kitchen and opened the restaurant
two months ago. Now we are a small team of four people and we need your contribution in order to have the restaurant operating.

What We Need & What You Get

The money we raise here will be used to have the restaurant operating during these
very difficult first six months after opening a restaurant. It will take an extra €15,000+ to have it operating until the end of the year that we cannot afford.

By contributing and getting one of our perks you actually prepay your dinner at the restaurant and you can come any time until the end of the year to get your dinner offer. It's like buying a voucher for clothes that is valid for a given period!

You can also get one of our branded T-shirts or a special edition of the Portuguese scarf from the last year's European football cup that Portugal won!

The Impact

By supporting us you will bring diversity to the capital city of Sofia!

You will help for the existence of a homey restaurant for the native Portuguese and a touch to the Portuguese culture and cuisine for the rest. 

Risks & Challenges

July, August and September is low season here in Sofia so this makes it very difficult for us to continue operating. Only your support can make a difference!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help by:

  • Getting the word out and making some noise about this campaign.
  • Using the Indiegogo share tools to share with your friends and family!
  • Just drop by our restaurant for a Portuguese bite or beverage!

You can check on our website some of the dishes that we are offering:

http://tugabarsofia.com/

story:
Our Story

Our names are Juan and Charlie. We are cousins, Boulder locals, CU graduates and the creators of Green Belly’s Guatemalan foods and experiences. We believe in cross cultural exchanges of flavors that bridge foods with love, traditions, and ethical partnerships.

Green Belly Foods started when Juan shared his mother’s delicious hot sauce with his friends. They were blown away by the unique cilantro, garlic and habanero blend. The sauce was so fresh and tasty that Juan began getting bombarded with requests for more of the delicious green hot sauce. Eventually they convinced him to enter the local farmer’s market in 2015. Once he opened up a tent, sales took off and the Green Belly revolution began!

Our Humble Beginnings

When we opened our first tent in 2015, we were so new to large scale production that we could hardly keep up with demand. We had other full-time jobs to juggle, family and kids, but the constant demand for Green Belly showed us we were onto something special.

The craving for Green Belly has been overwhelming! At farmers markets people tell us they can’t get enough. We receive orders online from all over the country, and have even shipped to Europe! People from all walks of life have shared their stories about how our sauces have changed their diet and brought new explosion of flavor into their daily meals.

It's been three years of hard work and constant determination to keep this growing. The most important contributions we've received have been the continuous love and support from our customers who crave our sauces. We would like to thank everyone who has helped us along the way!

Customers have further supported us by helping us enter and grow in local retail stores and restaurants such as Alfalfa's, Lucky’s Market, The Village Coffee Shop and Peppercorn who picked us up right after our first summer.

Green Belly Hot Sauce

The success of Green Belly is our unique recipe that focuses on flavor. Our recipe is simple, but very different than most hot sauces that are vinegar-heavy, poorly spiced and rely on acidic tomatillos for body.  Green Belly uses loads of organic cilantro and garlic to give our sauce a fresh, herby body; we continue to blend in ripe habaneros, olive oil and organic apple cider vinegar to create the right balance of acidity, heat and flavor.  

Red Belly Hot Sauce

The success of Green Belly pushed us to create Red Belly with a unique smoky flavor that stems from the Cobanero pepper. This dark red and wrinkly pepper comes from the cloud forests of Guatemala where Mayan communities have been harvesting and smoking peppers for millenia! We have paired the fiery Cobanero with fire roasted tomatoes and garlic to give the sauce a fresh body packed with flavor!

Chile Cobanero or Cahabonero

We source the best, fresh smoked peppers we can find in Guatemala. We pay a fair-trade price that benefits local producers and vendors.  This is especially rewarding because we directly contribute to their developing economies, indigenous farming communities, and further facilitate entrepreneurial growth in one of Guatemala’s poorest regions. We are bringing business directly to hard working people that benefit from bigger markets for their goods. Giving back to the local communities that produce the amazing flavor of the Cobanero pepper is one of our highest priorities.

 

Guatemala is not known for hot sauce, but peppers have been used by Mayan communities for millenia. This is especially true outside the cities, where it is hard to find a house that doesn't have a pepper plant growing in the backyard or patio. The truth is that Guatemalans love peppers! The famous Cobanero pepper s a staple in every dining room table. It is grown by Maya Q'eqchi' communities in North Central Guatemala.

The Cobanero pepper gets its name from the city of Coban, the capital of the state of Alta Verapaz, although it is grown in towns like Cahabón at much lower elevations.  This pepper and many others have been used for centuries by the local Maya Q’eqchi’ communities. This pepper is a perfect expression of our traditional Guatemalan inspirations.

This pepper is key to traditional dishes such as a wild turkey and chile stew called kak’ik, which directly translates to “red chile.” This spicy hot stew is a pre-hispanic recipe that is eaten year round in the rainy cloud-forests of Alta Verapaz and is one of Guatemala’s national dishes. Ask us for a recipe and we'll tell you how to use Red Belly to spice it up in an authentic way!

 

Black Belly Beans

In our journey into the food world we’ve been guided by a cross cultural connection of flavors.  Which brings us to our newest product, Black Belly Beans! If you’ve never tried the now world famous Guatemalan black beans, you’re really missing out on one of the most delicious and nutritious meals you can have: blended black beans!

They are the staple food in Guatemala, and the most reliable source of protein for people who don’t consume meat all the time. No matter what part of the country you are from, rich or poor, urban or rural, you can find black beans in every kitchen. Juan has kept up the tradition (and straight love for them) by cooking the traditional frijoles negros that he learned in his mom’s kitchen.

We started offering our black beans as a complimentary sample food for our hot sauce samples, but customers at the market would always ask, “Well how much for the beans?!” and again after customers insisted on having us sell them the beans, we began packaging them for sale. They are now one of the staple items at our farmer's market stand and again, people can’t get enough of them! We always sell out quickly and we would like to scale our production.  Which is another reason why we are asking for your help.

Sustainable Farming 

Sustainability is important for everyone, especially food producers. We are conscious of each ingredients' source, and look to find producers who take whole ecosystems into account. We create relationships with producers whenever possible, so that we can be sure we are providing you the freshest and healthiest foods.

Last year our very own uncle Carl planted over 70 Habaneros for us at his house in Boulder. This effort was further supported by friends and family who took in our habanero plants over the winter to replant this summer. Once again we can’t thank you and the community enough for you support--thank you!

This year we plan to grow around 600 habaneros in Longmont. Eventually we want build a greenhouse to grow our own ingredients locally and year-round. This way we will be able to bring you even better products.

 

We are Overwhelmed with Demand!

We started at one Boulder Farmers Market in 2015, grew to three markets last year, and now we are at six markets and many stores. We need your help to meet the growing demand!

We are increasing our production capacity to offer our sauces to a larger audience, provide the larger bottles that customers have requested for years, as well as expand the number of retail locations.

 

Specifically we need to triple our sauce production, hire workers, increase order sizes, buy equipment and  much more!

This campaign will really help us increase our production size. With your help we will be able to buy ingredients in larger quantities and decrease costs across the board.

New product development is also a major priority for our company. Our Black Belly Beans have been incredibly popular, and we're exploring ways to increase their production, as well as ways to extend their shelf life. This will help us provide you beans in convenient retail locations!

Does Our Story Leave You Wanting More?

You are in luck, you can become part of this journey by backing it. If you really want to engage in the full experience, immerse yourself in one of our Guatemalan experiences. Are you hungry to help? Let us provide you and some special guests with a spectacular home cooked Guatemalan meal.

Are you looking to get out of the house? Pack your bag and pick one of our guided Guatemalan adventures. These experiences come in multiple levels and are customized to you. What do you want to see? What do you want to feel? Are you ready for a life changing Guatemalan experience?

These Guatemalan trips also give you a privileged view into our future international developments. Pick one of these perks to demonstrate your belief in us, and directly make an impact on our global community. Do you like rich cultures, strong traditions, volcanoes, jungles, beaches, vibrant colors, delicious aromas, vivacious energy, inspiring dance, pure foods, hidden luxury and an abundance of opportunity? Then you need to come with us to Guatemala!

 

We need this money for:

1. Packaging purchases

At $4,320 we can purchase packaging for our next batch

 

2. Ingredient Purchases

At $9,120 we can purchase ingredients & packaging for our next batch

 

3. Facility and Production

At $16,299 we can purchase packaging, ingredients and cover the facility and production costs.

 

4. Hiring People

At $55,499 we can do all the above, and create summer jobs all across Colorado.

 

5. New Product Development

At $79,499 we can do all the above, and take our new products to the next level so you bite into the next level of deliciousness.

 

6. Infrastructure Addition

At $195,298 we can  do all the above and build a greenhouse.

 

7. Organization Empowerment

At $449,499 we can do all the above and hire full time employees to give us a jump ahead on our path toward maximizing our impact on communities around the world.

 

8. National Sales & Marketing

At $1,386,344 we can do all the above and support a marketing campaign that will enable us to share the love for our sauce across the nation.

 

9. Global Empowerment

At $10,000,000,000 we can do all the above and invest in transformative business actions and strategies that will empower us all.

Share the love!

Please pick a perk that matches you, and connect your family and friends to our hot sauce revolution.

If you really want to engage in the full experience, immerse yourself in one of our Guatemalan experiences. Are you hungry to help? Let us provide you and some special guests with a spectacular home cooked Guatemalan meal.Are you looking to get out of the house? Pack your bag and pick one of our guided Guatemalan adventures. These experiences come in multiple levels and are customized to you. What do you want to see? What do you want to feel? Are you ready for a life changing Guatemalan experience?These Guatemalan trips also give you a privileged view into our future international developments. Pick one of these perks to demonstrate your belief in us, and directly make an impact on our global community. Do you like rich cultures, strong traditions, volcanoes, jungles, beaches, vibrant colors, delicious aromas, vivacious energy, inspiring dance, pure foods, hidden luxury and an abundance of opportunity? Then you need to come with us to Guatemala! We need this money for:
1. Packaging purchases
At $4,320 we can purchase packaging for our next batch
 
2. Ingredient Purchases
At $9,120 we can purchase ingredients & packaging for our next batch
 
3. Facility and Production
At $16,299 we can purchase packaging, ingredients and cover the facility and production costs.
 
4. Hiring People
At $55,499 we can do all the above, and create summer jobs all across Colorado.
 
5. New Product Development
At $79,499 we can do all the above, and take our new products to the next level so you bite into the next level of deliciousness.
 
6. Infrastructure Addition
At $195,298 we can  do all the above and build a greenhouse.
 
7. Organization Empowerment
At $449,499 we can do all the above and hire full time employees to give us a jump ahead on our path toward maximizing our impact on communities around the world.
 
8. National Sales & Marketing
At $1,386,344 we can do all the above and support a marketing campaign that will enable us to share the love for our sauce across the nation.
 
9. Global Empowerment
At $10,000,000,000 we can do all the above and invest in transformative business actions and strategies that will empower us all.

Share the love!
Please pick a perk that matches you, and connect your family and friends to our hot sauce revolution.

story:
Exclusive boxing week deal!  
Offer ends: Jan 1st 2018

-

Drip coffee is usually...


MOOD is price friendly. If you were to buy a Starbucks coffee every day for a year, you'd end up spending upwards of $1,000. With MOOD, you can enjoy a delicious cup at a fraction of the cost.

MOOD is high quality. Our full bodied, medium roast beans are 100% Colombian Arabica and Fair Trade. We've worked hard to perfect our roasting technique to guarantee you the highest of quality.

MOOD is convenient. Skip the lines - you don't need to rely on someone else to satisfy your caffeine fix. With MOOD, you can be your own barista. Brew your own quality coffee anywhere you go.


 

 

Each MOOD Coffee Drip Kits comes with a beautiful dripper and a pouch of coffee portioned for one delicious cup.

MOOD drippers drip three times slower than the average filter, which ensures your coffee is concentrated and full of flavor. They're also sized to fit perfectly in any cup or tumbler. Designed in Japan, our dripper was crafted to give the perfect drip, enabling you to make a quality cup of coffee anywhere, anytime.

The design process of our dripper took place in Japan at a local cafe in Tokyo.

In Tokyo, brewing coffee isn’t exactly a ceremony, but it is ceremonious in its own right. Beans are weighed, ground, and then emptied into a filter to be pre-infused with water, allowing the coffee to bloom. The goal is to demonstrate the mastery of technique behind the brew, and then focus on the important details of service. It adds up to an overall incredible experience.

Our mission was to simulate the same type of experience, without sacrificing the quality of the coffee brewed. Working to ensure quality while keeping the product portable proved to be a challenge, but what sprung out of this was something incredible. We’re proud to share our final product, which rivals the large glass drippers typically seen in Tokyo cafes. Our beautiful, high quality drippers will change the way you drink coffee forever.

Our fresh ground coffee is packaged for a single cup of delicious coffee. It’s packed with a special formula to keep it fresh for a longer period of time.

A full-bodied roast of 100% Colombian beans delivers a true Colombian taste. Our coffee beans are Fair Trade and ground with superior quality control, to ensure you have the best cup of coffee, period.

 

See what other coffee lovers had to say about MOOD Drip Kits.

 

 

Sean Cho is the founder and designer of MOOD Coffee Drip Kits. With a biochemistry background from the University of Waterloo and an interest in food and nutrition, his studies were put to excellent use in the creation of MOOD Coffee.

He found a solution that would help maintain the freshness of the coffee grinds in an efficient, and surprisingly simple way. By sealing the sachets in a specific manner, the oxidization process would be delayed, allowing the coffee grounds to stay fresh and full of flavor for an average of one month longer. He also needed to design the perfect portable dripper. It had to be simple, but capable of having the same effect as other existing dripper technology.

After many months of research, Sean eventually flew to Japan where he worked with local coffee experts to design a one-of-a-kind dripper. Sean is proud to launch MOOD Coffee, and excited to finally be able to share his coffee technology with the world.

Contact Sean at sean@moodcoffee.co

We're now in the production stage, and couldn't be more excited to get MOOD in your hands. At this rate of progress, we'll be able to ship MOOD out to you as early as February 2018!

How do I make a purchase?

Pick a perk to support, and submit it!

What is the dripper made out of? 

Our dripper is made out paper and an integrated mesh microfilter. It's 100% recyclable!

What comes in a Drip Kit?

Each Drip Kit includes a dripper and a sachet portioned for one cup of coffee. We're offering our Drip Kits in packs of 15 or 30.

How big is each sachet?

Each sachet has 10 grams of coffee grounds.

How long does it stay fresh and how?

Our coffee good for up to one year, an average month longer than regular coffee grounds. This is because we carefully seal our sachets in a manner that delays the oxidization process, allowing the grounds to stay fresh and full of flavour!

Are duties/taxes included in the price?

From our experience, most countries don't charge taxes on coffee. With that said, every country has their own take on duties + taxes, so we would recommend checking before you receive any surprises!

Where do I put my shipping address?

We’ll ask for your shipping address as we get closer to delivery date.

Where is the product created?

The dripper is designed and crafted in Japan and the coffee is made and packed in Columbia.

story:
What on earth is a Calamansi???

Don’t be fooled by its size, but this tiny fruit is high in vitamin C, contains more antioxidants than an orange, and more nutrient rich compared to top leading citrus fruits.

Why Calamansi?

Most people haven’t even heard of this amazing fruit. The Calamansi is native to the Philippines, and is referred to as the golden lime or the Philippine lemon. No matter what you call it, get ready for a bold and delicious citrusy taste. On the outside, it looks just like a lime, but it resembles the bold colors of a tangerine on the inside. However, the scent of the fruit is entirely unique, and cannot be compared to any other scent. The vitamins and enzymes found in this fruit can:

  • Treat colds and coughs
  • Help with inflammation
  • Increase the productivity of the immune system
  • Promote better digestive health
  • Rehydrate your body
  • Lower cholesterol

With all of these amazing benefits, it’s hard to understand why you weren’t drinking this juice sooner.

MANSI is an all-natural, non-GMO project verified, OU Kosher certified, and gluten free juice. We take pride that our calamansi fruit are grown and squeezed in the Philippines, working with local farmers for a sustainable future.

Our Certifications

 

How do you Mansi?

 

Cold and Refreshing

Try Mansi on ice and feel REFRESHED. Packed with Vitamin C containing higher antioxidant levels than an orange and more nutrient rich than most leading citrus fruits, experience the calamansi like you’ve never before.

Warm like Tea

Used in medicinal home remedies for generations, try Mansi warm as you would like tea. Considered as a natural detox, enjoy this beverage warm for a SOOTHING experience.

Amazing Cocktails

Get the party started and say hello to your favorite mixer! No longer do you need to be a mixologist to create the most amazing cocktails. Great when you also add to seltzer or to liven up any beverage. It’s that simple.

Delicious Treats

Put some Mansi in the freezer and make popsicles for the kids or sorbet for the adults. Bake calamansi muffins, create delicious marmalades, or just add in your blender for a nutritious smoothie.

Exotic Flavor

Try Mansi as you would a lemon or a lime. Create mouth-watering dishes with this new exotic flavor. Perfect also for marinades, dipping sauces, even vinaigrette

Don’t just take our word for it

The Calamansi on ABC’s hit show The Chew-

Watch how the cast of the chew reacts to the calamansi: 

 

Extra Extra Read all about it!

"MANSI brings to the market juice made from a little-known, good-for-you citrus fruit."  CRAIN’S

"Perfect balance between sweet and sour that’s similar to a cross between a tangerine and a lime."  BEVNET

“Whenever I need a taste of the Philippines, I make sure to drink Mansi.”     Apl.de.Ap of the Black Eyed Peas

"Mansi ticks off all the boxes...surprisingly refreshing citrus drink" Mattson's                     Integrated Consumer Insights (ICI) 

"Innovative fresh tasting product. Super unique Juice. Loved the refreshing lemon taste."        Sofi Awards 

FAQ’s

Why should I back it now?

Take advantage of our huge discount and free shipping available on Indiegogo!  More importantly help support the mission to bring calamansi juice to the mainstream.  As a backer, you’re part of the Mansi team for life.

When should I drink Mansi?

Anytime!  Aside from drinking Mansi cold as it’s refreshing, many love drinking Mansi warmed up like tea on a chilly day.  Try it with your favorite cocktail and say hello to your new favorite mixer.  And if that isn’t enough, put some Mansi in the freezer and treat your kids to some Mansi-popsicles

Does Mansi need to be refrigerated?

No. Mansi is a shelf stable product.  However upon opening please refrigerate.

Is Mansi a clean label?

Aside from being Non-GMO Project Verified, Gluten Free, Dairy Free and OU Kosher, we take pride using only natural ingredients and organic sweeteners.  

If you’ve never tried the calamansi fruit before, now here’s your chance.

Your support will help assist us in our Research and Development efforts taking Mansi to a whole new level.  We will be able to create new flavors and formulations along with enhancing our current product’s design. 

Help us get Mansi out to the world.  Your generosity will help us educate and introduce this delicious superfruit to the country!

Time for the Perks!

Referrals = Free Mansi!

Refer as many friends as you can.  If the collective dollar value of your referrals is in our top 3, you will win one of the below prizes:

*Note- Shipping costs are not included for this 3+ referral reward.   You must also be logged into your Indiegogo account and use the share tools link to track referral contributions

#DrinkMansi

Can't wait to tell your friends about this new fruit you just discovered? Can you help us spread the word? Just 30 seconds of your time can make the biggest impact and in return you could win some free Mansi! Remember to use the share button above  and to tag a friend, family, or co-worker who would love to try the new citrus experience!

story:
Why ALLPRO Bartending Academy?

 

ALLPRO Hospitality, since its founding in 2016 has blazed a path in the service industry.  Staffing was the first branch under the ALLPRO Hospitality Group, which has received numerous awards in our community and nationwide, including INC. Magazine's 2019 Best Work Places in America.  

We have created training manuals, policies, and programs throughout our careers, highlighting the most vital information for trainees and longtime hospitality professionals.  We fully understand the importance of educating ourselves and others.  Knowing the value this provides to the ALLPRO team, we decided to offer the first-ever class practicals and theoretical training to new hires and existing employees to help them grow.  We began receiving requests from the hospitality community to join these training's and we decided to make them available to everyone. That's how ALLPRO Bartending Academy was born!  

The ultimate goal is to provide a modern class setting with professional instructors for beginners that would like to achieve bartending excellence.  Let's "raise the bar!"

 

ALLPRO promise to our community:

 

We pledge to provide full scholarship opportunities that will positively impact unemployed low income individuals, those who leave school before graduating and veterans in our community.  Our goal for recipients is to provide a new skill set, a highly respected certification, and placement opportunities that will help them earn a sustainable income.  Through our expert, personalized training and support,  we hope to help these individuals transform their lives.

 

Your generous donation will help us reach further!

 

We have been working on this exclusive bartending academy for six months, and we are very close to opening our doors!  With your support, we will be able to secure our modern classroom for a longer period of time.  Your donation will also provide high-end equipment, books, welcome kits, and consultation to students in need.  For us, this is more than educating our employees and students; it is about positively impacting our community and being able to provide a better future for those that need our support.   

 

Be the difference!

 

If you are unable to make a donation, your support is still valuable in other ways.  Please share the news with friends and family and let them know what a great addition this will be to the community.  

Use the Indiegogo share tools to reach others in your network.  However you can support, either big or small, it will make a huge impact.

story:
We've all heard of Food trucks, we've all heard of Food halls... Put them together and Voila!! You have LE RODEO! The first Food Truck Hall of its kind, giving you the best flavors of the Triangle!

Keep Scrolling to Learn More! :-)

 

Imagine your favorite Food Truck is no where to be found :-O

Imagine it started raining, but you've already made plans to go to a Rodeo with your friends, and you don't want to get your hair wet standing in line :-|

Or imagine you're at home, your favorite Food Truck is nearby, and you didn't even know it :'(

Nightmare right?

 

 

Le Rodeo is the first Indoor/Outdoor Food Truck Hall, Market, Bar, and Gathering Place of its kind. We are creating a hub for Local and Inter-State Food Trucks to serve the local community and their customers (our guests) authentic burst of flavors and the diversity they provide. 

To raise $100,000 from generous individuals and businesses who believe in our vision, which are: 

  • Building Community
  • Building Culture
  • Bringing Convenience  

Although we require way more than we are asking for, the $100,000 fund raised will go towards our building project, initial startup cost, marketing, and most importantly the equity required to secure the remaining balance through a bank loan.

 

 

 

 

To Provide a rotation of 3 Breakfast, 3 Lunch, 3 Dinner, and Desert trucks every day of the week,

To Create Opportunity for Food Trucks to connect and build relationships with the community

Le Rodeo’s customers will be spoilt with options for a quick stop on their way to work, chill night out with friends/family, or an intimate celebration with loved ones without the hassle of waiting outside in line in harsh weather conditions.

That’s right, our customers can visit each Food Truck access port from the inside! Think of it this way, the foodies are on the inside, the Food Trucks are on the outside.

 

  • Cousins Maine Lobster
  • Konopizza
  • Rare Earth Farms

 

AKA the 'Power Couple'

 

This crowdfunding campaign is important to us and the future of Le Rodeo because we have been unable to secure a few properties that would have been perfect for our vision, due to the lack of funds. To show our appreciation to all those who build Le Rodeo with us through their generous contributions, we have some exciting perks to give in return!

 

 

 

Please use the Indiegogo share tools on the top of our page to share this campaign with friends & family! Share & Link to FACEBOOK/ INSTAGRAM / TWITTER: @Le_Rodeo

Our Campaign Hashtags: #LeRodeo #ItsAGatheringEveryday #HomeoftheFoodTrucks

 

  • Support this campaign through your generous contribution
  • Share this campaign using the Indiegogo share links and tag us on social media
  • Come eat at Le Rodeo, when we open up
  • Follow us on all our social media and subscribe to our website for updates

    We have approached banks with our idea and business plan, in which majority have expressed their excitement in our idea. Many of the banks we have approached however require us to have at least a 20% deposit going towards the down payment of our project.

    We understand the risk and challenges involved in starting a brand new business, especially when it comes to raising funds. Some of the risks and challenges includes:

    • Business failing (the obvious one)
    • Not getting enough food truck owners to buy in with idea
    • The community not showing up to Le Rodeo
    • Renovation taking longer than expected

    Here are some of the ways we have and will continue to ensure these risks and challenges are minimized:

    • There is always a risk for any business to fail, however, we are striving to ensure that this does not happen to Le Rodeo by building a good team for our brand. The team currently consists of myself and my beautiful fiancé Tolu. Although a Registered Nurse by profession, Tolu has a business background. She is originally from London, UK. Prior to relocating to the RDU area in 2016, she had her own startup events and catering business in the UK, in which she exceeded in. She previously also assisted in successfully launching an African-Caribbean restaurant in the UK. Tolu has been a huge part of the Le Rodeo journey, as she has not only been as passionate and dedicated to the vision as I am, she has also been my check and balance, bringing in a different perspective to the bigger picture.
    • For the past 8 months, I have been meeting with 2 mentors that were assigned to me through the SCORE program. The SCORE program is a non-profit association that provides entrepreneurs business mentoring services from the early stage of an idea to the launch of the business.
    • My marketing background, as well as Tolu’s (my fiancé) charming British ascent has been a huge advantage throughout the process of entrepreneurship so far. Over the last few months, we have conducted market research with food truck owners at several rodeos in the Raleigh-Durham area, asking them what are some of the challenges for their mobile business. Majority of them expressed how weather, marketing, and location has the most impact on their success. Le Rodeo is perfect for resolving these, as we have a central location for food truck owners and food lovers to meet every single day of the week.
    • In regards to the community not showing up to Le Rodeo, we have conducted a random sample market research with members of our RDU community to ask them specific questions that has given us the confidence in our community's backing in pursuing this venture. Furthermore, the likelihood of no one turning up at Le Rodeo is very slim, considering the fact that RDU is known to be the place for food lovers.
    • Since 2017, we have been working with a turn key building company called ‘Bobbit Design Build’ to develop our unique concept. They have been in business for over 65 years. We have built a trusting relationship with them by meeting on a regular basis to discuss build out, site maps, and ways to be innovative, whilst remaining within budget. Thanks to their dedication and commitment to deliver our project in time, we gained tentative city approval for a previous property that we were aiming to purchase within months.
    • Our realtor that we have been working with for the past 6 months has also been excellent in negotiating with landlords on terms leading up to the first day of business (our official food truck hall opening day). These terms have worked in our favors with previous potentials to ensure that we do not pay any rent until we open our doors to our community.

    With these risks and challenges being important to consider, we just need people to gather around us, believe in our vision, and give us a chance so that we can bring this amazing idea, in which we believe in to our Raleigh-Durham community.
story_txt:
We've all heard of Food trucks, we've all heard of Food halls... Put them together and Voila!! You have LE RODEO! The first Food Truck Hall of its kind, giving you the best flavors of the Triangle!
Keep Scrolling to Learn More! :-)
 


Imagine your favorite Food Truck is no where to be found :-O
Imagine it started raining, but you've already made plans to go to a Rodeo with your friends, and you don't want to get your hair wet standing in line :-|
Or imagine you're at home, your favorite Food Truck is nearby, and you didn't even know it :'(
Nightmare right?
 

 
Le Rodeo is the first Indoor/Outdoor Food Truck Hall, Market, Bar, and Gathering Place of its kind. We are creating a hub for Local and Inter-State Food Trucks to serve the local community and their customers (our guests) authentic burst of flavors and the diversity they provide. 
To raise $100,000 from generous individuals and businesses who believe in our vision, which are: 

Building Community
Building Culture

Bringing Convenience  

Although we require way more than we are asking for, the $100,000 fund raised will go towards our building project, initial startup cost, marketing, and most importantly the equity required to secure the remaining balance through a bank loan.
 

 
 

 
To Provide a rotation of 3 Breakfast, 3 Lunch, 3 Dinner, and Desert trucks every day of the week,
To Create Opportunity for Food Trucks to connect and build relationships with the community
Le Rodeo’s customers will be spoilt with options for a quick stop on their way to work, chill night out with friends/family, or an intimate celebration with loved ones without the hassle of waiting outside in line in harsh weather conditions.
That’s right, our customers can visit each Food Truck access port from the inside! Think of it this way, the foodies are on the inside, the Food Trucks are on the outside.
 


Cousins Maine Lobster
Konopizza
Rare Earth Farms

 

AKA the 'Power Couple'

 

This crowdfunding campaign is important to us and the future of Le Rodeo because we have been unable to secure a few properties that would have been perfect for our vision, due to the lack of funds. To show our appreciation to all those who build Le Rodeo with us through their generous contributions, we have some exciting perks to give in return!










 

 
 

Please use the Indiegogo share tools on the top of our page to share this campaign with friends & family! Share & Link to FACEBOOK/ INSTAGRAM / TWITTER: @Le_Rodeo
Our Campaign Hashtags: #LeRodeo #ItsAGatheringEveryday #HomeoftheFoodTrucks
 


Support this campaign through your generous contribution
Share this campaign using the Indiegogo share links and tag us on social media
Come eat at Le Rodeo, when we open up
Follow us on all our social media and subscribe to our website for updates



We have approached banks with our idea and business plan, in which majority have expressed their excitement in our idea. Many of the banks we have approached however require us to have at least a 20% deposit going towards the down payment of our project.
We understand the risk and challenges involved in starting a brand new business, especially when it comes to raising funds. Some of the risks and challenges includes:

Business failing (the obvious one)
Not getting enough food truck owners to buy in with idea
The community not showing up to Le Rodeo
Renovation taking longer than expected

Here are some of the ways we have and will continue to ensure these risks and challenges are minimized:

There is always a risk for any business to fail, however, we are striving to ensure that this does not happen to Le Rodeo by building a good team for our brand. The team currently consists of myself and my beautiful fiancé Tolu. Although a Registered Nurse by profession, Tolu has a business background. She is originally from London, UK. Prior to relocating to the RDU area in 2016, she had her own startup events and catering business in the UK, in which she exceeded in. She previously also assisted in successfully launching an African-Caribbean restaurant in the UK. Tolu has been a huge part of the Le Rodeo journey, as she has not only been as passionate and dedicated to the vision as I am, she has also been my check and balance, bringing in a different perspective to the bigger picture.
For the past 8 months, I have been meeting with 2 mentors that were assigned to me through the SCORE program. The SCORE program is a non-profit association that provides entrepreneurs business mentoring services from the early stage of an idea to the launch of the business.
My marketing background, as well as Tolu’s (my fiancé) charming British ascent has been a huge advantage throughout the process of entrepreneurship so far. Over the last few months, we have conducted market research with food truck owners at several rodeos in the Raleigh-Durham area, asking them what are some of the challenges for their mobile business. Majority of them expressed how weather, marketing, and location has the most impact on their success. Le Rodeo is perfect for resolving these, as we have a central location for food truck owners and food lovers to meet every single day of the week.
In regards to the community not showing up to Le Rodeo, we have conducted a random sample market research with members of our RDU community to ask them specific questions that has given us the confidence in our community's backing in pursuing this venture. Furthermore, the likelihood of no one turning up at Le Rodeo is very slim, considering the fact that RDU is known to be the place for food lovers.
Since 2017, we have been working with a turn key building company called ‘Bobbit Design Build’ to develop our unique concept. They have been in business for over 65 years. We have built a trusting relationship with them by meeting on a regular basis to discuss build out, site maps, and ways to be innovative, whilst remaining within budget. Thanks to their dedication and commitment to deliver our project in time, we gained tentative city approval for a previous property that we were aiming to purchase within months.
Our realtor that we have been working with for the past 6 months has also been excellent in negotiating with landlords on terms leading up to the first day of business (our official food truck hall opening day). These terms have worked in our favors with previous potentials to ensure that we do not pay any rent until we open our doors to our community.

With these risks and challenges being important to consider, we just need people to gather around us, believe in our vision, and give us a chance so that we can bring this amazing idea, in which we believe in to our Raleigh-Durham community.

story:
Birch and Boar Butchery

Birch and Boar Charcuterie & Provisions was founded by 5 friends who share a passion for good food, supporting and being a part of the local community, and creating uniquely delicious food items. After years of working on our craft we've decided to pursue our dream of selling the best local charcuterie, sausages, fresh cut meat, fermented mustards, and house cured pickles.  
We utilize traditional old world techniques of food preserving while adding bold modern flavours learned through years of trial and error.

Let's bring local 

Prince George would run out of food in 3 days or less in the event of a major highway closure (like we saw last year during the fires)

  • By supporting local you encourage our local farmers to expand and bring you more of what you crave.
  • We hope to inspire people to grow with the farm to table movement.
  • These funds will help us grow our shop and source better products for the community.

Current Progress

Currently we have a small booth at the Prince George Farmers Market, where every Saturday from 830am- 2pm you can visit us and see what new concoctions we came up with. We butcher, cure, marinade, and smoke all of our products out of Betulla Burning Pizzeria. Prep cooks are sometimes on top of each other, fridges and freezers are packed to the gills, no one can decide on what music to play, its panadmoneoum, but we love it.

  • The response we have received at the farmers market over the last year has been nothing less than overwhelming. The farmers market has welcomed us to be part of their close nit community. 
  • Our customer base has grown, we’re meeting more farmers from our region every week, and we’ve even teamed up with local brewery Trench brewery to offer beer tasting with a bacon curing class. We’re selling in some like minded businesses that have a passion for supporting local including Trench Brewery, Crossroads brewery, Ritual coffee house, and Northern Lights estate winery.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Opening a store is EXPENSIVE ! We need your help! But we do not want something for nothing. We have created some unique gifts that offer  tremendous value for people who put their faith in us. 
Available now for a limited time ! 
As Jerry McGuire says. . . help me, help you! 
Click the links on the side today and lets bridge the gap between local farmers and our community 

Lastly, Thank you from the bottom of our hearts Prince George ! Your true colors shine and we are forever grateful. We could not do this without you

story:
A Founder's Story...by Jason Rhodes

 

At the core of BOHEMiYUM...there’s a deep passion not only for popcorn but also for the ARTS.

I come from a very CREATIVE upbringing...my mother has always had a love for drawing and painting, and my father’s a musician. My parents were ARTISTIC, but they were pretty "HIPPIE" as well...and part of that lifestyle was living and eating in a nutrition-conscious way. One of our favorite snacks was popcorn...and we had some very CREATIVELY INSPIRED ways of flavoring it. Through the years, it’s remained my snack of choice, and I’ve continued to make and share this DELICIOUS POPCORN with friends and family time and time again.
 


Definition of the Arts:
A group of activities done by people with skill and imagination. Music, film, theater, dance, painting, sculpture, literature, etc...


Did you know ?……

Studies have shown that students who are exposed to education in the Arts, (especially at a young age)...benefit from improved motor skills, improved language skills, and improved social skills? 

Did you know ?……

When kids learn to play a musical instrument, it creates new connections between the hemispheres of the brain, which in turn, supports long-lasting improvements in listening and communication skills?

Unfortunately...there is a grim reality in how fragile these programs are in schools across the US. Sadly enough, funding for the Arts programs is usually one of the first things that get affected in public school spending. 

Coupled with the crippling effects of the pandemic and the newly implemented “distance learning”, these are unprecedented and unusual times for public schools and their already delicate education programs...especially in the Arts department.

BOHEMiYUM is on a mission. With every bag sold, a portion of proceeds goes to help keep these programs alive.
 

With your help, we can get this delicious popcorn into the market, onto store shelves, into your hands...AND, be able to be part of something bigger than us...something that can make a real difference in people’s lives.

We've worked tirelessly to get the company to where it's at right now.

We've (obsessively) fine-tuned our recipes, we've conducted required tests and have met all of our needed FDA and food safety standards, we've obtained several certifications (Whole Grain, Vegan (our salt flavor), Kosher/Kosher OU), we've meticulously designed and printed our packaging, and we've completed a small/trial production run.

Your contributions will help us take the next critical step...

A large scale production run.

We're ready, and we're anxious. We need to make a big push to get BOHEMiYUM into the marketplace. This takes product...lots of it! This will help us get onto store shelves, online, into your hands (and homes), and into schools! The more we can raise, the bigger the push we can make, and the more impact we can have on our mission.

We are incredibly humbled and grateful for your support. We believe in BOHEMiYUM Popcorn, and we believe in our mission. Your support means so much!
Thank you for taking the time to consider investing in us.

 

For your contribution, you'll not only receive a virtual hug (and a warm, fuzzy feeling inside)...but you can also receive some super cool items as well.

Whether it's a personal "Thank You" on our website, a BOHEMiYUM branded cloth face mask, a YUM-Box (filled with our delicious popcorn), a wooden easel and deluxe art kit, an electric guitar (from Jason's personal collection), or an invite to our fun-filled (virtual) Happy Hour Talent Show...there is something for everyone! Only interested in a contribution and don't want perks or products at this time? Well, that's an option too.
Please take a peek and check out the details on the different choices available.

 

​We're crazy about popcorn, inspired by all things creative, and deeply passionate about our mission...we hope you will be too!

The further we can expand into the market and share our delicious popcorn with all of you, the sooner we'll be able to make an ongoing impact on keeping Arts programs alive in our public schools. Join us in helping make this campaign as successful as possible!

 

These are unprecedented times for all of us. 

We realize that some of you may not be able to make a monetary contribution...but hopefully, you still believe in BOHEMiYUM. If you'd still like to help, please use the Indiegogo share option to share this campaign with anyone and everyone. Share away!

There is strength in numbers...so please help us get the word out! We know that together, we CAN make a difference.

Sincerely,
Jason Rhodes
Founder

Alexandra Shields
Co-Founder

BOHEMiYUM Popcorn

Sincerely,Jason RhodesFounder
Alexandra ShieldsCo-FounderBOHEMiYUM Popcorn

story:
Our team wants to bring a truly unique experience in the form of a first-ever interactive-design cafe, Q Cafe, to Seattle. Fused with the desire to bring high-quality coffee and fresh baking products, we want our customers to engage with the interior of the cafe - be it through the revelation of its secret doors or the lever mechanism that takes your order directly from the espresso bar on the first floor to the mezzanine. This project reflects our desire to pull people away from their phones, start thinking outside-of-the-box, and interact with the world around them. This is what we have done with our first project, Quest Factor Escape Rooms - the largest escape-room company in WA state.

With over four years of experience in creating immersive designs and interactive puzzles at Quest Factor, we can ensure that this element of Q Cafe will be top-notch.

In addition to engaging experiences, we want to bring high-quality baking products to our customers every day. This is why we partnered with local Chef Koulikova (From V With Love), who will not only treat you to everyday-fresh croissants, crepes, and sandwiches, but introduce the Seattleites and its visitors to the mesmerizing beauty of mirror-glazed desserts. 

 

Each cafe location will be built with a unique thematic design. The theme of the first Q Cafe will be the fusion of luxurious Victorian style and steampunk. It will be reflected from the space interior with bookshelves, gears, and tapestry to the steampunk-style desserts and thematically-dressed employees.

 

In November, we were able to secure a lease in a prime location in Capitol Hill with 3500 SQFT of gorgeous space with a spacious patio, mezzanine, and big floor-to-ceiling windows for our customers to enjoy Seattle's moody weather from the inside of the cafe.

 

· THIS IS WHERE WE NEED YOUR HELP TO REALIZE THIS DREAM ·

 

The total costs of this project are at about $300,000, which includes construction of the space with intricate design and immersive elements and bakery and coffee equipment. The initial goal of $130,000 will help us speed up the construction process and incorporate some puzzle elements to the interactive design of the cafe. 

However, raising over this goal would not only help us buy some essential bakery and coffee equipment, but allow us to run the initial months of the new business more smoothly as we will be building a stronger customer base.

 

To show you how much we appreciate your support for our campaign, we have prepared a variety of exciting perks, so everyone is bound to find something that is right for them. We have three different tiers (or levels) of rewards:

  • LEVEL #1: you can receive Q Cafe goodies. These include exciting merchandise such as long-sleeve shirts, beanies, and travel tumblers as well as vouchers for escape rooms and delicious coffee we will be serving at our location on Capitol Hill.
  • LEVEL #2: you can become one of the Q Cafe members by getting one of the five different levels of memberships that come with merchandise, escape room vouchers, and lifetime-long discounts at all of our Q Cafe locations.
  • LEVEL #3: you can get goodies from our pastry Chef Koulikova in the form of merchandise, mirror-glazed cakes, and classes with the Chef on how to make one of those jaw-dropping desserts.

· FIND THE RIGHT PERK FOR YOU ·

 

Learn more about our professional team of passionate individuals with unique ideas and strong goals. We are a team of immigrants who have moved to the United States at different points in our lives and all are truly grateful for the opportunities this country has provided us with - the opportunities of being self-made entrepreneurs and venture creators.

 

One of our main goals is to provide our customers with everyday-fresh products - no frozen prepackaged food that you tend to get at the majority of coffee shops. To do so, our Capitol Hill location will include an in-house bakery and we will be partnering with local farms to get organic produce for everything we will be producing at the cafe.

In addition, we are committed to the green culture of Washington state, so we will be using and restoring recycled furniture at all of our locations.

Lastly, we do not plan to stop on Capitol Hill. By helping us through this campaign, you help us get a start at a larger chain of fresh bakeries and interactive-design coffee shops over the Greater Seattle Area.

Our goal is to open Q Cafe at our existing escape room locations in UW-Seattle, South Lake Union, and Redmond and we are also looking to have shops in Edmonds, Sammamish, Issaquah, and New Castle areas.

 

In addition to exciting perks, we would like to offer additional stretch goals that would benefit all customers of Q Cafe. Raising $10,000 more over our initial goal of $130,000 would allow us to do the following:

  • STRETCH GOAL #1: incorporate an interactive element at Q Cafe that will have enough puzzles and challenges to keep a group of 2-4 people busy for 30 minutes
  • STRETCH GOAL #2: add moving "alive" portraits at the Capitol Hill location that are bound to get any Harry Potter fan excited
  • STRETCH GOAL #3: create an intricate mechanism of taking your prepared order from the ground floor to the mezzanine in a steampunk way.

 

The biggest challenge of this project is its high costs and the necessities of a large amount of funds to be available to complete. Your involvement in this campaign is truly appreciated by our team as it will allow us to incorporate our creative skills in this exciting experience.

Besides the challenge of the costs, our team is equipped with all the skills needed to make this project high in its quality.

 

The best way you can help besides donating to this campaign is sharing it with other amazing people who, you think, would be just as excited about it as you.

· This is why we decided to start a referral challenge to get you excited about spreading the word! ·

To do so, follow the simple steps and make sure you use your Indiegogo share tools:

At the end of the campaign, we will gift one of the five memberships to those whose Indiegogo share link was used the most to donate to our campaign. There will be a total of 5 winners of this Referral Challenge!

· Help us spread the word and get rewarded! ·
