STRETCH GOAL #3: create an intricate mechanism of taking your prepared order from the ground floor to the mezzanine in a steampunk way.


 


The biggest challenge of this project is its high costs and the necessities of a large amount of funds to be available to complete. Your involvement in this campaign is truly appreciated by our team as it will allow us to incorporate our creative skills in this exciting experience.
Besides the challenge of the costs, our team is equipped with all the skills needed to make this project high in its quality.

 


The best way you can help besides donating to this campaign is sharing it with other amazing people who, you think, would be just as excited about it as you.
· This is why we decided to start a referral challenge to get you excited about spreading the word! ·
To do so, follow the simple steps and make sure you use your Indiegogo share tools:

At the end of the campaign, we will gift one of the five memberships to those whose Indiegogo share link was used the most to donate to our campaign. There will be a total of 5 winners of this Referral Challenge!
· Help us spread the word and get rewarded! ·

story:
Short Summary

Hello,       



  My family and I are trying to start an ice cream company that everyone can enjoy, even those with food allergies. The thought of Goo-Goo and Alice’s Ice cream came when my youngest daughter was diagnosed with several allergies which would limit our going out to eat and the food choices at home. The name was developed by her older sister and herself.  Our family really enjoys ice cream but is very hard to get Ice cream she can eat without the risk.

  Goo-Goo & Alice’s Ice Cream was created for children, adults and families who suffer from food allergies.  We understand what a inconvenience it is to have to go through the stress and research of a product that is peanut and tree nut free and other allergens as well. There are so many ice cream manufactures out there.  However, none of their products are produced in a facility that is dedicated to producing a product that is 100% free of specific allergens.

  We want your family to be able to enjoy the traditional American way of having ice cream. Worry free.. We are in the process of expanding our flavors from the 4 most popular, but want to be 100% certain our product meets gourmet quality and most importantly 100% allergy friendly. So enjoy a scoop of our delicious ice cream the way it should be, worry free.


What We Need & What You Get..

Careful Production And  Quality Packaging Will Help Us Provide A Quality Product

Lets break it down folks in more detail:

Low Temp Kneading Freezer

Low temperature ice cream undergoes a cold kneading creating a finely structured ice cream with a smoother, creamier taste.

Hardening Tunnels

Hardening enables fast freezing, which achieves the desired ice cream texture by limiting the growth of ice crystals and air bubbles.

Homogenizers

 uncompromising food safety.

Mix units

mix preparation requirements of small to medium capacity ice cream producers. Units are equipped with all the components you need for the preparation of ice cream mix and are ready for immediate production.

These are parts of the production lines.


Large storage freezers

To store finished products , we could also lease a large refrigerated 40 ft trailer and keep it at bay for storage if needed.

Pallet Jack

To move finish product pallets and or materials

Tool Crib

Tools used in switching molds and reassembling components after sanitizing and repair.

Office equipment

Delivery truck

Website   


  As stated before this is not a turn key operation, but a start up company. So many components are needed and are not listed simply because there is too much to list. We have set our based goal based on need and if exceeded, we will be able to purchase production equipment on a larger scale.

The Impact

Did you know?

  Somewhere around 150 to 200 people die in the U.S. each year becauseof food allergies. It's estimated that around 50 percent to 62 percent of  those fatal cases of anaphylaxis were caused by peanut allergies.

All food allergies are  a very real problem with a potentially fatal reaction. Someone who suffers from a peanut allergy reaction requires immediate medical attention. There are not many nut free ice creams factories and resources are limited to those with a peanut and tree nut allergies. With limited resources we miss out on one of Americas past-times favorites, going out for ice cream. There are very few  products available in our area without concern of contamination , Sure we can go down the street to the local creamery and get a ice cream, however the scoop is used on pistaccio and maple walnut and they use nuts as topping. I feel as most do when our allergy concerns are presented, they are simply in such a rush to handle it 100% . Our  daughters came up with the idea of  Goo-Goo &  Alices Ice Cream. We never go out for Ice cream and have been making it at home now for some time. As a parent I would like to help them with this project and as a entrepuneur I would love to go on this adventure, but also help others  in doing so.  Providing a safe product for families is our goal.  There is a lot of potential in this industry when you consider those who are in need than those who just want. We simply just want everyone to enjoy...

Many products have a  may contain warning sometimes known as (advisory labelling) and are used by food companies where there is a risk of cross contamination during the production process. Advisory labelling is widespread and causes immense frustration to shoppers. It is helpful that all prepackaged food sold include direct statements. For those who have allergies, you might  find the label misleading or not as direct as it should be.  Our goal is to eliminate the confusion. Our Product will always have a peanut ,tree nut and gluten- free label along with a statement stating none of these products have ever been used or introduced into our facilities.

Risks & Challenges

Many companies have risks and challenges before them. Our challenge is Getting volumes of product out there for the consumer. Instead of using small machines to create small batches of ice cream, we want to use large ones, so we can distribute through out the country. We are choosing to setup our company near New Englands heart of transportation so we can access all the way down the east coast and across New York. Marketing and distribution is going to play a large part in the success  of GOO-GOO & Alice , but with key personnel in these key position this should come a lot easier than anticipated. These are not the only challenges that we will be taking on. We know how high the demand is for this product. We need to be FDA approved and be able to brand our product allergy safe. ( some companies are stating they are treenut free. These companies use Coconut, according to the FDA Coconut is a treenut  don't be mislead. My daughter is allergic to Coconut as well.) If our goal isn't reach we are still moving forward with this project. If our goal is exceeded than we have larger plans for Goo-Goo & Alice. We would love to open a ice cream shop at headquarters and several throughout the country. Let us enjoy the fun of going out for it.

Other Ways You Can Help

</a>

Discussing our product ideas would help immensely. This will help the campaign and success of Goo-Goo and Alices Ice Cream. We believe in paying it forward, and Goo-Goo and Alices Ice Cream wants to give back if we are successful. We plan on donating some of our proceeds to the following charities.

The Asthma and Allergy Foundation of America

Neurofibromatosis, Northeast

American Kidney Fund

American Diabetes Association







Here are images of our perks....


T-Shirt -$50 Donation

Tumbler $25 Donation

UPDATE:

Startup on the funding has been slow. But hopefully it will begin gaining speed. Thank you for those who have contributed so far. For those who cannot provide a financial contribution, we could use your help by spreading the word about our kick-starter. This would help out a lot.  Several people have asked, why is our goal is so high? Our response is simple; we want to be able to purchase the equipment and personnel to get our product distributed across the country. What if you don't reach the goal? The goal can be less, however this means slower turn around on product and limited distribution. If our is reached at least half way we can still get Goo Goo & Alice up and running. It will just take some time for us to be able reach out to everyone.

story:
Nate and 'Baby' need help, after being evicted just days before Christmas. 

My name is Marcia Crain.  My husband and I run Crain Ministries, a local non-profit that gives food out to people living on the streets.  We found Nate and 'Baby' trying to stay out of the cold wind on Christmas Day,  after being evicted from their apartment.  We need your help to help them get back on their feet.  

It was Christmas night (2014)  when Dan and I pulled into a convenience store for coffee. That's where we found Nate and his big-hearted furry companion 'Baby' sitting against the wall next to propane tanks.  Both were cold and both were hungry.

While I stepped inside and got Nate some hot coffee, my husband talked to Nate and scratched 'Baby' on the ears.   Then Dan told me we needed to get to a market - fast. 

We tried one market, and found it was closed. Then we tried two more - same thing.  The only store we found open was a 24-hour pharmacy.  We bought what we could there, then went home and grabbed everything we could from our cupboards (stuff that could be eaten without cooking it) and as much dog food as we had on hand.  

When we got back, we gave Nate and "Baby" the food, and right away 'Baby' was nosing into the bag with the kibble and bread, wagging her whole body!  

With "Baby" snug in her parka  (Nate had two coats, but 'Baby' was wearing the warmest one and a scarf) Nate told the rest of their story. 

He used to have an apartment that he shared with "Baby".  About a month ago he saw some people on the street and felt bad because the temperature was dropping, so he invited them to stay overnight in his living room.  The next morning, they refused to leave.  He explained that his landlord didn't allow anybody to live there but him and 'Baby', and that by helping them last night, he was taking a risk.  But it didn't matter, they refused to budge and became confrontational when he tried to force them to go.

It didn't take long for his landlord to find out and instead of listening to Nate's side, he just evicted him.  Now, Christmas Day, Nate and 'Baby' only had each other - huddled against the fierce cold - with nowhere to go. 

We want to help them get another apartment, a reliable cellphone for communication, resources for food and help finding work, but we need your help.

story:
Who are we?

We are a company founded on the possibility of vitality and health. Renee Faur is the founder and CEO of Renee’s Raw Chocolate, and she is here to invite all of humanity to contribute to this possibility.

Since age 11, Renee struggled with extreme bouts of depression, fatigue, and anxiety. After 20 years and without any relief from these issues, she decided to make a change. She refused prescription drugs and started down a path in search of a natural remedy. Renee found her answer in her food and began eating a plant based, raw diet. The unprocessed vitamins and nutrients from this diet helped Renee's body to heal itself. Her depression, fatigue, and anxiety completely disappeared. She became such a passionate believer in the raw food culture that she took the next step to completely immerse herself in the lifestyle. She became a certified raw food chef and started to create her own recipes. 

Most of us have a sweet tooth - raw foodists are no different. After deciding to eat raw, that doesn't change. Renee's favorite treat to get her fix was always chocolate, thus Renee's Raw Chocolate was born. As she perfected the recipe it slowly grew from an experiment in the kitchen to a staple in her family's home and eventually a loved and supported business within her community.

According to the World Health Organization (WHO) more than 350 million people suffer from depression world wide. Additionally, in 2008 WHO reported that more than one third of people around the globe aged 20+ are considered overweight or obese. In 2013, Mayo Clinic released a study that showed 70% of Americans are currently taking at least one prescription drug with at least 50% on at least two. These numbers show that our world is in a health crisis. We think it is time to start a health revolution.

It is our belief that we can inspire people to make healthy choices by providing them with a new kind of chocolate.  Our uncompromising dedication encourages all of humanity to strive for more rather than just survive with what they have.  We know that our passion can change lives and make a dent in changing the world.

What is raw food?

Raw foods are beneficial to the body because they contain all the enzymes and nutrients that nature intended. A food is classified as raw when it is not heated above 115 degrees Fahrenheit.

Why chocolate?

Because who doesn’t love chocolate? And the fact is that chocolate, in its raw and unprocessed form, is a superfood and truly something that can and should be eaten every day.

The main ingredient in all chocolate products is cacao. Cacao is the most antioxidant rich food on the planet. It also contains an incredible amount of compounds including: protein, fat, carbohydrates, fiber, iron, zinc, copper, sulfur, calcium and magnesium. In addition, it contains two chemicals produced naturally in the body while experiencing feelings of love and excitement, thereby increasing mood and decreasing depression.


What makes us different?

The unfortunate reality is that most mainstream chocolate is completely stripped of its natural goodness. It is infused with refined sugar, preservatives, and dairy, which actually leach the body of nutrients.

We guarantee that our chocolate contain only the highest quality, raw, and organic ingredients. Not only that, but we ensure that our raw materials come from fair trade and environmentally friendly farms.

We are different because we stand for your health and the health of the environment.


Why we need your help…

We are asking for $120,000 so that we can make our dream become a reality.

The money will go towards:

-Renting a space in The Fulton Carroll Center in Chicago, IL

-Building out a commercial kitchen

-Buying raw materials

Vision Statement: To bring happiness to the planet

Mission Satement: To inspire and transform every human being into an extraordinary life by providing them with the highest quality best tasting healthy raw chocolate ever.

“Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it’s the only thing that ever has.”- Margaret Mead

Sincerely,

  Renee Faur, CEO

  Donna Faur, COO

  Shauna Kase, VP of New Product Design

  Kelley Bode, VP of Marketing

story:
Short Summary

We are Channing & Stephanie Doss and over the past several years we have dreamed of opening our own local business, but we were handcuffed by our careers in corporate America. We decided we weren't going to allow a CEO who didn't even know our names to dictate the way we lived our lives, but rather that we owed it to our three beautiful daughters to build a business of our own that would accomplish three things: 1) Create a legacy for our children and their children; 2) Be an integral  part of the community and city it serves; 3) Provide a snack that everyone could enjoy without excluding those with food allergies/sensitivities or diet restrictions. With those goals as the foundation, we have created Popculture. A gourmet popcorn shop located in the heart of America in our hometown of Parkville, Mo. Popculture is a mix of old fashioned handmade popcorn made fresh daily on site paired with a modern focus on providing an organic and non-gmo popcorn seed in 60+ flavors handcrafted from scratch with  vegan, dye free and food allergy/sensitive offerings. Available in our store and online with nationwide shipping we strive to show all of our customers how passionate we are about popcorn!

What We Need & What You Get

We have the recipes, the passion and the space. Your generous investment will help us buy a 20 gallon commercial caramelizer,  2 cooling/sifting tables and outdoor commercial signage. $7,706.00 is the cost associated with the 20 gallon caramelizer and cooling table & the remaining $4,500.00 will be allocated for our commercial signage. Additionally, Indiegogo charges an 8% fee for using this crowdfunding platform.

Now on to the important stuff! We are extremely humbled and grateful for your consideration of Popculture as a business you would like to invest in. For your important contribution, we have come up with a list of amazing giving options, all of which feature our yummy POPCORN starting at just $5.00!!! Should your reward come with an awesome Popculture T-shirt, you can pick from the following sizes (S/M/L/XL/XXL/XXXL).

Popcorn - All rewards that include our Popculture popcorn will come in either Small (9 cups) or Medium (26 cups) individual bags.

Tins - Come with 56 cups of Popculture popcorn divided into 3 sections.

For single orders - you will be contacted a week prior to shipment to customize your order of assorted flavors.

For subscription orders, you will be contacted a week prior to shipment of your first order and at the beginning of each month thereafter to customize your Tin(s) or assorted flavors.

Our Flavors

ORIGINAL

BUTTERY * LOW SALT

CLASSIC

CARAMEL * EXTRA BUTTERY CARAMEL * SEA SALT CARAMEL * CHICAGO

EXTRA CHICAGO * CARAMEL APPLE * CARAMEL PECAN (w/ nuts)

SAVORY

CHEESE * EXTRA CHEESY * EXTRA BUTTERY * CHILI LIME * PARMESAN GARLIC * DILL PICKLE

SPICY BUFFALO * LOADED POTATO * JALAPENO RANCH * SALT & VINEGAR * RANCH    

        MAC & CHEESE * BACON CHEDDAR * WHITE CHEDDAR * SOUR CREAM & CHEDDAR  

         FRIED PICKLE * KETTLE * CINNAMON TOAST * BLUE CHEESE * COCONUT CURRY    

               SEA SALT & CRACKED PEPPER * PIZZA * WING NIGHT * BBQ

SPECIALTY

BANANA * GREEN APPLE * CHEESECAKE * CINNAMON * BLACKBERRY * STRAWBERRY

CHERRY * COTTON CANDY * COCONUT * DR. PEPPER * VANILLA * GRAPE

BLUEBERRY * ORANGE

LOCAL MIXES

PARKVILLE MIX (EXTRA CHEESY/CARAMEL) * PARK HILL (CHERRY/CHEESECAKE)

PARK HILL SOUTH (GRAPE/CHEESECAKE) * KANSAS CITY (BBQ & CHEDDAR)

COLUMBIA MIX (WHITE CHEDDAR/CARAMEL)

LAWRENCE MIX (CHERRY/BLUEBERRY/VANILLA) * MANHATTAN MIX (GRAPE/VANILLA)

LINCOLN MIX (CINNAMON/WHITE CHEDDAR) * BASEBALL MIX (BLUEBERRY/CHEESECAKE)

FOOTBALL MIX (EXTRA CHEESY/CARAMEL/CINNAMON

The Impact

We have the skill set and the ambition to operate a successful business, and with your help we will have an amazing new piece of equipment and awesome store signage to really propel our business from startup to success story.

We can't express the amount of gratitude we have for the people in our community and through social media that have stepped up to support, encourage and help us through this process. It really is amazing, the power of people helping people make their dreams a reality. 

Risks & Challenges

It's possible that the store can be delayed due to construction, but we have been assured by the property manager & contractor that everything is on track for construction to be completed by beginning - mid July.

Other than the lead times and construction - with your help and generousity Popculture will be open and serving the public by Aug 15, 2017!!!. As of this post going live - WE ARE UNDER CONSTRUCTION!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

We believe that not all investing has a dollar sign in front of it. If you are unable to contribute financially but would like to be a part of our project you can help us by spreading the word! Tweet, repost, email and SHARE this campaign with your network. We appreciate any and all giving...including just taking the time to send us your positive thoughts and best wishes.

Our email is info@popculturekc.com provided you have any questions about our business, crowdfunding campaign or rewards. 

You can also check us out @ www.popculturekc.com, Facebook @ Popculture Gourmet Popcorn and Instagram @popculturepopcorn.

Love, Laughter and Popcorn,

Channing and Steph <3
story_txt:
Short Summary
We are Channing & Stephanie Doss and over the past several years we have dreamed of opening our own local business, but we were handcuffed by our careers in corporate America. We decided we weren't going to allow a CEO who didn't even know our names to dictate the way we lived our lives, but rather that we owed it to our three beautiful daughters to build a business of our own that would accomplish three things: 1) Create a legacy for our children and their children; 2) Be an integral  part of the community and city it serves; 3) Provide a snack that everyone could enjoy without excluding those with food allergies/sensitivities or diet restrictions. With those goals as the foundation, we have created Popculture. A gourmet popcorn shop located in the heart of America in our hometown of Parkville, Mo. Popculture is a mix of old fashioned handmade popcorn made fresh daily on site paired with a modern focus on providing an organic and non-gmo popcorn seed in 60+ flavors handcrafted from scratch with  vegan, dye free and food allergy/sensitive offerings. Available in our store and online with nationwide shipping we strive to show all of our customers how passionate we are about popcorn!

What We Need & What You Get
We have the recipes, the passion and the space. Your generous investment will help us buy a 20 gallon commercial caramelizer,  2 cooling/sifting tables and outdoor commercial signage. $7,706.00 is the cost associated with the 20 gallon caramelizer and cooling table & the remaining $4,500.00 will be allocated for our commercial signage. Additionally, Indiegogo charges an 8% fee for using this crowdfunding platform.


Now on to the important stuff! We are extremely humbled and grateful for your consideration of Popculture as a business you would like to invest in. For your important contribution, we have come up with a list of amazing giving options, all of which feature our yummy POPCORN starting at just $5.00!!! Should your reward come with an awesome Popculture T-shirt, you can pick from the following sizes (S/M/L/XL/XXL/XXXL).
Popcorn - All rewards that include our Popculture popcorn will come in either Small (9 cups) or Medium (26 cups) individual bags.
Tins - Come with 56 cups of Popculture popcorn divided into 3 sections.
For single orders - you will be contacted a week prior to shipment to customize your order of assorted flavors.
For subscription orders, you will be contacted a week prior to shipment of your first order and at the beginning of each month thereafter to customize your Tin(s) or assorted flavors.
Our Flavors
ORIGINAL
BUTTERY * LOW SALT
CLASSIC
CARAMEL * EXTRA BUTTERY CARAMEL * SEA SALT CARAMEL * CHICAGO
EXTRA CHICAGO * CARAMEL APPLE * CARAMEL PECAN (w/ nuts)
SAVORY
CHEESE * EXTRA CHEESY * EXTRA BUTTERY * CHILI LIME * PARMESAN GARLIC * DILL PICKLE
SPICY BUFFALO * LOADED POTATO * JALAPENO RANCH * SALT & VINEGAR * RANCH    
        MAC & CHEESE * BACON CHEDDAR * WHITE CHEDDAR * SOUR CREAM & CHEDDAR  
         FRIED PICKLE * KETTLE * CINNAMON TOAST * BLUE CHEESE * COCONUT CURRY    
               SEA SALT & CRACKED PEPPER * PIZZA * WING NIGHT * BBQ
SPECIALTY
BANANA * GREEN APPLE * CHEESECAKE * CINNAMON * BLACKBERRY * STRAWBERRY
CHERRY * COTTON CANDY * COCONUT * DR. PEPPER * VANILLA * GRAPE
BLUEBERRY * ORANGE
LOCAL MIXES
PARKVILLE MIX (EXTRA CHEESY/CARAMEL) * PARK HILL (CHERRY/CHEESECAKE)
PARK HILL SOUTH (GRAPE/CHEESECAKE) * KANSAS CITY (BBQ & CHEDDAR)
COLUMBIA MIX (WHITE CHEDDAR/CARAMEL)
LAWRENCE MIX (CHERRY/BLUEBERRY/VANILLA) * MANHATTAN MIX (GRAPE/VANILLA)
LINCOLN MIX (CINNAMON/WHITE CHEDDAR) * BASEBALL MIX (BLUEBERRY/CHEESECAKE)
FOOTBALL MIX (EXTRA CHEESY/CARAMEL/CINNAMON

The Impact
We have the skill set and the ambition to operate a successful business, and with your help we will have an amazing new piece of equipment and awesome store signage to really propel our business from startup to success story.
We can't express the amount of gratitude we have for the people in our community and through social media that have stepped up to support, encourage and help us through this process. It really is amazing, the power of people helping people make their dreams a reality. 

Risks & Challenges
It's possible that the store can be delayed due to construction, but we have been assured by the property manager & contractor that everything is on track for construction to be completed by beginning - mid July.
Other than the lead times and construction - with your help and generousity Popculture will be open and serving the public by Aug 15, 2017!!!. As of this post going live - WE ARE UNDER CONSTRUCTION!!!


Other Ways You Can Help
We believe that not all investing has a dollar sign in front of it. If you are unable to contribute financially but would like to be a part of our project you can help us by spreading the word! Tweet, repost, email and SHARE this campaign with your network. We appreciate any and all giving...including just taking the time to send us your positive thoughts and best wishes.
Our email is info@popculturekc.com provided you have any questions about our business, crowdfunding campaign or rewards. 
You can also check us out @ www.popculturekc.com, Facebook @ Popculture Gourmet Popcorn and Instagram @popculturepopcorn.

Channing and Steph <3

story:
Short Summary

A little about us:

Pre-meadery days we were gardeners, birders, kayakers, cavers, cooks, and brewers. We love finding things from a garden that we can include in a brew. We LOVE to brew. If you know anyone who does brew you might have noticed their brewing setup fermenting away in their living room, basement or garage. It is with that same passion that we decided that we wanted to make this our life's work.

We love mead and we want others to love mead, too. In case you don't know what mead is: it is an alcoholic beverage made by fermenting the sugars out of honey (much the same way you would with grains for beer or apple juice for hard cider). So...We started a meadery. We won five medals (3 gold, a silver and a bronze) and got in over 90 stores across Massachusetts (and into 31 states through VinoShipper)! Yayay!

Here's Where We Are Now and How We Can Use Your Help to Get to the Next Level:

Now we have a new space. It has a tasting room. It needs a counter & a retail system. It also needs work. In addition, we need to upgrade a few things in our work room in order to help us increase capacity (gosh it would be swell to be able to fill more than a bottle at a time!) and bring you and our distributor MORE MEAD! $17,300 will get us there.

If you *really* like  our perks & we exceed our goal then maybe we can do more...

Please join us for this journey. Make a contribution, share the link with friends, read our updates, get excited with us, come to the tasting room when it's done, get a tour of the space and find out what else we have done!!

When will our perks be available? Our anticipated end date is early 2018. Get a perk for yourself and get one for a friend as a gift. These perks are the gifts that keep on giving, especially our year-long mead clubs.

Interested in helping but not finding a perk that blows your skirt up? You can still contribute (any amount) by clicking on the "back it" button on the top right side of the page. And sharing our campaign link (https://igg.me/at/housebearbrewing) to your friends, relatives, cohorts, dotdotdot, is also helpful.  Thanks for supporting craft!

 

DISCLAIMER: If you are contributing to a perk level that includes bottles of mead, like one of the clubs, and think you might want them shipped, please be sure to check Vinoshipper.com to make sure that alcohol shipments are legal in your state.  There is a list on the homepage that has all the states that Vinoshipper can legally have alcohol shipped to homes.  Currently there are over 30 states that allow it.  Shipping charges will apply through Vinoshipper.com. If you don't intend on having anything shipped, or you plan on assigning a trustee, then this will not apply to you; we would love to have you come in to the meadery!

story:
Campaign Summary

Pizza Paradise is a family run wood fired pizzeria on wheels, run by us.....Cindy and Oliver. We have been doing pop ups and parties around South Florida for the past 3 years. We have built a farm garden that supplies many of our herbs and veggies, and have met and fed many great people. We are now building a permanent home. 

We want to build a fun, creative space where we can work at our craft and make the best pizza possible. The community is an important part of this, and we want to create as many jobs as we can. This is not only achieved through the restaurant but through supporting other small farmers and businesses in the area.  

What We Need & What You Get

Ok so here it is, we are looking to raise $15000 to build a beautiful new wood fired oven. We have secured a location and need a little help to put in the oven. We have great gifts for all donors, large and small. We have brand new t shirts, pizza parties, chefs table dinners and of course pizza!!

If we don't reach our goal we will put everything into the oven anyway and put the rest on credit cards!!! We have already put a deposit on the oven and the space so its happening either way!!!

The Impact

When this project is up and running we will rescue South Florida residents from bad pizza, one pie at a time.

Risks & Challenges

Quality pizza drought!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate monetarily you can still lend a hand. By simply passing this campaign on to your friends and family you are helping considerably. Thanks............Trust the Crust!

story:
Summary

Perfect Serve is the UK's new premium bottled cocktail brand. Independently owned, we specialise in creating small batches of unique, high-quality classic cocktails – delivered to your home.

We never compromise on the quality of the ingredients. Our cocktails are hand blended and we only use the highest quality spirits. Wherever possible we like to use Fair Trade products, giving Perfect Serve cocktails a superior taste and a natural wholesome flavour – so much better than using artificial flavourings.

Perfect Serve cocktails have their own visual and taste twist, so each one is unique and Instagram worthy. We aim to deliver the same quality of cocktail that you would stumble upon in the world’s most famous bars.

 

What We Need

We are looking to raise £24,000 this round which will enable us to do the following: 

  • £8000 will cover our rent for one year in commercial premises that we have sourced. We need commercial premises to sell and distribute alcohol. Having this space will allow us to increase production, implement an intensive quality control process and give us the chance to experiment on further recipes. The premises we have identified are already within the catering industry and currently hold a 5* Food Hygiene Certificate which is ideal for us.
  • £2000 will be used for licensing applications and insurance.
  • £12,000 will be used for a social marketing campaign in order for us to raise awareness of the brand among our target audience. Our product is highly Instagrammable and we want to use this to our advantage as much as possible. 
  • £2000 will be used to purchase ingredients so that we can maintain a large stock of our cocktails. 

 

What has happened so far? 

We have sent samples to tasters and have received very positive feedback. We have also showcased our product at an exhibition in Chelsea where our cocktails were very well received by the guests and local restaurants.

 

What gaps do we fill?

Cocktails being delivered to homes around the UK is on the rise and is sure grow massively over the next few years, but currently it is a boom. We anticipate a strong demand for premium bottled cocktail products as measures are currently introduced within the pandemic with no foreseeable end in sight. Unfortunately, restaurants, bars and hotels are taking a massive hit in terms of losing staff, which will have a knock-on effect and potentially reduced the quality of products served. However, it is important for them to keep their standards up high. Our product allows for these areas to keep thriving. Furthermore, customers at home can safely enjoy cocktails where they may not have the knowledge, equipment or ingredients to create such cocktails. Restaurants and hotels can use our product to serve guests quickly and efficiently, as the cocktails are designed to have minimal experience needed but still maintain a high-quality product. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any help would be greatly appreciated in order to increase awareness of our brand. We encourage you all to follow our Instagram page: @PerfectServeOfficial Get talking to your friends who are enthusiastic about cocktails and get them talking! Share this funding campaign and like our social media posts – it all goes a long way.

 

Thank you for you coming and continuing support. 

Harry & Jumaane

Perfect Serve Team

story:
Management Team

The management team consists of me. I am an agricultural engineer with 25 years of experience.

Customer Problem

As a result of market surveys we conducted, 97% of the people who participated in our survey did not believe that the vegetable and fruit from the market were healthy. 
This «farmobile» solves the problem of doubt, gives the user confidence by producing healthy vegetables and fruits that people can comfortably put on their table ...

Products & Services

- Ensuring that the agricultural products purchased by the customer are not healthy 
- Introduce the customer who has a busy business and social life to nature and agriculture. 
-To enable customers who think that they can not get healthy food to grow organic products.

Target Market

The target customer segment will be those who live in the big cities and have a senior income group working in the plazas. This segment is a conscious consumer awareness of the importance of healthy eating and the need to reach a healthy diet. 
20/60 years of age women and men, 
High-income, 
Intensive social / business life 
Believing in the importance of healthy eating, 
Well educated, 
Families with children,

Business Model

Marketing strategy: 
Targeted healthy product highlighted TV and social media ads, 
Revenue Streams: 
With the membership method, monthly rentals per selected parcel and advance payment with service fee ...

Customer Segments

- 20/60 years 
- High income earner 
- Higher education level 
- Woman man 
- Possibly children with children 
- People who take care to live well and have the necessary knowledge 
- Individuals struggling to reach organic products and paying attention to what they eat 
- People who use social media frequently and interact with their environment

Sales & Marketing Strategy

The advertisements for the customer segment and organic products will be sold in the foreground. 
In order to satisfy customer satisfaction, the product will be carefully cultivated and delivered on time. Customer feedback will be taken into consideration. 
The customer will be 20% discounted on the prices of the next year and various gifts will be given for continuing the production. 
The importance of healthy products will often be highlighted.

Competitors

Our prospective competitors will be e-commerce stewards who sell organic agricultural products. However, we can not say that we are in the same segment because we are going to make special production. These are our closest competitors.

Competitive Advantage

A breeding form in which the client follows the production process and is instructed is not yet implemented by anyone. This application is unique in the global sense.are

story:
Short Summary

We are looking to expand our offerings to include mail order and shipping of our Glatt Kosher BBQ to your doorstep. In order to do this, we will need to add a second pit to increase production, as well as purchase additional items needed for shipping such as freezer packs, styrofoam coolers, and a commercial-grade cryovac sealer and bags.

As this is a passion project, fueled by my desire to raise funds for charities I support, and not a full-time retail operation, I could use your help raising the needed funds to expand the business. 

It is out of this desire to make the BBQ more accessible, raising additional funds for the charities we support, that we are looking to expand. With your help, we can Repair The World One Bite at a Time.

What We Need

Here's a breakdown for how the desired funds will be used:

  • Pitmaker Magnum Sniper Trailer.....$11,000
  • Screening in for the trailer................$5,000
  • Shipping materials............................$1,500
  • Campaign Fulfillment/Fees..............$7,500

If We Exceed Our Goal

If we successfully raise more than $25,000 we will use the additional funding to pay off existing business debt. But, if lightning strikes and we raise substantially more than our goal ($75,000+) we will use those funds to create a more permanent presence in the Houston market.

Other Ways You Can Help

If after seeing this campaign, you are not interested in supporting us financially, please help us get the word out of this campaign by posting it to your social media channels, and telling others. With your help, we can successfully raise the needed funds for expansion.

story:
Philip Gelb is a vegan chef with his own catering business, "Sound and Savor". He has been hosting an underground restaurant series for 11 years, often with world famous musicians performing live in a very intimate setting. This is is his second cookbook of his own recipes.

The books help others demystify world cuisines, helping them produce amazing food in their own homes.  Contributors have the option of books for perks as well as book release parties with live music and gourmet cuisine.

I need a few thousand more dollars to self publish the book. The wonderful photographer and famous food blogger, Hannah Kaminsky is doing photos for the book, adding a higher grade of visuals that the first book was lacking.  Funds raised are used to pay my editor, designer, photographer, as well as the cost of printing the book and mailings.

story:
Summary

So we saw them, we fell in love! We wanted them! We wanted lots of them! And we wanted them fast!!

Floating Cat Marshmallows - an absolute must have surely!!?

We were left disappointed! - as with all the latest fun and on trend products - they aren't yet available in the UK - booooooo!!!

We cuddled our cats and cried a little...no cute cat marshmallows for us!

BUT - we are pretty stubborn and just couldn't stop there! So we decided to make some! And what a journey that was!

The journey so far...

After many attempts (about 150!) and a handful of moulds we finally found what works. 

We learnt that the mixture could be too sticky, not sticky enough, didn't taste sweet enough, didn't melt in the hot drink, wouldn't come out of the mould, didn't look anything like a cat!

But eventually we got there and got very excited!!

Our poor family and friends have tried and tested more CatMallows than i count! Sorry everyone!

Then we thought, if we were so pleased with our squishy delightful CatMallows, then surely cat lovers across the UK would share in our excitement!?

Could we sell them? How would we make them in volume? 

So we set about finding out!....

What next?

We can make them in volume, we have found the factory, refined the recipe and looked at costs for moulds and production - but as with anything we need an initial order volume to get started!

So here we are....

Calling all cat lovers (or marshallow lovers!) across the UK...

Get your CatMallows ordered and be one of the first to have them in the UK. 

Catify your hot drinks, icecreams, cakes, dinner parties, events, weddings and more...

Treat yourself or what better present is there for the cat lover in your life?

Our first batch will be dispatched at the end of April 2017 ~(as long as we reach the goal)  - they are boxed and have a minimum shelf life of 2 months.

Ideally we wanted these to be delivered by rescue cats but we will work on that next.....

What are they made from?

Our marshmallow recipe is top secret but does contain the following:

Icing sugar, egg white, corn flour, water, corn syrup, gelatine, lemon juice, 
Glucose-fructose syrup, dextrose, acidulant: lactic acid, vanilla flavouring. colouring may contain all or some of the following: water, humectant E442, E102, E122, E133, acidifier E330, preservative E202.

They are gluten free. but they aren't suitable for vegetarians 

We also cannot at this stage guarantee that the factory is completely free from nut products.

Who are we?

Who are we? What do we know right?

Are we just crazy cat ladies? Well yes but don't hold that against us! 

We are Caroline and Claire, Caroline has worked in Marketing (Senior Levels) for the last 15 years and now runs her own marketing consultancy business and Claire has been a Teacher for over 15 years focusing where possible on the arts. Do we know anything about marshmallows? No - but we've learnt ALOT over the last few months!

Obviously we love cats and marshmallows but as mums we have learnt to try anything once! 

The challenges

Honestly – It’s all a challenge! BUT we like challenges and love our CatMallows!!

It’s a massive task but with your help and backing I am sure we can do this. If we don't get funding -our poor friends and family will just have to keep enjoying our squishy floating friends!!

Share Share Share...

If you can't help or can't afford any just yet, thank you for reading!

Would be hugely appreciated if you could share my campaign and encourage others to buy them! 

Just follow the links...

If you can support in other ways other than financially then I'm also happy to hear from you!! 

If you'd like a much larger order then please get in touch directly.

Thank you and Meow!!

www.squishydelights.co.uk

story:
Here's how to get rewarded for helping us finish our taproom

We're not looking for a handout.

Far from it.

And we're not asking you to pick up a hammer or paint roller either. 

All we're asking you to do is contribute on this page.

And for this for this, you'll get some limited edition perks, your first beer free when we open in July and public recognition in our brewery taproom (if you want it) that you can show off /brag to friends and family.

Yep. You'll always have a place that you can go to and say "Look, that's me up there" and know that you helped finish the taproom that you're sitting in enjoying one of our out-of-this-world brews.

Pretty cool, eh?

No matter what you contribute (even if you just share this page on Facebook), know that each one of our perks comes with something we can never give you enough of: Our Gratitude. 

We are truly grateful to everyone who has helped us achieve this dream.  Even though we are primarily self-funded, these ventures take a lot more than money to be a success (although money is a big part of it, so please contribute!). 

We could not have done this without the encouragement and helping hands from our friends and family, and we hope that you will be a part of that too. 

Why are we different and why should you help?

If you're looking for "another brewery", we're not it. 

There are too many breweries in Orlando to just open another one. 

We saw what all the other breweries we're doing and decided to do things a bit different. 

How?

First, we're going to be the only brewery and homebrew shop in Orlando. Jeremy Pittman, the owner of Orlando Homebrew Supplies is also the one of the owners of Rockpit Brewing. 

He's moving his shop from Curry Ford Rd into our new 5,000 SQ FT location at 10 W Illiana St, Orlando, FL when we open there in July.

 
(This is Jeremy)

That means if you want to learn how to brew the beer you'll enjoy in our taproom, you can walk 10 steps to the shop and learn how to make it.

Second... We're the only brewery in Orlando that has a theme based on one of the owners  unusually unique and weird family heritage. Brutal family feuds, mountain moonshine and West Virginia coal mining? Yeah... That's Jeremy's heritage. (See the story below) 

Third... We're building almost everything in the brewery by hand. We obviously can't do some of the work that specialists are needed for like plumbing and commercial electric. 

But just about everything else... The bar, the half-walls, the tables are all going to be hand-crafted by us. That means that you'll see stuff in our brewery you'll never find anywhere in the world. 

Four... We'll have both super weird AND run-of-the-mill offerings.

Our specialty will be stretching the bounds of normal craft beer creations for our craft beer enthusiasts (that's you, right?) while also serving those who are just looking for a "good beer".

This means we'll have all sorts of the weird stuff like "Pineapple Milkshake New England Double IPA", "Jalapeno Cream Ale", "Horchata Ale", "Lime Gose with Gin soaked oak chips", "Carolina Reaper IPA", "Cucumber Brown Sugar Lager" and well.. You get the idea...


(Just one of our weird creations)

... but we'll also have more mainstream options like Stouts, Porters, Pale Ales, IPA's, Cream Ales and even stuff the "mass-marketed light beer lovers" in your life will like. 

If you don't find something you like in our brewery, we'll walk next door to ABC and buy you a beer you do like. 

Finally... The reason we need your help. 

We're self-funded. 

We're four guys who came together and scraped up the funds to get started and then got a loan to help fund the project. 

However, opening a brewery comes with a hefty price tag.  Because we have done this all on our own (to this point) through our savings and a small business loan, we are left with a longer list of necessities than we have cash to support.  We hope that any of you that are passionate about beer and pushing the limits of what is available in your community will consider becoming a supporter of this special cause.  We are a brewery for the community with intention of being a platform for advocacy, fundraising (non-profit), collaboration and education.

And for that, you'll get recognition and cool perks from our brewery. All you need to do is choose a perk and contribute. 

Easy enough, right?

So go grab a perk now!

Who is Rockpit Brewing and how did we get started?

Hi there, I’m Jeremy Pittman. I own and operate Orlando Homebrew Supplies and am the President of Rockpit Brewing.

The following is the tangled web of a story about how Rockpit Brewing came to life and how we're going to do everything we can to turn an old SODO warehouse into a craft beer haven. 

------

“You think I could add a brewery here?”

My cousin, Chris Rock (no, not that one), looked around my shop for a second and something to the effect of…


(This isn't Chris either)

He was right. My building wasn’t big enough to add a brewery.

In December 2015, I opened my small homebrew shop on the corner of Bumby Rd and Curry Ford Rd. 

I started Orlando Homebrew Supplies after deciding that I had enough of being an employee. I spent 8 long and stress-filled years as a commercial property appraiser over in Tampa.

It’s not that I hated my job, I just had co-workers that led me to consume mass amounts of the beer I was homebrewing.

Maybe you can relate...

After those 8 years of horror, owning my shop has been nothing short of amazing. My customers are undeniably cool, they always bring me beer to sample and love hanging out at the shop with me.

I now get to spend my days talking about beer, making beer and trying tons of amazing beer that my customers make.

Even with all that, early in 2017, I felt like something was missing.

You see… I originally put together a business plan to open a brewery and homebrew shop under one roof.

After looking at the investment needed to open a brewery and the fact that I was going to be a one-man shop for a while, trying to run two completely different businesses just wasn’t in the cards at the time.

That all changed when I ask Chris if he'd want to partner up with me and run the marketing for the brewery.

He thought about it for a few seconds and “Oh heck yeah!”

We looked at each and said:

We knew that something special was brewing (pun intended).

Yeah, but what does "Rockpit" mean?

“What are you going to name the brewery?” Chris asked me.

“No clue” I replied.

For about 5 minutes we went through names.

Sandcastle Brewing. Nope…

Curry Ford Brewing. Nope…

Eola Brewing. Nope…

Flying Space Monkey Brewing…. WTF?? Nope!!!

Then Chris jokingly said “Why don’t we call it Rockpit Brewing. Like our last names?”

I sat there for a few seconds and said “You know what… That’s not bad at all”

Chris replied “I was just kidding”

I said “No… I think that might be it”.

And like that, we officially had a name for our brewery and we were pretty proud of 5 minutes of work.


(re-enactment of our actual chest bump)

The weird and historic way we came up with the theme for our brewery

I always heard crazy stories about my family history.

I knew my mom and grandfather were from Kentucky. I also heard stories has a kid about some kind of family feud where people actually we're killed over a pig. 

Wait, what?

Yeah... turns out, I'm a direct descendant of Anderson "Preacher Anse" Hatfield. Who's that?

Do you remember the show "Hatfields and McCoys"? It was a mini-series on the History channel that showed the brutal feud in the mountains of Kentucky and West Virginia between the Hatfield and McCoy families.

That's the feud my family kept talking about as a kid. It was so brutal they actually created a whole mini-series about it. 

Crazy, right?

My great, great, great, great, great grandfather Preacher Anse Hatfield was the local justice of the peace that presided over "The Hog Trial" which essentially started the feud. 

My grandfather, Homer Little (you'll see his picture in our brewery), spent his childhood in the mountains of West Virginia and Kentucky. 

His favorite hobby? Making moonshine with this grandpa and dad. It's only natural that I love to brew beer with a history of moonshining in my blood. 

After school, he spent a good chunk of his days as a young man working the coal mines for the Red Jacket Coal Company in West Virginia before they shut down in the 1950's. After they shut down, he left the mountains behind and moved to Orlando.

So to say my family history is deeply entrenched into the folklore of the Kentucky and West Virginia mountains is an understatement. 

When you look at our logo again, you'll see how we worked this history into it. 

How we convinced two other people crazy enough to start a brewery with us. 

Even though I’m good at cranking out tasty beer and Chris is a wiz at marketing and technology, we knew after a few months there was no way that we could get this brewery up and running by ourselves. Not with our busy schedules. 

We needed a rock star to help run this place. Someone who's "been there, done that"

That's when Chris introduced me to the third member of the wolf-pack: Sean Burke

Sean was (still is) a very good friend of Chris and local business consultant. 

Whenever he's involved with a project, everything flows effortlessly and the business runs like a well-oiled machine. 

More important was something Sean said to Chris 10 years ago... 

Long before Chris was a craft beer consumer (circa 2007), Sean invited Chris to his house for an evening of education.

The subject? "How to brew beer at home and stop drinking mass-marketed light beers"

Sean showed Chris how easy it was to brew 5 gallons of beer right on your stovetop (using extract) and how good the beer you make at home can be. 

By the end of the night (and after a few homebrews), Sean confessed to Chris that he wanted to someday open a brewery.

He didn't know how or when, just that it was going to happen. 

Well... Here we are 10 years later and he's opening a brewery with the same guy he first confessed his dream to. 

Weird how that works, eh?

But there was still a missing piece. One that could only be filled by a very persistent customer and good friend of mine who kept offering his services if I ever decided to open a brewery.

He had a particular set of skills. Skills that would useful for someone building a brewery (he's an Engineer!) His name? Ed Clark.


(not an actual pic of Ed, but he did keep calling me like this)

With the core group of guys in place and the permission of all our wives, Rockpit Brewing was officially formed as an LLC and we set out on this crazy journey of bringing a kick-ass brewery to life.


(Jeremy Pittman, Chris Rock, our AWESOME landlord Tony, Sean Burke and Ed Clarke in front of our building we're revitalizing)

The answer to those questions are "SODO District near the corner of Michigan and Orange", "5000 SQ FT" and "July 2018"

We get the following questions quite a bit when we're at brewfests or talking to people about the brewery:

  1. When are you opening?
  2. How big is your new place?
  3. Where are you located?

Here's the answers...

After a few failed attempts to secure a building, we finally lucked into a building near the corner of Michigan and Orange Ave in the SODO district in Orlando. We're right behind Cecil's BBQ on Orange Ave.

It’s a huge, 5000 SQ FT warehouse (that's at least three times as big as the old building, Zoolander) that will host my homebrew shop, a taproom and brewery all under one roof.

Here are the latest plans.

Our projected open date is July 2018 which means we’re only a few months away from bringing you the concept I only dreamed about a few years ago.

It’s going to be a place where you can sit and relax with friends and enjoy some of the most delectable and anomalous (that means strange) beers you’ll ever have.

Our head-brewer Danny Diaz is a beer making genius. The recipes he comes up with are out of this world. 

Believe me... When you try the beers that Danny makes, you're going to have one of those "Holy crap this is good" moments. 

We hope to see you when we open July 2018!

 

Perks, Explained...

Flat Swag Pack...

This is pretty much everything we could think of that would fit in an envelope and probably make it to your address with a single stamp.  Fingers crossed!

Sticker ->        Coaster ->  

 

16 oz. Pint Glass...

Seems kind of redundant and obvious, right?  16 ounces = 1 pint, and it is made out of glass.  The cool thing is that we won't ever make them like this again, so it is bound to be worth something at some point.  To someone.  Somewhere.  Maybe?  Just kidding - you better take care of this little gem, it will serve you well in the future!

 

T-Shirt (*** You'll be emailed for size, style and color after donating ***)

This was a common garb worn by the "cool people" in the 20th and 21st centuries on planet Earth.  At least that is how we think it will be described in the future after enlightened people have decided that clothing is irrelevant - since all anyone cares about is beer.

These t-shirts will include a never-to-be-printed-again "Launch Crew" inscription that will let us know you were here for us before we opened. 

And that comes with perks that you'll only know about when you wear the t-shirt into the brewery. 

Printed by our friends LR Printing in Orange City, FL (https://www.lr-printing.com/)

Mens Next Level 60/40 Blend. All colors available in S-3XL. Available with both our tagline "Adamantly Anomalous Ales" or "Orlando - Florida" on the bottom of the logo.

Both large and small logos available.

 

Mens colors available

Womens T-Shirts

Next Level Ladies' Triblend Scoop (50% polyester/25% combed ringspun cotton/25% rayon jersey. Printed by our friends LR Printing in Orange City, FL (https://www.lr-printing.com/)

All colors available in S-3XL. Available with both our tagline "Adamantly Anomalous Ales" or "Orlando - Florida" on the bottom of the logo.

Womens t-shirt colors

You'll receive an email after your contribution for size and color. 

Chill out...

30 oz Rtic Tumbler with Laser Etched RockPit Brewing Logo.  Created by our friends Oviedo Laser Arts (http://www.oviedolaserarts.net/) in Oviedo, FL

Available in Silver, Black, Teal, Blue and Pink

 

Beer Snob School...

This is a seriously entertaining power session with some of the most knowledgeable people we know who know about beer... you know? 

 

RockPit Mug Club with 20 oz. Mason Jar Mug...

Do this, and you are in the gang.  Well, it's more like a group.   Actually just think of it as a fairly unrelated diverse population who may or may not know each other, yet are loosely affiliated by the random fact that you all can get a great deal on great beer, in a limited edition mug.

 

Keggers Can Be Choosers...

A half-barrel keg is the last stop on our beer's journey before it is served to a satisfied customer. We will honor your contribution by emblazing your name (or 21 characters of your choosing) on the side of one of these noble vessels. You won't own the keg, just the naming rights.  We will contact you by email to finalize what will be put on the keg.  Take comfort knowing that you will forever be an important part of our brewing process.

 

Attitude Of Gratitude...

Looking for a place to hold your charity event or company party? We have you covered, literally. Let us host your event under our roof! There is no better place to relax, unwind, and give (craft beer drinkers are very charitable).

 

The Best Day of Your Life...

What if every day could be better than all the others before it?  We believe it is possible, with the right attitude.  Let us help you get there, with beer!  On each and every visit to our Taproom, your first beer of the day is on us.  Forever.  But wait, there's more:  that beer will be served in your very own personalized Limited Edition Beer Glass kept on-site in a special case.

 

It's Your Call...

Fermenting tanks are where the magic of brewing really gets interesting.  For your contribution, you get everything in "The Best Day Of Your Life" offer and you will be immortalized in the Brewery for eternity (or sooner) with your very own named Fermenter. No, you won't own the vessel, but you will own the naming rights to it. We will contact you by email to finalize what will be put on the plaque that will be mounted on the fermenter.

 

 

Risks and Challenges...

Right now the biggest risk we have to hit our target open date is that the property improvements are not within our control.  We are taking a 5,000 square foot building and completely repurposing it.  Permitting is going well, but you can never be too sure about what can go wrong on a construction job.  We have a great General Contractor and a great team of professional craftsmen that are some of the best in their respective lines of work.   But sometimes stuff happens, and with the aggressive timelines that we are pushing for, one setback could impact a lot of other parts of the project.  

We are confident that we have a solid plan in place and can handle any curveballs that come our way.  We have lots of help - from people just like you - so there is no shortage of creativity, ingenuity, passion, and assistance of all kinds.

 

Other Ways You Can Help...

Whether you do or don't make a financial contribution for our startup, there are still plenty of ways we could use your help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.  Follow us on social media to keep up to date on what's going on with the project. 
  • We do lots of events, so come see us at any (or all) of the outdoor brew-fests in Central Florida!  We will have samples of your favorite RockPit Recipes, and probably a few new concoctions too.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and get your friends to help out!

I also heard stories has a kid about some kind of family feud where people actually we're killed over a pig. Wait, what?Yeah... turns out, I'm a direct descendant of Anderson "Preacher Anse" Hatfield. Who's that?Do you remember the show "Hatfields and McCoys"? It was a mini-series on the History channel that showed the brutal feud in the mountains of Kentucky and West Virginia between the Hatfield and McCoy families.That's the feud my family kept talking about as a kid. It was so brutal they actually created a whole mini-series about it. Crazy, right?My great, great, great, great, great grandfather Preacher Anse Hatfield was the local justice of the peace that presided over "The Hog Trial" which essentially started the feud. My grandfather, Homer Little (you'll see his picture in our brewery), spent his childhood in the mountains of West Virginia and Kentucky. His favorite hobby? Making moonshine with this grandpa and dad. It's only natural that I love to brew beer with a history of moonshining in my blood. After school, he spent a good chunk of his days as a young man working the coal mines for the Red Jacket Coal Company in West Virginia before they shut down in the 1950's. After they shut down, he left the mountains behind and moved to Orlando.So to say my family history is deeply entrenched into the folklore of the Kentucky and West Virginia mountains is an understatement. When you look at our logo again, you'll see how we worked this history into it. How we convinced two other people crazy enough to start a brewery with us. Even though I’m good at cranking out tasty beer and Chris is a wiz at marketing and technology, we knew after a few months there was no way that we could get this brewery up and running by ourselves. Not with our busy schedules. We needed a rock star to help run this place. Someone who's "been there, done that"That's when Chris introduced me to the third member of the wolf-pack: Sean BurkeSean was (still is) a very good friend of Chris and local business consultant. Whenever he's involved with a project, everything flows effortlessly and the business runs like a well-oiled machine. More important was something Sean said to Chris 10 years ago... Long before Chris was a craft beer consumer (circa 2007), Sean invited Chris to his house for an evening of education.The subject? "How to brew beer at home and stop drinking mass-marketed light beers"Sean showed Chris how easy it was to brew 5 gallons of beer right on your stovetop (using extract) and how good the beer you make at home can be. By the end of the night (and after a few homebrews), Sean confessed to Chris that he wanted to someday open a brewery.He didn't know how or when, just that it was going to happen. Well... Here we are 10 years later and he's opening a brewery with the same guy he first confessed his dream to. Weird how that works, eh?But there was still a missing piece. One that could only be filled by a very persistent customer and good friend of mine who kept offering his services if I ever decided to open a brewery.He had a particular set of skills. Skills that would useful for someone building a brewery (he's an Engineer!) His name? Ed Clark.(not an actual pic of Ed, but he did keep calling me like this)With the core group of guys in place and the permission of all our wives, Rockpit Brewing was officially formed as an LLC and we set out on this crazy journey of bringing a kick-ass brewery to life.(Jeremy Pittman, Chris Rock, our AWESOME landlord Tony, Sean Burke and Ed Clarke in front of our building we're revitalizing)The answer to those questions are "SODO District near the corner of Michigan and Orange", "5000 SQ FT" and "July 2018"We get the following questions quite a bit when we're at brewfests or talking to people about the brewery:
When are you opening?
How big is your new place?
Where are you located?
Here's the answers...After a few failed attempts to secure a building, we finally lucked into a building near the corner of Michigan and Orange Ave in the SODO district in Orlando. We're right behind Cecil's BBQ on Orange Ave.It’s a huge, 5000 SQ FT warehouse (that's at least three times as big as the old building, Zoolander) that will host my homebrew shop, a taproom and brewery all under one roof.Here are the latest plans.Our projected open date is July 2018 which means we’re only a few months away from bringing you the concept I only dreamed about a few years ago.It’s going to be a place where you can sit and relax with friends and enjoy some of the most delectable and anomalous (that means strange) beers you’ll ever have.Our head-brewer Danny Diaz is a beer making genius. The recipes he comes up with are out of this world. Believe me... When you try the beers that Danny makes, you're going to have one of those "Holy crap this is good" moments. We hope to see you when we open July 2018! Perks, Explained...Flat Swag Pack...This is pretty much everything we could think of that would fit in an envelope and probably make it to your address with a single stamp.  Fingers crossed!Sticker ->        Coaster ->   16 oz. Pint Glass...Seems kind of redundant and obvious, right?  16 ounces = 1 pint, and it is made out of glass.  The cool thing is that we won't ever make them like this again, so it is bound to be worth something at some point.  To someone.  Somewhere.  Maybe?  Just kidding - you better take care of this little gem, it will serve you well in the future! T-Shirt (*** You'll be emailed for size, style and color after donating ***)This was a common garb worn by the "cool people" in the 20th and 21st centuries on planet Earth.  At least that is how we think it will be described in the future after enlightened people have decided that clothing is irrelevant - since all anyone cares about is beer.These t-shirts will include a never-to-be-printed-again "Launch Crew" inscription that will let us know you were here for us before we opened. And that comes with perks that you'll only know about when you wear the t-shirt into the brewery. Printed by our friends LR Printing in Orange City, FL (https://www.lr-printing.com/)Mens Next Level 60/40 Blend. All colors available in S-3XL. Available with both our tagline "Adamantly Anomalous Ales" or "Orlando - Florida" on the bottom of the logo.Both large and small logos available. Mens colors availableWomens T-Shirts Next Level Ladies' Triblend Scoop (50% polyester/25% combed ringspun cotton/25% rayon jersey. Printed by our friends LR Printing in Orange City, FL (https://www.lr-printing.com/)All colors available in S-3XL. Available with both our tagline "Adamantly Anomalous Ales" or "Orlando - Florida" on the bottom of the logo.Womens t-shirt colorsYou'll receive an email after your contribution for size and color. Chill out...30 oz Rtic Tumbler with Laser Etched RockPit Brewing Logo.  Created by our friends Oviedo Laser Arts (http://www.oviedolaserarts.net/) in Oviedo, FLAvailable in Silver, Black, Teal, Blue and Pink Beer Snob School...This is a seriously entertaining power session with some of the most knowledgeable people we know who know about beer... you know?  RockPit Mug Club with 20 oz. Mason Jar Mug...Do this, and you are in the gang.  Well, it's more like a group.   Actually just think of it as a fairly unrelated diverse population who may or may not know each other, yet are loosely affiliated by the random fact that you all can get a great deal on great beer, in a limited edition mug. Keggers Can Be Choosers...A half-barrel keg is the last stop on our beer's journey before it is served to a satisfied customer. We will honor your contribution by emblazing your name (or 21 characters of your choosing) on the side of one of these noble vessels. You won't own the keg, just the naming rights.  We will contact you by email to finalize what will be put on the keg.  Take comfort knowing that you will forever be an important part of our brewing process. Attitude Of Gratitude...Looking for a place to hold your charity event or company party? We have you covered, literally. Let us host your event under our roof! There is no better place to relax, unwind, and give (craft beer drinkers are very charitable). The Best Day of Your Life...What if every day could be better than all the others before it?  We believe it is possible, with the right attitude.  Let us help you get there, with beer!  On each and every visit to our Taproom, your first beer of the day is on us.  Forever.  But wait, there's more:  that beer will be served in your very own personalized Limited Edition Beer Glass kept on-site in a special case. It's Your Call...Fermenting tanks are where the magic of brewing really gets interesting.  For your contribution, you get everything in "The Best Day Of Your Life" offer and you will be immortalized in the Brewery for eternity (or sooner) with your very own named Fermenter. No, you won't own the vessel, but you will own the naming rights to it. We will contact you by email to finalize what will be put on the plaque that will be mounted on the fermenter.  Risks and Challenges...Right now the biggest risk we have to hit our target open date is that the property improvements are not within our control.  We are taking a 5,000 square foot building and completely repurposing it.  Permitting is going well, but you can never be too sure about what can go wrong on a construction job.  We have a great General Contractor and a great team of professional craftsmen that are some of the best in their respective lines of work.   But sometimes stuff happens, and with the aggressive timelines that we are pushing for, one setback could impact a lot of other parts of the project.  We are confident that we have a solid plan in place and can handle any curveballs that come our way.  We have lots of help - from people just like you - so there is no shortage of creativity, ingenuity, passion, and assistance of all kinds. Other Ways You Can Help...Whether you do or don't make a financial contribution for our startup, there are still plenty of ways we could use your help:
Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.  Follow us on social media to keep up to date on what's going on with the project. 
We do lots of events, so come see us at any (or all) of the outdoor brew-fests in Central Florida!  We will have samples of your favorite RockPit Recipes, and probably a few new concoctions too.
Use the Indiegogo share tools and get your friends to help out!

story:
We need to fix the way we relate to food. Even if our time for preparing meals is limited, we want to adopt healthier eating habits and have as much information about what we eat as possible.

At Suvoi, we believe there is a new way that blends pleasure, convenience and transparency in an awesome way!

  • Pleasure. Enjoy high quality, authentic and incredible taste. A taste that comes from within food as a result of the blend of ethical production process and innovative cooking techniques like Sous-vide that respects and preserves the nutriments.
  • Convenience. Get our products online, have them delivered at home, finish the preparation in 20 minutes or less, and enjoy incredible meals regardless of your cooking skills.

  • Transparency. Learn all the information about the products you are receiving. It is about getting a full picture of what you are eating, both from a nutritional as well as a sustainable standpoint.

_____

How it works:

1. Find your Delicious Bundle - Choose a Plan: Choose from one or more of Suvoi’s bundles. You always have the possibility to select your deliciously-cooked ingredients and customize your bundles.

           


2. Finish your Irresistible meals in 20’ or less: use our featured recipe cards or create your own meals using Suvoi’s cooked-to-perfection ingredients.


3. Enjoy Amazing Flavors: take your time to create beautiful plates and enjoy the food with your family and friends.


Sneak Peek @Suvoi is Different
 


 

We are Suvoi

Since 2012, brothers Leonardo and Daniel Garcia have been exploring innovative and emerging culinary techniques and the science behind them. We were soon impressed by the amazing and consistent flavors that can be obtained when cooking food with precise and gentle approaches.

We believe that bringing Sous-Vide to the many people can change the way we relate to food. This is why we created Suvoi: we believe there is a way to eat delicious food that really fits our lifestyle while enjoying high-quality and nutritional ingredients that have been obtained to meet our values and take care of the planet.

Today, siblings Adelio and Sahel Garcia have also joined Suvoi. Sahel is the heart and head of the kitchen and everything food!. Adelio has taken our supply chain to the next level, ensuring the best quality in our products and sourcing practices. 

 

We know you care..

And that is why we count on your support to build the basis for a new way to relate to food. We can only make this happen with your help. By using the best technology and culinary techniques, we can amplify together our passion for food and for sustainable and transparent practices.


Find your Delicious
