story:
(version française plus bas)

 

Short Summary

Art Is An Ale Brewing is a Franco/American couple brewing American style craft beer with French ingredients. We are starting a brewery in the medieval city of Amboise, France. Our brewery will be 2 hours from Paris and one block from the Chateau d'Amboise, historic home to the royal families and final resting place of Leonardo da Vinci. We will brew beer on site and host people in our taproom. We will distribute beer throughout France to specialty shops, hotels, & restaurants. We are excited to combine American beer styles, like the West Coast IPA as well as, brewing innovations from the US with the high-quality local ingredients. Art Is An Ale Brewing will use filtering, bright tank carbonation, and bottling technology to distribute bottled craft beer that tastes like it does on draft.

A little about us … Art Is An Ale Brewing is a Franco/American couple brewing American style craft beer with French ingredients. We are starting a brewery in the medieval city of Amboise, France. Our brewery will be 2 hours from Paris and one block from the Chateau d'Amboise, historic home to the royal families and final resting place of Leonardo da Vinci. We will brew beer on site and host people in our taproom. We will distribute beer throughout France to specialty shops, hotels, & restaurants. We are excited to combine American beer styles, like the West Coast IPA as well as, brewing innovations from the US with the high-quality local ingredients. Art Is An Ale Brewing will use filtering, bright tank carbonation, and bottling technology to distribute bottled craft beer that tastes like it does on draft.

What We Need & What You Get

WE NEED... to raise 30,000 EUR to buy a bottle filler to distribute in France. The micro carbonated bottle filler we will purchase will preserve the clarity and quality of our beer, making it unique to the French market and amazing to drink at home!  Our beer in a bottle will taste like beer on draft.

The process of carbonating using 2nd fermentation is the predominant process in France for bottling beer. However, it may have an impact on flavor and quality consistency. As explained in the videos below, the 2nd fermentation can sometimes give an off flavor, created by yeast, masking some of the subtleties we work so hard to achieve in craft beer. The flavor of the beer can vary depending on temperature conditions during storage and length of time between when it is bottled and consumed. Have a look at our video series for a better understanding.

Here is how we can do it if we get funded!

What YOU Get:

Who doesn't prefer a beer on tap?!

Of course, we are thrilled that people will be able to enjoy our beer in a bottle, but the experience of beer on draft is unique. Also, the community that develops in a taproom is one of our top priorities. We will be able to accommodate groups, have events, and do regular tours of the brewing process (a.k.a brew days!) We want people to, not only come and drink a beer but, really experience our process and be a part of it.

As for when you cannot make it to our taproom, Art Is An Ale's beer will taste like you are in the taproom when you open a bottle at home or anywhere our beers can be found. The micro carbonated bottle filler will allow us to ensure that your beer tastes awesome every time!

Perks

We will be offering a range of items and experiences for donating towards our campaign. Everything from stickers to a private brew session are up for grabs. Check them out!

What happens if we don’t meet our goal?

You will still get your perks, rest assured! We will likely reduce the overall capacity of the brewhouse and still purchase the bottle filler in order to ensure quality. Less beer, but higher quality beer.  We want to make as much of this tasty stuff as we can for you and it will be important to our overall financial strategy (i.e. make sure we stay in business) to make a certain quantity of beer. So, let’s make it happen!

The Impact

By contributing to our campaign, you will help continue to spread beer culture and community to a larger audience. Taprooms and many popular American beer styles like the West Coast IPA, Gose, Farmhouse Ale, and Brett to name a few are not super common in France. We want to bring some variety, collaborate, and contribute to the beer community. Also, given that our project is located in a town highly visited by tourist, we hope that we can be a destination for beer drinkers from other countries looking to vacation in France. Our taproom experience will hopefully be one of many rich memories for visitors to our town, as well, a location for local people to enjoy a community experience. The successful distribution of our bottled beer throughout France will facilitate the overall financial stability necessary for our project to exist as a whole. Besides, we want you to be able to drink our beer whenever you want!

Risks & Challenges

But isn’t there already beer in France and Europe?

Yes, however, we are aiming to position ourselves to introduce products in gaps in the existing market. We are paying close attention to the existing beers and strategically, developing recipes that introduce something new while supporting a local economy. In general, the market for our product is increasing in momentum. The craft beer market is growing faster in France than the industrial beer market. The time to start this project is now!

What about cultural preferences and established trends in the tastes of the French market?

One of our largest challenges is adapting our recipes to a new audience. We want to give time and attention to the palettes of our audience. We have conducted focus groups and continue to fine tune recipes specific to our customers. An added advantage of our taproom is the continued contact with customers and their experience of our beer. We will continue to make new recipes and experiment. Beers on tap can be seasonal or evolve into distributed signatures. We want to build a community too and make awesome beer together.

Matt’s experience brewing and capacity for detail, are also essential to this process. Due to his extensive travel during his sales work, he has had the opportunity to taste beer and visit breweries in over 40 countries. His time spent in various cultures with wildly different food trends informs his openness to try new things and consider the preferences specific to various audiences. The drive to make a high quality, well researched, delicious product with community inspired flavor profiles is at the core of our mission as a brewery.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not everyone can give, but you can still help!

Please sign-up for updates, share, like, and repost! Your word of mouth can make a huge difference and we greatly appreciate it!

We will have multiple contests for contributions and referrals so sign up to stay connected even if you cannot give

-- Version Française--

 

Petit Résumé

 

Art Is An Ale Brewing est une brasserie créée par un couple franco – américain d’un genre nouveau.

Nous avons la vocation de brasser des bières artisanales de style américain en utilisant des matières premières françaises.  Au printemps 2019, nous ouvrirons notre brasserie artisanale à Amboise : une ville médiévale située à seulement 2 heures de Paris. Nos locaux se tiendront  à moins de 100 mètres du mythique château de la Renaissance, résidence royale exceptionnelle et dernière demeure de Léonard de Vinci.

 

Nos bières seront brassées et embouteillées sur place. Egalement, nous pourrons vous accueillir dans notre bar à dégustation afin d’y savourer nos productions.  Nos bières seront principalement distribuées en France : en boutiques spécialisées ainsi que dans certains bars, hôtels et restaurants.

 

Notre vocation est de proposer des bières aux styles américains (comme des West Coast IPA) tout en utilisant des matières premières Françaises de haute qualité.  En effet, chez Art Is An Ale Brewing, nous filtrerons nos brassins et carbonaterons la bière en cuves de garde. Cette technique de mise en bouteille bien particulière (importée d’Amérique du Nord) permet de conserver les mêmes saveurs et arômes que dans les bières en pression.

A propos de nous…

Mattieu est Français.  Après ses études, il s’est expatrié à Los Angeles, pour poursuivre une carrière dans l’aéronautique en tant qu’ingénieur commercial.  Durant plus de 10 ans et en occupant différents postes (Vice-Président des ventes, Responsable des équipes et campagnes de ventes, etc.), Mattieu s’est vu confier des responsabilités sur des projets représentant plus de 250 millions de dollars.

 

En novembre 2008, alors qu’il résidait en Californie, il est devenu un brasseur passionné. Depuis cette date, il a régulièrement produit ses brassins.

En observant l’évolution du marché de la bière artisanale aux Etats-Unis et en capitalisant sur son expérience professionnelle, Mattieu se lança le défi de créer sa propre brasserie artisanale. Il est donc revenu dans son pays natal pour se consacrer à son rêve et se donner pleinement les moyens de l’atteindre..

 

Durant son séjour aux Etats-Unis, Mattieu a rencontré Katie : sa future femme. Katie est une artiste, designer graphique indépendante. Elle a notamment travaillé pour de grandes entreprises.

 

Ensemble, nous associons nos talents et notre créativité pour construire une entreprise qui mettra la bière artisanale à l’honneur et qui répondre aux exigences de la communauté des passionnés de bière.

Nos besoins et vos récompenses

Nous avons besoin de 30 000 euros pour acheter une embouteilleuse isobarométrique.

Cette machine permettra de mettre en place un procédé de fabrication de bière novateur en France. Grâce à elle, nous obtiendrons une bière limpide dont la la qualité se conservera davantage.. En somme, nos bières bouteilles dégustées à la maison seront tout aussi excellentes que nos bières pressions !

Aujourd’hui, sur le marché français de la bière artisanale, la méthode prédominante consiste à re-fermenter la bière mise en bouteille. Ce procédé a souvent un effet néfaste sur la saveur et la qualité du produit. En effet, des « faux-goûts » proviennent de la levure et masquent de subtiles saveurs pourtant recherchées par les brasseurs artisanaux. L’optimisation des saveurs d’une bière peut varier en fonction de la température et de la durée de conservation.  Pour plus d’information, n’hésitez pas à regarder notre série de vidéos.

 

Vos compensations

 

Qui préfère la bière pression ?   Evidemment, nous tous ! Nous sommes ravis de vous faire découvrir nos bières en bouteilles ayant la même saveur que nos bières en pression.  De plus, nous avons à cœur de créer une communauté d’amateurs de bières qui se retrouveront dans notre bar à dégustation.  Nous serons en mesure de recevoir de grands groupes, organiser des évènements et vous faire visiter notre espace de production lors des différentes étapes du brassage.  Nous souhaitons que les gens viennent autant pour savourer notre bière que pour être témoins de notre savoir-faire et de la qualité de nos produits.

L’embouteilleuse isobarométrique va nous permettre de développer un gout authentique dans chacune de nos bouteilles. Ainsi, chez vous comme n’importe où ailleurs, vous retrouverez l’authenticité et la qualité de la bière Art is An Ale de notre bar à dégustations.

 

Vos récompenses :

Si vous faites un don à notre campagne, nous vous proposons un large choix d’articles et d’expériences uniques.  Cela peut aller du simple sticker à une séance de brassage VIP. Vous avez l’embarras du choix : allez les découvrir !

Que se passe-t-il si on n’atteint pas notre but ?

Pas de problème : vous recevrez vos articles quoi qu’il arrive ?

A ce compte-là, nous réduirons le nombre ou la taille de nos fermenteurs et minimiserons le coût d’achat de notre salle de brassage. Ceci aura pour effet de réduire notre capacite de production mais n’impactera en rien la qualité de nos produits.  Nous faisons ainsi le choix d’amoindrir la quantité plutôt que d’abaisser la qualité.

Cependant, conserver notre capacité de production est stratégique pour notre brasserie : elle est un élément clef de notre équilibre financier. Il est donc important de pouvoir atteindre notre but pour cette campagne et de ne pas renoncer à nos quantités prévisionnelles. Bref, on compte sur vous !

L’impact

En contribuant à notre campagne, vous aiderez la culture bière artisanale à se populariser et à trouver sa place dans notre communauté .  Un bar à degustation et des styles de bière comme des West Coast IPA , Gose, Farmhouse, Brett et beaucoup d’autres encore ne sont pas populaires en France, c’est pourquoi nous voulons amener de la diversité, collaborer avec des brasseurs français et étrangers afin de faire partie de la communauté brassicole.  De plus, comme notre projet se situe dans un lieu très touristique, nous espérons devenir une destination pour les amateurs étrangers de bières artisanales en visite en France. On pense que l’expérience de notre bar à dégustation restera un très bon souvenir pour les nombreuses personnes qui visitent notre ville et bien sûr aussi pour les amboisiens . Ce sera un lieu de rassemblement et de bien être.  La distribution de nos bières en bouteille en France est un élément clé de notre stabilité financière et elle nous permettra d’exister sur le marché. En outre, Nous souhaiterions que vous puissiez boire nos bières ou que vous soyez !

Risques et challenges

Mais n’y a-t-il déjà pas suffisamment de bières en France et en Europe ?  Peut-être…  MAIS, nos produits ont des caractéristiques différentes de celles de nos concurrents.  Nous surveillons le marché et, stratégiquement, nous développons des recettes inédites. Nous avons également à cœur de supporter l’économie locale en achetant des produits de proximité.

De façon générale, le marché français pour nos bières a le vent en poupe. Il s’accroît plus rapidement que le marché de la bière industrielle.  C’est donc MAINTENANT qu’il nous faut lancer notre projet !

Les préférences culturelles et les tendances gustatives du marché français font parties de nos priorités majeures. Notre enjeu est bien de savoir adapter nos recettes au goût de notre clientèle. Pour être ainsi à l’écoute des désirs de nos clients, nous avons déjà organisé des séances de dégustation pour mieux affiner nos recettes.

Notre bar de dégustation est l’opportunité d’être en contact immédiat avec les consommateurs de notre bière. Cela permettra d’échanger en direct sur la qualité perçue de notre produit et de développer de nouvelles recettes innovantes avec nos clients.  

Certaines bières pressions seront produites en quantité limitée : des bières de saison ou des recettes exclusives par exemple.  Cette démarche de co-création sera totalement aboutie lors d’ateliers organisés avec notre communauté de passionnés.

Grace à son expérience professionnelle internationale, Mattieu a eu la chance de savourer des bières artisanales brassées dans plus de 40 pays ! Durant plusieurs années, il a su développer un grand éclectisme culinaire. Son ouverture d’esprit combinée à son expérience brassicole et à son souci du détail permettra de réaliser un produit subtil et délicieux.

La réussite de notre brasserie artisanale française tient donc autant à la haute qualité de notre bière qu’à la communauté de passionnés pour qui nous œuvrerons.

Autres façons de nous aider :

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, vous pouvez quand même aider !

En effet, nous organiserons prochainement plusieurs concours et nous aurons besoin de vous pour partager et faire connaître notre brasserie à vos proches. N’hésitez donc pas à renseigner votre adresse e-mail pour rester informés de la suite de nos projets.
story_txt:
(version française plus bas)
 
Short Summary
Art Is An Ale Brewing is a Franco/American couple brewing American style craft beer with French ingredients. We are starting a brewery in the medieval city of Amboise, France. Our brewery will be 2 hours from Paris and one block from the Chateau d'Amboise, historic home to the royal families and final resting place of Leonardo da Vinci. We will brew beer on site and host people in our taproom. We will distribute beer throughout France to specialty shops, hotels, & restaurants. We are excited to combine American beer styles, like the West Coast IPA as well as, brewing innovations from the US with the high-quality local ingredients. Art Is An Ale Brewing will use filtering, bright tank carbonation, and bottling technology to distribute bottled craft beer that tastes like it does on draft.

A little about us … Art Is An Ale Brewing is a Franco/American couple brewing American style craft beer with French ingredients. We are starting a brewery in the medieval city of Amboise, France. Our brewery will be 2 hours from Paris and one block from the Chateau d'Amboise, historic home to the royal families and final resting place of Leonardo da Vinci. We will brew beer on site and host people in our taproom. We will distribute beer throughout France to specialty shops, hotels, & restaurants. We are excited to combine American beer styles, like the West Coast IPA as well as, brewing innovations from the US with the high-quality local ingredients. Art Is An Ale Brewing will use filtering, bright tank carbonation, and bottling technology to distribute bottled craft beer that tastes like it does on draft.

What We Need & What You Get
WE NEED... to raise 30,000 EUR to buy a bottle filler to distribute in France. The micro carbonated bottle filler we will purchase will preserve the clarity and quality of our beer, making it unique to the French market and amazing to drink at home!  Our beer in a bottle will taste like beer on draft.The process of carbonating using 2nd fermentation is the predominant process in France for bottling beer. However, it may have an impact on flavor and quality consistency. As explained in the videos below, the 2nd fermentation can sometimes give an off flavor, created by yeast, masking some of the subtleties we work so hard to achieve in craft beer. The flavor of the beer can vary depending on temperature conditions during storage and length of time between when it is bottled and consumed. Have a look at our video series for a better understanding.

Here is how we can do it if we get funded! 

What YOU Get:
Who doesn't prefer a beer on tap?!
Of course, we are thrilled that people will be able to enjoy our beer in a bottle, but the experience of beer on draft is unique. Also, the community that develops in a taproom is one of our top priorities. We will be able to accommodate groups, have events, and do regular tours of the brewing process (a.k.a brew days!) We want people to, not only come and drink a beer but, really experience our process and be a part of it.
As for when you cannot make it to our taproom, Art Is An Ale's beer will taste like you are in the taproom when you open a bottle at home or anywhere our beers can be found. The micro carbonated bottle filler will allow us to ensure that your beer tastes awesome every time!
Perks
We will be offering a range of items and experiences for donating towards our campaign. Everything from stickers to a private brew session are up for grabs. Check them out!
What happens if we don’t meet our goal?
You will still get your perks, rest assured! We will likely reduce the overall capacity of the brewhouse and still purchase the bottle filler in order to ensure quality. Less beer, but higher quality beer.  We want to make as much of this tasty stuff as we can for you and it will be important to our overall financial strategy (i.e. make sure we stay in business) to make a certain quantity of beer. So, let’s make it happen!


The Impact
By contributing to our campaign, you will help continue to spread beer culture and community to a larger audience. Taprooms and many popular American beer styles like the West Coast IPA, Gose, Farmhouse Ale, and Brett to name a few are not super common in France. We want to bring some variety, collaborate, and contribute to the beer community. Also, given that our project is located in a town highly visited by tourist, we hope that we can be a destination for beer drinkers from other countries looking to vacation in France. Our taproom experience will hopefully be one of many rich memories for visitors to our town, as well, a location for local people to enjoy a community experience. The successful distribution of our bottled beer throughout France will facilitate the overall financial stability necessary for our project to exist as a whole. Besides, we want you to be able to drink our beer whenever you want!

Risks & Challenges

But isn’t there already beer in France and Europe?
Yes, however, we are aiming to position ourselves to introduce products in gaps in the existing market. We are paying close attention to the existing beers and strategically, developing recipes that introduce something new while supporting a local economy. In general, the market for our product is increasing in momentum. The craft beer market is growing faster in France than the industrial beer market. The time to start this project is now!
What about cultural preferences and established trends in the tastes of the French market? 
One of our largest challenges is adapting our recipes to a new audience. We want to give time and attention to the palettes of our audience. We have conducted focus groups and continue to fine tune recipes specific to our customers. An added advantage of our taproom is the continued contact with customers and their experience of our beer. We will continue to make new recipes and experiment. Beers on tap can be seasonal or evolve into distributed signatures. We want to build a community too and make awesome beer together.
Matt’s experience brewing and capacity for detail, are also essential to this process. Due to his extensive travel during his sales work, he has had the opportunity to taste beer and visit breweries in over 40 countries. His time spent in various cultures with wildly different food trends informs his openness to try new things and consider the preferences specific to various audiences. The drive to make a high quality, well researched, delicious product with community inspired flavor profiles is at the core of our mission as a brewery.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We realize that not everyone can give, but you can still help!
Please sign-up for updates, share, like, and repost! Your word of mouth can make a huge difference and we greatly appreciate it!
We will have multiple contests for contributions and referrals so sign up to stay connected even if you cannot give
-- Version Française--
 
Petit Résumé
 
Art Is An Ale Brewing est une brasserie créée par un couple franco – américain d’un genre nouveau.
Nous avons la vocation de brasser des bières artisanales de style américain en utilisant des matières premières françaises.  Au printemps 2019, nous ouvrirons notre brasserie artisanale à Amboise : une ville médiévale située à seulement 2 heures de Paris. Nos locaux se tiendront  à moins de 100 mètres du mythique château de la Renaissance, résidence royale exceptionnelle et dernière demeure de Léonard de Vinci. Nos bières seront brassées et embouteillées sur place. Egalement, nous pourrons vous accueillir dans notre bar à dégustation afin d’y savourer nos productions.  Nos bières seront principalement distribuées en France : en boutiques spécialisées ainsi que dans certains bars, hôtels et restaurants. Notre vocation est de proposer des bières aux styles américains (comme des West Coast IPA) tout en utilisant des matières premières Françaises de haute qualité.  En effet, chez Art Is An Ale Brewing, nous filtrerons nos brassins et carbonaterons la bière en cuves de garde. Cette technique de mise en bouteille bien particulière (importée d’Amérique du Nord) permet de conserver les mêmes saveurs et arômes que dans les bières en pression.

A propos de nous…
Mattieu est Français.  Après ses études, il s’est expatrié à Los Angeles, pour poursuivre une carrière dans l’aéronautique en tant qu’ingénieur commercial.  Durant plus de 10 ans et en occupant différents postes (Vice-Président des ventes, Responsable des équipes et campagnes de ventes, etc.), Mattieu s’est vu confier des responsabilités sur des projets représentant plus de 250 millions de dollars. En novembre 2008, alors qu’il résidait en Californie, il est devenu un brasseur passionné. Depuis cette date, il a régulièrement produit ses brassins.
En observant l’évolution du marché de la bière artisanale aux Etats-Unis et en capitalisant sur son expérience professionnelle, Mattieu se lança le défi de créer sa propre brasserie artisanale. Il est donc revenu dans son pays natal pour se consacrer à son rêve et se donner pleinement les moyens de l’atteindre.. Durant son séjour aux Etats-Unis, Mattieu a rencontré Katie : sa future femme. Katie est une artiste, designer graphique indépendante. Elle a notamment travaillé pour de grandes entreprises. Ensemble, nous associons nos talents et notre créativité pour construire une entreprise qui mettra la bière artisanale à l’honneur et qui répondre aux exigences de la communauté des passionnés de bière.
Nos besoins et vos récompenses
Nous avons besoin de 30 000 euros pour acheter une embouteilleuse isobarométrique.
Cette machine permettra de mettre en place un procédé de fabrication de bière novateur en France. Grâce à elle, nous obtiendrons une bière limpide dont la la qualité se conservera davantage.. En somme, nos bières bouteilles dégustées à la maison seront tout aussi excellentes que nos bières pressions !
Aujourd’hui, sur le marché français de la bière artisanale, la méthode prédominante consiste à re-fermenter la bière mise en bouteille. Ce procédé a souvent un effet néfaste sur la saveur et la qualité du produit. En effet, des « faux-goûts » proviennent de la levure et masquent de subtiles saveurs pourtant recherchées par les brasseurs artisanaux. L’optimisation des saveurs d’une bière peut varier en fonction de la température et de la durée de conservation.  Pour plus d’information, n’hésitez pas à regarder notre série de vidéos.




 

Vos compensations Qui préfère la bière pression ?   Evidemment, nous tous ! Nous sommes ravis de vous faire découvrir nos bières en bouteilles ayant la même saveur que nos bières en pression.  De plus, nous avons à cœur de créer une communauté d’amateurs de bières qui se retrouveront dans notre bar à dégustation.  Nous serons en mesure de recevoir de grands groupes, organiser des évènements et vous faire visiter notre espace de production lors des différentes étapes du brassage.  Nous souhaitons que les gens viennent autant pour savourer notre bière que pour être témoins de notre savoir-faire et de la qualité de nos produits.
L’embouteilleuse isobarométrique va nous permettre de développer un gout authentique dans chacune de nos bouteilles. Ainsi, chez vous comme n’importe où ailleurs, vous retrouverez l’authenticité et la qualité de la bière Art is An Ale de notre bar à dégustations. Vos récompenses :
Si vous faites un don à notre campagne, nous vous proposons un large choix d’articles et d’expériences uniques.  Cela peut aller du simple sticker à une séance de brassage VIP. Vous avez l’embarras du choix : allez les découvrir !
Que se passe-t-il si on n’atteint pas notre but ?
Pas de problème : vous recevrez vos articles quoi qu’il arrive ?
A ce compte-là, nous réduirons le nombre ou la taille de nos fermenteurs et minimiserons le coût d’achat de notre salle de brassage. Ceci aura pour effet de réduire notre capacite de production mais n’impactera en rien la qualité de nos produits.  Nous faisons ainsi le choix d’amoindrir la quantité plutôt que d’abaisser la qualité.
Cependant, conserver notre capacité de production est stratégique pour notre brasserie : elle est un élément clef de notre équilibre financier. Il est donc important de pouvoir atteindre notre but pour cette campagne et de ne pas renoncer à nos quantités prévisionnelles. Bref, on compte sur vous !

L’impact
En contribuant à notre campagne, vous aiderez la culture bière artisanale à se populariser et à trouver sa place dans notre communauté .  Un bar à degustation et des styles de bière comme des West Coast IPA , Gose, Farmhouse, Brett et beaucoup d’autres encore ne sont pas populaires en France, c’est pourquoi nous voulons amener de la diversité, collaborer avec des brasseurs français et étrangers afin de faire partie de la communauté brassicole.  De plus, comme notre projet se situe dans un lieu très touristique, nous espérons devenir une destination pour les amateurs étrangers de bières artisanales en visite en France. On pense que l’expérience de notre bar à dégustation restera un très bon souvenir pour les nombreuses personnes qui visitent notre ville et bien sûr aussi pour les amboisiens . Ce sera un lieu de rassemblement et de bien être.  La distribution de nos bières en bouteille en France est un élément clé de notre stabilité financière et elle nous permettra d’exister sur le marché. En outre, Nous souhaiterions que vous puissiez boire nos bières ou que vous soyez !

Risques et challenges
Mais n’y a-t-il déjà pas suffisamment de bières en France et en Europe ?  Peut-être…  MAIS, nos produits ont des caractéristiques différentes de celles de nos concurrents.  Nous surveillons le marché et, stratégiquement, nous développons des recettes inédites. Nous avons également à cœur de supporter l’économie locale en achetant des produits de proximité.
De façon générale, le marché français pour nos bières a le vent en poupe. Il s’accroît plus rapidement que le marché de la bière industrielle.  C’est donc MAINTENANT qu’il nous faut lancer notre projet !
Les préférences culturelles et les tendances gustatives du marché français font parties de nos priorités majeures. Notre enjeu est bien de savoir adapter nos recettes au goût de notre clientèle. Pour être ainsi à l’écoute des désirs de nos clients, nous avons déjà organisé des séances de dégustation pour mieux affiner nos recettes.
Notre bar de dégustation est l’opportunité d’être en contact immédiat avec les consommateurs de notre bière. Cela permettra d’échanger en direct sur la qualité perçue de notre produit et de développer de nouvelles recettes innovantes avec nos clients.  
Certaines bières pressions seront produites en quantité limitée : des bières de saison ou des recettes exclusives par exemple.  Cette démarche de co-création sera totalement aboutie lors d’ateliers organisés avec notre communauté de passionnés.
Grace à son expérience professionnelle internationale, Mattieu a eu la chance de savourer des bières artisanales brassées dans plus de 40 pays ! Durant plusieurs années, il a su développer un grand éclectisme culinaire. Son ouverture d’esprit combinée à son expérience brassicole et à son souci du détail permettra de réaliser un produit subtil et délicieux.
La réussite de notre brasserie artisanale française tient donc autant à la haute qualité de notre bière qu’à la communauté de passionnés pour qui nous œuvrerons.
Autres façons de nous aider :
Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, vous pouvez quand même aider !
En effet, nous organiserons prochainement plusieurs concours et nous aurons besoin de vous pour partager et faire connaître notre brasserie à vos proches. N’hésitez donc pas à renseigner votre adresse e-mail pour rester informés de la suite de nos projets.

story:
Short Summary

Mame’s Burrito’s is a story of Mame, who fourteen years ago at the age of 65 started Mame’s Burrito Company.  She followed her heart and passion and started making fresh high-quality handcrafted burritos igniting a burrito craving community. Her rich story is one of persistence, passion, integrity and strength, and she inspires us daily.

Have you ever gone to the store to grab a quick meal to warm up in the microwave and been disappointed?  Have you noticed that everything is changing in the world of food – from the way people eat, grocery shop, cook, and have food delivered? It is becoming more and more customized and tailored to a lifestyle with a new generation of possibilities.   We are reaching outside of the box and meeting people where they want to shop and eat high quality yummy prepared food, such as coffee shops, food service, frozen grocery and specialty stores.  Mame’s is elevating the grab and go space with food that is just prepared better, with care and love and premium ingredients.

Over the past year, Mame’s has been preparing the company to go big!  What started in local coffee shops has expanded into frozen retail. In April of 2018, Mame’s launched in 123 King Soopers stores in Colorado. Our loyal customers are excited to now have their favorite burrito in their very own freezer to enjoy whenever they want, and our tribe is growing!

The Impact

Our launch into frozen grocery has been greeted with such success that we are looking to expand across the nation, not just in grocery, but in coffee shops, specialty food stores, and foodservice (think college campuses, hospitals, hotels and more)!  Our model has worked in Colorado, and we know we can replicate it nationally – people are asking for us!

Your contribution to our campaign at any level will help to fill Mame’s lifelong dream of spreading food as love across the country with Mame’s Burritos.  If you are interested in an equity position, please contact us separately and we can get you details!

Growth is expensive, and Mame’s will be prepared to support our “go big” burrito campaign with sales and marketing, logistics and support.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for checking out our Indiegogo campaign.  Even if you are not able to contribute financially, you are an important part of our growth and you make it all possible! Here are some other things you can do to help us:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the Mame’s campaign (you can share from this page).
  • Feed your Mame’s Burrito cravings in your local CO coffee shop or buy them in one of our retail locations: https://www.mamesburritos.com/where-to-buy/
  • Stay connected with us! We want to stay in touch with our community!  Like and follow our social media pages (Facebook and Instagram)

And most importantly, live like Mame …. love your neighbor, eat good food and believe everything is possible!

story:
When you contribute to Pemmican Patty you will help us:

Bring to life a small business for an Indigenous woman – independence

Promote the use of bison as a viable option, grow the herds – culture

Bring a clean, healthy food into the world – health of future generations

Inspire entrepreneurs of all ages to follow their dreams – hope  

A portion of proceeds to fund scholarship – inspiration   

 

PERKS YOU ASK?!?! Why YES!

We love the idea of giving kudos and perks! All contributions will be recognized on our website and Facebook page; $50 and above will receive samples of our initial, self-funded “Pemmican Style Bites”; $100 will receive our re-useable tote bag (made of recycled materials) and for $200 you can be the proud owner of our adjustable, multi-pocket canvas apron!

Your Donation Will Help With The Following Costs:

Description

Estimated Need

Research and consultation to find co-manufacturing partner

$ 500

Product development – recipe and formula testing

$1,500

Package design and printing

$2,500

Product manufacturing and co-packing of initial production of 5,000 units

$12,500

Digital marketing campaign

$3,000

 

 

Total

$20,000

 

 

When you support our cause, you are supporting more than just a product

Even though contributions will initially go to helping get the business started, we’d like to set aside funds for scholarships for indigenous students to further their education in areas such as  culture, nutrition and entrepreneurship.

Bringing an item to market is new for me, but I have faith in the health benefits and in these uncertain times, we need to help each other. We all could put better things in our bodies and it helps when they taste good! Contributions to this campaign will help keep more than one small business in operation, and produce a tasty source of energy for every age!

This is not only a great food product but also a revitalization of a family tradition. Keeping our culture alive and giving back to our people is just as important to us as good nutrition and real food options.

 

How Our Journey Began

My name is Patricia "Patt" Mabin. I am a descendant of Chief Little Thunder (Joseph Gourneau) and his father before him, Old Wild Rice, one of the earliest recorded chiefs of the Pembina/Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians. I began this journey when my brother Mike and I were driving home after spending the day in Belcourt, North Dakota, on the Turtle Mountain Reservation. We were talking about our heritage and our futures. I expressed that I’d like to find a way to bring our past into the present and keep our culture alive. The discussion of bison, survival, and ingenuity started to unfold, and when pemmican was mentioned, the vision began.

 

 

I believe that Pemmican Patty breathed new life into a worn-out woman. As a teenage single mother, I got my GED and began a long stretch of minimum wage jobs to provide for myself and my son.  Over the past 6 decades, I’ve been divorced (more than once), recovered from alcoholism and addiction (more than once). I've been treated for depression (more than once), had 3 major surgeries, countless minor surgeries, and survived a serious ATV accident. I’ve been homeless, uninsured and without a car. I’ve also visited or lived in many of the states west of the Mississippi, had the honor of caring for my Grandmother during her last year of life, and learned that money might make living “easier” but true riches (and character) come from hardship. The most I’ve really had to offer has been time and love.

In my late 50s’, I lived in Mexico for a year before bringing my 7-year-old granddaughter to North Dakota to live with me. I journeyed with her through tuberculosis, all her childhood vaccinations, mega dental work, and into middle school when her family decided to take her back. After a lifetime of putting others before myself, I was over 60, overweight, without an income, without a car and unable to afford rent.  After moving back into my parents’ basement and being treated for depression once more, I struggled to consider a future, much less try to dream up something new to try!

 

With the help of the Creator, my family and especially my brother, the dream of Pemmican Patty has come alive. It has given me renewed hope and purpose. It’s strengthened family ties and provided a view of the past and a vision for the future. It’s living proof that the joy is in the journey! Based on a strong desire to keep our heritage alive, my brother, nephew and I learned that our Metis ancestors, as well as our Grandma Ida, made pemmican to sustain themselves and others, including trappers, traders and soldiers.  Dubbed “the indigenous super food,” our version of pemmican is made of real food. A combination of bison, beef, berries, sunflowers, and a hint of honey provides a convenient, natural source of energy for people on the go in today’s modern world. My hope is for this product to promote good health and preserve Metis traditions, one pemmican bite at a time!

 

 

 

Other ways you can support our campaign!

We understand that not everyone is able to give a monetary donation, however it is our dream to share this journey with all of you! We would greatly appreciate it if you would take the time to share our campaign with your friends and family, post it on your social media, and please reach out to us if you would like us to set up an information booth at an event you're hosting!

Chi Miigwech!! (Thank You)

As a teenage single mother, I got my GED and began a long stretch of minimum wage jobs to provide for myself and my son.  Over the past 6 decades, I’ve been divorced (more than once), recovered from alcoholism and addiction (more than once). I've been treated for depression (more than once), had 3 major surgeries, countless minor surgeries, and survived a serious ATV accident. I’ve been homeless, uninsured and without a car. I’ve also visited or lived in many of the states west of the Mississippi, had the honor of caring for my Grandmother during her last year of life, and learned that money might make living “easier” but true riches (and character) come from hardship. The most I’ve really had to offer has been time and love.
In my late 50s’, I lived in Mexico for a year before bringing my 7-year-old granddaughter to North Dakota to live with me. I journeyed with her through tuberculosis, all her childhood vaccinations, mega dental work, and into middle school when her family decided to take her back. After a lifetime of putting others before myself, I was over 60, overweight, without an income, without a car and unable to afford rent.  After moving back into my parents’ basement and being treated for depression once more, I struggled to consider a future, much less try to dream up something new to try!

 
With the help of the Creator, my family and especially my brother, the dream of Pemmican Patty has come alive. It has given me renewed hope and purpose. It’s strengthened family ties and provided a view of the past and a vision for the future. It’s living proof that the joy is in the journey! Based on a strong desire to keep our heritage alive, my brother, nephew and I learned that our Metis ancestors, as well as our Grandma Ida, made pemmican to sustain themselves and others, including trappers, traders and soldiers.  Dubbed “the indigenous super food,” our version of pemmican is made of real food. A combination of bison, beef, berries, sunflowers, and a hint of honey provides a convenient, natural source of energy for people on the go in today’s modern world. My hope is for this product to promote good health and preserve Metis traditions, one pemmican bite at a time!
 

 


 
Other ways you can support our campaign!
We understand that not everyone is able to give a monetary donation, however it is our dream to share this journey with all of you! We would greatly appreciate it if you would take the time to share our campaign with your friends and family, post it on your social media, and please reach out to us if you would like us to set up an information booth at an event you're hosting!
Chi Miigwech!! (Thank You)

story:
UPDATE: for every $5 dollars contributed we will donate one plant-based meal to Feeding San Diego. 

 

We are building a plant-based restaurant! 

I am so excited to update you about our newest project! Meet The Plot: a lively, inviting restaurant. We make delicious, high-quality, and sometimes boundary-pushing food that is completely plant-based. A conscientious business with operations that benefit our team, the health of our communities and the future of our planet.

Our goal: build one, make it awesome, then build many.

We want to bring you the best possible version of a business: epic plant-based food, great design, local and regenerative sourcing, and zero-waste operations.

Coming soon to south O!

We are building out the first of what we intend to be a chain of plant based restaurants. We found an amazing old building in South Oceanside, CA, less than a block from our first two restaurants. It's a great big space that is perfectly located, with room for 150 seats plus a commissary kitchen to supply future locations, grab-and-go sales and retail food operations. Our lease even came with a small rental cottage that has a huge yard where we will create an urban garden and host private events. The only catch is that it is costing us a lot more to build out than we originally raised.

 

Design: Solstice Interiors | Architect: Mark Bausback | General Contractor: CLTVT 

A little help from our friends

We were hesitant about crowd-raising capital at first, but then we realized how cool the concept really is. Crowd-raising levels the playing field for small businesses, and allows a community to come together to create positive change. 

In total we aim to raise $750,000 to pay for construction costs. This will cover a whole range of building expenses, materials, large kitchen equipment, and finishes. By contributing to this campaign you will very literally be building a Plot, from floor to ceiling! 

We get that this is a big ask for a crowd raise, and we don't necessarily expect to hit that height. We are definitely working to raise funds by more traditional means. However we needed a number, and saw no harm in being honest about how far we have to go. As business owners we value transparency; in our sourcing, our operational practices, and in our fundraising. We want to partner with friends and community members that believe what we believe. Large or small, those partnerships are super valuable to us, and they all add up to make a big impact. 

Video created and donated by the incredible Sam Wells @ChefEpic

We hope you will join us in building something great.

You will have the opportunity to select from apparel, gift cards and special catered events. We will still be able to fulfill these "perks" if we do not reach our funding goal. Anything raised will help us build, and these inspired entrepreneurs will find a way to build our flagship Plot! 

In addition to the perks above, anyone who contributes $100 or more will literally have their name on the plot! We will dedicate a wall to list the names of all who made this flagship location possible. Here is more information on how your contribution will be impactful: 

Be the change, one bite at a time

Zero Waste Ethos

Food waste is a costly practice. According to a report by NPR, one half pound of food for every restaurant guest served, on average, is discarded. As much as ten percent of food purchased by restaurants ends up in the landfill. The Plot restaurants will be built with a zero-waste ethos from the ground up. With some careful planning and a solution-based attitude we will create systems that result in a win-win-win.

UN Report on Climate Change 

"Efforts to curb greenhouse-gas emissions and the impacts of global warming will fall significantly short without drastic changes in global land use, agriculture and human diets, leading researchers warn in a high-level report commissioned by the United Nations.The special report on climate change and land by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change describes plant-based diets as a major opportunity for mitigating and adapting to climate change ― and includes a policy recommendation to reduce meat consumption." -Nature,  August 2019

The report outlined three main solutions, all of which are components of our business plan! 

1. Eat less meat: we are completely plant-based! 

2. Waste less food (less organics in landfill): we are a zero-waste restaurant

3. Make farmland more productive: we support local and regenerative farming 

Investing in people 

A Strong Partnership - Davin + Jess: Our partnership stems from a shared passion for the ideals on which we have built our companies, and for the challenge of making these ideals marketable and accessible. We both want to change the world for the better and see an opportunity to do this by building a business that is efficient, scalable, and that will set the bar high for those that come after it. 

We currently own and operate two restaurants that are plant and seafood-centric. We work to minimize waste and respect the planet by practicing total utilization and waste minimizing techniques. We work with local farms and fishermen and understand that the most sustainable and tastiest products are those that are sourced locally and seasonally. Davin has been offering vegan options on his menus since 2004 and he believes strongly that moving in a plant-based direction makes sense.

A Well-Rounded Team: While we were not lacking in passion, drive and operational experience we have identified our need for a team member with a strong history in corporate operations and scaling. Christopher Logan has long been a mentor to both of us and brings with him decades of such needed experience.

Risks & challenges

There are plenty of hurdles to overcome when building a successful restaurant business.  Davin and Jess boot-strapped Wrench & Rodent with almost nothing to their names. After six years in business they have learned from mistakes, built a strong team, and have had the opportunity to support a broad range of local businesses and organizations. Our team knows that to be truly resilient we need a community, and have learned much from a broad range of advisors and supporters. 

Other ways you can help

Help comes in all forms. If you are not able to make a monetary contribution we would greatly appreciate if you would share your enthusiasm for our project via social media, or by sending links to our campaign to your friends.

Thank you for supporting our efforts to make a delicious difference!

story:
We are two committed young entrepreneurs sisters Andrea Márquez and Kamila Márquez who funded a Meal-Prep Company in October 2018 located in Puerto Rico with the mission to contribute to people’s wellbeing. We believe that healthy eating is not a diet but a lifestyle. We believe that people are what they eat, that food is the cure for many diseases and the fuel for a strong and energetic body. For us, nothing feels better than sharing an opportunity to make our dream come true.

We were raised in a family conscious about the importance of living an active and healthy life which inspire us to start a wellbeing business. We want to see a change in people’s lifestyle primarily in their eating habits. Kamila had a dream when she was in high school, to build a business with her sister Andrea. Through the years they had many conversations but it was not until Kamila Graduated in 2018 that they were serious about it. At this moment both had their own degrees and things started to fall in place.  After graduation, Andrea continued to post her exercise routines and meal plan diet. People became curious about Andrea's lifestyle and her commitment to a healthier life.  We took on the opportunity and created a business that contributed to people’s wellbeing.

 

UltraFit Next level

Help us raise $20,000 dollars for:

  • Purchase of a professional kitchen
  • Electric and plumbing work
  • Expand our staff
  • Equipment and mobility to create a comfortable and pleasant ambiance

Risk and challenges

Finding a space was a big step towards the business growth which we know will entail money and time.  We are launching this campaign to raise funds to renovate our new location. 

It was a great challenge to run our business from our own small kitchen. We did it!  And our sales increased rapidly forcing us to find a bigger location. We give thanks to all the people who have supported us throughout our first months,  we are ready to move to a bigger location.  Our new, renovated and bigger location will give us the opportunity to systematize the production for faster and better results and to hire more staff contributing to generating new jobs for people in Puerto Rico.

The Impact 

With this space, we will be able to have a home base that is actually ours. It is spacious and strategically located for people to visit us and pick up their meals.  We will increase Ultra Fit Meals clientele by 100%.  This project gives us the opportunity to help raise a community conscious about their wellbeing. 

Our Promise 

We are 100% committed to this project. We have given it all, nights and weekends,  trying to put everything together.  Each donation will have the biggest impact on our business developments.

story:
I started my dental career as an orthodontic dental assistant where I developed a passion for oral health and in 2011, I became a dental hygienist. I've been involved in dental outreach and currently mentors hygienists across the country. Outside of dentistry, I have a 16 year old son and enjoy spending time with my family who are rooted in Puerto Rican heritage.

I'm not one to ask for money and have been funding my project up to this point. As a result, it's taken a lot longer than I anticipated. You can help make my vision into a reality.

story:
Story

The Pot Goes Italian

Firstly, thank you for taking the time to check out our Crowdfunder. We really want you to feel invested, so rather than give you a token reward (a coffee or your initials on a wall in the toilets) we REALLY want to reward you; our investors. That’s why we have set up our rewards so you can easily earn your investment back and more, we are literally  giving away food, drink and money! The more you invest the more you get back, we've hopefully set this up in a way that nobody feels out of pocket and you all get to share our continued success with lifetime discounts available.

So why are we doing this?

Put simply, over the last few years running The Pot bistro we’ve seen a real change in dining habits, coupled by a genuine slowdown in the economy. We feel now is the time to really shake things up; it's essentially do or die and we want to continue bringing our award winning food to the people of Cardiff for years to come... but in a slightly different format; there is also a definite gap in the market for an Italian style restaurant on Whitchurch road and the Heath area.

So what’s the plan!

We’re going to open a truly modern Italian restaurant the likes of which Cardiff has never seen before, focusing on handmade pastas, artisan pizzas and a twist on some classic dishes.

We plan to fuse local and seasonal produce with classic Italian ingredients, whilst keeping to our well known roots from our successful French bistro- to create dishes like Confit Duck lasagne and Lobster Arancini with Thermador sauce.

We really want to tap into the growing takeaway market using apps like Deliveroo and Just Eat, and this is where Italian food comes into its own... imagine getting one of our delicious handmade pastas delivered to your door with a tasty artisan pizza and a side of arancini…..Belissimo! 

We are also hoping to add a & deli counter to the operation , we would provide sandwiches, pasta pots, cured meats, chutneys and a selection of welsh/ Italian cheeses and Chef made ready meals to take home at the end of a busy day! 

We are also  looking to branch out into event catering for weddings, private functions and eventually private dining, bringing a taste of restaurant quality food to your home.

But what’s your experience!

Well, as you know we’ve owned The Pot Bistro for 6 years now, winning multiple awards that culminated in three last year including a 'Highly commended chef of the year' for Rhys- one of our owners. Rhys has been running kitchens for the past 21 years spending 11 of those in Italian kitchens working his way up to a 2 Rosette level. This is really where his passion lies, Italian food is his first love and he is really looking forward to sharing it with you. 

Your used  to being greeted by Laura- our other owner. She is the glue that has held The Pot together for the past 6 years , spearheading the menu designs to the décor and bringing you the relaxed but prompt professional service that you have all become accustomed too.

What’s the money for!

So let’s get down to brass taxes! Your money will be going towards a refurbishment of the Whitchurch road site and the new deli, lots of new equipment for both sites including a pizza oven, pasta makers and a dough mixer. New signage, general fixtures and fittings and some outdoor lights to illuminate the building. 

Rewards!

We are offering a range of rewards from £5 up to £1000  rewards from £25 up will get a  loyalty card that will entitle  the bearer to a 20%  discount on food, £50 will entitle the bearer to a discount for 2 people and £100 for 4, the discount card will be capped at 6 people for the pledge of £150 and above. 

We feel this is the fairest way to reward you all and  keep the business viable in the long term..........Happy Pledging!

Risks and challenges

As with everything there is risk but having owned a successful business for the last 6 years and with a combined experience of over 30 years in the hospitality trade, we feel they are small. We know the area and market well and see a bright future ahead.

story:
Short Summary

Tom Cat's Kitchen will be a cafe and deli that provides rich and healthful breakfast foods, coffee drinks, fresh juices, and grab & go options to get the neighborhood's morning commuters and incoming office workers nourished for their day. We will run a lively lunch service focused on quick turn-around times to cater to those working nearby seeking a quick and healthy lunch or juice pick-me-up. Weekends will feature a hearty brunch menu utilizing ingredients from the nearby Farmer's Market and Bring Your Own Bubbles for mimosas made with fresh-pressed juices. The Greenmount corridor is a main thoroughfare for public transit and for individuals commuting from adjacent areas such as Belvedere Square, Govans, or Lake Montebello on their way downtown or to 83 access. As a historic main street, it's avenues were planned to capture traffic and create a business hub. Tom Cat's will be a key player in re-establishing this Baltimore main street.

What We Need & What You Get

Helping Tom Cat's Kitchen also helps you! 

In order to finalize the details of our lease we must meet certain funding goals. By participating in this crowdfunding push you will be a crucial factor in the success of Tom Cat's Kitchen. Aside from the good feelings, you will receive awesome swag and membership in our coffee club.

The Impact

The vision for Tom Cat's has been in development across a collective 30 years of hospitality experience. The owners, Anna and Janell,  have each spent time in just about every role in the restaurant world, having first met in the soft lights and loud music of Joe Squared on North Ave.  Within the past seven years, Anna has advanced to varying levels of management in four different food concepts and has found her strengths in team-building and operations management with a particular eye on finance. Janell's time in the industry has been spent in many roles, serving a wide range of audiences. At one point in her career her dedication to a vegan hot dog business helped it thrive in the unique market of metal music shows. Combine Anna's financial management experience with Janell's passion for great food and fantastic hospitality with the growing trend towards more conscientious eating and the success of Tom Cat's becomes clear and attainable. Tom Cat's Kitchen will be an important part of the Waverly community in providing a thoughtful and healthy approach to delicious food in a space for quick coffees, lunches with friends, and afternoons spent on your laptop. 

Risks & Challenges

While small business loans are available to us, unrealistic repayment terms and inflated interest rates would immediately place the business in a financially unfavorable position, angling us towards an unstable future. 

Exploring non-traditional funding options became necessary. Grants, micro-loans, crowdfunding and crowd investing are the paths we are pursuing to realize our dream.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially, but we will accept all the help that we can get. So please...

Talk about our plans and adventures with the people in your life.

Share our crowdfunding goal, future events and updates with your social network.

And please, keep the well wishes and high fives coming.

The Impact
The vision for Tom Cat's has been in development across a collective 30 years of hospitality experience. The owners, Anna and Janell,  have each spent time in just about every role in the restaurant world, having first met in the soft lights and loud music of Joe Squared on North Ave.  Within the past seven years, Anna has advanced to varying levels of management in four different food concepts and has found her strengths in team-building and operations management with a particular eye on finance. Janell's time in the industry has been spent in many roles, serving a wide range of audiences. At one point in her career her dedication to a vegan hot dog business helped it thrive in the unique market of metal music shows. Combine Anna's financial management experience with Janell's passion for great food and fantastic hospitality with the growing trend towards more conscientious eating and the success of Tom Cat's becomes clear and attainable. Tom Cat's Kitchen will be an important part of the Waverly community in providing a thoughtful and healthy approach to delicious food in a space for quick coffees, lunches with friends, and afternoons spent on your laptop. 

Risks & Challenges
While small business loans are available to us, unrealistic repayment terms and inflated interest rates would immediately place the business in a financially unfavorable position, angling us towards an unstable future. 
Exploring non-traditional funding options became necessary. Grants, micro-loans, crowdfunding and crowd investing are the paths we are pursuing to realize our dream.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially, but we will accept all the help that we can get. So please...
Talk about our plans and adventures with the people in your life.
Share our crowdfunding goal, future events and updates with your social network.
And please, keep the well wishes and high fives coming.

story:
"It is more than just a fish scaler. M-scaler brings a second life to materials that would otherwise be wasted or even cause environmental pollution.” 

–Eugene Pan, business development manager 

 

 

It is a fish scaling tool that is made from 100% recycled plastic. Whether you are preparing a salmon dinner at home or cleaning a newly caught fish during a camping trip, M-scaler is the ideal tool to help you accomplish your task. The tool comes with a built-in bottle opener and a magnetic connector, allowing you to pop open your favorite beverage and use the lid as a replaceable blade to slice off fish scales from all angles. The strong ceramic magnet ensures your blade to attach firmly throughout the fish scaling, while the handle is carefully crafted to optimize the user experience. 

 

Who we are

We are two passionate high school students based in Taiwan who care about the environment that we live in. 

 

Eugene: 

Hi! I am an IB student who is taking economics and business management. I have fallen in love with Daniel's idea of creating a fish scaling tool that is made entirely from recycled materials a year ago and started my partnership with him ever since. Daniel is an incredible achiever who could balance his hard-core academic studies with his interest in other pursuits, not to mention the fact that he single-handedly designed, created, and presented one of the most meaningful products that I have seen. I am thrilled to be able to apply my knowledge and put theories into real use, starting my own business with my talented friend Daniel. 

 

Daniel: 

Hello! I am an AP student who is taking Calculus BC and Physic C and I can't wait to share my story with you. M-scaler has won a gold medal in the International Trade Fair 'Ideas-Inventions-New Products' iENA at Nuremberg Germany, and that was the end of its journey for a long time. Not that I didn't think of upscaling my invention, but I wasn't certain of HOW. That is why I was overjoyed when I finally met Eugene about a year ago. Other than his perfect grades in academics, I could feel his commitment to this project from just the look in his eyes; I know he is a trustworthy person who has the expertise to assist me in bringing M-scaler to the next level. I have no doubt that we would create something spectacular together. 

 

Our Passion 

Our passion for environment protection and recycling originated from our high school chemistry class, which we were studying ozone deconstruction and its impact. The curriculum also mentioned how this phenomenon has caused climate change and the possible solutions to respond. In summary, it all comes down to two things: adaptation and mitigation. This got us thinking, are we really going to accept the fact that our environment is ruined and cope with the new normal of extreme weather, or are we going to take initiatives that could reduce the impact and attempt to fix climate change? Obviously, we have chosen the latter. 

 

About the product 

How to use

 

1. Use the built-in bottle opener to pop open your favorite beverage 

 

 

2. Attach the cap to the magnetic head 

 

 

3. Start your fish scaling 

 

 

Specification

Length: 15 cm

Width: 5 cm 

Height: 1 cm 

 

Parts 

(1) bottle opener 

(2) designer handle 

(3) 100% recycled plastic material 

(4) ceramic magnet 

 

Why choose M-scaler

We always believe that M-scaler is beyond an ordinary fish scaling tool. Made from 100% recycled plastic, M-scaler brings a second life to materials that would otherwise be wasted or even cause environmental pollution. Think of it this way: if we could add value to used materials, this would provide an incentive for people to start recycling because these materials are no longer wastes, but scarce resources. The effect could be amplified if more and more people could recognize the importance of recycling and protecting the environment and actually start taking actions within their community. Our vision is for individuals to affect neighbors, neighbors to affect their community, community to affect an entire nation, and eventually, nation to affect other nations. We dream of a healthier, cleaner, and more sustainable planet, and we can't achieve that without you. 

 

We view M-scaler as an epitome of recycling. Yes, it is a useful and well-designed tool, but what is more, is the idea it represents. Through M-scaler, we want to convey the message that everyone is responsible for the environment. Whether you are a businessman, a lawyer, an artist, a chef, or a mechanic, we all live on this planet, there are no outsiders. If two inexperienced high school students could do this much, what could you do to make this world a better place? 

 

More reasons to choose M-scaler

1. Compared to traditional fish scaling tools, M-scaler has better food hygiene since the scaling blade is replaceable. This prevents the scaling tool to become rusty and reduces the chance of eating bacteria-contaminated fish. 

2. M-scaler is a perfect two-in-one tool for outdoor activities lovers. You could easily fit M-scaler inside your backpack, using it to open chilling beverages or remove the fish scales from a fish that you just caught while enjoying the beauty of nature. 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have already produced four fully functional prototypes, and we are aiming to raise 20,000 USD to move on to mass production. Each dollar you contributed would bring us closer to our goal. The fund will be used to purchase recycled plastics, pay the cost of plastic injection mold, and serve as our operational fund to pay for manufacturing and other expenses. 

 

Together, we could make the world a better place. By funding our project, you are not just supporting a startup business, but a good cause. The more fish scaler we could sell, the more “wastes” could be transformed into recycled goods, and fewer pollutants will be harming the environment. This is also the chance for you to receive one (or multiple) M-scaler at a HUGE discount price and be directly involved in helping the planet. 

 

 

Development 

We built the first-generation M-scaler with wood. However, this model is limited by the undesired thickness and heavyweight. This prompts us to replace the materials with a lighter alternative. 

 

 

We built the second-generation M-scaler with plastic. The original design was to squeeze the bottle cap directly into the handle, but this creates structural issues as the blade would not be stable enough to smoothly remove fish scales. This prompts us to produce our third and final generation M-scaler, which includes a ceramic magnet to firmly secure the bottle cap. 

 

 

We built the third-generation M-scaler with 100% recycled plastic. This final version of the design also incorporates a built-in bottle opener, allowing M-scaler to become a multi-functional tool. 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Frankly, we are expected to face several obstacles, with some hitting us in ways that we couldn't even imagine. But as the saying goes, “only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly." We are young, we are eager, and we are determined; we can't promise to succeed, but we promise to give everything we have into this campaign. 

 

Due to our lack of experience, there is a risk of the shipment being delayed. Further, we will not be able to manufacture the product if we could not cover the break-even cost. However, we would donate the fund entirely to The Nature Conservancy (https://www.nature.org/en-us/)  as an alternate solution to help the environment if we do not reach our goal. One way or another, you would be contributing to protecting the environment, and we sincerely appreciate you for doing so. Still, we are committed to trying our best–even if that means to incur some loss–to successfully deliver our product to your hand. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Although we highly encourage you to contribute to our M-scaler package, you could also support our campaign by funding the Angel package. We would love to take advantage of the convenient internet resources, so please help share this project through various channels, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Whatsapp, you name it. Talk to your friends, talk to your families, and ask them to spread the news as well. Even if you are not funding our campaign, please share anyways; raising awareness of environmental issues is also a crucial component for a healthier, cleaner, and more sustainable future. 

 

"Processing a fish has never been so easy, scrape your fish skin with M-scaler and protect the environment! " 

–Daniel Chen, chief engineer 

 

We sincerely appreciate your contribution, and we hope you a better future.

story:
I grew up and continue to live here in Traverse City, MI. I've spent my entire life being in, on or around the water. I've skied, snowboarded, snowmobiled, hiked, biked and just about everything else the Great Lakes region has to offer. I've gone through several incarnations of employment, with many years in corporate America. But I've always had a wandering eye, and over the years I've often dreamed of being able to leave the daily grind of sales meetings and TPS reports behind and do something on my own… something that I love and something that incorporates the region that I love so much.

The question of "What if?" was a constant companion. If I ever had the opportunity, What would “it” look like, sound like, taste like? What is “it”? Kind of like those questions of what you would do if you ever won the lottery. Thanks to my family and some very good friends who gently but firmly helped push me off the ledge of self-employment terror, “it” turned out to be Food Baby the food truck.

Food Baby isn't designed to be just another "me too" food truck. My intent is to stay away from the typical taco and same ole' sliders. I want Food Baby to be against the grain, in a good way. In other words, you'll see things coming out of Food Baby that are far from typical in this area. I'll cook what I love and what I love is typically off the beaten path. While the menu is still on the DL, you’ll see menu items ranging from Asian to Caribbean, from Creole and Cajun to Latin and maybe even Middle Eastern. There is one dish that I’m particularly excited about that I won’t divulge yet. I believe it’ll be huge if I can get the hard to find ingredients and specialized equipment required to make it. I’ll be selling out of the truck most days while spending a day or so doing prep work in a local downtown commercial kitchen. I’m very excited to get started.

Now for the darkness…

The universe, it seems, is full of forces that want to stop us from achieving our goals and realizing our dreams. They stand in our way and refuse to move and it’s up to us to find a way around them. They are ever present and, for whatever reason, they really don’t like us very much. For me, that force is a man named Nic.

Last spring, I contracted with Nic in Raleigh, North Carolina to build a kitchen in my already purchased truck. It was a decision I felt comfortable with as I had already conversed with literally dozens of other food truck sellers, builders and buyers. According to our agreement, the truck was to be finished in late May, early June… It wasn't. Every couple days I’d ask for a progress report and he’d give me a little good news followed by an excuse of waiting for some piece of equipment or some "person" to install something. I asked for photos several times but there was always a reason he was unable to send them. (This was obviously a major red flag.) Nic made every excuse in the book and being 1,000 miles away I had no choice but to try to be patient. At one point, he ceased communication all together and I had to hire a private investigator just to get him on the phone! Time marched on and before I knew it, my first selling season had slowly faded away. By the end of August I still didn’t have a food truck. In retrospect, it appears that Nic never really intended to fulfill his contractual obligation. He has made promises since to refund a pathetically small part of my investment but he has made no effort to follow through despite many attempts to collect. Last fall I retrieved my truck and its currently being built but I'm still out my initial investment and many more thousands of dollars in related expenses. Not to mention lost revenue! It’s especially tragic knowing that I was not the only victim of this evil doer. Here’s a link to a news story about Nic. No joke…

http://abc11.com/news/i-team-whats-keeping-food-trucks-from-hitting-the-roads-/501183/

Thus, the need for this Indiegogo campaign. I am currently in the process of paying for this project for a second time. I have everything, and then some, into it. But I still need a little help. The truck will be complete when it arrives in a few weeks. However, I will need to purchase several additional pieces of equipment, pay inspection and licensing fees, insurance and have reserves for operating capital.

The required equipment includes a couple of pieces that are very specialized. One is a rice cooker/warmer. The second is, at this point, secret. In the interest of protecting Food Baby’s niche, I think it best not to broadcast my menu. The rest is the normal accoutrements you’d find in any commercial kitchen

The fees payable include but may not be limited to the health department inspection, vendor license fees in the city of Traverse City (this one is quite expensive), event participation fees and additional inspection fees in other counties that are also possible.

Why $20,000? The fact of the matter is that Food trucks are expensive. I knew what I was getting into. But I really didn’t plan on paying for mine twice. But that’s my reality. I’m past being angry. I just want to get to work. I don’t really talk about Nic very often. I only talk about the truck now… probably to the point of being annoying. It’s literally the only thing I think about from the second I wake up to the moment I go to bed. My brain is currently making plans to make a five year goal into a two year accomplishment. Needless to say, it’s been a very challenging year with extreme financial, mental and emotional strains. Not to mention the strains on my personal relationships. It's been the best and worst year of my life. And thanks to friends and family who have stood by me and supported me through it all, I’m nearly there. I just need your help to finally get this thing off the ground.

If you can’t contribute, don’t worry about it. You are already a citizen of the Food Baby Nation!! But please share this on your Facebook page and email it to EVERYONE you know. I need one more boost and together we can finally make this happen.

Thank you in advance and God Bless.

For the record, Food Baby is currently being built by a very competent and conscientious team in South Holland, Illinois, just south of Chicago. Headed by Mick Walsh of Autofuture, I’m certain they are knocking it out of the park as we speak. Even though I’ve not seen the finished product, I’ve seen pictures of their progress and I can confidently give a glowing recommendation to anyone looking for a food truck builder.
