story:
My Pitch:

Below you'll find an overview of how you can help:

  • My name is Rickie Pauley. I have been in the food industry over 30 years. I have had a passion to serve good food to great people!
  • My campaign is simple, I have everything except refrigeration for my new food trailer!
  • Everywhere I go in this small community, I get asked the same question; When you cooking again for me? The chills spread down my spine and I say, Soon! That's where you come in! Your contributions will help me serve my good food to the great people around me!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is the skinny

 

$4,000 is needed for a sandwich prep table, refrigerator, freezer, and cold counter-top holding unit, That's it.

  • In return, I have set up some food perks and discounts on my food to share with you.
  • If we should not reach the entire goal, we will purchase at least a refrigerator and freezer.

The Impact

  • My little community has some of the most down to earth people I have ever met, they deserve a great place to eat that isn't just fast food.
  • Plus, this would allow me to get out to an even bigger area being mobile now!
  • All in all, your generosity in the form of contributions is needed to help make my dream a reality!
  • And I will be Thankful to every contributor.

Risks & Challenges

  • In addition to the needed refrigeration equipment, there are many other expenses, vehicle insurance, inspections, licensing, among other behind the scenes challenges.
  • Your generous contributions will allow me to give attention to these things without worrying where the funds will come from for the refrigeration equipment.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute for whatever reasons, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • AND Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Thank YOU!

Rickie Pauley
story_txt:
My Pitch:
Below you'll find an overview of how you can help:

My name is Rickie Pauley. I have been in the food industry over 30 years. I have had a passion to serve good food to great people!
My campaign is simple, I have everything except refrigeration for my new food trailer!
Everywhere I go in this small community, I get asked the same question; When you cooking again for me? The chills spread down my spine and I say, Soon! That's where you come in! Your contributions will help me serve my good food to the great people around me!

 

What We Need & What You Get
Here is the skinny
 
$4,000 is needed for a sandwich prep table, refrigerator, freezer, and cold counter-top holding unit, That's it.

In return, I have set up some food perks and discounts on my food to share with you.
If we should not reach the entire goal, we will purchase at least a refrigerator and freezer.


The Impact

My little community has some of the most down to earth people I have ever met, they deserve a great place to eat that isn't just fast food.
Plus, this would allow me to get out to an even bigger area being mobile now!
All in all, your generosity in the form of contributions is needed to help make my dream a reality!
And I will be Thankful to every contributor.


Risks & Challenges

In addition to the needed refrigeration equipment, there are many other expenses, vehicle insurance, inspections, licensing, among other behind the scenes challenges.
Your generous contributions will allow me to give attention to these things without worrying where the funds will come from for the refrigeration equipment.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute for whatever reasons, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
AND Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.Thank YOU!Rickie Pauley

story:
We have solved the two things everyone hates while enjoying a few cocktails, calories and hangovers.  

Triple 0 is a zero calorie, zero sugar cocktail mix that also helps you avoid a hangover!  

Hangovers are caused by dehydration, vitamin deficiencies and liver toxins.  So re-hydrate, replenish and detoxify with every drink of Triple 0.

Most folks opt for 0 calorie choices for their mixers...so why not use a great tasting one that also helps you feel better the morning after?  

We are giving away our cocktail mix and Triple 0 branded apparel to meet our $30k goal.  

Outside of getting a great tasting cocktail mix all we ask is for you to tell 10 friends about us and for them do the same.  Use Indiegogo sharing tools to get the word out, like us on Facebook.  We greatly appreciate everyone’s support!!

Check out our website & social media pages:

www.triple0mixer.com 

www.facebook.com/Triple0-871293629706861/

https://twitter.com/@Triple0Mixer

https://www.instagram.com/triple_0_cocktail_mix/

So what’s in Triple 0 that helps prevent hangovers?

  • Electrolytes – Replacing lost electrolytes is key in regulating hydration, which is the primary cause of a hangover.
  • Vitamin C – This important nutrient speeds up the metabolism of alcohol by the liver.  It also increases levels of glutathione, the body’s main antioxidant.
  • Vitamin B
    • Thiamine (B1) – prevents glutarate spikes which causes the pounding headache
    • Riboflavin (B2) – Regulates energy levels
    • Cobalamins (B12) – Controls important bodily functions and protects the nervous system.  A B12 deficiency leaves you feeling tired, lethargic and confused…sound familiar?
  • Prickly Pear Extract – Combats the effects of liver inflamation caused by alcohol
  • Milk Thistle – key antioxidant that protects vital liver functions, helps with liver repair and maintaining energy levels
  • N-acetyl Cysteine (NAC) – helps produce glutathione which breaks down acetaldehyde, a toxic byproduct caused by alcohol metabolism which is the main cause of many hangover symptoms.


                      FAQs

What is Triple 0?

  • A 0 calorie, 0 sugar cocktail mix that aids in the prevention of hangovers

Does it contain alcohol?

  • No, Triple 0 is a non-alcoholic cocktail mix

Does it work?

  • Yes!  Triple 0 helps prevent most symptoms of a hangover. 

How does it taste?

  • Like a million bucks!  A lemon flavored million bucks that is.

Does it keep me from becoming intoxicated?

  • No, Triple 0 does not prevent you from becoming intoxicated, nor does it lessen side effects or impairment while intoxicated. 

How do I consume it?

  • Use it as the mix when making vodka or other spirit drinks

How much do I need to drink in order for it to work?

  • Simply mix 2 parts Triple 0 to 1 part vodka for every drink.  The rest takes care of itself.  Please drink responsibly and in moderation.

What’s in it?

  • Triple 0 is packed with electrolytes for re-hydration, a proprietary blend of vitamins to replenish and antioxidants to cleanse your body.  All with a great lemon flavor!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Maya, I'm French and I'm 26 years old. I am married and I am the mother of a lovely baby boy. I have been interested by the catering industry since I discovered my mother's friend restaurant when I was young. Since that day I want to open a restaurant. I graduated from a Catering Business School at the age of 16 years old. I started my first internship at 14 in a restaurant. I have gained skills and I know how a restaurant works. I worked in gastronomic and Michelin star restaurants, discovering the tough rythme and the high level of professionalism of famous Chiefs. I worked in Nantes, Paris and London.

A while ago, I thought about how we could stop eating animals because I love them and care about them. My answer is THE CHOICE. I affirmed my convictions in London because the concept was more advanced in anglosaxon countries than in France. Therefore, I started to learn more about lifestyle. I'm vegetarian since 2012 but I don't consume cow milk because, according to me, cows are the most exploited and I definitely don't want to be a part of it. Sometimes, I eat some products from animals such as eggs but only organic.

My project is to create a franchise of Change your life in the world. For that, I need to start with my first restaurant which will be in NY, Manhattan. Afterwards, I would like to expand it in Florida, West Coast, Europe and in Asia. With this project I want to be part of the right sharing system with animals, that is to say we give them love and they give it to us. All of this with Love and not hate which is characterize by killing, massacre, profit, domination etc..

In addition, I plan to buy a farm because I will know that we will take care of my animals. For example: a chicken will give us her eggs, we will thank her with Love and Thankfulness. Concerning vegetables and fruits, they will be organic and harvest with Respect not thrown into a crate. I think that over consumption  destroys us and reinforces profit, which generates many negative things for our planet. 

By contributing to my great project you will participate in a transformation on the relationship that we have with food, animals and nature. This will create a new era for us and our future generations.

What We Need & What You Get

I need $480.000.

It's going to Start up funding

Legal & Consulting, G & A, Equipment, Rent, Security deposit, Renovation, Marking expenses, Salary ( 6months ). 

Start up Assets: Working capital, Inventory and food.

Change Your Life will be a Vegan & Vegetarian fast food restaurant located in Midtown, one of the most famous neighborhood of NYC. The restaurant will be based on the original idea of combining a vegan/vegetarian, organic and eco-friendly restaurant within a unique place. The creation of a unique and innovative FENG SHUI and VASTU atmosphere. People will be able to enjoy their food inside a contemporary and original restaurant or they will be able to take their meal to go.

The concept of the restaurant is to make people more sensitive concerning the food they eat, I want to prove them that organic food tastes better and is healthier. Moreover, our emphasis on organic ingredients is based on Change Your Life dedication to sustainable development. 

In the center of Manhattan's culinary hot spot, Change Your Life will be a place known to have the best Vegan/Vegetarian food. The restaurant will feature a trendy, fun and friendly place with comfortable furnishings and decor with soothing coral and white tones.

The products will be either on demand or inspired by classic recipes, composed with trendy ingredients. Change Your Life will only use fresh, organic and eco-friendly products to offer a healthy cuisine and a diverse, unusual menu. The ingredients will be determined based on seasonal specialities. Prices will be competitive with other restaurants in the area.

The service will be relaxed and friendly but professional. I will hire the best people available, and then train, motivate and encourage them to ensure we retain the most friendly and efficient staff possible.

If I don't reach all of my funds on Indiegogo, I will find the remaining balance elsewhere but my project will be the same.

The Impact

Thanks to my project, we will participate in a new era. 

My project can give an opportunity to people suffering from obesity and anorexia to find  balance. It will enable rushed people to eat with pleasure, sanely.

It will contribute to decrease animal massacres, over harvesting of produce and will give respect to seasonal products.

My project will prompt a factory reduction = water, electricity, non natural soil, pesticides, synthetic fertilizers, ammoniac, genetically modified which will participate in a decrease of global warming process = respect of the environment and nature and THAT IS OUR FUTURE. 

Risks & Challenges

I am a leader. I am professional, dynamic, persevering and creative. I'm a business woman.

story:
HAY there, meet SOOSHAY! 

hook:

a build-your-own, down-the-line model for sushi. 

bait:

I created SOOSHAY last year while trying to come up with a business idea in a college entrepreneurship class of mine. after finding a lack of quality sushi on-the-go, I started seeing a lot of opportunity. most people who like sushi don't have the time or money to go to a traditional Japanese restaurant. as a result, they normally settle for the pre-made rolls from a grocery store. however, not only are those rolls made with low-quality and often unhealthy ingredients, they sit out for up to ten hours a day, increasing the risk of a customer getting sick. in addition, the pre-made rolls lack any sort of personalization or fun, where a customer can create what they want from better ingredients. with the success of companies like Panera, Chipotle and Sweetgreen who are changing food to fit our lifestyles, I couldn’t believe there was little innovation happening with sushi. I took my passion for food along with my high-energy work ethic and thought why are we settling? I am inspired to change the way sushi is being done on-the-go and I hope to take your support with me.

in 2017, I founded SOOSHAY.

the idea? to bring personalization, freshness and convenience to sushi on-the-go.

the company:

SOOSHAY is a fast-casual sushi restaurant creating high-quality and made-to-order sushi using local, seasonal and sustainable ingredients whenever possible. SOOSHAY offers a limited menu of specially curated rolls that the consumer can choose from as well as a “build your own” option. Here, the customer can choose from a variety of fresh grains, fish, veggies, fruits and toppings to create the perfect roll. SOOSHAY’s mission is to help people live healthier through more meaningful experiences. To make meaningful experiences happen, SOOSHAY makes mindful food choices and embraces a transparent story around how the food came to be. SOOSHAY is dedicated to building long-term relationships with partners, including Boston fisherman, and customers through quality products, fair pricing, and a meaningful experience every visit.

your donation:

your support and donation will help me take my first steps in building this company and later being eligible to get funding through the Small Business Administration. 

about me: 

my name is erika rouleau. I was born and raised in a town called barre, vermont. vermont is known for many things including its beautiful green mountains, world-famous granite, sweet maple syrup...oh, and those two guys named ben and jerry. I was ever really known for one thing: cooking.

I remember the first time that I met the sport. I was seven years old and home sick from school. I was all wrapped up on the couch when a repair man came through the door to fix something on our gas stove. "playing hooky today?", he said jokingly. I responded "yes" after thinking he said 'hockey' which I really did play. confused and embarrassed, I started flipping through the channels to 'play it cool'. at that time, there were not a thousand channels. I think we had eighty, but the tv never went higher than channel 51 which was of course, disney channel. that day I got up to channel 58 and was introduced to the food network. for the first time, I watched a man throw salt into a pan screaming "BAM!" and my life was changed forever. ​

for the next ten years, I would spend more time watching channel 58 than anything else on television or in the theater combined. food network was the only thing that could get my spirited body and mind to sit still. it was the potential with the ingredients. it was the creativity and fun in the process. it was the sense of satisfaction when it was served. it gave me that sense of flow.

I didn't realize why until my father made a comment years later. though I didn't recognize it at the time, he realized that I never really watched emeril or paula or bobby or mario cook anything; I studied them. I was so focused that their tricks and trades became internalized and as a result, I knew spices, flavors, techniques etc. better than any other ten year old could.​

food has become a second nature to me. it's the outlet to where I escape and express myself. it makes me feel alive and that's why it's the only thing that I want to do for the rest of my life. 

fast-casual:

today’s $780 billion restaurant industry has four main categories including fast food (43.8%), fast-casual (7.7%), full-service and fine dining (together at 48.5%). fast-casual restaurants take the convenience of fast-food and the quality of full-service to offer better food for our fast-paced lives.

since 1999, the fast casual segment has grown nearly 500% and continues to grow globally at 10.4% while some build-your-own models post 22%. as the newest segment of the food industry and around $60 Billion worth of sales in 2016, the fast casual industry is expected to keep growing, reaching $67 Billion quickly by 2020. this growth comes from changes in consumer lifestyles such as busier lives, increased focus on health and a curiosity for transparency in food. overall, fast-casual has allowed people to eat quality food in a convenient way.

story:
ABOUT ERI'S CUPCAKES

Eri’s Cupcakes is a small baking business serving the Atlanta Metro Area, as well as shipping throughout the United States and abroad. We specialize in delicious cupcakes by the dozen, cupcakes bouquets, and cupcakes in a jar, made perfectly for any occasion. As customer needs and demands are constantly growing, we are looking to expand business, with hopes to eventually be housed in a storefront location here in Atlanta. We have provided services for holidays and special occasions, such as baby showers, birthday parties, and corporate events, and look forward to serving more in the community.

ABOUT THE OWNER

Eri’s Cupcakes is owned and operated by myself, Erica Porter. I moved to Atlanta, GA in 2012 to focus on a career in entertainment, specifically with a focus in professional dance and choreography. While in between jobs, and with a lot of downtime on my hands, I began baking delicious, decorative cupcakes on a regular basis as a way to keep myself busy. The rest as they say, is history.  I have found that my love for baking cupcakes, combined with the gift of adding my own decorative flare to things, is the perfect way to feed my sweet tooth, while also fulfilling my passion for art and creativity.  For the past 5 years I have been brainstorming and dreaming of making this a full time career. It is with your help and generous support that I will soon be able make my dream become my true reality.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION

Currently, Eri’s Cupcakes is operating out of a home based kitchen. Our goal is to raise $8,500 which will allow Eri’s Cupcakes to move into a commercial kitchen space. This will help supply the needs of our growing customer base, in a more efficient and timely manner. More specifically, your donation will help with:

Marketing and Promotions

Equipment and Supplies

Kitchen Rental Fees

Tastings and Events

Packaging, Postage, and Delivery Services

FUTURE GOALS

Our end goal is to eventually operate out of our own storefront location, as a bakery and coffee shop. In the meantime, your contribution would be a tremendous help in assisting us to get our business there someday. We hope to reach the amount of $8,500, however, if the goal is not reached at this time, we will utilize the funds raised to help with current and growing business.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Any amount you are able to donate helps, and would be greatly appreciated. If you are unable to provide a monetary donation, please assist in spreading the word about this campaign. Please share with as many people as possible. For those who can contribute, be sure to review the donation incentives that will be offered for your support. Thank you for your help in making this dream come true.

Sincerely,

Erica Porter-Eri’s Cupcakes

This will help supply the needs of our growing customer base, in a more efficient and timely manner. More specifically, your donation will help with:Marketing and PromotionsEquipment and SuppliesKitchen Rental FeesTastings and EventsPackaging, Postage, and Delivery ServicesFUTURE GOALSOur end goal is to eventually operate out of our own storefront location, as a bakery and coffee shop. In the meantime, your contribution would be a tremendous help in assisting us to get our business there someday. We hope to reach the amount of $8,500, however, if the goal is not reached at this time, we will utilize the funds raised to help with current and growing business.OTHER WAYS TO HELPAny amount you are able to donate helps, and would be greatly appreciated. If you are unable to provide a monetary donation, please assist in spreading the word about this campaign. Please share with as many people as possible. For those who can contribute, be sure to review the donation incentives that will be offered for your support. Thank you for your help in making this dream come true.Sincerely,Erica Porter-Eri’s Cupcakes

story:
Dry Land Distillers is a celebration of the people, places, and land of Colorado and the American West. Both of us (Nels and Aaron) grew up in the West, and we understand that the place we call home is a huge part of who we are.

Photo: Aaron Main and Nels Wroe, Founders. (Photo Credit: Luc A. Nadeau)

Several years ago, we were lucky enough to work on a yearlong magazine project to interview and profile new craft distilleries in Colorado and Wyoming. It was a delightful experience, and the people we met and the creativity and perseverance shown by these early entrepreneurs was inspiring. Aaron and I started tossing around the idea of our own distillery - and the idea stuck.

We began experimenting with different native and local ingredients such as prickly pear cactus, spruce trees, and a dry land, heirloom wheat to see if we could at least get a decent beer from the ingredients. We quickly realized there was huge potential in these ingredients – but they were also a huge challenge to work with. We stuck with it - and the results were incredible!

We enlisted the help of good friends of ours at Still Cellars in Longmont to help us convert our recipes into distilled spirits in a few test runs. We shared the results with friends and strangers to rave reviews – and Dry Land Distillers was born.

Today, we’re in the process of opening a craft distillery in the heart of downtown Longmont. Our spirits are influenced and inspired by Colorado’s lands and the American West’s iconic places. Our first production includes a dry land heirloom wheat whiskey, two unique prickly pear spirits, and a dry land spruce gin created with all Colorado native botanicals.

Photo: Fresh pressed prickly pear cactus fruit for Dry Land Distillers Prickly Pear Cactus Spirit, October 2017.

The journey to create these spirits is not easy – the ingredients are finicky, prickly, hard-to-find, expensive, and at times extremely frustrating. But the results are spectacular. Our spirits are an authentic representation of the land and the environments that created them - complex, rich, sweet, and earthy.

We hope you’ll join us in discovering the spirit of the land. 

How You Can Become Part of History

Your support in this campaign will ensure we have a strong launch in the spring of 2018. We're looking to raise $25,000 in our phase 1 campaign to help with the build out of the distillery.

Here are some important facts:

  • Our goal is to raise at least $25,000 - there is no cap, so we're trying to exceed this goal!
  • The funds will be used to pay for expenses in our build-out and launch, such as structural improvements, required equipment (e.g. glycol chiller), and raw ingredients for our spirits.
  • If we don't meet our goal - things get harder, but not impossible! We have funding to complete our build-out, but we need your support with our launch this spring.
  • We are in a unique position compared to most new distillery startups - we've already got our recipes tested and our first barrels aging thanks to the support of Still Cellars.
  • We did every bit of the process ourselves - sourcing the ingredients, mashes, fermentations, and distillations. Jason and Sadye let us use their equipment to get our first barrels ready, and we're already hosting tastings of our spirits in their tasting room.
  • We felt strongly that we wanted to have our first barrels ready in advance of launching our campaign to minimize any risk of production delays on our side.
  • Our reclaimed aspen wood coasters and t-shirts are already in stock for this campaign - another plus.

Photo: Aaron Main, master distiller, empties the parrot in our first production run of  our Dry Land Heirloom Wheat Whiskey at Still Cellars.

The Impact

Your support does more than just help to create a new craft distillery. You'll be supporting the vision for a Longmont community hub. The building we're leasing is one of the oldest historical landmarks in downtown, and will be home to a community co-working space, a live music and arts events venue, and a craft coffee shop and restaurant.

Some key points about our project:

  • Aaron and Nels are experienced professionals. Aaron is a master brewer and manages lab systems for a biotech company. Nels is an experienced product manager, has started a successful coffee shop, and has a long history working with small distillers in Colorado.
  • We have compiled a top-notch team to build our distillery, including a leading distillery architectural firm (Dalkita Architecture) and an experienced local contractor (LSE Builders Group).
  • Our collaboration with Still Cellars has given us a huge head start - our products are already in production. We will have revenue up to nine months earlier than most startup distilleries since we will have products available at our opening.

Photo: The future home of Dry Land Distillers at 471 Main Street in Longmont, Colorado. It's one of the oldest historic buildings in the heart of downtown.

Risks & Challenges

This is a big project! Starting a craft distillery is hard enough, but we've made it even more complex by designing products that require uncommon ingredients. Seems crazy, but the benefits significantly outweigh the risks.

Here are some things you'll want to evaluate as you look to support our campaign:

  • Risk to Production. Most craft distillery startups have a long lead time before they have products available. We've mitigated this risk by partnering with Still Cellars. Our first whiskey and prickly pear spirits are recipe-tested and in barrels - so we know we can fulfill our perks! 
  • New and unproven industry. Craft distilleries are new and are generally unproven. The industry is at a similar point that craft breweries were 20 years ago. We view this as a huge opportunity - getting in early means we have significant upside and growth potential.
  • Permitting and licensing. Our federal DSP license is in process, and we see no reason that our permit should be delayed; but we won't know for several months. We can't open our distillery without this permit. That's why we've collaborated with Still Cellars to ensure we can legally distill under a federally licensed distillery. This is a huge risk reduction - and a head start for us.
  • Level of funding. We're confident we have the funding necessary to open our distillery, but there is always a risk of unexpected costs and complications. Should we encounter unanticipated costs, it could reduce our ability to be well-prepared for marketing and operations. We're addressing this risk by building in plans for a phase 2 campaign, as well as having backup investors available should we need additional support.
  • Ingredients and suppliers. Our ingredients are uncommon, difficult to source, and hard to work with. However, our first batches have shown the value of investing in these ingredients - the spirits we produce are unlike anything available today. We are minimizing supplier risk by purchasing future contracts of key ingredients in advance, and we're looking to identify backup suppliers.

Photo: Dry Land Distillers first production batch of Mezcal-Style Prickly Pear  going into the still for distillation. 

About Our Perks

Our perks are a mix of shippable items (such as T-Shirts, Coasters, etc.) and non-shippable (such as reservations or vouchers). Remember, if you are purchasing perks that include reservations and vouchers, you are not purchasing alcohol - you are purchasing a voucher (think 'gift card') that can be redeemed in the future at our distillery.

Due to laws restricting the shipment of alcohol, we can't ship anything that contains alcohol. If you purchase a perk that includes a voucher and can't redeem it at the distillery, we'll work with you to figure out the best way for you to legally receive it.

We've had a number of requests to contribute to our campaign with no strings attached. If you want back Dry Land Distillers but don't want to receive a perk, we encourage you to choose a perk that includes vouchers for our first batch - you can choose to donate your vouchers to our Spirits for the Community campaign. We'll use the bottles as a fundraiser for local non-profit organizations in 2018. We'll let you know which organization receives your vouchers and make the donation in your name.

Any perks above $50 also includes your signature on our Founder's Wall. Any perks above $400 also gets your name etched onto our whiskey still!

You can make multiple pledges on Indiegogo using a single account. Just make sure you use the same email address and login, so we’ll know that all of your perks are meant to go to the same person. (This applies to any perk).

When you purchase any perk, we will send you an FAQ about our perks with a thank you card.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute - but that doesn't mean you can't help! Please spread the word about Dry Land Distillers and our campaign. The more people that know about us increases our chances for success. 

Here are a few ways you can help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out - tell your friends, family, and networks.
  • Visit our Website and sign up to stay in touch.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign with your social media networks - this is really important!
  • Encourage friends and family to fund our campaign - the spirits we've created are pretty incredible, and supporters will get a chance to try them with our first batches.

And finally - From all of us at Dry Land Distillers, THANK YOU!

Without your support, this journey becomes a lot harder (and a lot less fun).

Photo: The entire Dry Land Distillers family (Photo Credit: Luc A. Nadeau)

Questions or Comments?

Reach out to us anytime at hello@drylanddistillers.com. We will keep all backers up-to-date on our progress, and we're happy to give you a tour of our site anytime.

story:
Uncle Budsy's Barbecue Restaurant

Uncle Budsy's Barbecue Restaurant has been a local Food Truck company serving public events along with business and private clients in Portland and the surrounding towns for the last 19 years under the name Texas Barbecue. We are establishing a brick and mortar restaurant in the Lloyd District of Portland, Oregon to further capitalize on that history.

Established in 1998, the business has operated a catering kitchen and specialized in full-service catering and event planning for events in the region both at client sites, street fairs and at event spaces and halls. For most events, Uncle Budsy's Barbecue provides referrals to additional vendors, manages client rental equipment needs, and provides event management expertise on the day of the event.

With the legalization of recreational cannabis use in Oregon in 2014, we will be establishing a cannabis friendly restaurant under the name Uncle Budsy's Barbecue. Currently public consumption of cannabis and cannabis infused product is still not legal in Oregon but anticipation for that legalization within the next 5 years is expected. Until that time Uncle Budsy's will be a straight Texas Barbecue Restaurant. In the meantime the release of a Cannabis Cookbook and Infused Barbecue Sauces sold in retail cannabis stores and catered cannabis dinners in a private cannabis lounge here in Portland. These together will allow the connection with the cannabis industry until completely legal.

My name is Michael Davis and I have been a Medical Marijuana Patient for over 3 years but a fan of cannabis since a teenager back in Texas. The advent of legal cannabis here in Oregon has made some tremendous opportunities and challenges in this industry. 

Previously, I have been a stockbroker and investment banker with several successful companies. The financial landscape for cannabis businesses has been scattered with some successes but because of the illegal nature at the Federal level many of these businesses are having a difficult time with taxes and banking issues. It is that exact reason we have elected to enter this market as an ancillary, completely legal business.

Uncle Budsy's Barbecue will initially only sell traditional non infused barbecue from the restaurant with cannabis infused products offered through licensed retail cannabis stores. In addition we intend to hold monthly private cannabis dinners at our establishment. This until we can also have cannabis infused products on our public menu.

We intend to merge Uncle Budsy's into a NASDAQ publicly traded company along with our, cannabis friendly hotel - www.420HolidayHotel.com a cannabis lounge www.420Holiday.club and our ticket brokerage www.CannaTixx.com

There are many great things we expect to accomplish here in Portland with the cannabis industry and the progression of cannabis as both a medicine and a recreational product. Join us now as we launch the second leg of our entertainment complex. Uncle Budsy's Barbecue.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are raising $250,000 to fund the expansion of our existing Ticket Brokerage and the launch of our brick and mortar restaurant.  To see details of the requirements and expenditures please download our business plans for CannaTixx and Uncle Budsy's.
  • All contributors of at least $1,000 will receive a $25 gift certificate to Uncle Budsy's Restaurant.
  • All $5,000 contributors will receive an Uncle Budsy's T-shirt or Baseball Cap with the Uncle Budsy logo.
  • All $10,000 and up contributors will receive both Uncle Budsy's T-shirt and Baseball Cap with the Uncle Budsy logo.
  • If we do not reach our entire goal we will equally divide the proceeds between expansion of both CannaTixx and Uncle Budsy's.

The Impact

There is a definite need here in Portland to develop this cannabis friendly entertainment complex for the industry growth. In addition this will enhance the local economy and increase jobs in the area. To have a safe place for people to consume and enjoy cannabis is a definite plus for Portland

Risks & Challenges

Currently there is very limited public consumption of cannabis in Portland, Oregon. It is expected this will change in the next 3-5 years particularly with the direction that public referendums and the general public is clamoring for.  We expect to be at the forefront of this with Uncle Budsy's, our private cannabis friendly hotel and nightclub. When that day comes we can be completely open

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help right now as a contributor we ask you to:

  • Tell your friends and relatives about our campaign.
  • Like us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
  • Use the Indiegogo Share tools!
  • Visit Portland and come see us.

story:
Coolship Brewing Company

  • Cooled by air
  • 100% organic
  • Limited batch size
  • Natural bottle conditioned
  • High degree of craftsmanship
  • Fermented in open wooden barrels
  • Brewed with yeast, isolated from the nature

Claus Christensen, the man behind the project, is educated with a master degree in Biology and a PhD in Health Science, and work experience as a brewmaster in Denmark and the German Alps. He always was interested in brewing like his grandmother did before him. She was requested as a guest brewer, around the larger farms of the island of Fyen, Denmark, when higher quality beer was needed.

The idea to make beer, as it was done 200 years ago, became more and more consuming for Claus Christensen, since most beer are made in steel tanks and computerized equipment. He wished to go back to a time, where the brewmaster brewed the beer, by hand and could see the beer fermenting and could closely follow the brewing process. A small pilot brewery system in wood was designed and tested. Brewing on this small system in open wooden barrels, and cooled down by air and matured in bottles, as his grandmother before him.

To make everything as authentic as possible, a yeast ring was carved out of wood, and yeast from the nature, from his grandmothers island, was isolated and used for brewing.

Demo samples were giving to potential supporters, which instant liked the beer, kombucha and cider. The samples quickly made distributors and shops very interested. Now a larger system is needed, to make the demand for brewing orders.

We need your help to make this happen, we need people who believe that beer, brewed with love and respect for the traditions, taste better, when you know how it was made. This is brewed with organic grains, hops and yeast, not influenced by pesticides and chemicals. This is how beer was made, by people for the people.

Support us, be a part of the project, and follow the building of the wooden brewery in oak and craftsmanship, on YouTube and social media.

One of the ways to support us, is just for 245€ (291$), where you get a free bottle of everything new we make, the first 3 years. It can be a berliner weisse with raspberries, dry apple cider, kombucha, barrel aged imperial stout or other crazy things.

Or you can order you own batch, 500 liter (132gal), it is just 660 champagne bottles with your own private label, and a recipe which is designed for you.

Let’s make this happen, together.

 

 

A yeast ring, is a small wood puzzle, giving it a large surface. The purpose is to transfer/keep the yeast from batch to batch of fermentation. After the yeast cells are finished fermenting, the yeast cells settled slowly back on the ring. The ring is then taken up from the beer, and let to air-dry.

After being cooled down the beer is transferred to an open wood barrel, where a traditional yeast ring, is used for fermentation. After fermentation is finshed the beer matured cold or in barrels, until it is ready for kegs or bottles. The pressure is natural formed within 2 weeks, after bottling.

 

Visit us, see the brewery grow and fill a Growler with fresh beer, from one of our taps.

You can find us, on the island of Fynen, Denmark, at Hundslevvej 141, 5300 Kerteminde

This project is supported by Nyborg Castle and Museum for support of recreation of the brewing systems, according to historical records.

Furthermore, we have support from Sortebro Kro (Denmark), Rudolf Matis (Denmark), Bier-DeLux, Berlin (Germany), Gulating Ølutsalg Sandvika (Norway) and California Beverage Co(USA).

He wished to go back to a time, where the brewmaster brewed the beer, by hand and could see the beer fermenting and could closely follow the brewing process. A small pilot brewery system in wood was designed and tested. Brewing on this small system in open wooden barrels, and cooled down by air and matured in bottles, as his grandmother before him.To make everything as authentic as possible, a yeast ring was carved out of wood, and yeast from the nature, from his grandmothers island, was isolated and used for brewing.Demo samples were giving to potential supporters, which instant liked the beer, kombucha and cider. The samples quickly made distributors and shops very interested. Now a larger system is needed, to make the demand for brewing orders.We need your help to make this happen, we need people who believe that beer, brewed with love and respect for the traditions, taste better, when you know how it was made. This is brewed with organic grains, hops and yeast, not influenced by pesticides and chemicals. This is how beer was made, by people for the people.Support us, be a part of the project, and follow the building of the wooden brewery in oak and craftsmanship, on YouTube and social media.One of the ways to support us, is just for 245€ (291$), where you get a free bottle of everything new we make, the first 3 years. It can be a berliner weisse with raspberries, dry apple cider, kombucha, barrel aged imperial stout or other crazy things.Or you can order you own batch, 500 liter (132gal), it is just 660 champagne bottles with your own private label, and a recipe which is designed for you.Let’s make this happen, together.  A yeast ring, is a small wood puzzle, giving it a large surface. The purpose is to transfer/keep the yeast from batch to batch of fermentation. After the yeast cells are finished fermenting, the yeast cells settled slowly back on the ring. The ring is then taken up from the beer, and let to air-dry.After being cooled down the beer is transferred to an open wood barrel, where a traditional yeast ring, is used for fermentation. After fermentation is finshed the beer matured cold or in barrels, until it is ready for kegs or bottles. The pressure is natural formed within 2 weeks, after bottling. Visit us, see the brewery grow and fill a Growler with fresh beer, from one of our taps.You can find us, on the island of Fynen, Denmark, at Hundslevvej 141, 5300 KertemindeThis project is supported by Nyborg Castle and Museum for support of recreation of the brewing systems, according to historical records.Furthermore, we have support from Sortebro Kro (Denmark), Rudolf Matis (Denmark), Bier-DeLux, Berlin (Germany), Gulating Ølutsalg Sandvika (Norway) and California Beverage Co(USA).

story:
ABOUT THE CHEF

Chef Nicola Blaque has been dreaming of opening a Jamaican Inspired restaurant for over a decade. The Jerk Shack an idea of first-generation Jamaican American, Army Veteran, and now Chef, saw Jamaican food in a different light. Her idea? Delicious Jamaican inspired dishes served to the community. Chef Nicola is launching a new food concept in San Antonio, The Jerk Shack, with dreams of one day expanding the concept across Texas then nation wide.

Chef Nicola will bring the people of San Antonio a new artesian way of Jamaican Inspired cuisine, as well as telling a story based on cultural perspective and history. 

They say the chase is better than the catch, so if you’re willing to chase the dream, then join us in building a community and launching San Antonio’s first Jerk Shack.
 

FUNDING DETAILS 

With your support, we'll be able to put the money towards the following: 

Much-needed Woodburning Charboiler -- Chairs, Tables, Boilers, Burners, Trays, Outdoor renovation, etc.

Marketing Materials -- Signs, Merchandise, Physical & Digital Advertising

R&D -- New Flavors, New Dishes,

Raising $20,000 will allow Chef Nicola to finish small renovations on a historic building in San Antonio along with key kitchen equipment and outdoor lighting. Chef Nicola was very specific about how the Jerk Chicken is prepared and creating the atmosphere of the restaurant with a goal of bringing a similar Jerk Shack from her home in Mandeville, Jamaica keeping it authentic as possible.

When we exceed the goal, funds will be reinvested into The Jerk Shack's second location or a Food Truck. The Jerk Shack has big plans but this is only the beginning. We can't do it without you and looking forward to serving you fresh new Jamaican inspired cuisine. 

THE PERKS 

Chef Nicola and her marketing team made the perks something you can't say no to. Understanding everyone has a budget and not always able to give money like they would like she tired the perks so you can give where you most comfortable. Some LEVELS of perks are set up to INSTANTLY DOUBLE YOUR INVESTMENT at The Jerk Shack. Chef Nicola has give you the option to be the first to try her "Fried Jerk Wings and Mac"  or possible the"Braised Oxtails with rice and peas" . If you want authentic dishes with a new Culinary flare be the first to bite into he "Ackee Saltfish egg rolls".  If being the first to try the food doesn't excite you she has other perks from Jerk Bucks to spend at Jerk Shack and even 20% Lifetime customer discounts. 



If the Jerk Shack misses its goal, the funds will be used and stretched as far as possible to make the best possible launch. It may cause longer wait times without key equipment in the kitchen and the Jerk Shack renovation may be postponed, and we will still continue with offered perks and soft opening party. Chef Nicola is confident her campaign will reach it's goal and excited to make her supporters proud.

 

Dates

Soft Opening (Founder Only) May 4th starting at 6pm
GRAND OPENING May 11th starting at 6pm 

The Impact

San Antonio has recently been recognized as a food capitol, however there is a lack of Jamaican food and the variety of restaurants aren't spread across the map. Chef Nicola is ready to break away from the norm and create her own path. With the lack of Caribbean options in San Antonio she understands there is a want/need/demand for The Jerk Shack. When Chef Nicola Debut the "Jerk Chicken and Pineapple waffle topped with Pineapple relish drizzled with habanero maple syrup and a option of avocado puree and crispy plantain chips" the room was in aww. Needless to say her leaks in the market has been  a major success and she can't wait to go full throttle.

Risks & Challenges

It'll be challenging to open a Jamaican restaurant in a city where 80% of the people have never tried Jamaican food. The flip side to that coin is once they like it there aren't many Jamaican options in the city. To climb over a few humps Chef Nicola understand exposure is the key and will won't leave no stones unturned in her marketing venture.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this campaign with someone 
  • LIKE LIKE LIKE OUR FACEBOOK
  • Follow us on Instagram (WE FOLLOW BACK) 
  • Come out to the JERK SHACK GRAND OPENING PARTY MAY 11th @ 6pm

story:
Bismillahirrahmanirrahim - Im Namen Allahs des Allerbarmers des Barmherzigen 

Assalaamu alejkum we rahmetullahi we barakatuh liebe Geschwister im Diin!

Kurzbeschreibung

  • Wer sind wir? Wir sind ein junges Team von Muslimen  in Graz, der 2. größten Stadt Österreichs, aus verschiedensten Nationen mit einem gemeinsamen Ziel: "Die Verbreitung der Botschaft des Islams und der Aufklärung."  
  • Was machen wir? Wir haben vor kurzem alhamdulillah eine  DAWA- Organisation mit dem Namen: "TO THE ROOTS" gegründet mit der Absicht dieser Mission nachzugehen in jeder Art und Form der Dawa, insbesonderer der Streetdawa, der Einladung zum Islam in der Öffentlichkeit.
  • Warum liegt uns das am Herzen? :
  1. Allah sagt im edlen Quran in der ungefähren Übersetzung:  "Rufe zum Weg deines Herrn mit der Weisheit und der guten Ermahnung, und streite mit ihnen mit dem, was am besten ist, - dein Herr, Er weiß ja am besten, wer fehlgeht von Seinem Weg, und Er weiß am besten Bescheid über die Rechtgeleiteten. Sura 16 Vers 125  (Ahmad v. Denffer) 
  2. Der Gesandte Allahs Muhammed sallallahu alaihi wasallam sagte: „Verkündet von mir, auch wenn es nur ein Vers ist.“ Saheeh Al Bukhari
  • Unsere zukünftigen Produkte in schaa Allah:
  1. Dokumentation der Streetdawa
  2. Schahada - Islamannahmen
  3. Kurze Erinnerungsvideos jeglicher Art - Nasiha
  4. Unterschied zwischen dem Islam und allen anderen Weltanschauungen
  5. islamische/muslimische Kurzvideos und Filme zu verschiedenen Themen wie zum Beispiel : "Wie nimmt man die Gebetswaschung - Wudu?"
  6. Vorträge von  islamischen Gelehrten und Predigern filmen zum Beispiel im Dienste der Moscheen
  7. Kurze Antworten zu häufig gestellte Fragen zum Islam
  8. Für weitere Ideen sind wir immer offen :)
  9. ...

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

  • Wir brauchen ca. 1600 € damit wir eine gute Kamera mit qualitativer Ausrüstung kaufen können in schaa Allah (Die Preise für eine gute Kamera für diesen Zweck beginnen bei ca 1200€ und gehen bis ca. 10.000€ und noch weiter, jedoch reicht das in schaa Allah für den Anfang)
  • Auch wenn du EINEN EINZIGEN 1€ spendest sind wir glücklich, dankbar und zufrieden :) , denn deine Aufrichtigkeit und dein Ikhlas sind uns viel wichtiger!
  • Warum wir so viel Geld ausgeben möchten ist, deswegen da das für die Sache Allahs ist und nichts privates oder geschäftliches ist, und das verdient nur das beste Equipment
  • Der wohl bekannteste Hadith (Überlieferung; Mz.: Ahadith), der diese Art der Sadaqa erwähnt, ist der folgende: Der Prophet Muhammad (s*) sagte sinngemäß: „Wenn der Mensch stirbt, wird er (vom Verdienst) seiner Taten getrennt, außer in drei (Fällen): eine Sadaqa, die fortdauert (Sadaqa dscharija), Wissen, das Nutzen bringt, und ein aufrechter Nachkomme, der für ihn bittet“ (Muslim). 
  • Man stelle sich vor ein einziger Mensch nimmt den Islam an oder beginnt zu beten subhanallah?! Man hat in schaa Allah in jeder seiner guten Taat seinen Anteil der Belohnung auch nach seinem Tod bis zum jüngsten Tag

Die Folgen

Was kannst du mit deiner Spende bewirken ? :

  • Die Kamera ist ein gutes Hilfsmittel für dich und andere Muslime in schaa Allah mit Allahs Barmherzigkeit das Paradies betreten zu dürfen 
  • Das Nichtmuslime den Islam annehmen 
  • Nicht praktizierende Muslime zum Islam zurückfinden
  • Nichtmuslime ein besseres Bild vom Islam bekommen

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Die Risiken und Hindernissen, die auf diesem Weg zum Erreichen unseres Ziels sind offen:

  • Ihr werdet ganz gewiß in eurem Besitz und in eurer eigenen Person geprüft werden, und ihr werdet ganz gewiß von denjenigen, denen die Schrift vor euch gegeben wurde, und denen, die (Allah etwas) beigesellen, viel Beleidigendes zu hören bekommen. Doch wenn ihr standhaft und gottesfürchtig seid, so gehört dies gewiss zur Entschlossenheit (in der Handhabung) der Angelegenheiten.
  • Deswegen gehen wir trotz allem diesen Weg bis zum Ende... in schaa Allah
  • Diese Herausforderungen können in schaa Allah mit Geduld und Standhaftigkeit bewältigt  werden

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Wenn du  keinen finanziellen Beitrag leisten kannst, das heißt aber nicht, dass du nicht helfen kannst:

  • Bitte darum, dass du über unsere Kampagne sprichst und sie so bekannt machst.
  • mach bitte Dua-Bittgebete für unseren Erfolg und dass Allah uns Ikhlas Aufrichtigkeit gibt
  • beginne selber in deiner Stadt, Gemeinde Dorf Dawa zu machen auf jeglicher Art! Organisiere dich mit anderen Muslimen! 

Das war es auch schon. Möge Allah dich reichlich belohnen mit der höchsten Stufe des Paradieses Firdaws! Allahumma Amin! ;)

story:
Over the past three years, we sought to make our UK-based healthy eatery, Emily’s, as environmentally friendly as possible. Shockingly enough, we discovered that for the 10,000 (and counting) litres of dairy milk we served to ordering customers last year, over 10 million litres of water were required along the production process of that milk.

10 million litres/year from one small cafe!

This led us to pursue an alternative which might require less water and land mass to produce, result in less greenhouse gas emissions, but still rival dairy milk on taste, nutritional value and heat stability (to beautifully display the barista’s skills).

We wondered how can we make our everyday coffee choices just a little bit more sustainable, more sensible, while keeping in mind that our choices, big or small, can and will affect the options of future generations.

The answer was strong and clear for us: a heat-stable, beautifully textured, delicious-tasting oat milk. 

A non-dairy milk to be proud of, rather than simply accepted.

We are developing ōti: a sustainable, liquid oat-based milk that can not only handle the high temperatures needed for stretching and steaming milk but rival (if not supercede) dairy on taste, texture, and nutritional quality. 

ōti is Māori for oats. Pronounced "oo-tee."

We want to be bold and join other conscious New Zealanders to minimise our dependence on dairy milk, yet still savour a deliciously smooth flat white. New Zealand needs craft mylk and micromylkeries to ensure we continue enjoying our morning coffee whilst reducing any ugly consequences on our environment.

Late 2018, Peter accepted a position in the Edmund Hillary Fellowship (more in the FAQ section) that grants him access to other entrepreneurs, investors, and business incubators to help support in later stages of this project.

  • Oats are a fantastic nutritional choice to help improve bodily health, be it to lower cholesterol or increase Vitamin A, C or fibre intake
  • Growing oats actually revitalises local soil, ensuring many years of oat growing
  • Less demand on water sources and less land needed to grow than other coffee base alternatives
  • We're responding to the call of the UN's No. 12 Sustainable Development Goals: Responsible Consumption & Production
  • By 2050, there'll be 9 billion people on Earth, doubling the demand of food. The increased global demand for dairy will result in growing pressure on our natural resources
  • In 2017, the OECD warned New Zealand that reliance on primary industries is detrimental to its future international green reputation

Once the standard barista oat milk is well-accepted, we aim to introduce other pre-blend options for baristas to work their magic.

New Zealand.

The South Island has a beautiful trifecta for oat farming: soil composition, temperature and rainfall, making it equally as ideal for oat growing as anywhere in Europe. We want to harvest that potential to be a catalyst of change in the coffee environment, starting in the South Island.

We want New Zealand to be the first nation where oat milk is the standard option, the new “normal”, when ordering a coffee. Imagine if we were able to lower the dependence on the dairy industry in such a delicious way that the rest of the world joined in too? What a sustainable, proud way to experience coffee.

Our focus is primarily New Zealand, but once successful in the Aotearoa coffee world, we have a long-term vision of expanding to Asia and Australia whilst growing our product offering to include oat-based ice-cream, cheese and cream - it’s time for more dairy-alternatives to become household staples.

After completing a competition patent search with James & Wells in Auckland and working with several eco-conscious companies in New Zealand, these raised funds will tremendously help us complete:

In this stage, the food technologists at FoodSouth, Christchurch, will take our idea and wish-list to the laboratory to ensure we’ll have a product commercially safe and sound for the market.

Indiegogo Fees: 8% + 30p per contribution to graciously allow us to use their crowdfunding platform.


If you're willing and able, please may you:

  • click the "BACK IT" button to contribute financially without a perk
  • select a "Perk" to the right
  • share our mission and this page with your friends

If everyone who followed our cafe, Emily's (@emilystruro), on social media were able to back even just £1, we would surpass our goal!

**If there is a "perk" you would like shipped, please contact us directly at either plmaher11@gmail.com or hello@emilystruro.com**

We could not have opened our cafe in Truro, Cornwall without your previous support and would love to journey with you again with this exciting adventure!

 

  • Cafe: If you're in Cornwall, head to Emily's in Truro (@emilystruro) for a delicious breakfast, brunch and/or lunch! You'll love the team behind the counter!
  • Branding: Design by Friends (@designbyfriends), best branding company in the South West by far. Based in Penryn and offering a limited free consultancy sessions - quick! 
  • Coffee: Olfactory (@olfactorycoffee), Penryn-based coffee roaster. Their delicious K.O. coffee is served at Emily’s and many many eateries in Cornwall
  • Photography: Sam Sherring (@sam_sherring) & Jaimie Sutton (@jampotted), talented and aspiring photographers

Imagine if we were able to lower the dependence on the dairy industry in such a delicious way that the rest of the world joined in too? What a sustainable, proud way to experience coffee.Our focus is primarily New Zealand, but once successful in the Aotearoa coffee world, we have a long-term vision of expanding to Asia and Australia whilst growing our product offering to include oat-based ice-cream, cheese and cream - it’s time for more dairy-alternatives to become household staples.After completing a competition patent search with James & Wells in Auckland and working with several eco-conscious companies in New Zealand, these raised funds will tremendously help us complete:In this stage, the food technologists at FoodSouth, Christchurch, will take our idea and wish-list to the laboratory to ensure we’ll have a product commercially safe and sound for the market.Indiegogo Fees: 8% + 30p per contribution to graciously allow us to use their crowdfunding platform.If you're willing and able, please may you:
click the "BACK IT" button to contribute financially without a perk
select a "Perk" to the right

share our mission and this page with your friends
If everyone who followed our cafe, Emily's (@emilystruro), on social media were able to back even just £1, we would surpass our goal!**If there is a "perk" you would like shipped, please contact us directly at either plmaher11@gmail.com or hello@emilystruro.com**We could not have opened our cafe in Truro, Cornwall without your previous support and would love to journey with you again with this exciting adventure! 

Cafe: If you're in Cornwall, head to Emily's in Truro (@emilystruro) for a delicious breakfast, brunch and/or lunch! You'll love the team behind the counter!

Branding: Design by Friends (@designbyfriends), best branding company in the South West by far. Based in Penryn and offering a limited free consultancy sessions - quick! 

Coffee: Olfactory (@olfactorycoffee), Penryn-based coffee roaster. Their delicious K.O. coffee is served at Emily’s and many many eateries in Cornwall

Photography: Sam Sherring (@sam_sherring) & Jaimie Sutton (@jampotted), talented and aspiring photographers

story:
Git Your Groove With Groovie Smoothies!

 

Many people today, probably even people you know & love, are suffering from physical, mental, and emotional illnesses brought on by the S.A.D (Standard American Diet). Food diets heavy in animal protein, high-fat dairy products, eggs, and processed foods encourage diseases like  Cancer, Cardiovascular Disease, Hypertension, High Cholesterol, Arthritis, Auto-Immune Disease, Obesity, Type II Diabetes, Addiction, Anxiety/Depression and more. These ailments plague our family and friends with horrific side-effects from doctor-prescribed pharmaceuticals and place costly burdens of medical bills and unnecessary stress on themselves and their caregivers. 

                  

Most people also do not realize that a shift in eating habits is the low-risk and cost-effective treatment they have been looking for. 

Hi guys!! My name is Zalaha (call me Zee, all my friends do!) and it is my passion to cultivate awareness of the healing powers of plant food, and the undeniable benefits of eliminating meat from the diet. Research shows that plant-based diets greatly reduce high occurrences of BMI (Body Mass Index), blood pressure, blood sugar, cholesterol, and also eliminate the need to use toxic medications.                                                                              

 

My journey into plant-based living began in 2015 when I suffered from one of the greatest tragedies of the human experience: my twenty-three-year-old son, Joshua, was murdered. I suffered tremendously. When my grief became debilitating, taking control of my mind & body and destroying my soul, I was challenged to fight for my life by a childhood friend, just as I was ready to give it all up.

To prepare for this battle, I began weight training with my husband and doing raw food cleanses that strengthened me physically and gave me proper nourishment. After a month of overwhelmingly positive effects, I decided to commit to a plant-based lifestyle and GROOVIE SMOOTHIES was born.

  

GROOVIE SMOOTHIES is the most convenient and delicious way to incorporate more live, raw, and whole foods into your diet. The smoothies help achieve wellness by nourishing the body with a colorful variety of fresh and organic whole fruits & vegetables, blended velvety smooth and sweetened by nature.                                     

        

I am reaching out to you and campaigning to raise funds to open and operate THE GROOVE THEORY CAFE, a vegan smoothie cafe in Atlanta, Ga. In addition to smoothies, THE GROOVE THEORY CAFE will offer fresh, delicious, and affordable whole food eats & treats while educating customers on the benefits of maintaining a plant-based diet. We will deliver recipes that instruct on multiple ways to incorporate healing fruits and vegetables into your daily lives! 

Remember this: "Every time you eat, you're either fighting disease or feeding it!”

 

While life requires balance, each wellness modality serves its respective purpose to achieve total body alignment. However, the true power is in the plants! I credit the adherence to a plant-based lifestyle as the major influence in the joy and overall well-being I experience today. GROOVIE SMOOTHIES will help you achieve a more nourished body and THE GROOVE THEORY CAFE will offer the holistic support needed to maintain your improved body and spirit!                                                                

One of the most important things I've learned along this journey is that despite any suffering that occurs, you can HEAL and GROW through your experience! You, too, can go on to live a beautiful, joyous life — a life on purpose — Once you Git Your Groove. 

With your funding help, I take GROOVIE SMOOTHIES out of my kitchen, and into a community that has no immediate access to nutritious and delicious alkaline- healing food and drinks. Health is wealth and a natural birthright that no one should be denied because of a lack of knowledge or inaccessibility.                                                                                                                                                                                   

Achieving my initial goal of $25,000 will allow me to secure a lease on a commercial restaurant space, complete all licensing requirements, purchase costly restaurant equipment and supplies, such as a cooler, a freezer, additional blenders & juicers, display cases, food & beverage packaging, labels, etc.

 

    

In the event that my funding goal is not met, rest assured that all funds received will be used ​for the continued advancement of the GROOVIE SMOOTHIE/GROOVE THEORY CAFE'S mission of to promote awareness of the healing benefits of a plant-based lifestyle!

story:
Gray Jay 

Gray Jay is a passion project. The dream began three years ago when Dominique and Devon decided to open their own restaurant. They didn't know how; they didn't know where; but now they do.  Along the way they met a lot of extraordinary people and one of them was Charles-Eric.  With his "joie de vivre" and his natural talent for making people feel completely at ease, he quickly became an essential part of the team! Finally, they found the perfect space: small, cozy and perfectly situated on bustling Preston Street! Since then, they have worked tirelessly to make their dream come true.  They have risen to each new challenge in creating the space - from framing to woodworking, grinding cement to refinishing an antique refrigerator, nothing has dampened their enthusiasm for this new venture.   With the grand opening anticipated for early summer 2019, they need a little help to cross the finish line.  This is where you can make a difference and get involved.   

What We Need & What You Get

We've encountered some unexpected bumps and we need to raise $20,000 to help us finish our project.  Therefore, we are offering an exclusive pre-sale event of the Gray Jay experience.  We had already formed a very special bond with our collaborator Atelier Trema, as well as having started preparing some of the foraged teas that will accompany our dining experience. 

You can choose to contribute by taking home simple things like wholesome candles, herbal teas, or going all out and springing for a full evening of dining with us or even wine for a year!! In doing so, you are telling us that YES,  we want to encourage a small restaurant that reinvests in the community by only purchasing local!  YES, we believe in you and want to come for an evening.  YES, we support dreamers,  who dare to create a dining experience that is something completely different for Ottawa,  and play by their own rules.  

The Impact

We at Gray Jay are very conscious of the impact the food industry has on the environment. With climate change reaching a boiling point and contributing to the increasing natural disasters every year (some of us have been flooded out of our homes recently!),  we believe that we need to rethink how to consume for our future to be brighter.  We are committed to 100% Canadian fruit, vegetables and proteins.  Always. We are committed to local farmers and our community and to following the seasons.  We are committed to reinvesting every dollar into small producers that will feed our establishment with what you, the guests, consume.   Over the years we have gotten to know the people who grow and raise our food and we think that the relationships we cherish are the backbone necessary to create a brighter and more sustainable future .  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Are you tight on cash  cannot help us financially right now? No worries, here is how you can still make a difference for us!
  • SHARE SHARE SHARE!! knowledge is power and the more people know about us, the more chances we have to reach our goal.  
  • ALSO use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Here's The Deal

What we are doing is simple. We want the Brewheim family to grow so we are offering an exclusive pre-launch opportunity to "Join The Family". Those who do will be given a Brewheim gift card worth up to 110% more than their donation to the campaign to purchase Brewheim beer and merchandise. 

That's it... No lame perks. Just way more beer and merch for your money. 

Your Options

  • The Rich Uncle ($1,000 donation; limit 100):
    You’ll receive a $2,100 Brewheim Gift Card, that’s 110% more beer and merch
     
  • The Uncle ($500 donation; limit 500): 
    You’ll receive a $1,000 Brewheim Gift Card, that’s 100% more beer and merch
     
  • The Cousin ($200 donation; limit 500): 
    You’ll receive a $380 Brewheim Gift Card, that’s 90% more beer and merch 
     
  • Beer Bro ($100 donation; limit 1000): 
    You’ll receive a $180 Brewheim Gift Card, that’s 80% more beer and merch
     
  • Beer Buddy ($50 donation; unlimited): 
    You’ll receive a $85 Brewheim Gift Card, that’s 70% more beer and merch
     
  • Beer Me ($25 donation; unlimited): 
    You’ll receive a $40 Brewheim Gift Card, 60% more beer and merch

Our Brewer

Brewmaster Derek Wasak

Our über talented Brewmaster Derek Wasak started his career with Boston Beer Works and Smuttynose on the East Coast before seizing an opportunity to work at Stone Brewing Company. Most recently, relocating to the central coast to open Solvang Brewing’s new Lompac production facility before calling Brewheim home. Derek is always striving for consistency, quality, and great flavor in a vast array of beer styles. Originally hailing from Boston, Derek studied brewing in Munich, Germany at Siebal and is also a certified Cicerone.

Our Founders

Brewheim is the brainchild of Dan Ward and Eric Ferguson. With Dan's extensive background in brew pub ownership and Eric's avid homebrewing, it was a no-brainer for them to come together and create Brewheim. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not a beer drinker? That's a-ok, I bet you have a family member or friend that is. This is an exceptional gift for the beer enthusiast and casual alike. Why not show someone special how much you love them? 

Additionally, we are so excited to launch, we've created an extra perk called Dollar Beer For A Year. That's right -- 7 lucky Southern Californians will get a $1 beer, per day, for 365 days after we open. All you have to do is be 21+, and live within 100 miles of Anaheim. Check it out!

www.dollarbeerforayear.com

 

UPDATE #1 - (5/18/18)

Thank you to all who have already joined the Brewheim Family thus far -- we can't wait to welcome all of you trailblazers through the door and get the taps flowing. You've already secured what's likely to be the best offer on beer we will ever present. Congrats!

We've received so many inquiries about our progress and the space itself, and we want to keep you in the loop.

Construction Progress

A month ago in mid-April, our fermenters, brite tanks, mash and lauter tuns were picked up from their sides and raised into place where they will permanently reside. They've been bolted into place and supporting equipment began to be assembled.

From there, framing, insulation, basic plumbing and electrical have all been completed. After our framing has been inspected, remaining drywall through the facility will be completed.
 
Steam and glycol lines that keep beers at perfect temperatures throughout the brewing process are being installed as we speak. Gas lines are also going in now. Essentially, the entire brewhouse is "full steam" ahead and getting closer to finish.
 
The next phase will have us installing the iconic grain silo out front of the brewery, and we'll move into the aesthetic portions: interior, finishes, outdoor patio build out, and finally, landscaping. This is just a render, but it should give you an idea of how awesome it's going to be to relax on the patio:
 
 

Dollar Beer For A Year: Winner #1

You guys are crazy:
 
 
While 2000+ entries is nothing to balk at, it's the smallest that number is going to be with 43 days still left. The chance of winning the most satisfying beer prize ever is highest early on, so good luck to you early birds. Some of you are doing serious work enlisting your friends, getting 10+ entries. Bravo.
 
Our first winner of 7, the extremely lucky and visibly stoked:
Stephen Hoganson
 
Congratulations brother! Welcome to the Family.

1 down, 6 to go... May the suds be with you. 
Remember that each friend that you initiate gets you an extra entry as well.
 
 

UPDATE #2 - (5/30/18)

Bolts, Big Bolts.

The brewhouse is coming together at rapid pace and literally being bolted and welded into place. It's amazing how fast things come together in the home stretch. Last week, head brewer, Derek Wasak, gave a tour through the facility to show all of the awesome equipment going into our space. Watch the facility walkthrough:

 

Dollar Beer For A Year: Winner #2

Our second winner of 7, the extremely lucky and casually cool:
Kyle Slominksi
 
Congratulations, dude! Welcome to the Family.

2 down, 5 to go... May the suds be with you. 
Thus far, both of our randomly drawn winners have had multiple entries. Remember that each friend that you initiate gets you extra entries!
 

FAQ

We've been taking note of all the incoming questions about the brewery and the Pre-Launch Campaign. We've put them all below, but if you have a question that isn't found here, as always, feel free to reach out.

When is Brewheim opening and what are your hours?
The brewery is opening mid-late summer. We haven't released the concrete grand opening date yet just to add some leeway for final permits and construction bits. You will be sure to hear from us when the day is announced!

Why are you doing the Pre-Launch Campaign?
Simply put: to hook you up. We want to spread the word about Brewheim opening up and reward our early followers with crazy good deals -- more than double your money in some cases. Of course, with the contributions we're able to jump into some cool stuff like small batch releases and new merch a little earlier, but all of that will happen regardless.

Does the Pre-Launch Campaign contribution goal impact opening?
No. Brewheim Beer Makers is deep into development and opening in mere months, no matter what. All of the campaign perks are a "thank you" to our early supporters and the contributions let us do cool stuff sooner.

What kind of beers is Brewheim going to make?
All of the beers. We'll have a little bit of it all from your crushable German-inspired lagers to your barrel-aged adjunct imperial stouts and sours. That said, our taps will expand over time as wood-aged beers, collaborations and special releases will gain momentum once we open. We will announce 5 beers that will be on tap for the grand opening in the next week, so keep your eyes peeled.

Will the tap room be dog-friendly?
Yes! We are very dog-friendly and actually have our very own brewery dog, Barley. She's got her own Instagram account (@barleysbuddies) and will be proudly showcasing other Brewheim pups that cruise by.
 

UPDATE #3 - (6/8/18)

Guaranteed Sud Activity:

We've been asked more times than we can count about what's going to be on tap -- good job guys ?? While the 32 taps of delicious suds are poised to grow immensely over time, Head Brewer, Derek Wasak, walks us through some of the core beers that will be available right away starting this summer. Other treats will be available, but you can count on this.

 

Dollar Beer For A Year: Winner #3

Our third winner of 7, looking like he knew he was the winner of 365 beers from the start:
Mike Shyu
 
Congratulations, dude! Random number generation and beer gods have both blessed you. Welcome to the Family.

3 down, 4 to go... May the suds be with you. 
 
All three of our randomly drawn winners have had multiple entries. Remember that each friend that you initiate gets you extra entries!
 

UPDATE #4 - (6/26/18)

 

Recent Brewhouse Updates:

The brewery is making big strides. Currently:

  • Finished almost all of the hard piping (steam, glycol, etc.)
  • All grain handling piping and equipment
  • Framing and drywall are installed
  • Tile and brick up next to outfit the tasting room and bathrooms

Once a final electrical upgrade is complete, we will be flicking the switch and powering up the brewhouse. You best believe we'll be capturing that moment to show all of you the inaugural brews that will be flowing for the grand opening this summer!


Dollar Beer For A Year: Winner #4 + #5

We've got a double-whammy this week. Our fourth and fifth winners of 7:
 
A fan of a particular drink and sports team we heartily approve of:
Winner #4: Gus V.
 
And another beer-loving Anaheim native:
Winner #5: Brett G.
 
Congratulations to you both! Your entries and random number generation hath blessed you both on this day. Welcome to the Family.

5 down, 2 to go... May the suds be with you. 
 
This is the last week to enter for a chance to win the best beer prize in SoCal. Remember that each friend that you initiate gets you extra entries!
 

Cheers. Welcome HEIM!

Stay tuned for more updates, and visit our social pages for the most up-to-date posts:
http://instagram.com/brewheim
http://facebook.com/brewheimbeer
