Our second winner of 7, the extremely lucky and casually cool:
Kyle Slominksi

 
Congratulations, dude! Welcome to the Family.2 down, 5 to go... May the suds be with you. 
Thus far, both of our randomly drawn winners have had multiple entries. Remember that each friend that you initiate gets you extra entries!
 
FAQ
We've been taking note of all the incoming questions about the brewery and the Pre-Launch Campaign. We've put them all below, but if you have a question that isn't found here, as always, feel free to reach out.When is Brewheim opening and what are your hours?The brewery is opening mid-late summer. We haven't released the concrete grand opening date yet just to add some leeway for final permits and construction bits. You will be sure to hear from us when the day is announced!Why are you doing the Pre-Launch Campaign?Simply put: to hook you up. We want to spread the word about Brewheim opening up and reward our early followers with crazy good deals -- more than double your money in some cases. Of course, with the contributions we're able to jump into some cool stuff like small batch releases and new merch a little earlier, but all of that will happen regardless.Does the Pre-Launch Campaign contribution goal impact opening?No. Brewheim Beer Makers is deep into development and opening in mere months, no matter what. All of the campaign perks are a "thank you" to our early supporters and the contributions let us do cool stuff sooner.What kind of beers is Brewheim going to make?All of the beers. We'll have a little bit of it all from your crushable German-inspired lagers to your barrel-aged adjunct imperial stouts and sours. That said, our taps will expand over time as wood-aged beers, collaborations and special releases will gain momentum once we open. We will announce 5 beers that will be on tap for the grand opening in the next week, so keep your eyes peeled.Will the tap room be dog-friendly?Yes! We are very dog-friendly and actually have our very own brewery dog, Barley. She's got her own Instagram account (@barleysbuddies) and will be proudly showcasing other Brewheim pups that cruise by. UPDATE #3 - (6/8/18)
Guaranteed Sud Activity:
We've been asked more times than we can count about what's going to be on tap -- good job guys ?? While the 32 taps of delicious suds are poised to grow immensely over time, Head Brewer, Derek Wasak, walks us through some of the core beers that will be available right away starting this summer. Other treats will be available, but you can count on this.

 
Dollar Beer For A Year: Winner #3
Our third winner of 7, looking like he knew he was the winner of 365 beers from the start:
Mike Shyu

 
Congratulations, dude! Random number generation and beer gods have both blessed you. Welcome to the Family.3 down, 4 to go... May the suds be with you. 
 

All three of our randomly drawn winners have had multiple entries. Remember that each friend that you initiate gets you extra entries!
 

UPDATE #4 - (6/26/18)

 
Recent Brewhouse Updates:
The brewery is making big strides. Currently:

Finished almost all of the hard piping (steam, glycol, etc.)
All grain handling piping and equipment
Framing and drywall are installed
Tile and brick up next to outfit the tasting room and bathrooms

Once a final electrical upgrade is complete, we will be flicking the switch and powering up the brewhouse. You best believe we'll be capturing that moment to show all of you the inaugural brews that will be flowing for the grand opening this summer!
Dollar Beer For A Year: Winner #4 + #5
We've got a double-whammy this week. Our fourth and fifth winners of 7:
 
A fan of a particular drink and sports team we heartily approve of:
Winner #4: Gus V.

 
And another beer-loving Anaheim native:
Winner #5: Brett G.
 
Congratulations to you both! Your entries and random number generation hath blessed you both on this day. Welcome to the Family.5 down, 2 to go... May the suds be with you. 
 
This is the last week to enter for a chance to win the best beer prize in SoCal. Remember that each friend that you initiate gets you extra entries!



 
Cheers. Welcome HEIM!
Stay tuned for more updates, and visit our social pages for the most up-to-date posts:http://instagram.com/brewheimhttp://facebook.com/brewheimbeer

story:
We are Cory and Jaclyn Yates, proud owners of Jersey Bagels. When we met in Houston 6 years ago our first conversation was about New Jersey. The east coast way of life runs deep in our family. With this comes a greater appreciation for authentic east coast staples, one of those staples being bagels. Great food has always been a passion of ours as we spend many hours either in the kitchen or trying local restaurants. We jumped at the opportunity to create Jersey Bagels once we realized we could combine our passion for food with our roots. Having the opportunity to serve the community while doing something we love is beyond humbling. Achieving our campaign goal will allow us to fully embark on our mission of spreading authentic New Jersey style bagels across the greater Houston area, starting with Northwest Houston. 

 

How You Can Help

By reaching our goal we will be able to rent a commercial kitchen, purchase a food truck and establish a strong presence at local markets and food truck parks. We have received quotes for all necessary equipment to set up our food truck thus leading to our $60,000 goal. If we don't reach our goal then we will use all funds raised to rent a commercial kitchen and purchase supplies to set up a booth at several local markets. We won't be able to reach our goal without your support and with your support comes some pretty cool perks. The perks may differ but they all come with our genuine appreciation for your contribution. Whether we fill your wardrobe with a fresh Jersey Bagels shirt or your belly with some delicious bagels, we will be dishing out some pretty cool perks that you will want to get your hands on.

 

What's To Come

The need for a different, quick, affordable and delicious breakfast/brunch/lunch establishment in our area is evident. Although quick and delicious, its safe to say the donut and kolache scene in Houston is flooded. That is where we come in. Whether providing something new to our native Texans or helping our east coast transplants get a taste of back home, Jersey Bagels will offer customers something hard to find in this area. We will offer flavors of the month to keep things interesting as well as frequent giveaways and discounts. We realize there aren't many opportunities like the one we have right now. That is why we are all in and willing to go the extra mile to make Jersey Bagels an even bigger success.

 

Risks & Challenges

Chasing our dreams can be fulfilling but it comes with its challenges and risks. As much as we pride ourselves on our east coast roots, presenting this style of food in Houston has its disadvantages. East coast staples are somewhat foreign to Southerners, but it won't take long for everyone to understand the hype around Jersey Bagels. We decided to test the market by launching our operation out of our home. Needless to say the operation was a huge success and the market for Jersey Bagels is rather large. The restaurant business can be expensive and repairs to major equipment are always around the corner. We have witnessed this firsthand. With this experience comes the realization that a small portion of funds raised will need to be set aside for future equipment repairs. That way if any speed bumps come our way we won't miss a beat. We have also networked with local restaurant owners and obtained an adviser thus ensuring some business guidance along the way. 

 

Let's Make The World A Better Place, One Bagel At A Time!

Spread the word, tell your friends, yell it from the rooftops. Jersey Bagels is coming and it's going to be great! Don't forget the share functions of IndieGoGo to share our campaign with all your friends and family. You can also like our Facebook page here https://www.facebook.com/Jerseybagels/ to stay up to date on all things Jersey Bagels. Thank you for taking the time to learn more about Jersey Bagels and we look forward to serving you in the very near future!

story:
We need your help!

After spending many years as a corporate stooge, and rarely being able to utilize my true talents and doing something I am super passionate about, Robin (my wife and much better half) and I are starting a distillery.

Our backgrounds vary from Engineering, Biology and business with skills in sales and management. I love to make things and I love to cook. Most importantly Robin and I are huge fans of whiskeys and gins.

This venture is very important to Robin and I. We want something that is ours that we build from the ground up that makes a product that can be enjoyed by everyone. Well, everyone of legal drinking age...

Our distillery is located in Pocatello, Idaho. We have started buying equipment but we need  more, and we'll need operating capital to get things up and running.

How are we different?

We are not a super big mass production distillery. Not that there is anything wrong with super big, mass production distilleries; I enjoy some pretty big named Bourbons after all. 

Much like small wineries and micro breweries have done in the past, the micro distillery industry is taking off. Consumers want small batch liquors that are made by hand in a simple copper still, as there is a clear difference in the taste and quality of these libations. 

Moonlight Mountain Distillery is also committed to supporting local farmers. Utilizing ingredients from local sources decrease transport costs and environmental impact and is just good business for everyone involved. We also take special care with waste to ensure our spent grains go to local farmers for feed and that we properly treat our used water before it returns to the city for treatment.

What we need:

  • Our 126 gallon copper still has been partially funded but we need to be able to get it out of hock when it's complete.
  • We need a 200 gallon mash tun.
  • We need capital for electrical and plumbing work.
  • We need working capital to buy ingredients and hardware as the business starts.

As soon as all of these items are secured, we will be ready for business. If we are not able to raise all of the funds, we will use what we do raise as equity for a SBA loan.

What is our distillery making you ask?

Happy to tell you. We will produce gins and whiskeys with a couple different liqueur varieties. 

  • High Desert Gin - Refreshing and light, perfect in a cocktail or for sipping. The base is made from 100% barley and the botanicals will be gathered locally. These local flavors will allow the drinker to experience the terroir and aromas of the Idaho desert without having to leave your favorite bar stool.
  • Coffee Liqueur - This liqueur will be partnered with a cold brew coffee from our local roaster here in Pocatello. Don't expect a syrupy sweet drink, but a smooth, rich coffee flavored delight.
  • Snake River Rum - Idaho is not in the Caribbean, but this rum will be available in clear and dark varieties, and will impress you with the taste and complexity.
  • Cranberry Gin - This will be our high desert gin with a bit of Oregon cranberries infused, and barrel rested. The mixed drink options are endless.
  • Whiskey - American Single malt whiskey to rival the national spirit of Scotland. 
  • Howlin' Rabbit Bourbon - Our flagship drink (because I enjoy bourbon over the rest) that will be made with a locally grown heirloom corn to be aged the appropriate time for one of the best bourbons outside Kentucky. 
  • Thievin' Magpie whiskey - this will be a young whiskey made entirely of several locally grown ancient grains. 

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Get the word out for us! Tell your friends and share our story on your favorite social media platform.

    There are also the Indiegogo share tools which can get the word out.

story:
Short Summary

Roux Cajun Eatery is authentic Cajun food and a southern vibe from a Louisiana girl.  

At its core, Roux Cajun Eatery is about serving the awesome people of the Farmington Valley a delicious Cajun experience, as well as telling a story based on cultural perspective and history. 

Join our founders club to help our family bring something different, authentic and exciting to Simsbury.

What We Need & What You Get

With your support, we'll be able to put the money towards the following: 

Food Handling License & Other Permit Fees

Much-needed restaurant equipment -- Tables, Take out counter, Grab and Go Cooler, Patio Seating, convection ovens & a proofer, Fryers, Daiquiri Machine, paper goods, cups, etc.

Marketing Materials -- Signs, Merchandise, Physical & Digital Advertising

Anything over our initial $30,000.00 goal will go towards our stretch goal: a "Jazz Brunch Fund." Our ultimate dream is to have a Jazz Brunch on Sundays where we can serve beignets, king cake, shrimp and grits with a Jazz band on our patio.

If you're not able to contribute, don't worry! Just share our story with your friends and spread the good word! 

The Perks

Grab your Roux tshirts, hoodies, baseball caps, masks, car magnets, and grocery bags before supplies run out!

For those who are interested in having a party with 10-12 of their peeps, we have a poboy party with contact delivery.

For those who are looking for a true Louisiana experience, we have a Jambalaya Shindig, and a Crawfish Boil.  We will come to you and serve you fresh out of the pot.

Our Real MVPs can sign up for a private Jazz Brunch at the restaurant this spring.

 

The Dream 

Roux Cajun Eatery is a concept 20+ years in the making.  Stephanie Civitillo grew up around Baton Rouge and she is an LSU tiger through and through.  Stephanie has been dreaming of this, designing the location, and creating recipes for this restaurant since she was in college.  Stephanie and her family, Vic, Damian, Blaine, Tara, Charlee and Robert, are excited to serve Simsbury all the delicious food they grew up eating.  (Vic is a Simsbury boy, but we've converted him with delicious Cajun flavors.)

Nothing on earth brings together family and friends like food. Cajun food is more than food for us. It goes beyond that. It’s family. It’s community. It's an experience.  Many of our fondest memories are centered around sharing food with the people we love.

What is a roux?  (Sounds like 'roo'.)  A roux is the base for so many delicious French (and so Cajun) dishes.  It is also Stephanie's grandma's name.  Maw Maw Irma Roux Ford grew up 1 of 13 kids in Gretna on the banks of the Mississippi River.  Stephanie cooked with her grandparents and mother ever since she can remember and is bringing that knowledge and experience to Connecticut.

Stephanie always has a smile on her face and has a zest for life that energizes those around her.  In true Cajun form, she finds joy in every little thing.  Joie de vivre! 

To all the folks that share, donate & show us love. Thank you (from the bottom of our hearts). This is for y'all.

Looking for more information? Check the project FAQ

story:
The Hillis & McGee American whiskey, or moonshine, recipe dates back more than 250 years. Great, great, great grandson Chris Chapman is bringing that history and exceptional taste back in the form of Hillis & McGee moonshine. Chris is a master distiller, having learned his craft from his more recent relatives.

Hillis & McGee's goal to elevate moonshine to a respected addition to any liquor collection. Hillis & McGee moonshine is a traditional 150 proof. Using the family recipe that predates Tennessee as a state, Hillis & McGee moonshine is a pure, authentic American whiskey. It is made from the purest ingredients in a custom copper still. It is sure to please even the most discerning drinker.

The company was well on its way to opening its doors in 2020. Then Covid hit. The dreams and the jobs to be created were forced on hold. While in shut down, we did what we could. We finalized zoning, had our still made, bought a bottling machine, worked on our logo, and performed other things necessary to get a business up and running. We stretched our money to the limit. 

Now we ask for your help in crossing the finishing line. Now that zoning and local permitting are in place, we can seek federal permits. We also need to finalize our packaging. By donating today, you will help us achieve those goals and help to bring a tradition back.

Hillis and McGee is looking to raise $20,000. This money will help us secure our license (~$5,000), finalize packaging (~$6,000) and enable us to properly launch the product (~$8,000). We have invested approximately $100,000 to date and have a positive balance in the bank (~$6,000). Your donation can get you Hillis & McGee swag! Your donation means the World to us and we want to show our appreciation.

 

While we believe we are at the 1 yard line, there are always risks. Licensing may be denied or delayed. The process normally takes 90 days from acceptance of our application package. Any questions or deficiencies could cause a delay. We see no reason that we would be denied permits. Another risk is that we do not raise enough money to complete the tasks required to launch. We see this as only delaying the launch. We have put a lot of work into the project, not to mention money. We will not stop until the job is done.

story:
Who Are We?

2 years ago, My wife and I moved to Cincinnati, Oh from Nashville, Tn. 

We decided on Cincinnati because we have family close by or in the city. We decided on Price Hill because there is an Ecovillage there, (Enright Urban Ecovillge). We love the village and are excited to be using the vegetables from Urban Earth Farms as well as selling their produce at the Shop. We want to be able to give back to not just Enright Ecovillage but to the Price Hill Community at large. 

We have had a long road to Cincinnati.  Both Blair and Scott we raised in central IL then met in Chicago and moved to Nashville TN only to settle in Cincinnati.  Scotts' history with food is a vast.  He grew up visiting his family of farmers and then worked in a meat processing and catering plant that his parents opened.  After learning production and butchery he moved to the restaurant world where he worked in BBQ, pizza, deli's seafood and more.   In Nashville,  after helping move one restaurant to a new location and manage the opening and development of a new restaurant, we have decided to start a project of our own. Scott has worked in several kitchens over his professional career all the while missing something.  He yearns to have creative freedom and get quality healthy (and not so healthy but oh so delicious) meals to individuals and communities that deserve them.   Common Roots is a venue that will allow us to be creative but also show the respect to the community around us that deserves it.  It will be a community corner where all are treated as family.  

What We Need & What You Get

We cannot accomplish this program alone.  We your help we will be able to get the kitchen up to code for the city of Cincinnati.  We will be installing an updated grease trap, hood system and new equipment that will allow us to cook in a wide range of methods.  

We hope to offer a community corner where we can facilitate a wide rand of events that put the community first.  This could be as simple as an outlet to express local arts and music or as complicated as providing a space for future projects to hold fundraisers.  We plan to have profit share nights where we can help organizations that are already doing great things for the community gain support and visability.  These organizations are including and not limited to Price Hill Will, Santa Maria House and Imago Earth. 

New Projects Come with Risks

This is a new concept and something new for this community.  Price Hill has a lack of healthy food and a lack of forward thinking business's within the community.  Our plan is to create a sustainable business that used sustainable healthy food.  Not all of the community will be ready for these products but we plan on making this as accessible to the public as possible.  We also plan on making the space a fun and safe place for all the neighborhood to enjoy.  We want to have free all ages movie nights for the youth in the community.  We want our courtyard to be a place for anyone to come enjoy and play in.  With your help we can be a safe corner for our neighborhood to feel comfortable and grow in.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Contact us-We will be having work days to clean up the courtyard, fix the fence, build garden beds and an array of projects that we would love your help with
story_txt:
Who Are We?
2 years ago, My wife and I moved to Cincinnati, Oh from Nashville, Tn. 
We decided on Cincinnati because we have family close by or in the city. We decided on Price Hill because there is an Ecovillage there, (Enright Urban Ecovillge). We love the village and are excited to be using the vegetables from Urban Earth Farms as well as selling their produce at the Shop. We want to be able to give back to not just Enright Ecovillage but to the Price Hill Community at large. 
We have had a long road to Cincinnati.  Both Blair and Scott we raised in central IL then met in Chicago and moved to Nashville TN only to settle in Cincinnati.  Scotts' history with food is a vast.  He grew up visiting his family of farmers and then worked in a meat processing and catering plant that his parents opened.  After learning production and butchery he moved to the restaurant world where he worked in BBQ, pizza, deli's seafood and more.   In Nashville,  after helping move one restaurant to a new location and manage the opening and development of a new restaurant, we have decided to start a project of our own. Scott has worked in several kitchens over his professional career all the while missing something.  He yearns to have creative freedom and get quality healthy (and not so healthy but oh so delicious) meals to individuals and communities that deserve them.   Common Roots is a venue that will allow us to be creative but also show the respect to the community around us that deserves it.  It will be a community corner where all are treated as family.  

What We Need & What You Get
We cannot accomplish this program alone.  We your help we will be able to get the kitchen up to code for the city of Cincinnati.  We will be installing an updated grease trap, hood system and new equipment that will allow us to cook in a wide range of methods.  
We hope to offer a community corner where we can facilitate a wide rand of events that put the community first.  This could be as simple as an outlet to express local arts and music or as complicated as providing a space for future projects to hold fundraisers.  We plan to have profit share nights where we can help organizations that are already doing great things for the community gain support and visability.  These organizations are including and not limited to Price Hill Will, Santa Maria House and Imago Earth.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Contact us-We will be having work days to clean up the courtyard, fix the fence, build garden beds and an array of projects that we would love your help with

story:
BOY MEETS GIRL

Our story began in Harlem six years ago when Milka and I (Romeo) met at Awash. I was new to the city, arriving from Paris as a film intern and looking for a part time gig. She was the manager at her mom's Ethiopian restaurant. It was love at first sight. A whirlwind romance led to wedding bells months later and an opportunity to take over the Awash in Cobble Hill. It was a scary venture but we knew that together we had what it  took to succeed- Milka had been working in the restaurant industry for over a decade, honing her managerial skills. I have an immense love and passion for  cooking and for people-as a child, I would often help my mom create amazing dishes for family and friends. We were a formidable match. After several weeks of renovation and a revamp to our menu, we reopened as Awash Brooklyn. From cooking to cleaning to waiting tables and bartending, we did (and continue to do) it ALL.  It was through hard work and dedication that we have been able to make Awash Brooklyn a premier destination for classic Ethiopian cuisine and culture.  

STARTING OVER

This project is very personal to us for several reasons. For starters, Awash has laid the foundation for our desire for entrepreneurship. We have an immense passion for our culture, for its people and food. Our existing space has allowed us to create our interpretation of what the Ethiopian cultural experience is, one that is centered around a sense of community and fellowship. Secondly, Awash has extended our knowledge of food- Milka and I have come to appreciate the importance of providing clientele with  the best quality food and ingredients. Our newest venture, namely Ras, will serve as a marriage of these precedents. Located in Crown Heights, Brooklyn, Ras will be the first organic locally sourced farm to table plant based Ethiopian restaurant  in NYC (locally sourced as much as possible). Our desire for a vegan menu stems from  our own personal journey and transition towards a plant based lifestyle. Riddled with a multitude of health issues, both Milka and I veered away from conventional medicine and instead looked into how what we eat can have its own transformative effects. The Ras menu is a culmination of the knowledge that we’ve acquired, put thoughtfully into every ingredient, every  menu item, every single detail.  It is our contribution to helping our clientele and community eat better to feel better. Our research has also helped us to understand the importance of  sourcing food, which is why we have opted to work exclusively with local farms. Buying local not only provides fresher, healthier options but is actually better for the environment as well. Ras will do its share in leaving a small ecological footprint- from sourcing food to energy, we will make conscious decisions today that affect tomorrow and beyond.

OUR VISION 

In addition to being the first farm to table Ethiopian restaurant in NYC, the Ras menu will offer traditional vegan cuisine as well as a variety of new options that includes stews and salads. Similarly, our weekend brunch  will feature the classic fare as well as a good selection of  Ethio-American fused alternatives. Our bar will offer everything from signature cocktails to beers, wines and kombucha on tap. Live events throughout the week will showcase talent from near and far. Aesthetically, Ras will emulate a garden, bringing the beauty of Mother nature indoors.  From our carefully curated food and beverage menus to our large art murals, Ras will strive to represent Ethiopian culture the best way we know how- in a fresh, modern way while staying true to our roots.

WHAT WE NEED

Ras will be a perfect addition to the growing, culturally diverse Crown Heights area.   Our success thus far has been driven by the support of our community, family and friends. This campaign is no different. We have found the perfect home for Ras at 739 Franklin Ave. but it is currently an empty concrete box in need of a lot of work. Having functioned as a bar prior to us, we would need to get the space up to code with city regulations as well as build out the entire bar, dining and kitchen area. We are looking to raise $100,000 to help alleviate some of the construction costs. 100% of funds raised through this campaign (be it more or less than our intended goal) will go directly into creating a space worthy of our amazing clientele. Below is a rough breakdown of how much this project will cost in its entirety:

Architect/Expediting fee-$23,500 
Build out - $198,800
Equipment -$41,745.47
Furniture and fixtures - $20,000 (estimate)
Legal fees/Liquor License -$28,000
TOTAL ESTIMATED COST: $312,045.47
 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Milka and I have taken a huge leap of faith with this project-the lease has been signed, hard hats are on and construction is underway. BUT in all honesty, we don't have the entire amount needed to bring Ras to life. We have usurped our saving and maxed out our credit cards. After several NO's, we finally got approved for a loan (YES!!) but it only covers a third of our estimated build out costs. Call us crazy (we kind of are!!) but its a testament to how much we believe in ourselves and our vision. And now we are turning to YOU to help us make Ras a reality. Family, friends, loyal customers- we’re talking about you!! You have witnessed first hand how our hard work and dedication has made Awash a go to spot in Downtown Brooklyn. We ask that you put that same faith into us to jumpstart Ras. Be it through monetary pledges or simply sharing this campaign with someone you know, every bit helps us get one step closer to our goal. Thank you in advance!
 

PERKS

We are well aware that the best things in life aren't free, which is why we've compiled a great list of incentives for every pledge tier. From lunch at our new location to private cooking classes to shutting down our restaurant for a 100 person event, we've covered all grounds. Check out our perks below! To buy a perk: Mobile users- head back to the top of this page, select the perk that you're interested in and follow instructions. Desktop users- perks are to the right. 


Check out a few of the places where Awash Brooklyn has been mentioned:

https://www.bonappetit.com/city-guides/new-york...

http://www.grubstreet.com/bestofnewyork/absolut...

https://ny.eater.com/maps/best-restaurants-bars...

https://www.huffpost.com/entry/cobble-hill-broo...

https://www.zagat.com/l/best-restaurants-in-boe...

https://www.thrillist.com/eat/new-york/cobble-h...

https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=hRaZbyLi8z0 (Insider)


 A few images of the future home of RAS

CONSTRUCTION HAS BEGUN!!!

 Conceptual rendering of Ras

story:
Here's What We Have Going On

 

We are so excited to offer downtown Bluefield, Virginia a new option in their morning routine!

My name is Collin O'Donnell, founder of 'The Grind'. I'm a 26 year old college student, veteran, and entrepreneur. I'm looking to share my love of coffee & bagels with downtown Bluefield, Virginia and create a space for the community to gather in social events, while offering a unique & comfortable space for everyone to enjoy themselves.

The proposed space at 103 Spring Street, Bluefield, Virginia 24605, is currently owned by the city who will be conducting a large scale renovation to the property within the coming months. We are looking to take up between 1200 and 1400 square feet and offer a dynamic space that will invite all members of the community in as family. Our unique floor plan will include:
- A lending library

-Televisions, gaming and couches

-Traditional seating

-An express lane for coffee grabbers who need to get in and get out 

As we look to invite the community in with everything we do, we will hold events such as 'bake off's', book and philosophy clubs, college nights, public engagements and much more.

We can't wait to invite the community in to try our rewards and discount programs that will be the first of its kind in the area, and we aren't done yet! 'The Grind' will fit in perfectly with Appalachia; on the inside, a warm wood accent invites the spirit of fall even in the middle of winter, while on the outside, our semi-enclosed patio space will allow you to enjoy the cool, spring breeze of the Appalachian mountains in-between the soul-warming coffee you're enjoying.

-

What We Need & What You Get

The city will be doing an extensive renovation, but this does not cover everything to include both mechanical and aesthetic aspects, nor the necessary cash flow needed for a start up in our industry. We will also need to purchase equipment which, in estimates gathered during the course of our business plan, could run upwards of $30,000. Currently we have personal capital of $25,000 guaranteed.

In order to raise funds and pitch our idea, 'The Grind' took part in the Tazewell County business challenge for startups to pitch their idea for a shot at a $5,000 dollar grant to use towards equipment. Winners will be announced December 3rd, 2019.  The pitch can be viewed  here or under our header slides, above. Skip to the 22:00 minute mark of the video to see our official pitch!

We could use your help right now!

We are looking to raise between $10,000 and $50,000 to use toward necessary cash flow, renovations not covered by the city, and equipment. 

For your patronage you'll get:

 

$30,000-  18% equity in the company, a copy of our business plan, renderings, 3 years of cash flow predictions, a The Grind coffee mug, t-shirt and free 16 ounce coffees for life, as well as the life of someone you choose, additionally you may pick a third person to receive free 16 oz coffee's for 2 years time. You'll also receive an array unique discounts. Last but certainly not least, you'll receive  a "White house Honey Ale" beer from former President Barack Obama,  given to me personally during recovery at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center. The ultra-rare collectors beer will also be complimented by an American flag. 

$15,000- 9% equity in the company. a "White house Honey Ale" beer from former President Barack Obama  given to me personally during recovery at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center. The ultra-rare collectors beer will also be complimented by an American flag.  You'll also receive a 'The Grind' t-shirt, mug, and a copy of our business plan, renderings and cash flow estimates for 3 years.  You will also receive free 16 oz coffee's for as long as you live and at any location we may expand to.

$7,500- 4.5% equity in The Grind  as well as our business plan, renderings, 3 years of cash flow predictions, 2 years of free 16 ounce coffees (good at any future location as well), a The Grind coffee mug and t-shirt and an American flag, along with other unique discounts.

$3,750- 2.25% equity in the company. Our Business plan, renderings, and 2 years of cash flow predictions. You'll  receive a The Grind  t-shirt, mug and  American flag as well as receive unique discounts and coupons which will be good at any future location.

$500- You'll receive a The Grind  t-shirt for you and 1 other, 2 coffee mugs, and you'll also receive unique discounts and coupons, as well as a copy of our business plan.

You can still donate a custom amount even if you aren't fully investing.

The Impact

Every dollar contributed is a dollar not taken out in the form of a loan, we are so incredibly grateful for your patronage and investment.

Risks & Challenges

There are risks in creating a business, but also risks in not taking risk at all. Working in conjunction with the Bluefield College business department, and using an internship at a subsidiary of Starbucks in order to become more acquainted with the industry, we believe we can mitigate risk with our excellent business plan, marketing ideas and events to keep people coming through our doors, with your support of course! Donate now!

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out and share our project!

story:
Hi, my name is Ankurveer. Me and my team have created an all natural herbal solution to end hangover mornings after a night out. I am a cellular biologist by profession. My background  is in Biotechnology, and have a diverse range of work experience in the world of biopharmaceutical and nutraceuticals world. Much like myself, our SOS Wake Up Fresh! team is a group of some passionate scientists & engineers (genetic, chemical and biochemical engineers), entrepreneurs, footballers, cricketers and genuine lovers of Science!

We've been working on SOS Wake Up Fresh for more than two years and have created a product that is backed by science and optimized by us to help you 'poor' party souls from hangovers. SOS was created so you can still enjoy your late night sesh and be maximize productivity the next day. Now it's time to share it with the world!

SOS is manufactured in South Korea at a leading manufacturer that use cGMP (Current Goods Manufacturing Practices), a facility that adheres to the standards of the FDA and other regulatory bodies internationally! All ingredients undergo extensive testing for safety, purity and stability.

Your Impact

As a backer, you'll be making a huge difference to this 'little' project and will be responsible for helping us achieve our first round of large scale production! Funds raised through this campaign will be going to our 1st batch of production. We're offering our backers up to 20% off + free shipping, and are excited to get SOS to you! We will do our very best to ship your order out no later than the end of July!

If you can't contribute, that's ok. We would love if you could share our campaign with your friends and family.

Spread the word and save a soul! Cheers to hangover-free mornings.

story:
Overview

Our vision is twofold: experience coffee and strengthen community.

We are Cabrona Coffee, a place where blending traditional Mexican flavors, ingredients, and culture creates a memorable coffee-drinking experience for everyone to enjoy. 

 

 

 

Why is Cabrona Coffee Necessary?

Everyone deserves a space where they feel welcomed and understood. We have personally felt disappointed by not having enough coffee shops in Denver that are Latino-owned. We know we're not the only ones wanting something more than the average neighborhood coffee shop.

We want to create a place where Mexican culture is translated into a coffee-drinking experience. This is what we are building. Cabrona Coffee is the place where the Latino community of Denver can find themselves and a community of like-minded folks in a neighborhood coffee shop.

We are opening Cabrona Coffee because Latino coffee drinkers matter: our stories, our experience, our community, and our dollars. It is a space for those who love coffee, music, and a good time.

Become a Madrina or a Padrino

Want to help make this space a reality? We need your help to bring this space to life! Starting a business is a life-changing experience. Just like other major life events where Padrinos step in to support with time and money, this business endeavor is no different. We are asking family, friends, and the broader community to help us build something new.

 

Our current reality:

 

 

 

OUR FUTURE :

Why Our Name? 

"Why not?" is usually our first response. As a woman-owned business, we embrace empowerment and culture by reclaiming a name that has been used for far too long against women who think for themselves and who live life to the fullest. Latinas-regardless of their background-can immediately identify with the word cabrona and claim it as their own. With Latinas growing influence as consumer dynamos and empowered activists, we can manifest our values by supporting businesses who understand us best.

Our Offer

Cabrona Coffee is much more than a coffee shop. We are on a mission to strengthen and support our community by becoming a neighborhood hub. Here are just a few reasons why we exist:

  • Representation: Brown ownership is vital to us. It's how we build wealth and roots for generations to come. 
  • Memorable Experiences: We want you and those you care about to feel welcome and have a good time in our space.
  •  Responsibility: We believe ownership brings responsibility. We are in a position to be stewards of the money you spend. Your dollar supports other small businesses with a similar focus and values as ours.

Okay, Opening a Coffee Shop is Risky...

We are a business, and like any business, we have a certain amount of risk. But here are a few things that make us different:

  • Cabrona Coffee leads the competition by serving incomparable signature beverages, baked goods, and light food items in a setting culturally appropriate to the area and its historical roots of the neighborhood. We provide an informal and cultural coffee house ambiance with a contemporary flair.
  • The Spanish language is an essential part of the ambicultural (100% fluent in more than one culture) nature of many. Latino consumers actively seek out in-culture media content and Spanish-language conversations online, in music, on television, and in conversations with friends and family. Cabrona Coffee is intentional with the language used by our staff, signage, and on our website. We understand how important it is for us to use English, Spanish, and Spanglish as a cultural connector. 

Our Supporters/Padrinos/Madrinas Help Us:

We value each of our supporters. Every. Single. Dollar. Matters.  We are at the start of construction and the many needs that will soon follow. From building bathrooms to painting our walls, your dollars will be used to bring our space to life.

Speaking of walls, we will add the name of every contributor to our special wall of appreciation. We believe everyone at every level should be recognized.

Some people cannot contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask your people to get the word out, donate, and make some noise about our campaign. They can sign up for the newsletter on our website www.cabronacoffee.com and join us on Instagram @cabronacoffee!
  • You can spread the word by using the Indiegogo share buttons!

story:
About Bright Penny Brewing

In 2016, three friends sat down over a beer and began the plans for Bright Penny Brewing. After looking at several cities in the RTP and Piedmont area of North Carolina, Mebane quickly rose to the top of the list of locations as being one of the fastest growing municipalities in North Carolina. In 2017, downtown Mebane was named a Top 5 Great Place in NC. The outpouring of support from the community has been overwhelmingly positive which confirmed our choice in coming to Mebane.

Pictured left to right owners, Jason Brand, Cristina Carroll, and Jeremy Carroll. 

We are pleased to introduce our very talented Head Brewer, Scott Schenk. Originally from Gastonia, NC, Scott was introduced to craft beer while a student at N.C. State. Upon graduation, he decided to pursue his passion and secured an internship at the Mash House Brewing Company in Fayetteville, NC. Within a year, Scott took over as Head Brewer before leaving to obtain a formal brewing education through the Master Brewer Program at the Siebel Institute. After returning from Europe, he was immediately hired by Starr Hill Brewery in Charlottesville, VA, where he applied the theories he learned at Siebel to the practical applications of production brewing and developed a solid foundation for brewing consistent, high quality beers. Scott's next move took him to Humperdinks Brewpub in Dallas, TX. There he refined his brewing style, focusing on high quality, consistent execution of standard, approachable styles to provide any customer with a beer they can come back to time and time again. He brings this philosophy now to Bright Penny, where he will create a solid core lineup, rounded out with a variety of one-off and seasonal recipes covering all sorts of styles and interpretations. Scott is excited to be closer to his family, his alma mater, and to once again be a part of the thriving North Carolina beer industry.

What's It To You and What Do We Get?

For this campaign, we are looking to reach a goal of $15,000.  In addition to the money raised through investors and bank financing, this funding will allow us to purchase an additional fermenter. Anything left over will go directly in to the purchase of additional fermenters to increase our production capabilities.

The Perks.

In exchange for your support, check out the perks listed to the right.  A wide variety of swag and several brewing experiences are up for grabs. (Please keep in mind that merchandise is subject to slight changes from the pictures.)

If you aren't interested in any perks but would like to back the project, check out the "Back It" button just above on the right side of the page.

The Mill Company

  • The Mill Company is Bright Penny Brewing’s customer loyalty program. Memberships provide individuals with discounted beer and merchandise as well as exclusive access to parties and limited edition releases. 
  • This campaign is currently the only way to become a member of The Mill Company.  Any remaining memberships will become available as we near our opening date.
  • Unfortunately, laws prohibit us from shipping alcohol from the brewery.  However, we are happy to hold any bottles/cans for members for a limited amount of time.
  • Price for a Mill Company membership is for One Year (365 days).  Anyone who joins during our Indiegogo campaign will maintain membership throughout the 2019 calendar year.  Your benefits will begin the first day we are open. 
  • You must be 21+ to be a member of The Mill Company.

Name A Fermenter

  • Your Name/Business Name will be affixed (somehow) on to one of our four fermenters.  We'll work with you to pick a design and method that will be presented on the fermenter forever.
  • Under no circumstance will the fermenters or brite tanks have anything racist, sexist or otherwise degrading and/or completely uncool to your fellow humans. 

Assistant Brewer

  • Soft opening invite for you and three guests for a behind the scenes tour of the restaurant and brewery. 
  • Your Name/Business Name will be affixed (somehow) on to one of our future fermenters or brite tanks.  We'll work with you to pick a design and method that will be presented on the fermenter or brite tank forever.
  • Under no circumstance will the fermenters or brite tanks have anything racist, sexist or otherwise degrading and/or completely uncool to your fellow humans. 
  • You and up to three guests will spend a VIP afternoon at the brewer working with our Head Brewer Scott.  Lunch included.
  • Swag bags for you and your guests
  • You must be 21+ for this perk. 

Head Brewer

  • Lifetime Membership for 1 (one) into the Mill Company*
  • Soft opening invite for you and three guests for a behind the scenes tour of the restaurant and brewery. 
  • Your Name/Business Name will be affixed (somehow) on to one of our future fermenters or brite tanks.  We'll work with you to pick a design and method that will be presented on the fermenter or brite tanks forever.
  • Under no circumstance will the fermenters bare anything racist, sexist or otherwise degrading and/or completely uncool to your fellow humans. 
  • You and up to three guests will spend a VIP day at the brewery, working with our Head Brewer Scott to create or scale your own recipe.
  • Label credit as a collaborating brewer.  Lunch included.
  • Head Brewer benefits for 2019!! (Take-home “examples” of your recently brewed beer.)
  • Swag bags for you and your guests.
  • You must be 21+ for this perk. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please make some noise about our campaign and share our link!!

story: Since 2002 we are working to safeguard the wild cacao stands in the Beni. This crowdfunding initiative is linked to a wider promotion program that over the coming years will get more people involved in what we try to achieve here in the Bolivian Amazon. Besides your support we need money. So we are looking for more direct contact to you and it has its benefits for both ends of the value chain. Back our work! Donate and get compensated by our products. Get involved!
